case_summary:
On Monday August 14th 1306, 11 David (Ptlw Kirlin) was contacted by an off duty officer in reference to a firearm
possibly being concealed in a golf bag in the area of E. 10th and N. Pine Streets. Upon arrival in the area, Officer Kirlin observed a
black and white golf bag at the southeast corner of the above intersection with two shirts and a hat situated on top of the bag. After
removing the articles of clothing, a Brown Sears Roebuck & Co .22 caliber long rifle (#846483) was observed inside one of the bag’s
open compartments. Further investigation using BWC footage and city watch surveillance video yielded positive results for a suspect
description. A short time later, with the assistance of the Crime Gun Intelligence Center (Moses, Lerro, and Linkhorst), the defendant
Jason Miles BM 01/26/1973 was observed in the area of E. 10th and N. Spruce Streets at which time he was taken into custody. Under
Miranda the defendant admitted to possessing the rifle as well as consenting to his DNA being obtained. Miles was charged
accordingly and received $15,200 secured (bound over to HRYCI).

On Tuesday November 14, 2023, Detective Silvers was working anti-violence and was on a directed patrol at
Sycamore and South Van Buren Streets. While at this location, Eddy Peguero BM 09/19/2000 was observed pacing on the sidewalk
for over an hour. He was later observed picking up a blue in color bag and placing it in a vehicle. Detective Silvers left the area for a
short time and returned. Upon his return, the bag that Peguero was seen with prior was back out of the vehicle and on the ground.
Detective Silvers exited and walked over to the bag. The top of the bag was open and a bag containing approximately one pound of
marijuana was observed inside. When Detective Silvers looked into the bag, he observed a Taurus G2C 9mm (#ABE573528) along
with several smaller bags of Marijuana (712 grams of marijuana).
Upon seeing Detective Silvers picking up the bag, the defendant began walking towards S. Van Buren St. Detective Silvers attempted
to stop the subject at which time he immediately fled on foot towards the Browntown neighborhood. The defendant fled into a rear
alleyway and began to jump fences in the area of Lower Oak Street. With the assistance of C Platoon, a perimeter was established at
which time the defendant was seen fleeing back out onto Lower Oak Street and jumping into a vehicle. The vehicle attempted to leave
the area, however was quickly stopped and the defendant was placed into custody without further incident.

On Wednesday November 1, 2023 members of Operation Safe Streets conducted a motor vehicle stop on a grey
Chevrolet Malibu (DE: 143097) in the 100 block of N. DuPont St for an equipment violation and unsafe motor-vehicle. Officers made
contact with the driver (Phil Jones BM 09/22/91) at which time officers were able to determine Jones to have an active capias out of
JP court 11. D1 Jones was ultimately removed from the vehicle and taken into custody for his capias. Officers also made contact with
the passenger of the vehicle (Jamar Roane BM 03/12/91). Officers were able to establish probable cause to search the vehicle at
which time Roane was removed from the vehicle. Officers conducted a search of the vehicle which revealed: (0.021 grams) of Heroin,
(52.2 grams) of Crack Cocaine, tan/black Taurus G3C 9mm semi-automatic handgun (# ACL477458) loaded with 13 live 9mm
rounds, and a black in color magazine containing (29) live rounds of 9mm ammunition. As officers were attempting to take Roane into
custody, a brief foot pursuit ensued at which time Roane fell to the ground and was ultimately secured. Both Jones and Roane were
transported to central where they were booked and processed. Roane was taken to the Wilmington Hospital where he was treated for
minor abrasion sustained to his face which resulted from his fall while fleeing on foot from police.

A Platoon (Wilkers/Bond) conducted a motor vehicle
stop in the area of 7th & Washington St for illegal
windshield tint on a black in color Chrysler 300 PA
LTH6043. Upon making contact, the operator of the
vehicle immediately handed officers a cigar filled with
marijuana. It was at this time occupants (driver: John
Lawrence & passenger: Zahkeem Clark) were asked to
step out of the vehicle and both were detained. A search
of the vehicle was conducted and resulted in the
recovery of a Taurus 9mm loaded with (7) rounds of
ammunition which was located underneath the passenger
seat. Both defendants advised that they were traveling to
Wilmington in order to get a phone fixed. Clark advised
officers that he had no knowledge of the firearm being
inside of the vehicle prior to the stop. He stated that his
DNA is on the firearm due to the fact that he
felt/touched the gun as he reached underneath his seat to
pull his seat up during the traffic stop. Lawrence
advised officers that he had no knowledge of the firearm
being inside the vehicle. He also refused to give his
DNA. Both have criminal histories in PA to include
firearm charges.
Case # 30-22-13535
It should be noted that the owner of the firearm is John
Lawrence girlfriend, Brya Granberry BF 05/12/98

During the month of October, members of Safe Streets began a firearm investigation involving Naseer Bullock
(02/01/2007). On October 15, 2025, Safe Streets established surveillance on Bullock’s listed address of 30 W. 36th St. At approximately
1945 hours, Bullock arrived at the residence, driving a VW Passat (NJ: F73SLM). Bullock was detained and found to be in possession of
marijuana, which was in the vehicle. Officers search the residence, where they recovered a FN 503 9mm (SN#CV022337) handgun, a
Glock 17 9mm (SN#CDGM422) handgun in Bullock’s bedroom, along with additional marijuana and drug packaging material. While on
scene, Angel Morrow (02/06/2008) approached officers, advising the FN firearm belong to him. He was able to describe distinct features
on the weapon, therefore, he was taken into custody without incident. Both Bullock and Morrow were charged accordingly.

On Sunday August 27th at approximately 0304 hours, C Platoon officers Downing, Murzyn and Young responded to
610B S. Walnut Street (Salvation Army) in reference to a suspicious vehicle complaint. Upon arrival, this officer observed a gold in
color 2001 Chevrolet Suburban (DE PC164755) parked in the parking lot. Officers made contact with the vehicle and observed the
defendant Eric Gaines BM 08/26/1983 asleep in the driver seat. After a few minutes of knocking on the driver’s side window, Gaines
woke up and began to put his vehicle into drive. Officers gave numerous commands for Gaines to stop, place the car in park and to
roll down his windows. After initially failing to comply with commands, Gaines eventually opened his door and advised officers that
he was in possession of a firearm. While placing Gaines into custody, officers observed a black in color Springfield XD 9mm
handgun (#XD152579) sticking out from the top of the back of his pants. Officers were able to quickly remove the firearm from
Gaines person at which time he was then placed into custody without further incident. The firearm was loaded with 15 9mm rounds in
the magazine and 1 round in the chamber. Due to the observation of Gaines being highly intoxicated and was operating his vehicle, an
assessment was conducted. See Patrolman Young IDR for further information. A DELJIS inquiry was conducted of Gaines which
revealed that Gains is a convicted DUI Offender.

On Friday September 16th 0924 hours, Officers were dispatched and responded to the 1000 block of North Park
Drive regarding a person with a gun complaint. The reporting person described a subject, who was operating a motorized scooter, in
possession of a firearm and who reportedly displayed same to an unknown person in the area. The reporting person was not the
recipient of the Aggravated Menacing, and only a witness. D Platoon Officers observed Brandon Roane BM 12/11/82 matching the
suspect description in the 1000 block of N Park Drive and coordinated a stop on same. Pursuant to their investigation, ROANE was
found to be in possession of a loaded S&W M&P Shield .380 caliber handgun, concealed on his person. ROANE is a person
prohibited from possessing firearms and ammunition due to prior felony convictions. Street Smart records don’t indicate any gang
affiliations, however Deljis confirmed ROANE to have extensive criminal history involving Robbery, Burglary, Assault, Resisting
Arrest and Drug Offenses. Attempts at locating the potential victim of the Aggravated Menacing was met with negative results.

On Monday May 23rd 2109 hours, A Platoon officers were dispatched to Conrad and N. DuPont St in reference to a
person with a gun. Upon arrival, officers exited their vehicles at which time James Cooper BM 09/06/88 immediately fled on foot
before being taken into custody. Cooper was found to be in possession of a loaded Ruger Security 9mm handgun concealed within his
waistband.

On January 25, 2024, at approximately 2136 hours, members of Safe Streets were in the 600 block of Monroe
Street., where they conducted a vehicle stop on a black in color Buick sedan (unreadable NJ temp tag) for a stop sign violation. As
soon as the Buick came to a stop, the front passenger, Lucas Gatlin BM 11/21/1998, exited the vehicle and began running W/B in the
800 block of W. 6th Street while holding his waistband. Officers pursued Gatlin on foot while providing information to assisting
officers over WILCOM. The Buick fled from the scene at a high rate of speed and was last seen turning E/B on 11th Street from
Madison Street. Members of Safe Streets quickly coordinated with members of D Platoon, and a perimeter was immediately
established. As a result, officers quickly located Gatlin in an alleyway located alongside 827 W. 5th Street and took him into custody
without further incident. Additionally, officers located a Smith & Wesson 9mm firearm that Gatlin discarded during the pursuit.
DNA was collected from Gatlin and a test fire form was submitted. Safe Streets will continue to investigate in attempts to identify the
Buick as well as any additional occupants inside present during this incident

On Tuesday September 20th 0019 hours, C Platoon officers conducted a vehicle stop in the area of Water & Shipley
St on a gray 2004 BMW (DE #685440) for an expired registration. Upon approaching the vehicle, officers detected the odor of
marijuana emanating from the vehicle interior. Contact was made with the occupants of the vehicle, Jamir Dantley BM 10/22/99
(driver – found to be driving without a license), Leroy Lynch BM 11/06/00 (front seat passenger), and Yshaad Butcher BM 02/13/01
(rear seat passenger). The occupants were removed from the vehicle at which point Dantley advised that there was a small amount of
marijuana in the vehicle. While searching for the marijuana (2.2 grams recovered), officers located a book bag on the driver side floor
between the defendant’s legs. Concealed in the bag was a loaded Ruger EC9S 9mm semi-automatic (Serial #45751376). That
weapon was reported stolen to the Salisbury Police Department in Salisbury, North Carolina. After Miranda Dantley confessed to
possessing the firearm and the other occupants were released from the scene. Dantley was transported to Central and charged with
CCDW, Receiving a Stolen Firearm, and multiple T-21 violations.

On Monday January 30th 2353 hours, A Platoon officers (Bond/Wilkers) conducted a traffic stop in the 400 block of
W. 8th St on a blue in color Volve XC90 (PA LZW0378) operating with illegal window tint. Officers made contact with the operator of the vehicle (Joseph Griffy BM 11/24/86) who began to show severe nervousness, including attempting to avoid eye contact and shortness of breath. While speaking with Griffy, officers observed a marijuana blunt in the center console and ultimately asked the defendant to exit the vehicle. A grey in color bag as located on the passenger side of Griffy’s vehicle and a search of same revealed a black in color Taurus G2 9mm handgun (#TKP17304) and a black in color magazine containing (11) 9mm rounds. Griffy was taken into custody and charged with CCDW

On August 30 2024, Officers were on directed patrol in the area of W. 2nd St. and N. Franklin St. While on directed
patrol Officer Mann observed a silver 2021 Nissan Altima park in the 200 block of N. Franklin St. Officer Mann observed Anthony
Morrow (02/06/90) exit the front driver side door of the vehicle and upon doing so drop a handgun magazine containing 9mm
ammunition on the ground. Morrow was then observed throwing the magazine back into the vehicle in attempts to conceal from
officers in the area. A pedestrian stop was made on Morrow at which time he was detained and taken into custody.
Upon taking Morrow into custody, officers observed a black Taurus G2C 9mm (S/N: TLT15273) semi-auto handgun with an
extended magazine on the floorboard next to the driver seat of the vehicle.
Officers made contact with Lillian Polk (09/19/77) who was seated in the rear passenger side of the vehicle, she was also detained.
While at Central a Search Warrant was drafted for the vehicle and as a result of the search, officers located a Black and Silver
Taurus G3C Semi-auto handgun (S/N: AGB01885), additional, live 9mm ammunition, a handgun cleaning kit, Approximately 56
grams of marijuana, scale and packaging material

On Thursday November 24th 0217 hours, C Platoon Officers were dispatched to 1305 Richards Alley in reference to
a suspect who had threatened persons inside the house with a shotgun. Prior to arrival victims had fled the residence and reported that
the suspect was now inside refusing to exit. C Platoon officers secured a perimeter and established a line of communication to the
defendant (Ryan Mullen WM 12/25/1996) through vehicle loudspeakers.
After several minutes of negotiating, Mullen exited the residence unarmed and was taken into custody. Officers then conducted a
preliminary search of the residence for any additional victims. While searching officers located in plain view a black Mossberg
shotgun, two handguns, various suspected illegal narcotic substances, and drug paraphernalia.
Interviews with the victim/defendant (Dante Jannuzzio WM 01/23/1997) stated that Ryan Mullen and others had been drinking at the
bars and returned to the residence. Once back at 1305 Richards Alley they continued drinking and smoking marijuana. While in the
residence, Mullen became agitated and verbally threatened residents to get his shotgun. The argument escalated and Mullen retrieved
his shotgun. Mullen then stood at the top of the stairway pointing and racking the shotgun towards the residents. The other residents
were able to flee and alert police.
A search warrant was executed at the residence and the following items were located and tagged as evidence.
• Mossberg 500 12 gauge Shotgun (#V0198173)
• Smith & Wesson M+P Shield 9mm Handgun (#RHB0876)
• Glock 22 .40 Caliber Handgun (#BKWH238)
• 4 Marijuana Plants
• 200 rounds of 9mm Luger ammunition
• 100 Sig Sauer Hollow point 9mm rounds
• 100 Remington .40 Caliber Pistol and Revolver Rounds
• 45 .22 Rifle rounds
• 200 vials of suspected homemade marijuana oil cartridges
• Machinery used to infuse oils with marijuana
• Large amounts packaging materials.
Both the defendant and the victim were taken into custody for weapons and title 16 violations.

On Friday September 16th at approximately 1525 hours officers were alerted to a possible stabbing victim located at
2022 Washington Street. Upon arrival officers located the victim (Kion Tymes) who was suffering from a through and through GSW to his right bicep, and a GSW to his abdomen on the right side. There were no calls for shots fired and no Shot Spotter notifications. Officers observed a large amount of blood within Tymes’ living room and in an upstairs bedroom which appeared to have been partially cleaned up. Kwamir Wise BM 08/08/05 and Tymes were both interviewed and provided conflicting statements; however both eventually admitted that they were inside the residence playing with the gun when it accidentally discharged, striking Tymes. Wise
stated an unknown third subject was also with them in the room and he took the firearm with him when he fled the residence. Wise was only able to describe this subject as a black male from Philadelphia.
The search warrant was executed and the following items were located in Wise’s bedroom:
• Silver magazine for a Sig Sauer .357
• Plastic bag of .357 live rounds
• (8) ounces of marijuana
The following items were located in the basement of the residence:
• Ruger 10/22 rifle, stolen from NCCPD jurisdiction in 2021.
• Ruger 9mm handgun, loaded with a magazine and several bullets
• Diamondback .556 rifle, loaded with a magazine and several bullets
This will be carried as a Miscellaneous investigation due to the multiple conflicting statements provided by Tymes and Wise.

On Thursday June 23rd 1930 hours, B Platoon officers responded to 1128 Pleasant St in reference to a man armed
with a gun. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Douglas Bush, who was on the roof of his residence where he advised officers
that he was armed. Officer Osler asked Bush to come down which he complied without incident. A pat down frisk for weapons was
conducted which met with negative results. Bush advised that he was being threatened by people in the neighborhood which led to
him arming himself. Officers conducted a DELJIS inquiry on Bush which revealed that he is a person prohibited from possessing both
firearms and ammunition as a result of a violent felony conviction (assault 2nd). Officers executed a search warrant and removed (15)
firearms along with ammunition and magazines which were located inside of a gun safe in a second story bedroom. Two additional
firearms were recovered from the roof of the residence where officers initially saw Bush, and where he told officers that he was
armed.
not in gunstat meeting reports

During the month of June 2022, Det. Silvers, Det. Gibson (DEA Task Force) and Det. Lynch (ATF Task Force)
initiated an investigation into John PURNELL for Fentanyl sales throughout the City of Wilmington. Det. Silvers utilizing testifying
Confidential Informants was able to conduct five direct purchases of Fentanyl (1 bundle per buy) and a Hi-point .45 caliber semi-
automatic handgun serial #X4311764 (29N).
On August 05, 2022, CMTT along with members of the DOCV, OSS, SCU, K9, ATF, & UAV executed two, simultaneous, search
warrants at the aforementioned locations. During the search warrant execution at 1113 W. 2nd Street, John PURNELL failed to comply
with all attempts made by CMTT to exit the residence. CMTT utilized various means to gain compliance during which time John
PURNELL exited same and was taken into custody by members of CMTT.
During the callout procedures, Daija PONZO arrived and confronted officers. During the encounter, she was found to possess a
concealed S&W M&P handgun and a small quantity of Marijuana. Daija PONZO does not possess a concealment permit.
During the search of 1113 W. 2nd Street, it was found that John PURNELL discarded the Fentanyl and Pills out of the second-floor
window into a neighbor’s yard. Additional Marijuana and Heroin were located in the residence.
Approximately 27 grams of Marijuana were located at 1107 W. 4th Street, Wilmington, DE.
John PURNELL is currently out on bail for two arrests; a vehicle pursuit involving DSP on June 13, 2022, and a Felony drug arrest involving NCCPD on June 26, 2022. Some of John PURNELL’s charges are pending for investigative reasons. John PURNELL will be indicted at a later time on these charges. Purnell was charged with PWID (x6), Poss Controlled Substance (2) & Resisting Arrest Bail: $20,000 secured (posted) – Released on Pre-Trial Supervision 83 prior Felony Arrests  13 Convictions.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On August 3, 2025, at approximately 0011 hours, Officers Holland and Malvestuto were on proactive patrol in the 900 block of North Church Street when they observed Lamonte Butler (11/02/1991) operating a 2014 Buick Verano (DE 699633) disregard the stop sign at East 9th and North Church Streets. A motor vehicle stop was conducted at which time the vehicle refused to stop, eventually pulling over at Vandever Avenue and Northeast Boulevard. Throughout the course of their investigation, Bulter was found to be in possession of approximately 200 pills to include oxycodone, Tizanidine as well as 31 grams of marijuana, and one black Glock 19 9mm handgun (SN: CBUL305) containing a drum style magazine with fifty-one (51) 9mm rounds. Butler was taken into custody without incident and transported to Central.

On September 4, 2025, at approximately 2116 hours, members of Safe Streets stopped a black in color, Nissan Altima
(DE: 625446) in the 300 block of W. 9th St, for registration and equipment violations. The operator of the vehicle, Adrian Pringle
(06/07/2001) was found to have a traffic warrant out of Georgia. Pringle was removed from the vehicle, and officers located a loaded
Palmetto Dagger Compact 9mm (SN: CD012184) handgun concealed within his waistband. It was confirmed that Pringle does not have a
concealed carry weapons permit, he was then taken into custody without incident and charged accordingly.

On September 8th, 2023 Members of CGIC initiated an investigation into Kyon Harvey and Neiamjha Rollins
regarding the possession of a firearm. With the assistance of DOCV and PO Carnevale, surveillance was established on the residence
at which time Kyon, Neiamjha, and James exited the residence and entered a vehicle. As the vehicle began to travel south on
Washington St, detectives were able to confirm both Kyon and Neiamjha were in the vehicle. Detectives followed the vehicle to the
500 block of West 4th St where a felony vehicle stop was conducted. All occupants were ordered out of the vehicle and detained.
While Kyon Harvey BM 09/14/2005 was exiting the vehicle he was observed to have a firearm in the front of his waistband. While
securing the vehicle, a second firearm was observed on the front passenger side floor board. All three occupants were transported to
central. At central DNA was obtained from all three occupants of the vehicle. Detective Moses applied for and was granted a search
warrant for 2927 N Washington St. A search of the residence was conducted which resulted in the recovery of an additional 7 rounds
of 22 caliber ammunition from Kyon’s bedroom. Attempts were made to interview Kyon and Neiamjha however both refused. Kyon
was charged with PFBPP X 2 and CCDW. Neiamjha was processed for his outstanding warrant and firearm charges are pending at
this time. James was released at this time pending the results of the DNA. Neiamjha was arraigned and given a $100,000 cash bail.
Bail information was not available for Kyon at the time this document was authored.

Original Arrest: Over the past 2 months, CGIC detectives conducted a firearms investigation into Davon Lloyd and Ironn Collins-Demby. During this investigation, it was learned that Davon will wrap his GPS monitor in aluminum foil to prevent his locations from transmitting. 
On August 9th, 2024, CGIC Detectives established surveillance on 314 9th Ave at which point Davon Lloyd (05/15/2008) was observed exiting the residence and entering a vehicle. Detectives surveilled the vehicle to the north side of the city at which point the vehicle began driving evasively. Surveillance was able to be maintained on the vehicle at which point it was observed parking outside of 500 E 5th St. Once parked, Ironn Collin-Demby (05/31/2006) exited the driver’s seat and entered the apartment building where he stayed for approximately 1 minute before returning to the vehicle. 
As the vehicle left, a traffic stop was conducted on the vehicle at which point Davon’s GPS became active again. After conducting the traffic stop, Detectives were able to pull surveillance video of Ironn entering the apartment building where they observed him displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. During this time they were able to identify apartment B1 as the residence in the apartment building and made contact with the homeowner who confirmed Ironn has access to the apartment.
Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for the residence at which point they located and recovered a Black in color Polymer 80 9mm handgun with an extended magazine loaded with a total of 28 rounds of 9mm ammunition and a Black in color Smith & Wesson M&P 9 Shield 9mm (#NJP5701) handgun loaded with 9 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
Once the execution of the search warrant was complete, members of CGIC and Safe Streets responded to 314 9th Ave to attempt to locate Davon. While establishing surveillance on the residence, Davon exited the rear door and immediately attempted to flee upon seeing officers. After a brief pursuit Davon was taken into custody, once in custody Davon’s GPS was observed to be wrapped in aluminum foil. 

Updated Arrest: On August 19th, 2024 CGIC detectives and City Watch (Sierra) observed Ironn Collins-Demby in the area of 24th and Market. During this time, Ironn was observed displaying characteristics of an armed gunman.  Detectives were also aware of an outstanding firearm from the previous investigation.  
Detectives and members of DOCV immediately responded to the area at which point Collins-Demby was observed walking onto the front porch of 8 E 24th St.  Detectives exited their vehicles and responded to the porch to make contact with Ironn who immediately attempted to flee.  After a brief struggle, Ironn was taken into custody.  During the brief struggle, Ironn was observed discarding a firearm from the front of his waistband off of the porch.  
Once in custody, detectives recovered a black in color Girsan Regard MC 9mm firearm (SN T6368-20A00617) which was found to be loaded with a total of 13 rounds of 9mm ammunition.  During a search of Ironn, he was found in possession of .3 grams of crack cocaine.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On June 5, 2025, at approximately 1815 hours, Officers Smagala and R. Mitchell were notified by Officer Chambers that an individual known as Kason Rollins (08/12/2007) was observed in the area of 7th and Monroe St. Rollins is known to have an active warrant out for Violation of Probation. During an area canvas, Rollins was observed entering the store at 7th and Adams Streets. Officers entered the store and made contact with Rollins, placing him into custody without incident. He advised officers he has a firearm in his waistband. Officer Smagala then located a black in color Ruger SR9-C 9mm (S/N: #334-71558) loaded handgun, concealed in his front waistband. Rollins was also found to be possession of 5 grams of Crack Cocaine. Rollins was transported to Central.

During the month of July 2024, Det. Coffiey initiated an investigation into Marijuana sales from 3800 Market Street, Wilmington, by Alexander Pratt, 06/21/1989. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for the aforementioned location.
On July 31, 2014 at approximately 1012 hrs members of the Vice Unit, OSS, and K9 executed the search warrant without incident. During a search of the residence, investigators located the listed firearms, Marijuana, ammunition, and drug paraphernalia. Korey Marshall, 08/25/1983 gave consent for his vehicle during which time the listed Heroin, Cocaine, Crack Cocaine, Xanax, and currency was recovered.
The following items were seized during this search warrant: 
· FN model 509, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number GKS0103381 (29N). The handgun was not loaded, the extended magazine contained 24 rounds.
· Ruger Security 9, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number 382-02278 (29N). The handgun was not loaded, the extended magazine contained 15 rounds.
· 57.2 grams of Marijuana
· .056 grams of Heroin stamped “In Out”
· 7.7 grams of Cocaine
· 5 grams of Crack Cocaine
· 18 Xanax pills
· $975.00 USC (seized)
· Ammunition
· Drug Paraphernalia
Korey Marshall has an extensive firearm and drug arrest history in PA.

defendant_name: Harry Anderson, Tyon Walley, Lashaun Bradley, Tamir Knots
case_summary:
On Saturday May 21st 1753 hours, C Platoon Officers K. Johnson & Poorman conducted a vehicle stop on a silver
Lexus ES350 (DE XQ229788) registered to Harry Anderson BM 07/01/03 for a speeding violation. Upon approaching the vehicle,
officers detected the odor of marijuana and removed all occupants.
Driver – Harry Anderson
Front Seat Passenger – Lashaun Bradley
Rear Seat Passengers – Tyon Walley & Tamir Knotts
Upon searching the vehicle, two handguns and (44 grams) of marijuana were located.
The first handgun is a Glock 26 9mm with a loaded extended magazine and a “switch” (#AFVB860). This firearm was located on the
floorboard of the rear passenger seat.
The second handgun is a Polymer 80 receiver and a Glock 19 Slide (#BWFD524) loaded with 9 rounds of 9mm ammunition and a
laser attachment. This firearm was located in the front passenger compartment adjacent to the front passenger seat.
DNA was taken from all four defendants

On Saturday, September 13, 2025, members of Safe Streets were working an operation which targets motorized scooter
violations in the city. At approximately 1421 hours, Officers stopped Kveon Winn (06/08/2007) in the 2200 block of Jessup St while he
was operating a motorized scooter in violation of Title 21 and Wilmington City Codes. Winn initially provided a false name and when
detained was found to be in possession of a firearm concealed within his waistband. The firearm was identified as a black Beretta
PX4Storm (S/N #PK21991) .45 caliber handgun, Winn was also in possession of approximately 0.42 grams of Heroin. Winn was
transported to Central, along with the evidence and charged accordingly

During the month of February, Det. Silvers initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales from Eric WHITTLE and Jasmin BROWN from 1213 Conrad Street, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for 1213 Conrad Street.   
On this date (2/10/24), the search warrant was executed by members of the Vice Unit, OSS, and K9. During the warrant execution, officers positioned at the rear of the residence observed Eric WHITTLE throw an item out of the second floor window, this item was recovered and found to be the listed handgun. During a search of the residence investigators located the drugs and paraphernalia.

During the month of December 2023, Det. Cuadrado initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales from Giotto
Berry BM 09/30/1992 from 2615 Pine Street, Wilmington, DE. Further information was that Giotto Berry was in possession of a
handgun and currently wanted.
On Friday January 5, 2024, Berry was observed exiting 2615 Pine Street, enter the passenger seat of a vehicle and proceeded to the
200 block of E. 28th Street. During mobile surveillance, the operator of the vehicle was observed committing several traffic infractions
and was stopped. During the traffic stop Berry was taken into custody and found to be in possession of 26.2 grams of Crack Cocaine
concealed in his underwear. Both occupants and the vehicle were transported to Central. Through the course of this investigation, a
search warrant was authored and obtained for 2615 Pine Street, Wilmington, DE. The warrant was executed by members of the Vice
Unit & OSS without incident. During a search of the residence investigators located the following:
• Black & green Glock 19, Gen 4, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number BGUR160 (29P Georgia). The handgun was
loaded, and the magazine contained 14 rounds.
• Black Springfield Arms XD, .45 Caliber semi-automatic handgun, serial number XD675875 (29N). The handgun was
loaded, and the magazine contained 9 rounds.
• Black & silver S&W 9VE, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number RBF4860 (29N). The handgun did not have a
barrel installed, 9mm barrel located separately.
• 146.8 grams of Crack Cocaine (this includes the amount located on Berry)
• 14.5 grams of Cocaine
• 70.3 grams of Marijuana
• 266 rounds of 9mm ammunition
• Numerous firearm parts, lights, sights, and extended magazine
• $524.00 USC (seized)
• Drug Paraphernalia

On Sunday October 13, 2024, at approximately 0125 hours, Officer N. Gliem conducted a motor vehicle stop on a
white Chevrolet Impala DE 555719 in the 100 block of North Adams Street for a traffic violation. As Officer Gliem made contact
with the vehicle/driver, (Jyaire Townsend BM 03/29/2004), he observed the backseat passenger, (Daunte Williams BM 12/01/2002),
holding a firearm, attempting to conceal same. Williams and Townsend were detained and the firearm (a loaded Glock 19 9mm semi-
automatic handgun (#AGHX220) reported stolen to WPD on 05/02/23 under case number 30-23-003854, was recovered from the
vehicle. Williams was charged with the firearm offenses. Jyaire Townsend was found to have an active capias and was taken into
custody and processed on same.

On Thursday June 13, 2024, at approximately 1430 hours, Robert Chavis BM 08/04/2000 responded to the Cherry Lane Probation Office at which time he was taken into custody regarding an ongoing drug and firearm investigation.  Probation Officers as well as Safe Streets responded to Chavis’ residence located at 1212 Elm Street to conduct and administrative search.  During the search, officers located the below listed items from Chavis’ bedroom:

•	Glock “25” .380 semi-auto (S/N: AHZL362 – 29N)
•	Smith and Wesson “M&P Shield” 9mm semi-auto (S/N: JCE3042)
•	Silver in color Revolver (Unknown make, model and S/N)
•	Ammunition
•	2.5 grams of crack cocaine
•	.357 grams of heroin
•	3 Alprazolam pills

Chavis was transported to Central where he was interviewed regarding this incident as well as recent violence in the City of Wilmington. Chavis was charged accordingly and test fire forms were submitted to FSU.

defendant_name: Denny Toston, Sr., Nyhe Toston, Denny Toston, Jr.
case_status:
D1: Resolved
D2: Pending
D3: Resolved
case_summary:
On Monday May 6th, 2024, at 1624 hours, 13 Adam (Mann/Diaz) was traveling east on East 23rd Street they
observed a white Chevrolet Impala traveling south in the 2300 block of Jessup St. The driver of the vehicle appeared to acknowledge
the occupied, marked police vehicle, and immediately pulled over to the east side of the street. Officers noticed that the occupants of
the vehicle were not wearing their seatbelts. Additionally, officers observed that the driver side rearview mirror appeared to be broken.
Officers then made contact with the driver, Denny Toston Sr BM 11/25/1989, and front seat passenger, Nyhe Toston BM
01/11/2000. Nyhe immediately informed officers that he was having some form of a medical emergency and removed himself from
the vehicle frantically. The driver was asked to exit the vehicle where he was pat down for weapons. An unknown black male juvenile
(later identified as Denny Toston Jr BM 06/11/2009) continued to approach the occupants of the vehicle. At one point, it appeared
that Nyhe Toston was attempting to communicate with Denny Jr to coerce him to tamper with the investigation. Nyhe Toston then fled
on foot before being tased and taken into custody. While officers were walking Nyhe back to the scene, they noticed Denny Toston Jr
inside the front passenger seat of the vehicle where he took possession of a firearm and fled on foot before being taken into custody.
The firearm was determined to be a black/grey in color Glock 22 .40 handgun (#EHD640). The firearm was loaded with (1) round in
the chamber and equipped with an extended magazine containing (21) .40 caliber ammunition. DNA was taken from all three suspects
and all were charged accordingly.

On Saturday January 28th 1858 hours, members of Safe Streets conducted a vehicle stop in the 200 block of E. 4th St for a registration violation. Officers made contact with the operator who was identified as Amanda Ricks BF 02/02/89 and the passenger, Brandon Williams BM 09/10/01. Ricks advised officers that she was in possession of a handgun and that same was located inside the glove box. Both occupants were removed from the vehicle at which time Williams was found to have a hard warrant (WPD) for Assault 3rd. Williams was taken into custody without incident and found to be in possession of approximately 1 gram of marijuana. A search of the vehicle was conducted at which time three firearms were located, concealed inside the vehicle. Ricks confirmed that she did not possess a concealed carry weapon permit. Ricks was taken into custody without incident and found to be in possession of 10 grams of marijuana. Once at central, Ricks admitted to owning the three concealed firearms located inside the vehicle. Williams stated that he never touched any firearms inside the vehicle. Both consented to their DNA collected. Williams was processed on his warrant and issued a summons for civil possession of marijuana. Ricks was charged with CCDW (3 counts), PFBPP (3 counts), civil possession of marijuana and registration violation.

On June 12, 2025, at approximately 2242 hours, Officer Hutt was on a proactive patrol in the area of 10th and Market St, when he observed a silver Chevrolet Impala (PA D66GYN), which was being operating without head or tail lights. Officer Hutt attempted to conduct a motor vehicle stop. The vehicle came to a stop, however the driver, Niisaiah Carter (04/21/2000) exited the vehicle, fleeing the area. As Carter was in pursuit, he was observed discarding a black backpack, containing 1,076 grams of marijuana. Carter was then taken apprehended into custody.
With the assistance of DOCV and Probation, an administrative search warrant was obtained and executed. In Carter’s bedroom, officers located and recovered a Springfield XD 9mm (S/N: BK129443) handgun, loaded with 14 rounds in the magazine and one in the chamber. In addition, officers recovered 23 grams of Crack Cocaine and 17 grams of Marijuana.
Carter was charged accordingly.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On September 10th, 2025, C Platoon responded to the 1300 block of Vandever Ave in reference to an incident of shots
fired in front of 1307 Vandever Ave. During their initial investigation, officers located a witness who advised officers of a potential
suspect. CGIC Detectives were notified and initiated an investigation into the shots fired. As a result of the investigation, Detectives
applied for and were granted a search warrant for 1307 Vandever Ave.
On September 19th, surveillance was established on the residence at which point the suspect, Steven Negron (04/14/84), was observed
leaving the residence and entering his vehicle. Detectives made contact with Negron and detained him. During this time, Negron
confessed to discharging the firearm during the original incident. While executed the search warrant, Detectives located and recovered a
black in color Smith & Wesson M&P 9mm (SN #NEX5151) handgun loaded with 8 rounds of ammunition and a black in color Taurus
TX 22 caliber (SN #1TJ060756) handgun loaded with 11 rounds of ammunition. Negron and the evidence were transported back to
Central.

On Friday March 3rd 1711 hours, two ShotSpotter alerts were received for 512 S. Heald Street. The first alert was for 15 rounds and the second alert was for 11 rounds. A Platoon (S/Cpl. Conor Bartolo) arrived on scene and observed Denny Toston Jr BM 06/11/08 opening a large gate to the rear yard to allow a white in color 2008 Chevrolet Impala DE 461847 to exit same. Denny Toston BM 11/25/89 and Andre Parker BM 10/11/00 exited the vehicle and were detained without incident. K9-7 (M/Cpl. Truluck and partner Manny) were on scene and assisted with the canvass for casings due to the condition of the rear yards (grass and straw). Manny alerted to casings in the grass and alerted to two firearms that were hidden behind a fence. The following items were collected from the scene by FSU: tan in color, 9mm FN 509 handgun, serial # GKS0262957 (not stolen) and a black in color, 10mm Glock 29 handgun, serial #BSRR018 (not stolen); eleven (11) spent 9mm casings and nine (9) spent 10mm casings. It should be known that both handgun magazines were empty. S/Cpl. Bartolo furthered the investigation by interviewing the subjects, where Parker admitted that the firearms were his legally owned firearms and that he test fired them in the rear yard and hid them prior to police arrival. Parker consented to providing a DNA sample. Toston was uncooperative with the investigation. It should be known that Det. Wilkers located open source intelligence that showed Toston in possession of one of the firearms just prior to the incident. A search warrant was authored for Toston’s DNA and for his white in color Impala. Items recovered from the Impala are as follows: the box for the FN handgun, thirty-five (35) rounds of 9mm ammunition, a receipt for the ammunition and a holster. It was found that Toston Jr., had no involvement and he was turned over to a guardian. Denny Toston was charged with Possession of a Firearm by a Person Prohibited and Parker was charged with Discharging a Firearm on the Street. A test fire form was completed and submitted to FSU.

On Friday March 3rd 1711 hours, two ShotSpotter alerts were received for 512 S. Heald Street. The first alert was for 15 rounds and the second alert was for 11 rounds. A Platoon (S/Cpl. Conor Bartolo) arrived on scene and observed Denny Toston Jr BM 06/11/08 opening a large gate to the rear yard to allow a white in color 2008 Chevrolet Impala DE 461847 to exit same. Denny Toston BM 11/25/89 and Andre Parker BM 10/11/00 exited the vehicle and were detained without incident. K9-7 (M/Cpl. Truluck and partner Manny) were on scene and assisted with the canvass for casings due to the condition of the rear yards (grass and straw). Manny alerted to casings in the grass and alerted to two firearms that were hidden behind a fence. The following items were collected from the scene by FSU: tan in color, 9mm FN 509 handgun, serial # GKS0262957 (not stolen) and a black in color, 10mm Glock 29 handgun, serial #BSRR018 (not stolen); eleven (11) spent 9mm casings and nine (9) spent 10mm casings. It should be known that both handgun magazines were empty. S/Cpl. Bartolo furthered the investigation by interviewing the subjects, where Parker admitted that the firearms were his legally owned firearms and that he test fired them in the rear yard and hid them prior to police arrival. Parker consented to providing a DNA sample. Toston was uncooperative with the investigation. It should be known that Det. Wilkers located open source intelligence that showed Toston in possession of one of the firearms just prior to the incident. A search warrant was authored for Toston’s DNA and for his white in color Impala. Items recovered from the Impala are as follows: the box for the FN handgun, thirty-five (35) rounds of 9mm ammunition, a receipt for the ammunition and a holster. It was found that Toston Jr., had no involvement and he was turned over to a guardian. Denny Toston was charged with Possession of a Firearm by a Person Prohibited and Parker was charged with Discharging a Firearm on the Street. A test fire form was completed and submitted to FSU.

defendant_name: Marhi Clark, Amir Clark, Nasir Turner
case_summary:
On the above date and time, officers were dispatched to the above address in reference to a theft of a firearm. Upon arrival, officers made contact with the victim, who advised that between 04/05/2024 and 04/07/2024 his firearm (black in color, Glock 43X, 15 round magazine, serial #CAUW394) was removed from his vehicle (black in color, Lexus RX350, DE PC327783). It is unknown if the vehicle was secured; however, there was no forced entry into same. The vehicle was parked on the north side of the street in the above listed block. An area canvass for witnesses met with negative results. Several surveillance cameras were located in the above block, but none were available for review at this time. The vehicle was processed for fingerprints, but met with negative results. TRU was contacted regarding the potential surveillance. A copy of this report was forwarded to the Data Center for entry into NCIC.
----------------------------------------------------------- Update ---------------------------------------------------------------
        On April 8th, 2024 CGIC Detectives initiated an investigation into the above firearm theft.  During the course of the investigation, Detectives were contacted by City Watch (Sierra) who advised she observed three juvenile suspects on the City Watch Cameras walking in the area checking car doors during the time of the firearm theft.  She further advised she believed the suspects entered the 711 at W. 4th St and N. Union St.  
TRU was able to retrieve video surveillance of the incident as well as the video surveillance from the 7-11.  Detectives reviewed the surveillance videos and were able to positively identify Marhi Clark BM 04/23/2008, Amir Clark BM 04/23/2008, and Nazir Turner BM 04/12/2007 as the suspects.  As a result of this investigation, Detectives were granted arrest warrants for Marhi, Amir and Nazir. Detectives applied for and were granted search warrants for 418 N Franklin St and 1007 W 8th St in regards to this investigation.  

On April 12th, 2024 at approximately 0600 hours CGIC executed both search warrants with the assistance of CMTT, Safe Streets, K9 and members of A Platoon. While responding to the residence, Detectives observed a group of 4 juvenile males, to include the suspects, walking eastbound on 4th St.  Detectives attempted to make contact with the suspects at which point they all fled.  After a brief foot pursuit, Marhi and Ishmael Turner were taken into custody.  

As a result of the search warrants the following evidence was located and recovered:
        418 N Franklin St:
- Black in color Glock 19 9mm handgun (Serial Number CCAW570) loaded with 13 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color Glock 17 9mm handgun (Serial Number CAGS184) loaded with 12 rounds of ammunition
                - 2 empty magazines/Misc Firearm accessories
        1007 W 8th St:
                - Black in color Glock 47 (Serial Number CAFD759) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color FMK 9mm handgun (Serial Number BB22209) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
                - 9 rounds of 40 caliber ammunition
                - 38 rounds of 9mm ammunition
                - 2 Spent 9mm casings
                - Miscellaneous firearm accessories
        Marhi and Ishmael and the evidence were transported to the Wilmington Police Department. Amir Clark and Nasir Turner turned themselves in the following day. The stolen firearm is still outstanding at this time. DNA was obtained from other occupants in the residence regarding the recovered firearms, charges are pending the comparison.

On Friday July 29th 1306 hours, SCU conducted a traffic stop on a white in color Honda Accord DE 447337 for an
equipment violation in the 400 block of N. Monroe St. Upon approaching the vehicle, officers smelled an odor of marijuana emanating from the vehicle and observed remnants of marijuana throughout the vehicle. SCU officers had the occupants (driver: Brennaye Brown BF 06/22/02 and passenger: Malik Winters BM 09/05/00) exit the vehicle and a search was conducted. During the search, officers located a satchel which contained a loaded High-Point 9mm Luger handgun and a loaded Beretta 9mm handgun. Winters was mirandized and advised that the weapons were his.

On Saturday April 1st 0854 hours, D Platoon officers (Stewart/Linkhorst) conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 1200 block of N. Clayton Street for expired registration. Upon initial contact with the operator/defendant (Angel Cruz BM 05/05/2000), officers noticed him acting very nervous, attempting to conceal an object by blading his body away from the officers while seated in the driver’s seat of the vehicle. Stewart/Lindhorst asked Cruz to step out of the vehicle and located a loaded Glock 19, 9mm handgun, Serial # BYFP447 with 13 rounds in the magazine in Cruz’s front left pocket. Also located in the vehicle were a single 9mm round and a speed loader in the center console, a box of 33 rounds of ammunition in the front passenger seatback, and a small amount of marijuana sitting on the back seat. Cruz was also identified previously as a suspicious person by these officers in the Canby Park area on two separate shots fired incidents last year.

On September 6, 2025, at approximately 1524 hours, officers responded to 103 N. Harrison St, in regards to a landlord
and tenant dispute. Upon arrival, the victim, Julia Pantoja, flagged down officers, claiming the suspect, Angel Rivera-Torrens
(08/31/1998), was pointing a firearm at her and trying to flee. Officers approached Rivera-Torrens, who admitted to possessing a
concealed firearm. He was detained and found to be in possession of a tan in color Glock 19x 9mm (SN: AKHZ029) handgun, with
multiple extended magazines.
Investigation revealed Pantoja responded to the location, with a contractor, in order to repair a water leak in the apartment. Upon arrival,
Rivera Torrens’ wife, allowed them to make entry to the apartment where they began to address the water leak. Shortly thereafter, Rivera
Torrens responded, began yelling at Pantoja, and responded to his bedroom where he obtained a firearm. He then pointed the firearm at
Pantoja demanding she leave. She left the residence, where she then make contact with the police.

On Thursday November 9th Cpl. Crocker reported hearing a gunshot in the area of 5th and Madison. Upon responding into the area, Cpl. Crocker also advised that he had several juveniles that had been exposed to mace. As assisting officers arrived and were directed to 418 N. Madison, Apt B, and advised that Angelita Jackson BF 05/30/1976 had fired a gun into the air during an altercation. Officers made contact and placed defendant into custody. The apartment was cleared and a search warrant was obtained for GSR and the residence. A CPX-2 9mm handgun (serial # C191425) was located and recovered.

On September 22, 2023 at approximately 2217 hours two Shot Spotter alerts (2 rounds and 6 rounds) were received
for the area of 3rd and Rodney Street. Patrol units responded and located several scenes in the 200 block of N. Rodney Street as well
as the 1400 block of W. 3rd Street. While officers were on the scene V- Kwame Harmon arrived at the St. Francis Hospital suffering
from a gunshot wound to the shoulder. Harmon had been driven to the hospital by his girlfriend (Marvel Pion 2/17/90) in an orange
Kia Forte (DE 450080). Harmon was unable to be interviewed by detectives due to his condition. Through the course of investigation,
Det. Wilkers was able to identify Zubair Granby BM 08/24/2005 as one of the shooter in this incident. Det. Wilkers was able to
obtain an arrest warrant for Granby for Assault 1st, Possession of a Firearm During the Commission of a Felony, and Possession of a
Firearm by a Person Prohibited stemming from this incident. It was learned that Granby was going to be responding to Probation and
Parole on today’s date and surveillance was established at that location. Granby was seen exiting a vehicle being driven by his mother
and entering Probation and Parole where he was detained. Contact was made with Granby’s mother who consented to a search of the
vehicle. During an initial sweep of the vehicle a firearm was located in same and the car was towed to Central pending a search
warrant on same. Det. Wilkers petitioned for a search warrant for the vehicle and a Smith & Wesson 9mm handgun (#JCE7973) was
recovered from same. Det. Wilkers then interviewed Granby who admitted to firing a gun during this incident but stated that the other
individual(s) fired at him first. Granby advised that the gun recovered from the car was the gun he used in this incident. Granby was
booked and processed on his outstanding warrant

Kevin Harris Homicide – 7/4/2024 
**Remington and S&W located in residence, belonging to suspect. Stoeger located besides victim.

On July 24, 2025, at approximately 2205 hours, Officer Crumlish conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 900 block of A Street on a silver Buick (DE 624730) for a suspended registration and heavy window tint.
As the vehicle pulled over the driver opened the front driver’s door and attempted to step out of the vehicle. Officer Crumlish ordered the driver to stay in the vehicle and made contact with the occupant, Raheen Sills (06/11/1991). Sills appeared to be very nervous, when Officer Crumlish then observed a black plastic handle by Sills’ feet. Sills was ordered to put his hands up, and then advised he did have a firearm inside the vehicle. Sills was removed from the vehicle and placed into custody without further incident.
The firearm was black Ruger Security-9 (SN: 386-81778) loaded with ten (10) 9mm rounds in the magazine and one (1) round in the chamber.

On Monday April 11th 0603 hours, WPD CMTT, DOCV and K9 executed a search warrant at 119 Eastlawn Ave in
reference to a firearm and drug (Oxycodone) investigation. During the warrant execution, the target of the investigation (Timothy
Thomas), fled from the rear of the residence before being taken into custody. Thomas was wanted on 14 warrants/capias.
Items seized during the search warrant:
Glock 19 9mm handgun (#BBRR221) loaded with 16 rounds of ammunition - (29N)
40 Oxycodone pills
$1,410 USC
11.5 grams of marijuana
Drug paraphernalia
Cell phone(s)

On Wednesday November 2nd 1930 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 500 block of W. 25th St when they
observed the defendant Wilmer, Nakhai (BM 11/28/2006) walking on foot, acting suspiciously, and displaying characteristics of an
armed gunman. Upon seeing SCU Investigators, the defendant fled on foot and was ultimately taken into custody in the area of 26th
and Zebley Street. SCU Officers conducted an area canvass for discarded items and located a loaded (BERSA Thunder .380 Caliber
handgun containing 1 live round in the magazine and 1 in the chamber which was bearing serial number C60210) in an alley
between 519 and 521 W. 26th St which was parallel to where the defendant was observed. Under a recorded post Miranda statement
with the defendant and his guardian, the defendant admitted he was in possession of the firearm that was recovered.

On September 6th 1339 hours, Det. Coffiey & Martin were conducting surveillance in the east side of the city when they observed Keith FISHER engaged in a drug transaction. The defendant then entered a black in color Toyota RAV 4 DE PC183979 and left the area. Officers followed the vehicle and observed same committing several traffic infractions before conducting a stop. Contact was made with Fisher who was found to not have a valid driver’s license and was removed from the vehicle. As Fisher was exiting the vehicle, officers observed (5) glassine baggies containing heroin (.035 grams) on the driver side floor board.  Fisher was detained and search incident to arrest revealed a Smith & Wesson .38 caliber Revolver which was located between the center console and front passenger seat. Fisher was also found in possession of (2) MDMA pills. Under Miranda, Fisher admitted to possessing both the firearm and heroin.

Over the past few months, CGIC Detectives have been conducting a firearm investigation regarding Anthony Huddleston (06/11/2009). On June 26, 2025, at approximately 1654 hours, Detectives observed Huddleston and Omillio Hines
(09/28/2009) walking westbound in the unit block of Cedar St. While surveilling Huddleston, he displayed characteristics of an armed gunman. 
Information gathered during this investigation, along with the mentioned observations, led to Detectives making contact with both subjects and placing them into custody after a brief struggle. Once in custody, a black in color Polymer 80 9mm (S/N: CA14924) handgun loaded with fifteen (15) rounds of 9mm ammunition was removed from Huddleston’s waistband.

On Monday July 17th at 2136 hours, officers were dispatched to 122 N. Scott Street in regards to a person with a gun.  While officers were enroute, the victim was on the phone with Wilcom and advised the suspect was in possession of a firearm and still inside the residence refusing to exit. Upon arrival, officers interviewed the victim who advised that he was assisting the defendant in repairing a pipe within the basement of 122 N. Scott St. He further advised that the defendant became irate for unknown reasons and threatened to shoot him. The defendant then locked the victim in the basement before retrieving his firearm from his bedroom and returning to the basement. The defendant unlocked the basement door and kicked the victim down the steps causing minor injury to the victim’s arm. The victim was able to exit the residence and call 911. 

Officers began to verbally engage the suspect in an attempt to have him surrender and exit the house unarmed.  After a few minutes, officers were successful and the suspect was taken into custody without incident.  A search warrant was authored and granted for the residence.  Officers recovered a silver Smith and Wesson 9mm handgun, loaded with (15) fifteen rounds from the living room area.  The firearm was 29N and same was tagged into evidence.

On Friday June 17th 2140 hours, SCU were in the 2100 block of Locust St when they observed several subjects
loitering on the side of the JP Liquor store. SCU officers made contact with the subjects to provide verbal warnings for loitering and
obtain ID before issuing a citation. While obtaining the subject names, Anthony Calm attempted to run through the officers in attempt
to flee. Officers grabbed the defendant who began to physically resist arrest. While resisting, a loaded Taurus G3 9mm handgun fell
from Calm’s person and onto the ground. Calm was taken in to custody and found to be in possession of (3.8 grams) of marijuana.

On the above date and time a ShotSpotter alert was received for one (1) round at 1901 W.
4th St (Checkers). Responding units located one (1) .380 caliber casing on the Northeast corner of 4th and Lincoln Streets.
Investigation revealed that the Suspect became angry when she was refused service for having walked up to the drive-thru window
and ultimately fires a single shot at an uninvolved food delivery driver (Victim) while he was waiting to pick up an order. The Suspect
flees on foot, however, an area canvass and a review of City Watch cameras yields negative results.
----------------------------------------------------------- Update ---------------------------------------------------------------
On June 11th, 2024 CGIC detectives initiated an investigation into the above shots fired incident. During this investigation, with the
assistance of TRU, video surveillance was obtained from the Checkers which CGIC detectives were able to review and identify Chie
Smyre as the suspect. Once identified, with the assistance of CID and Cpl Dan Shea, CGIC was able to obtain a search warrant for
Chie’s residence. On June 17th, 2024 CGIC established surveillance on Chie’s residence with the assistance of DOCV and City Watch
(Sierra). During this time, Chie was observed responding to a front porch in the 200 block of N. Broom St at which point Detectives
were able to make contact with her and take her into custody without incident. Chie was found to be in possession of 1.7 grams of
crack cocaine. Once in custody, CGIC and DOCV responded to 300 N Broom St Apt 1 and executed the search warrant. During a
search of the residence, detectives located Black in color Cobra FS380 handgun loaded with 8 rounds of 380 ammunition and 9
rounds of 9mm ammunition.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On July, 4, 2025, at approximately 2104 hours, Officer R. Brown was on a proactive patrol in the Riverfront area as part of a paid job detail to deter disorderly groups from setting off fireworks, when he observed subject, Mahkai Mcclain (12/27/2010) operating a motorized bicycle in the area of Justison and Beech Streets. Mcclain appeared to by moving towards the river walk area where several other juveniles were attempting to gather.
A pedestrian stop was conducted near the above mentioned intersection and Mcclain was found to be in possession of a book bag. Officer Brown asked Mcclain why he was in the area and asked if he had any fireworks in his book bag. Mcclain advised he did not and gave consent to search of the book bag. Immediately after consent was given, he attempted to reach into the book bag and was quickly stopped from doing so by assisting officers. A search of the book bag yielded positive results for a loaded Taurus G2C 9mm (SN #ACD760864) handgun. Mcclain was taken into custody without further incident and transported to Central.

defendant_name: Leroy Miles-Goldsberry, Kyon Harvey, Tyquan Vaughn
case_summary:
On Monday April 18th 0030 hours, D Platoon (Stewart/Linkhorst) attempted to coordinate a stop on a silver
Mitsubishi Eclipse (NJ C12MNA) in the area of Banning & S Broom St. The vehicle was believed to be involved in a shooting that
occurred on April 15th in the 800 block of E 22nd St (victim: Khasim Dryden 04/13/05). As officers attempted the stop, the vehicle
immediately accelerated and a short pursuit ensued before the Eclipse collided into an unoccupied parked vehicle in front of 1901
Maple St. The driver (Tyquan Vaughn BM 04/18/03) fled on foot before being taken into custody by Linkhorst. The other two
occupants (front seat passenger - Leroy Miles-Goldsberry BM 11/25/04 & rear seat passenger - Kyon Harvey BM 09/14/05) remained
in the vehicle and were taken into custody without incident. Located in Leroy Miles-Goldsberry front left pocket was an empty
ammunition magazine. Located in plain view on the middle of the rear passenger seat was a black in color Glock Polymer 80 with an
extended magazine containing (7) rounds.
A black in color Smith & Wesson loaded with (8) rounds was located in the side pocket of the front passenger door. Vaughn was
issued an ETicket for the appropriate traffic offenses. Harvey and Miles-Goldsberry were charged with the firearm offenses and turned
over to CID Detectives for further investigation.
EDU – vehicle processed – subject identified: Devin Pearson BM 08/02/02 – 9 S Clayton St
Update:
Mitsubishi Eclipse silver (NJ C12MNA) – rented by Deioni Pritchard BF 11/03/03 (girlfriend of Tyquan Vaughn) – Pritchard
responded to Central on 04/20/22 to take custody of the vehicle. During an interview with Det. Shea, she advised that she had
possession of vehicle all weekend other than when Tyquan had it at the time of his arrest. Pritchard was charged with Assault 1st,
PFDCF & Conspiracy 1st for the shooting of Kahsim Dryden (30-22-25798). See Sector 1 Gun Arrest Summary
not in gunstat meeting reports

On Friday January 27th 1543 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 1000 block of Wright Street when they observed
several subjects loitering in the rear yard of a vacant property (New Holiness Fellowship Church). Upon SCU Investigators
approaching the subjects in the rear yard, the defendant Amir Carr-Powell BM 07/16/2005, immediately stood up, grabbed his waistband and began fleeing on foot. Investigators pursued the defendant who was observed displaying several characteristics of an armed gunman. After the brief foot pursuit, Investigators were able to take the Defendant into custody without incident. Investigators conducted a back track for discarded firearms and located a black Taurus Millennium G2 9mm bearing serial number # TJZ88572
containing (12) twelve rounds in the magazine.) The firearm was reported stolen from a vehicle per NCCPD under case number 32- 22-087459 on 11/28/22. Carr-Powell was in the company of (Yusf Simon BM 06/29/2007) prior to fleeing from Investigators. Carr- Powell was charged with CCDW, PFBPP x2 and Resisting Arrest. A DNA search warrant was drafted for the defendant and a test fire request was submitted.

On April 12, 2025, at approximately 2248 hours, Officer Stewart was in the area of West 2nd and North Rodney St in
reference to a burglary in progress in the area. While conducting a search for possible suspects, Officer Stewart observed a group of
juveniles. As the group was walking, a subject, later identified as Zymir Monroe (10/06/2008), began walking away from the group,
while displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Monroe attempted to flee, with another individual, Marhi Clark (04/23/2008) into
the 200 block of Delamore Place. At this time both subjects were apprehended and taken into custody. As a result of the investigation,
Cpl. Stewart located a black in color Glock 23 .40 (#UXL274) handgun, in a trashcan, next to the porch where the juveniles were
standing. Monroe was charged in reference to the firearm, and DNA was taken as part of the investigation.

On Wednesday May 31st 2300 hours, members of Safe Streets were on proactive patrol in the West Center City area when they observed a gray in color Hyundai Sonata fail to stop for a stop sign located at 5th and Washington Streets.  A vehicle stop was conducted as the vehicle entered I-95 S/B from 2nd St.  It was determined that the operator was a Lyft driver who had just picked up three subjects (Tashayna Harden BF 12/28/1990, Jermaine Washington-Loper BM 10/04/2000 (MBF-450) & C’Shaun Washington BM 03/26/2005) from the area of 7th and Jefferson Streets.  The driver consented to a vehicle search at which time Tashayna Harden BF 12/28/1990 stated that she was in possession of a firearm that was located in her purse.  Harden, Washington and Washington-Loper were detained without incident and transported to Central.  A Cobra Arms “Denali” .380 semi-automatic handgun (#K17232) loaded with six rounds of .380 ammunition was collected from the purse and was not listed as stolen at the time of this investigation.  Washington and Washington-Loper consented to have their DNA collected and were released without charges pending the outcome of a DNA analysis.  Harden agreed to be interviewed and admitted that the firearm belonged to her.  Harden, who did not have a concealed carry weapons permit, was charged with CCDW.

During the month of April 2024, Det. Cuadrado initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales by Antoine
Young BM 01/29/1983 from 2501 West Street, Wilmington. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored
and obtained for Antoine Young and 2501 West Street, Wilmington. On Friday May 10th at 1349 hours, members of the Vice Unit and
OSS established surveillance on 2501 West Street, and 318 E. 22nd Street for Antoine Young. Young was observed exiting 318 E. 22nd
Street and stopped without incident. During this stop Young was found to possess 2.84 grams of crack cocaine on his person.
Investigators then executed the search warrant for 2501 West Street, without incident. Nothing of evidentiary value was located at this
residence. Based on the stop of Antoine Young and the crack cocaine seized, Det. Cuadrado authored and obtained a search warrant
for 318 E. 22nd Street. The warrant was executed at 318 E. 22nd Street without incident. A Smith & Wesson .38 Revolver (#7D19716)
was located along with drug paraphernalia. Young was charged accordingly and a test fire form was submitted to FSU.

On Wednesday January 10, 2024, Det. Coffiey received information that Anthony Miller BM 02/29/1976 was
selling Crack Cocaine in the 400 block of N. Monroe Street while in possession of a handgun. Det. Coffiey initiated surveillance on
Miller in the 400 block of N. Monroe St and observed him unlawfully consuming alcohol on a city street. Members of the Vice Unit
along with K9 Officer Williams conducted a pedestrian stop on Miller during which time he fled from officers. After a brief foot
pursuit and struggle, Vice Officers and K9 Officer Williams and his partner were able to quickly apprehend Miller. A black in color
Stoeger STR-9 9mm handgun (#T6429-21418114) was recovered from Miller’s front waistband along with (80) MDMA pills and (2
grams) of Crack Cocaine. Miller was transported to the Wilmington Hospital, evaluated, treated and released. The firearm as well as
the Test Fire Form was submitted to FSU for processing. A restriction was requested from the aforementioned area as part of his bail.

On September 9, 2024 at approximately 0823 hours, Officer Stewart was proactively patrolling the area of W 2nd St and N Harrison St when he observed a 2003 tan Chevrolet Suburban bearing DE temp registration #XF361951 driving Southbound in the 100 block of N Harrison St with an expired tag. Officer Stewart conducted a traffic stop on same in the BP gas station. 
Immediately upon walking up to the vehicle, the officer observed a zipped up black backpack to be sitting in the front passenger seat. 
The driver was identified as Ashshahiyd Perkins (02/09/1998). Upon request, Perkins provided officers with a Delaware Identification card, however not the vehicle insurance and registration. Perkins advised that he did not have insurance on his vehicle or the current vehicle registration in possession. During an inventory search of the vehicle, officers located (1) black in color MPA Defender Master Piece Arms Comer, GA MAC 10, 9mm caliber semi-automatic handgun (SN #FX29875) with a suppressor attached to the front muzzle end of the firearm with an extended magazine loaded inside same. The firearm was located inside Perkin’s book bag.  Also located was (1) additional Glock .45 caliber magazine loaded with (10) .45mm rounds.

On July 25th, 2025 members of Safe Streets were contacted by S/Cpl. Dan Shea regarding a subject possibly armed with a handgun in the area of 2nd and DuPont Streets. Members of Safe Streets canvassed the area and observed Aubrey Lecompte (04/02/1997), who matched the description provided by S/Cpl. Shea, in the 300 block of N. DuPont Street. Officers observed Lecompte displaying characteristics of a criminal gunman. A pedestrian stop was conducted, and Lecompte was found to be in possession of a concealed SCCY CPX-2 9mm (SN: C130992) handgun, loaded with 7 rounds of ammunition. Lecompte was taken into custody without incident.

On Thursday May 5th 1825 hours, A Platoon Officers Wilkers/Bond conducted a traffic stop on a vehicle with heavy
window tint in the 1000 block of N. Madison St. Upon approaching the vehicle, officers detected a strong odor of freshly burnt
marijuana and observed marijuana blunts in the ashtray. As a result, the occupants were asked to exit the vehicle. Driver: Averian
Brown BM 08/20/97 & Front Passenger: Genesis Omri BF 05/25/02. As officers conducted a probable cause search of the vehicle,
Averian Brown became verbally combative, stating that no probable causes existed to search his car. He then stated that his “licensed
firearm” was in the vehicle. A search of the rear fold down armrest revealed a black in color .380 S&W which contained 7 live rounds
in the magazine and one in the chamber. Also located within the vehicle was (1 gram) of Marijuana. Post Miranda interview, Brown
advised that he and the passenger work at Amazon on Boxwood Rd and he was in the process of dropping her off at her residence
prior to the traffic stop. Brown stated that he had obtained a CCDW permit from the state of Iowa approximately one year ago.
Genesis Omri was released with no charges. Averian Brown was charged with CCDW & Improper Window Tint.

On August 8, 2024, at approximately 2006 hours, officers responded to a report of shots fired in the 2300 block of N. Market Street. An unidentified caller reported that an unknown male had discharged a firearm into the air in front of Milton Liquors. Upon arriving at the scene, Officer Gula encountered the defendant, Christopher Sanchez (07/17/1990), standing in front of the specified location. During the interaction, Officer Gula noticed a fixed object protruding from under Sanchez’s shirt and observed that Sanchez was exhibiting characteristics consistent with an armed individual, including angling his body away from the officer’s line of sight. After confirming that Sanchez was concealing a firearm, he was placed under arrest without incident. A search incident to the arrest revealed a Ruger Model 57 semi-automatic handgun, 5.7x28mm (SN #642-19663), in Sanchez’s front waistband. The firearm was loaded with 21 rounds in the magazine and one round in the chamber.

purchaser_name: Avia Truitt at First State Firearms
case_summary:
On Saturday, August 6th , 2022 at approximately 2222 hours, Wilcom dispatched officers to 801 W 5 th Street, Apt N, for a domestic
related assault. Upon arrival, officers made contact with the above listed suspects, who each advised that a verbal altercation turned
physical. During the incident, both subjects allegedly began hitting each other, causing offense and alarm to each. It was also learned
that TRUITT displayed a firearm at FLETCHER, causing her to fear for her life. This domestic occurred in the presence of several
other residents. Officers took both subjects into custody, and secured the firearms. Both subjects refused medical attention and were
transported to central where charges will be authored for assault and aggravated menacing related offenses.

On June 1st 1542 hours, D Platoon responded to the area of Justison and S. West St in reference to a hit and run
complaint. WILCOM dispatch advised that an off-duty NCCPD officer observed the hit and run collision and was following the
striking vehicle. WPD officers conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 400 block of MLK Blvd. Upon approaching the vehicle, officers
made contact with Avian Curbison and observed the rear handle portion of a black in color firearm partially concealed in the center
console underneath the radio. Curbison was asked to exit the vehicle and officers took custody of the firearm (Ruger .380 loaded with
6 rounds). Curbison consented to a search of the vehicle which resulted in the recovery of (75.8) grams of marijuana

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On April 30, 2025, at approximately 2128 hours, Officers Mann, Diaz, Simpler, and Lopez, were on a proactive patrol in the area of 600 N. Adams St. Officers observed a Jeep Grand Cherokee (NJ 146285V), which appeared to have illegal tint. Due to the illegal tint, officers attempted to conduct a motor vehicle stop. The vehicle initially accelerated in speed, attempting to flee, however, the driver soon pulled over. Officer Mann made contact with the driver, Banford Poole (12/07/1993); it was learned that Poole had a suspended license. At this time, Poole was asked to step out of the vehicle. Officer Diaz then observed a firearm inside the driver’s side panel. The firearm was identified to be a black Glock 48 9mm (S/N: BYCY114) handgun, loaded with one chambered round and nine rounds in the magazine. Poole was transported back to Central and charged accordingly.
not in gunstat meeting reports

defendant_name: Jeremiah Winder, Laron Coleman, Elijah Winder
case_summary:
On October 6, 2025, at approximately 2144 hours, Officer Diaz observed a black in color Jeep Cherokee (DE
PC542253) fail to stop at a number of stop signs. Officer Diaz stopped the Jeep in the 1900 block of North Market Street. During the
stop, the driver, Jeremiah Winder (10/09/2003) and front passenger, Laron Coleman (12/06/2007), appeared visibly nervous. Elijah
Winder (08/14/2002) was in the rear passenger seat. Due to officer safety concerns and the suspicious behavior, all occupants were
detained. At this time, Elijah Winder admitted to having a firearm in his pants – a Glock 19X 9mm (SN#CELC529) handgun. The
weapon was secured and when asked if there were other firearms in the vehicle, Jeremiah Winder advised an additional firearm was
under the driver’s seat – a Glock 19 9mm (SN#CDKL958) handgun, which was recovered. Officer Diaz later located twenty-two 5.56
rifle rounds in a black plastic bag that was on the rear seat, as well as an additional American Manufacturing AM15-C 5.56
(SN#NS293875) Rifle.
All three occupants were transported to Central, along with the recovered firearms.

On Thursday February 1, 2024, at approximately 1015 hours, members of Safe Streets were in the 1500 block of W. 4th St where they conducted a vehicle stop of a silver in color Honda Accord (DE 972728) for a tint violation. Officers made contact with the sole occupant, Blanche Dunnum BF 03/29/1985, who advised she did not have a tint waiver for her vehicle. During the encounter, officers learned that Dunnum was in possession of a handgun, which was concealed within the driver’s door pocket. Blanche was ultimately removed from the vehicle and detained without incident. Officers recovered a Taurus G3 9mm (#ADC071711) and approximately 19 grams of marijuana inside of Dunnum’s purse.

On Wednesday December 21st 1759 hours, C Platoon Officers responded to the Wilmington Hospital for a person
with a gun. Upon arrival, Constables advised that the defendant, Blanche Dunnum BF 03/29/85 came into the hospital claiming that
her boyfriend was chasing her in a vehicle and that she drove to the hospital for safety. As constables were directing her to move her
vehicle from the ER entrance to the parking lot, she advised that she had a firearm in her purse. The constables retrieved the purse to
secure the weapon, which was a Smith &Wesson 9mm Shield loaded with six 9mm rounds. Also found in the purse were several bags
containing Marijuana (15.4 grams). The evidence was turned over to the officers and the Defendant was taken into custody. She was
charged with CCDW and PFBPP.

On April 10, 2025, members of Safe Streets responded to 2927 West St, in reference to L3 Probationer, Laandrea
Gibson (07/04/1991). Officers conducted an administrative search of the residence and located a loaded Taurus G3 9mm
(#ABJ869671) handgun in Gibson’s bedroom. Additionally Gibson was found to be in possession of MDMA. Gibson was
transported to Central, where he admitted to possession the handgun.

time_to_recovery: Not clear – lists gun purchase date as 8/5/25, but it was recovered 5/29/25?
case_summary:
On Thursday, May 29, 2025, at approximately 1423 hours, CGIC Detectives were contacted by Pltm. Hutt regarding a
possible robbery/assault which has occurred. Pltm. Hutt advised the victim was “pistol whipped” and robbed by a female and her friends
at 608 N. Washington St. (25-038909). Detectives are familiar with the residence and its occupants at which time they began responding
to the area to conduct surveillance. As Detectives were arriving in the area, Muhammad Means (03/28/2005) and Emanual Cooper (01/30/2006) were observed exiting the
residence. Both individuals had a bag in their possession, they then entered a tan Toyota Camry. Detectives surveilled the vehicle to the
area of 12th and West, at which point a vehicle stop was conducted. While initiating the stop, Cooper attempted to exit the rear passenger
side of the vehicle to flee, however, detectives immediately made contact and were able to detain him. While detain him, a black in color
Canik TP9 SFX (SN: 21-BC36622) 9mm handgun partially fell from his waistband, where it was immediately recovered. Means was the
