removed from the vehicle and detained. During a search of the rear seats, detectives located and recovered a black in color Taurus GX4
(SN: AEL831179) 9mm handgun, which was found under the driver’s seat. In addition, detectives located the bags that both individuals
were originally carrying, the bags were found to contain a total of 94.2 grams of marijuana. Both subjects were transported to Central

On February 23, 2025, at approximately 1130 hours, Officers Quinn and R. Mitchell were conducting a motor vehicle stop at 11th and Washington St. Officers learned the vehicle, a white in color Cadillac CTS (DE 330388) did not have a registration sticker on the license plate and initiated a stop. Kevin Britt (07/23/1990) was the sole occupant and owner of the vehicle. Upon taking the Britt’s information, it was learned he had a warrant for his arrest. After approaching the vehicle and asking Britt to step out, he then put the vehicle in drive and fled from officers. A brief pursuit occurred, until Britt collided with multiple vehicles at 14th and Washington St. Britt then exited the vehicle, continuing to flee on foot. He was quickly taken into custody. When asked if he had any weapons on his possession, Britt informed officers that he had a firearm in his vehicle. Officers then located a black in color Taurus G2C .40 caliber (S/N: #ACG066149). Britt was taken the hospital to be treated for injuries, and charged accordingly.

On October 14th, 2025, CGIC Detectives were conducting surveillance in the 400 block of N. Madison St in reference to
an on-going firearm investigation. While conducting surveillance, Detectives observed the defendant, Courtney George (11/17/2004),
who appeared to be involved in an argument with unknown subjects in the area of 5th and Madison.
While George was arguing, he walked behind a vehicle parked in the block and removed a black in color firearm from the front of his
waistband. After removing the firearm, George continued to argue with the unknown subjects. CGIC Detectives immediately responded to
the area where they attempted to make contact with George in the 300 block of N. Madison St at which point he immediately fled.
Detectives pursued George to 230 N Madison St where he entered the residence attempted to hold the door closed. Detectives were able to
make entry into the residence and take George into custody. A search warrant was then applied for and granted of the residence, where
detectives located and recovered a black in color Taurus G2C 9mm (SN#AEB066062) firearm loaded with 12 rounds of 9mm
ammunition along with an additional 77 rounds of ammunition. George and the evidence were transported to Central.

On Thursday July 14th 1823 hours, SCU were in the 1100 block of B St when they observed the defendant (Wilbert
Mable BM 10/06/98) wearing a cross body bag, displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. When officers exited their vehicle to
attempt a pedestrian stop, the defendant fled on foot into 1120 B St. Officers were able to gain entry into the residence at which time
the defendant was taken into custody. A search warrant was drafted for the residence at which time a Smith & Wesson Model 459
9mm was located inside the recovered cross body bag in the living room where the defendant was taken into custody. (3.6 grams) of
crack cocaine was recovered inside a living room dresser drawer and the defendant was found to be in possession of (46.1 grams) of
marijuana. Mable was also wanted by NCCPD for domestic related Stalking.

Officers responded to the 100 block of N Madison St in reference to an unresponsive person. Upon arrival, officers assisted EMS with the driver of a black in color Kia Sorento
DE PC213085 (later identified as William Triplett). It appeared that Triplett’s vehicle had collided with the rear bumper of a Chevrolet Silverado causing minor damage. Triplett
appeared to disoriented and possibly under the influence of PCP and was transported to Wilmington Hospital for evaluation. As officers were attempting to locate the vehicle
insurance information to provide to the owner of the Silverado, they located located a silver in color S&W 9mm (#FWF1994), with (14) 9mm rounds in the magazine which was located inside of the glove box. The vehicle was towed to central and officers obtained a search warrant for same. Upon execution of the search warrant, officers located a second
magazine containing (13) 9mm rounds and a holster.
Triplett was relased from the hospital and taken into custody. Triplett admitted to possessing the firearm without a legal permit. He was booked and processed for CCDW.
Case #30-22-15013

On Friday, August 11, 2024 at approximately 1829 hours officers were conducting proactive mobile patrol in the area in response to a call about a suspicious person who may be armed with a firearm. In addition, City Watch observed same.
Upon arrival at the location officers observed a black 2013 Nissan Sentra parked on the southeast corner bearing Delaware registration 585358, contact was made with the operator of the vehicle, Azaria Clark (11/07/2006). Clark denied any firearms in the vehicle and gave officers verbal consent to search the vehicle. Passenger, Klyne Summers (05/18/2005) had negative results on his person, however he met the description of the suspicious person. The other passenger, Yasir Laws (07/19/2004) advised officers that he had a capias for his arrest for a traffic violation. Laws was removed from the vehicle, he advised officers he did not have a firearm on his person, but did not give consent for officers to search him. Once Laws realized he was being taken into custody, he attempted to flee from these officers with violent force. Laws was taken to the ground and placed into custody; during a search incident to arrest, officers located a black 9mm Springfield Armory XDM loaded with 19 live rounds of 9mm ammunition (18 in magazine, 1 in chamber), (serial# MG920759) with a laser attachment in his right pant leg tucked in his compression pants. It should be noted that Laws was sitting directly next to Summers in the back of the vehicle. It is thought that the two could have passed around the firearm from the back seat of the vehicle.

defendant_name: Francis Miller, Derris Llyod, Ke-mani Evans, Josiah Grimes
case_summary:
On Friday May 13th 1312 hours, A Platoon officers (Kline/Oakes) were on proactive patrol in the 800 block of E 4th
St when they located a black Volkswagen Jetta which was a suspect vehicle in an earlier shots fired incident in the unit block of W.
24th St. Officers were able to get behind the vehicle and conduct a NCIC inquiry on the vehicles registration which revealed that the
vehicle was taken during an armed carjacking from 401 N Spruce St on May 12, 2022 at 1135 hours and was involved in a pursuit
with WPD on May 13, 2022 at 0009 hours.
Officers activated their emergency equipment at which time the vehicle refused to stop. A vehicle pursuit ensued which lasted several
minutes and eventually ended with the vehicle crashing at the intersection of E. 10th & N Spruce St. All suspects exited the vehicle,
which resulted in Ke’mani Evans BF 09/07/04 being run over by the suspect vehicle as it was still moving. When officers removed the
vehicle from Evans foot, they located a loaded Springfield 9mm handgun with an extended magazine under her body. That firearm
was reported stolen to DSP Troop 3 on September 30, 2020. Josiah Grimes BM 11/02/05 was taken into custody moments after the
collision.
Francis Miller BM 06/01/04 and Derris Lloyd BM 01/24/05 fled south on Spruce St while holding firearms. As officer’s approached
on Derris Lloyd’s location, he threw a pink in color SCCY 9mm handgun with an extended magazine in a vacant lot and was taken
into custody. Officers also located another firearm (black in color Polymer 80 .22 caliber) in the same lot. That firearm is believed to
belong to Francis Miller. Miller was able to elude police after the initial foot pursuit. M/Cpl. Draper dispatched a drone from the roof
of WPD headquarters and began flying same over the area where Miller was last seen. M/Cpl. Draper located Miller hiding in the
backyard of 913 Church St where he was taken into custody without incident

Over the past several months, CGIC detectives conducted a firearm investigation regarding Shawn Robbins BM 11/13/1999 in the 200 block of W 28th St. During that time, members of DOCV conducted a drug investigation into same. On February 2, 2024, CGIC, DOCV, Safe Streets, and members of the FBI task force established surveillance on 208 W 28th St in regards to the investigation. At approximately 1145 hours, the defendant Shawn Robbins BM 11/13/1999 arrived at the residence in a maroon in color Chevy Malibu. Detectives made contact with Shawn as he approached the residence at which point he was taken into custody without incident. While taking Shawn into custody, he was found to be in possession of a tan in color FN509 9mm handgun (#GKS0118657), loaded with a total of 13 rounds of ammunition, which was concealed in the front of his waist band. Once in custody, Detectives executed two search warrants at 208 W 28th St Apt 1 and 2. During a search of Apt 2, Detectives located and recovered one black in color Taurus G3C 9mm handgun (#ACN766562) loaded with 8 round of ammunition, a total of 136 grams of marijuana, 55 unused zip lock baggies used for the sale of marijuana, and a scale.

Street Crimes conducted a vehicle stop in the 600 block of W 6th St for a vehicle infraction. Officers approached the vehicle and observed a firearm on the front dash. Contact was
made with the driver (Briana Hazelett) who advised that the firearm was hers. The firearm was a FN 509 9mm with an extended magazine. Officers had all occupants of the
vehicle exit: Briana Hazelett BF 06/17/86 (driver), Mahogany Brown BF 06/17/86 (front seat passenger), Keshawn Swanson BM 01/24/05 (back seat passenger) & Javon Turner
BM 04/30/04 (back seat passenger). An inventory search was conducted and 52.4 grams of marijuana and 9 MDMA/Ecstasy pills were located in the vehicle. Hazelett was charged
with Driving while Suspended, Possession of Marijuana, Possession of MDMA, and Possession of a Firearm while in possession of drugs. Mahogany Brown was charged with
possession of marijuana. Swanson and Turner were released to their parents pending further investigation/DNA.

Over the last few months, members of Safe Streets developed information regarding Donnell Money BM
07/12/1989 who resides at 302 N. Union St., Apt. 2 being involved in drug sales and in possession of firearms. Money is a person prohibited from owning a firearm due to prior violent felony convictions. On August 30th at approximately 1129 hours, members of Safe Streets established surveillance in the area and observed Money driving in the 1900 block of W. 3rd St. Officers were aware that Money did not have a valid driver’s license and subsequently stopped and found to be in possession of a small amount of heroin/fentanyl. Money admitted that he owned firearms and same were located inside his apartment and consented to a search of same. Members of Safe Streets, along with the assistance of CGIC and TFO Lynch, located and seized the following:
• Mossberg 12 gauge shotgun (#MV77747G)
• Polymer 80 9mm (No Serial #)
• Polymer 80 9mm (No Serial #)
• Polymer 80 9mm (No Serial #) – as per FSU, 1 of the 3 Polymer 80’s was inoperable
• .042 grams of heroin/fentanyl
• .6 gram of crack cocaine
• Shotgun ammunition
• 9mm ammunition
• .32 caliber ammunition

On Tuesday May 10th 0952 hours, A Platoon Officer Osler conducted a traffic stop on a vehicle traveling in the
wrong direction in the unit block of E 22nd St. The officer made contact with the driver and sole occupant, Jermaine Dickerson, who
advised that he did not have a valid driver’s license and could not provide proof of insurance. As a result, Dickerson was asked to exit
the vehicle. While exiting the vehicle, the defendant advised that there was a loaded firearm under the driver seat. Officers located a
black in color Taurus Millennium G2 9mm handgun which was loaded with eight rounds and one in the chamber. The firearm was
concealed beneath the driver’s seat. A black in color “inside the waistband” style firearm holster with an additional magazine was
located in a separate area of the floorboard. One live 9mm round was located inside the center console and another live 9mm round
was located next to the defendant’s cell phone near the cup holder. A THC pen was also located inside the vehicle.
The defendant was transported to central and processed on several firearm related charges. DNA was taken.

On Friday April 21st 1341 hours, DOCV Investigators observed a wanted subject (Lenton Young BM 07/06/2006)
walking in the 2300 block Market Street. Young was known by Investigators to actively possess an active warrant for Abuse of
Pregnant Female Second Degree, Breach of Conditions of Bond as well as Arson by WFD. DOCV Investigators attempted to make
contact with Young in the 2100 block of Lamotte St, however Young began to flee leading Investigators on a brief foot pursuit. Young
was taken into custody without incident within the 2100 block of Lamotte Street. Search incident to arrest, Young was found to be in
possession of a black in color Ruger 9mm containing 6 rounds in the magazine 1 in the chamber bearing serial number 462-
76638) which was located inside the front of his waistband. The firearm was checked locally and NCIC and found to be reported
stolen out of New Castle County on 4/12/2023 out of a vehicle under case number 32-23-027041.

On Wednesday, July 2, 2025, at approximately 1104 hours, WPD CID detectives executed a search warrant at 2812
Rosemont Ave. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Simone Blagman and explained the reasoning of the warrants. As this was
happening, Dahmere White (01/14/1997) was seen opening a rear window to the residence and throwing a black bag out to a lower
roof. White, Blagman, and Shakei Hopskins (01/25/1992) were all detained while the evidence was collected.
The bag contained one tan Glock 19x 9mm (SN BKBY428) and one black and silver Glock 48 9mm (SNBKYT555). Detectives also
located heroin in Blagman's bedroom. Several cell phones were collected as part of the investigation. All suspects were transported to
CID and at the time of this report were being interviewed. DNA samples were collected from all suspects. CID obtained video
surveillance from Imani Village cameras which captured White throwing the black bag containing the guns out of the residence.

On Sunday, December 7, 2025, at approximately 1850 hours, Officers Diaz and Grieco were dispatched to 333 East 35th Street, in reference to an aggravated menacing incident. Upon arrival, officers determined that the victim had been involved in a road rage encounter in the area of 99 Eastlawn Avenue. During this incident, the defendant, later identified as Leonard Watson (02/01/1994)
produced a firearm and pointed it at the victim while operating his vehicle. The victim reported that he discreetly followed Watson’s vehicle back to his residence located at 523 East 35th Street. The victim observed the defendant enter the residence at which time he contacted 911. Officers responded to Watson’s residence and established a perimeter. Watson was observed attempting to exit through the rear of the
residence. At that time, officers entered the residence and placed Watson into custody. While entering through the basement, officers observed two handguns – one Smith & Wesson SW380 .380 (SN#RAB0920) handgun, and one Smith & Wesson SD9VE 9mm
(SN#FBH8888) handgun in plain view on the bed in the defendant’s bedroom. Additionally, a short-barreled AR-style Diamond Back LLC DC15 (SN#DB2104453) rifle with 30-round magazines was located in close proximity to the bed. A consent-to-search form was obtained and executed. During the search, officers recovered brass knuckles and a small quantity of marijuana. Watson was transported back to Central and charged accordingly.

On Monday August 14th, at approximately 1519 hours, this unit 111-David (Ludlam) responded to 315 Bradford
Street in reference to a person with a gun complaint. Upon arrival, this officer made contact with the reporting person/victim #1, Clifton Sykes who advised that the defendant Omar Core (BM 06/26/1981) but identifies as a female Alexis Young (BFNH 06/26/1981) responded outside of her residence 324 Bradford Street and started a verbal altercation with victim #2 Mike Cassidy, who is a contractor for Cassidy Painting. Sykes advised that he heard a verbal altercation between Core and Cassidy about the property
line, during this time he intervened himself into the argument. Skyes advised that Core responded out of her front door with a black in color handgun displaying and stated "I’ll put a cap in all your fucking asses" and continued arguing with him until he responded inside of his business to call 9-1-1. This officer made contact with the defendant who advised she got into a verbal altercation with the contractors over the property line.
Core further advised that Skyes intervened and advised that she felt threated by him. Core denied having a firearm but did advise that she did threaten the victims by stating "I never had a firearm, I told them I would pop them, but never had a firearm". During this time, assisting officers were viewing surveillance footage which showed Core exiting her front door and removing what appears to be a dark in color handgun from her back right pocket and moving it to her side as she walked down her steps and behind a vehicle. A search warrant of 324 Bradford Street was executed and resulted in the recovery of a Beretta PX4 9mm (# PX347636). The firearm had 8 live rounds in the magazine and 1 live round in the chamber. Per FSU, the firearm is inoperable

On January 14th, 2025, CGIC Detectives were monitoring Social Media when they observed Keshaun Swanson
(01/24/2005) post a video where he was in possession of a firearm with an extended magazine. During the investigation, detectives were
about to confirm the video and location. Probation was notified and was able to confirm Keshaun’s GPS points during the video at which
point detectives responded to the area with the assistance of K9 Williams and 18D (Davis/Holland).
Once in the area, they observed Keshaun walking in the 200 block of Delamore. As Detectives turned into the block, Keshaun
immediately changed directions and began to flee upon them exiting their vehicle. While Keshawn was fleeing, he discarded a black in
color Glock 43X 9mm (S/N #BZTK838) with an extended magazine containing 15 rounds of 9mm ammunition. After a brief foot
pursuit, Keshawn was taken into custody without incident and found in possession of .3 grams of heroin.

On August 9th 2115 hours, Safe Streets received information from a past proven and reliable confidential informant regarding a subject armed with a firearm in the area of the 300 block of W. 7th Street.  The officers responded to the area and observed Byeer Cherry, matching the description provided by the informant.  As the officers approached Cherry, he attempted to flee into 309 W. 7th Street, but was stopped by the officers.  During the stop, the officers located a loaded Taurus G2C 9mm firearm concealed inside a fanny pack affixed to Cherry’s chest area.  The officers also located approximately (18 grams) of marijuana inside the fanny pack.

On Thursday June 13, 2024, at approximately 1430 hours, Robert Chavis BM 08/04/2000 responded to the Cherry Lane Probation Office at which time he was taken into custody regarding an ongoing drug and firearm investigation.  Probation Officers as well as Safe Streets responded to Chavis’ residence located at 1212 Elm Street to conduct and administrative search.  During the search, officers located the below listed items from Chavis’ bedroom:

•	Glock “25” .380 semi-auto (S/N: AHZL362 – 29N)
•	Smith and Wesson “M&P Shield” 9mm semi-auto (S/N: JCE3042)
•	Silver in color Revolver (Unknown make, model and S/N)
•	Ammunition
•	2.5 grams of crack cocaine
•	.357 grams of heroin
•	3 Alprazolam pills

Chavis was transported to Central where he was interviewed regarding this incident as well as recent violence in the City of Wilmington. Chavis was charged accordingly and test fire forms were submitted to FSU.

On November 24, 2025, DOCV, with the assistance of CGIC, executed a search warrants at 2616 N. Thatcher St. regarding an ongoing Drug and Firearm Investigation. Officers established surveillance on the residence, when they observed Devin Wright (11/21/75) leave the residence on foot. Detectives coordinated a stop of Wright in the area of N. Thatcher St. and E. 27th St.
where he was taken into custody without incident prior to executing the search warrant. As a result, officers seized a loaded Black and Silver Ruger LC380 .380 caliber handgun. The serial number was originally obliterated, however partially restored by FSU to reveal
SN# 3*22238**. In addition, officers located a total of 3,258 bags (97.74 g) of Heroin. Wright was taken back to Central and charged accordingly, as well as processed on four (4) outstanding capias’.

On January 16, 2025, at approximately 1041 hours, members of Safe Streets were in the area of 4th and Rodney Streets
when they observed Nahreem Qaadir-Bey (08/28/89) operating a beige in color Saturn SUV (DE XQ604138). Officers were aware that
Qaadir-Bey was on Level 2 probation with an active violation of probation warrant. Officers followed the Saturn to the 700 block of
Clayton Street where Qaadir-Bey quickly pulled into the St. Francis Hospital drop off lane. Qaadir-Bey and his passenger, Dre’quille
Brickhouse (06/21/96), exited the Saturn and walked inside the hospital entrance. A few minutes later, Brickhouse was observed exiting
the hospital from a different exit, at which time a pedestrian stop was initiated.
Brickhouse, who is on level 3 GPS probation, stated that Qaadir-Bey was heading toward the emergency room, but could not provide a
reason why. Members of Safe Streets located Qaadir-Bey aimlessly wandering the halls of St. Francis Hospital and took him into custody
for his VOP warrant. During the subsequent search officers located a Kahr “CW-45” .45 semi-automatic firearm in his pants pocket as
well as 0.9 grams of suspected heroin/fentanyl. A search of the Saturn yielded no additional evidence.
Qaadir-Bey and Brickhouse were both transported to Central and interviewed. Brickhouse was eventually released without criminal
charges. *However was arrested 01/17/2025.*
not in gunstat meeting reports

On Friday October 24th 1432 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 1000 block of Maple Street when they observed
the defendant Pollard, Carron (BM 04/24/1997) walking west bound on Maple Street actively smoking a marijuana blunt.
Investigators exited their vehicle and made contact with Defendant 1 Pollard and Defendant 2 Sykes, Cheldon (BM 06/14/2000).
While speaking with Defendant 1 Pollard, he was asked if he had any additional marijuana on his person which he responded yes.
SCU Investigators patted down Pollard and his cross body satchel which a firearm was felt inside same. Pollard was taken into
custody and a (Black in color Girsan MC28 SA T 9mm handgun containing 14 live rounds in the magazine which was bearing serial
number 20AV09508) was removed from the satchel. Investigators located approximately 8.4 grams marijuana on Pollard’s person.
While dealing with Pollard, additional investigators observed Defendant 2 Sykes, Cheldon (BM 06/14/2000) to be extremely nervous
as well as displaying a bulge in his waistband consistent with characteristics of an armed gunman. Investigators detained Defendant 2
Sykes and a pat down for officer safety was conducted. During the pat down, Investigators located (Tan in color SIG Sauer P320
9mm handgun containing (9) live 9mm rounds in the magazine) and possessed serial number 58K091288. Both firearms were
checked locally NCIC and negative. Neither Defendant possessed a valid CCDW permit.

On June 30th 2024 at approximately 1712 hours, Uniformed Officers were dispatched
to the area of 4th and Church Streets in regards to a complaint of shots fired. Upon arrival, officers made contact made with
victims David Wilson 10/13/84, and Dashawn Gibbs, 5/15/88, who advised they arrived at the park, but were unable to enter the
parking lot due to a red SUV – unknown make/model - blocking the entrance. Wilson made verbal contact with the driver of the
SUV, the victims only knew the suspect as “Black Nine.” Wilson then exited his 2004 Chevrolet Tahoe bearing DE registration
#PC391928 and requested that the suspect pull his vehicle forward to allow his car to pass – this caused a verbal dispute
between the parties. The suspect/ “Black Nine” eventually pulled forward allowing Wilson’s Tahoe to enter, however as they
passed the vehicle, two shots were fired, striking Wilson’s vehicle causing damage. The suspect then fled the area. Officers
made contact with Gibbs who corroborated Wilson’s account of the incident. Gibbs advised that after the shots were fired, he
observed the suspect holding a handgun – unknown make/model. Officers were able to locate and collect two (2) 9mm casings
in the 300 block of N. Church St.
----------------------------------------------------------- Update ---------------------------------------------------------------
This incident was assigned to Detective Justin Wilkers on July, 1, 2024. Through the investigation, he was able to identify the
suspect “Black Nine” as Quinton White 04/15/1984, and a warrant was granted.
On July 9th, 2024, at approximately 1237 hours, Quinton White was observed in the area of 6th and Lombard, where he was
riding an electric scooter. It was known that White was wanted several times for outstanding warrants. After a brief foot pursuit,
White was eventually located in the area of 500 W 10th Street. A search of his person revealed a SCCY 9mm firearm along with
46 grams of crack cocaine as well as numerous pills. . It should be noted while White was being placed into custody he began
yelling to officers, “You’re lucky you caught me before I got back to 30th Street. I’m not going back to jail and would have been
shooting at you!” White was transported to Central, where he admitted to being in area of the original incident, but denied any
involvement. White was processed on his warrant and charged.

dealer_name: Target Master (license name Tommy Gun Inc)
case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On July 30, 2025, Officers Hutt and Connor were dispatched to 511 W. 4th St, in reference to a medical complaint. Officers made contact with the Wilmington Fire Department’s EMS personnel who advised while speaking with Charles Andrews (01/16/1987), they noticed a handgun located in his waistband area. Officers observed Andrews to be highly intoxicated, at which time they placed Andrews into custody without incident and seized the Taurus G2C 9mm (SN: ABM304853) handgun. EMS continued to examine Andrews, however he refused to be treated and was transported to Central.

On Wednesday April 20th 2120 hours, Safe Streets assisted P&P with an admin search regarding a Level 3
Probationer, Andre Pierce BM 10/10/02.
Located inside the residence:
Andre Pierce BM 10/10/02
Candra Bryant BF 06/01/86 (Andre’s mother)
Dahmir Cooper BM 01/08/08
Rahmir Pierce BM 07/31/13
Athier Pierce BM 04/24/15
Ja’Cier Pierce BM 03/14/21
Items seized during the search:
Marijuana (25 grams) – located in the defendant’s shirt pocket Glock 22 handgun (loaded with 21 rounds of .40cal ammunition inside an extended magazine) – located in the defendant’s bedroom
One live 9mm round – located in the defendant’s bedroom
Marijuana (3.2 grams) – located in the laundry room behind the defendant’s bedroom
Glock 19 handgun (loaded with 18 rounds of 9mm ammunition inside an extended magazine) – located in a toddler’s bedroom closet
Century Arms Rifle (with an empty magazine) – located in the back yard of the residence inside a green/back duffle bag
Two cellphones
During a post Miranda interview, Andre Pierce confessed to possessing the marijuana and stated that one of the handguns was his, but
he did not specify which handgun. He also confessed that ‘the big one is mine”, referring to the rifle. He also confessed to knowing
where it was found in the back of the residence outside by the garage.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
Over the past 3 weeks, CGIC Detectives initiated an investigation into a shots fired incident which occurred on July 10, 2025, at approximately 2054 hours, in the area of 1400 St. Elizabeth St. During the incident, an unknown male discharged a shotgun into the driver’s side door of a Toyota Highlander (DE PC404401). Witnessed on scene advised the suspect fled southbound on Broom where he entered a Grey in color SUV. During the course of the investigation, Detectives, along with the assistance of Cpl Stewart, were able to identify the vehicle, as well as Jesus Ortiz-Seda (08/28/1992) as a person of interest.
Detectives established surveillance on 1616 Bonwood Rd Apt P1, where they observed Ortiz-Seda enter and exit same along with 1614 Bonwood Rd Apt O2. Detectives applied for and were granted residential search warrants for both residences.
On July 28th, 2025 Detectives established surveillance on 1616 Bonwood Rd and observed the Ortiz-Seda exit the residence and enter the suspect vehicle. Detectives were able to make contact without incident. Once Ortiz-Seda was in custody, Detectives executed the search warrants with the assistance of DOCV. During a search of the residences, the following was located a rusted New England Firearms 20 Gauge Shotgun – which had a sawed-off 12 ¾ inch barrel. In addition, Detectives located 36 rounds of 223 ammunition, two rounds of 762 ammunition, 78 rounds of 380 ammunition, two rounds of 9mm ammunition, nine 20 gauge shotgun shells, two 30 round rifle magazines, one 380 caliber magazine, and two holsters. Ortiz-Seda and the evidence were transported to Central, where he then admitted to discharging the Shotgun into the vehicle.

On Wednesday April 6th 1801 hours, SCU officers received information from an off duty officer in regards to a
subject walking east in the 1600 block of W 2nd St displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. SCU officers responded to the area
and located the subject who immediately grabbed his waistband and fled on foot. After a brief foot pursuit, officers were able to take
Ahmeer Ledbetter in custody. He was found to be in possession of a loaded 380 Ruger LCP with an extended magazine. The firearm
was located in Ledbetter’s right pant leg and appeared to have fallen from his waistband. Ledbetter was also found to be in possession
of (5.5 grams) Marijuana.

Over the past month, CGIC detectives conducted a firearm/drug investigation into 306 N Harrison St. During this investigation, Detectives were able to identify Bobby Lomax as being involved. As a result of the investigation, detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 306 N Harrison St.
On August 27th, 2024 Bobby Lomax (02/14/1988) was observed exiting the residence and responding to the area of 4th and Franklin St, at which point members of CGIC and Safe Streets were able to make contact with Lomax. Once Lomax was detained, Detectives executed the search warrant at 306 N Harrison St where they made contact with Bobby’s girlfriend Key’anu Hollis. During a search of the residence detectives located and recovered a black in color Ruger Security-9 9mm Handgun (S/N 3821407) loaded with a total of 10 rounds of 9mm ammunition, one (1) clear vacuum seal bag of marijuana weighing approximately 425 grams, a total of twenty eight (28) small zip lock bags of marijuana each weighing approximately 3.5 grams (98 grams), a scale, and packaging material.

On Wednesday May 31st at 1521 hours, officers were dispatched to Forman Mills (4411 N. Market St.) for a
customer that pulled a handgun on an employee. The defendant, Cherish Bowe BF 06/29/1997, attempted to return a damaged speaker ($29.99 value) and argued with store employees when they refused to refund her money. During the argument, store employees stated that the defendant pulled a handgun out of a black satchel bag and put it into her waistband. This action was clearly seen by the store employees. During the argument, the defendant also stated, “You better give me my money or else.” The defendant
fled from Forman Mills and was spotted by members of the Gun Investigation Unit. The defendant was pulled over in the 2800 blk of N. Market St. During the traffic stop, officers observed a black-in-color Ruger .380 handgun (#376-37252) in plain view. The defendant was positively identified by store employees and taken into custody.

On Monday October 14, 2024 at approximately 0145 hours, A Platoon officers (Mann/Diaz) responded to the 4111
N Market St (Forman Mills parking lot) in reference to a “Street Takeover” (street racing). Upon arrival to the area multiple vehicles
began to flee the area at a high rate of speed. Due to the risks posed, no pursuits were initiated. While maintaining presence and
patrolling the area, Officers Mann and Diaz conducted a pedestrian stop on two suspicious males who were later determined to be
associated with the “Street Takeover” and identified as Donovan Spatz WM 01/11/2005 and Ethan Spatz WM 01/20/2006. While
continuing to survey the area, Officers Mann and Diaz located a 2016 Volkswagen Passat (PA LGR7144) parked in a handicap spot at
the Police Athletic League (3707 N Market St). Officers observed a female hiding in the rear seat of the vehicle and observed
fireworks located on the front passenger seat in plain view. The investigation led to the vehicle being towed to Central, where a search
warrant was applied for and granted. The execution of the search warrant revealed a Taurus G3C handgun (S/N #ACM620081)
which was concealed in the center console of the vehicle. The firearm was equipped with a magazine containing twelve (12) rounds
of 9mm ammunition. During the search, a red backpack was observed on the front passenger seat, the backpack contained an
additional black magazine holding twelve (12) rounds of 9mm ammunition. Through investigation measures, officers were able to
confirm that the red back pack, the magazine and spare ammunition belonged to Donavan Spatz, also confirming that Donavan was
operating the vehicle through the night and early morning hours and in possession of the vehicle keys.

In May 2023, TFO Schupp along with the FBI Task Force initiated an investigation into Antonio Carter BM
11/20/1977 and Dwayne Britt BM 02/20/1977 for Crack Cocaine sales in the Center City area of Wilmington. During the
investigation, Det. Schupp authored and obtained two search warrants for 834 W. 5th St., Wilmington, DE and 1406 W. 6th St.,
Wilmington, DE (see District 18 Summary for Britt arrest)
On August 22, 2023, Det. Schupp, the FBI Wilmington Resident Office, members of the Vice Unit, CGIC, and K9 executed the search
warrants at the two locations without incident.
During the search of 834 W. 5th St, Antonio Carter BM 11/20/1977 was taken into custody. David Loper BM 12/02/2003 (Carter’s
step-son) observed police and immediately fled up to the second floor of the residence prior to being detained. A search of the
residence was conducted and resulted in the recovery of:
• Smith & Wesson SD9VE 9mm (#HEP3653), loaded with 14 rounds – reported stolen to Philadelphia PD
• Polymer 80 PF45 frame with a Glock 10mm slide handgun (#BYV2939)
• (50) rounds of 9mm ammunition
• (7.4) grams of Marijuana
• (.175) grams of Heroin/Fentanyl
• (.1) grams of Crack Cocaine
• (71.5) MDMA pills
• $4,201 USC
• Drug paraphernalia
• Cell phones

On Thursday March 7th, 2024, CGIC detectives were conducting a firearm investigation regarding Chavez Water
BM 03/01/2007 whom they observed walking in the area of A and S. Heald St. Detectives began to conducted surveillance on Chavez
at which point he was observed displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. As Chavez crossed B St towards C St, detectives
briefly lost sight of him at which point he immediately fled through an alleyway. Detectives conducted a brief area search and
observed Chavez exiting an alleyway onto C St where he was taken into custody. Chavez was found to be in possession of a black in
color Taurus G2C firearm (#ABM217189) with an extended magazine which was found to be loaded with 23 rounds of ammuniti

On Saturday May 11, 2024, at approximately 2121 hours, Officer Stewart was dispatched to 615 N. Bancroft Pkwy for a report of subjects fighting outside. Moments later, Wilcom advised that one of the subjects involved in the fight was armed with a firearm. Through the course of the investigation, Officer Stewart learned that the defendant, Cliff Henry BM 12/29/1998, displayed a firearm to the victim, the cousin of the defendant’s girlfriend, during a domestic related argument. Officer Stewart placed the defendant into custody without incident. While on scene, Officer Stewart conducted a canvass for the firearm. During that time, Officer Stewart observed a Glock .45 (#LES605) in plain view on the floorboard of a vehicle parked outside of the defendant’s residence. The defendant was transported to Central, where he was charged with aggravated menacing, terrorist threatening, and CCDW. The firearm was submitted into evidence and a Test Fire form was submitted to FSU.

On Thursday January 11, 2024, at approximately 2206 hours, members of Safe Streets observed a white in color,
Chrysler Pacifica (NJ G82SMA) traveling W/B on 4th St without its headlights/taillights turned on. A vehicle stop was conducted in
the 400 block of N. Franklin St. The operator (Jerry Smith BM 07/25/1980) was found to have a suspended driver’s license as well
as a capias out of JP 20 for traffic charges. Additionally, officers observed a large bag of marijuana (56.2 grams) in the back of the
vehicle. Smith and his passenger (Alann Hutchinson BF 06/07/1994) were removed from the vehicle and Smith was detained
without incident. Hutchinson was found to be in possession of (8 grams) of crack cocaine, (.336 grams) of heroin/fentanyl and a
loaded Glock 43 9mm handgun (#BSSB219) concealed underneath her clothing. Smith, Hutchinson and the vehicle were transported
to Central. During a post Miranda interview, Hutchinson stated that when officers initiated the traffic stop, Smith handed her the
drugs and firearm, ordering her to hide them on her person. Smith declined to be interviewed regarding this investigation. DNA was
collected from both defendants and a test fire form was submitted. Both defendants were charged accordingly.
**UPDATE**
On Friday January 12, 2024, members of Safe Streets executed a search warrant at 104 Greenridge Road where they located and
seized the following:
• 38 grams of crack cocaine
• .497 grams of heroin/fentanyl
• 9mm and .40 caliber ammunition
• Digital scales
• Drug packaging material
• Stamps commonly used on bags of heroin/fentanyl
Warrants were authored for the additional charges for both defendants as a result of the items located during the search warrant. Since
their arrest on 1/12/24, Smith has been held on $74,103 cash bail, and Hutchinson has been held on $64,350 cash bail.

On June 27, 2024, at approximately 1635 hours, Safe Streets was contacted by members of Delaware Probation and
Parole, requesting assistance with an administrative search of a residence located at 314 Cedar Street. Members of Safe Streets and CGIC
responded to the residence where Isaiah Harrington (BMNH 6/1/04) and his brother, Elijah Ramsey (BMNH 11/21/05) were taken into
custody.
During the administrative search officers located a black in color, Ruger “LCP” .380 handgun in Harrington’s bedroom. Both
defendants were transported to Central where they were interviewed regarding this incident as well as recent violence in the City of
Wilmington. Both Harrington and Ramsey subsequently admitted to possessing the handgun, despite being convicted felons.
Harrington and Ramsey were charged accordingly, and a test fire form was submitted to FSU. Administrative warrants for both
defendants were submitted, but bail information was not available at the time this report was written.
It should be noted that the day prior, on June 26, 2024 the younger brother of Harrington and Ramsey (Caleb Ramsey BMNH 11/20/06) was
the victim of a shooting at Cedar and Brown Streets. CID was notified of the arrests and conducted their independent interviews regarding
the shooting investigation.

On December 12, 2024, at approximately 2225 hours, Officer D. Shea was on a proactive patrol, when he observed a blue Jeep Cherokee (MD 4AN8401) traveling eastbound on West 3rd St, approaching N. Madison St. The vehicle was reported stolen out of NCCPD during an armed carjacking. 
After attempting to conduct a vehicle stop, a pursuit ensued onto I95 and 141. The driver then fled from the vehicle at W. 9th and Gray Street, and the pursuit continued on foot. A witness advised officers that the black male entered their rear yard, and jumped the fence into the neighbor’s yard. At this time, the male, identified as Dewann Wilson (02/19/2007) was taken into custody. A search of Wilson was conducted and officers found a Hi-point magazine, containing nine (9) rounds of .40 caliber ammunition on his person.
Officers then conducted a search of the rear yard, where they located a Taurus G2C .40 (S/N #ABD527138) handgun with one (1) .40 cal. in the chamber, besides Wilson’s clothing. 
Officer Shea then responded back to the Jeep Cherokee, where a Hi-Point JCP .40 (S/N #X7157486) with an extended magazine, was found, in plain view in the center console. 
NCCPD responded to the scene and took custody of the vehicle for processing, as well as the Hi-point JCP Firearm. NCCPD responded to WPD Central to obtain a search warrant for Wilson’s DNA.

On Tuesday April 5th 0605 hours, WPD CMTT & FBI Violent Crimes Task Force executed a search warrant at 1401
Sycamore Ave., Apt. 4 in Elsmere for a subject (Ashley Smith) wanted by Philadelphia PD for a shooting that occurred 10/31/21.
Items seized during the search:
Taurus 9mm (#TIT26892) – reported stolen out of Philadelphia
575 grams Marijuana
478 MDMA pills

On Friday February 24th 1511 hours, SCU Investigators conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 2100 block of Menser Way for a vehicle infraction. The rear passenger quickly opened the door and exited the vehicle at which time he began fleeing on foot. Investigators gave chase and ultimately took Defendant 1 (Jerry Toston BM 06/28/1999) into custody in the 2200 block of Lamotte Street. The remaining Investigators proceeded with the vehicle stop. During the vehicle stop, Investigators observed a holstered Glock Model 23 SN# BTHV312 40 caliber firearm containing 13 rounds in the magazine located in between the front passenger seat and the center console. The occupants, Operator (Tyrone Caine BM 11/26/1990), front passenger (Corwin Allen BM 2/15/1991), and driver side rear passenger Defendant 2 (Jabrei Chase BM 01/06/1999) were all removed from the vehicle. Everyone was patted down at which time Defendant 2 Chase was found to be in possession of 34.2 grams of marijuana on his person. Investigators conducted a vehicle search and located a (black in color 9mm Polymer 80 handgun which contained (1) one round in the chamber and (11) eleven rounds in the magazine) tucked underneath the front passenger seat where Defendant 1 (Toston) was seated. All subjects consented to DNA which was collected and tagged into evidence. A test fire request was completed for both firearms. Toston was charged with CCDW, PFBPP x 2 (Gun & Ammo), and Resisting Arrest Chase was issued a written citation for Marijuana Possession and Caine was issued a traffic citation for turn signal violation.
not provided

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On August 9, 2025, at approximately 1751 ours, members of Safe Streets stopped a red in color Nissan Sentra (DE: 234517) in the 3900 block of Shipley Street for a stop sign violation. The sole occupant of the vehicle was identified as Denny Toston (06/11/2008). Toston was removed from the vehicle and officers established probable cause to search same. During the subsequent search officers located a loaded Sig Sauer 9mm (SN: #52E029294) handgun with an extended magazine, approximately 282 grams of marijuana and drug packaging material all concealed within the vehicle. Toston was taken into custody without incident and transported to Central.

On Wednesday January 3, 2024, at approximately 1513 hours, members of Safe Streets responded to 19 Central Ave., New Castle, DE to assist Probation Officers with an administrative search/arrest.  Upon arrival Probation Officers had Stephen Grabowski WM 08/13/1984 in custody.  Grabowski is a level 3 probationer who also had a NCCPD hard warrant for domestic related terroristic threatening and harassment. During a search of the property officers located the following:

•	Mossburg 20 gauge shotgun (#K837080) which was located concealed inside a blanket in the back seat of a red GMC Sierra pickup parked directly next to the residence. Also located in the vehicle was a prescription bottle labeled “Suboxin” with the name “Stephen Grabowski” printed on the label
•	S&W .38 Special Revolver (#BBT2587) located in the first floor bedroom closet
•	Remington 870 Express 12 gauge shotgun (#B630281M) located in the first floor bedroom closet

Grabowski was transported to Central where he was interviewed regarding this incident as well as recent acts of violence in the city.  DNA was collected from Grabowski and test fire forms were submitted.  Grabowski was charged accordingly and received a $15,000 cash bail for his new charges in addition to his administrative warrant.

dealer_name: Target Master (license name Tommy Gun Inc)
case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On Wednesday, August 20, 2025, at approximately 1452 hours, Officers Rogers and Ross responded to the area of Lancaster Avenue and North Rodney Street, in reference to an individual brandishing a firearm inside a black Nissan Pathfinder (DE XF51437). Upon arrival, officers were unable to locate the vehicle, however a short time later, Officer Stewart observed the vehicle in the 1200 block of Lancaster Avenue. A traffic stop was conducted, and contact was made with the sole occupant, Devante Carhee (08/07/1992).
During the investigation, officers recovered a loaded Smith & Wesson M&P 9mm (S/N: HRV1703) semiautomatic handgun concealed inside the vehicle. Carhee was transported to Central and charged accordingly.

On Saturday September 24th 1657 hours, C Platoon Officers (Dickerson/Cannon) were dispatched to St. Francis
Hospital in reference to an EMS unit that had been victims of an aggravated menacing while on a medical complaint at 104 Ashton St.
Investigation revealed that an elderly female relative was refusing to go to the hospital. The defendant (Curtis Nixon BM 06/29/82)
interfered with EMS and demanded that the relative be transported. The patient was deemed to be in good condition and EMS advised
they could not compel her to go to the hospital. Curtis Nixon then responded to the second floor of the residence and returned with a
firearm in his waistband. The defendant continued to insist EMS take the relative while motioning towards his firearm. Eventually
EMS made the decision to transport the patient to Wilmington Hospital. The defendant then followed the ambulance to the hospital
and continued to be disorderly. The defendant was taken into custody by officers at Wilmington Hospital. Through investigation it
was revealed the defendant may have concealed his firearm in his vehicle at the hospital. The vehicle was seized and a search warrant
was executed on same. This yielded a S&W MP Shield 9mm firearm with 13 rounds of ammunition. The defendant as booked on 3
counts of aggravated menacing and possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony. A search warrant was executed at 104
Ashton St at 0600 hours which yielded a Smith and Wesson MP 15 .556 rifle and a Mossberg .22 caliber semi-automatic pistol.
Numerous rounds of ammunition were seized.

On Saturday October 7th at approximately 1615 hours, C Platoon (L. Fisher) was dispatched to 1013 Duncan Street
in reference to a complaint of an assault with a deadly weapon. Upon arrival, contact was made with the reporting person, Iesha Rembert who advised that her son, victim Robert Rembert, BM 09/02/2008 had been struck in the face with a firearm. Contact was made with Robert who advised that he was walking from VIP Deli, located on Maryland Avenue and Cedar Street towards his residence when he observed the defendant, Marcus Brown BM 01/22/2008 and his brother Marquis Brown BM 03/14/2009 approaching him. Robert stated that he was walking in the 200 block of Stroud Street with his friend, Mahajj Battle when Marcus approached him and stated, "There he is." Robert stated Marcus asked if he wanted to fight, at which time Robert declined due to him observing a firearm in Marcus’s hand. Robert stated Marcus had a small grey Champion bag and kept putting the firearm in and out of the bag during the entire altercation. Robert described the firearm as all black with a magazine and a slide on the top. Robert stated that after Marcus asked him multiple times to fight, Marcus then struck him in the face with the firearm, causing the top of his right eye to swell, and a cut under his left nostril. Robert stated that when he was struck with the firearm, the magazine fell from the firearm, at which time Marcus picked it up from the ground and fled in an unknown direction. Robert stated that Marcus' brother Marquis had no involvement in the altercation, however he did observe Marquise recording the incident with his cell phone. Contact
was made with the defendant at 400 South Jackson Street. Marcus admitted to having an altercation with Robert, however denied being in possession of a firearm during the incident. Dalyss (defendants mother) advised that she owns a registered firearm and keeps it in her bedroom. When asked if Marcus is able to gain access to her firearm, Dalyss replied, "I don't know."Marcus advised that he punched Robert with his fist and that he carries around a small grey Champion bag, stating, "I carry that bag around to make people think I have a gun in there, but I didn't" I asked Dalyss to show me her firearm and she complied. The firearm Dalyss showed me, a black Smith & Wesson semi-automatic handgun, which was consistent with the firearm Robert described during his interview. I informed Dalyss that Marcus will be placed under arrest. I then put Marcus in handcuffs, and placed him in my patrol vehicle to be
transported to Wilmington Police Department for processing. The firearm was seized and turned over as evidence.

During the month of January 2024, Det. Cuadrado initiated an investigation into cocaine sales by Javier Acevedo
WMH 04/25/1983 from 1320 W. 4th Street, Apartment 2, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant
was authored and obtained for the residence.
On Friday February 16th at 1001 hours the search warrant was executed by members of the Vice Unit, OSS, and K9 without incident.
During a search of the residence, investigators located the following:
 Black Hi-Point CF 380, .380 caliber semi-automatic handgun, serial number P-8162165 (29P Tampa Florida).
The handgun was loaded, and the magazine contained 2 rounds.
 Black Polymer 80, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, no serial number. The handgun magazine contained 14 rounds.
 60.5 grams of Cocaine
 $3,681.00 USC (seized)
 Drug Paraphernalia
Javier Acevedo was interviewed about this incident and recent acts of violence. The firearms as well as the Test Fire Forms were
submitted to FSU for processing. The Black Hi-Point CF 380 firearm was reported stolen out of Tampa, Florida. DNA was obtained
from Javier Acevedo. Javier Acevedo is pending sentencing from a DSP drug arrest from April 2023

defendant_name: William Sells, Trudell Powell, Dylan Charles
case_summary:
On Wednesday June 22nd 0343 hours, A Platoon Officer Cancila was in the area of 10th & Lincoln St when he
observed a grey 2013 Infiniti G37 (DE 325895) which was taken during an armed carjacking on June 20th (30-22-42593). Cancila
attempted to stop the vehicle in the 1700 block of Pennsylvania Ave where a pursuit ensued. The vehicle eventually crashed into a
telephone pole at the intersection of E. 2nd & King Sts, at which time the driver (William Sells) fled on foot before being taken into
custody hiding in the bushes on the river walk. The front seat passenger (Trudell Powell) fled on foot and was taken into custody at W.
2nd & Orange St. The rear passenger (Dylan Charles BM 03/23/06) attempted to flee, but was injured and was taken into custody at the
scene of the crash.
In plain view on the passenger side floorboard of the vehicle was a silver/black in color S&W 9mm handgun loaded with (8) 9mm
rounds. The firearm was reported stolen to NCCPD on 12/05/21 (domestic related / victim is William Sells uncle).
The defendants were transported to Wilmington Hospital for treatment. Sells and Powell were charged with firearm offenses. An out
of custody warrant was signed for Charles, as he was admitted to AI Hospital with a broken femur and broken thumb.

On Wednesday May 24th 0321, Officer Gliem conducted a vehicle stop in the 1100 block of W 2nd St for suspended
registration. Officer Gliem made contact was made with the driver, David Collins and asked for his license, registration, and
insurance. The passenger (Lasondra Cannon BF 04/22/82) initially hesitated to open the glove box. However, she opened it and
began shuffling through paperwork. Officer Gliem saw a firearm in the glove box as she rummaged through the contents. Officer
Gliem was able to take both occupants into custody without incident. During questioning, Lasondra admitted that the firearm was hers.
Officer Gliem issued the operator a ticket (T302301290) for no insurance and released him. Officer Gliem transported Ms. Cannon to
the station for processing (bail info pending). The firearm was a black Taurus PT-22 (Serial #: 89414Z) with one round in the
chamber and seven in the magazine. Officer Gliem determined that the weapon had not been reported stolen.

On Friday December 30th 1056 hours, SCU Officers were in the 900 block of Spruce Street when they observed
(Joshua Thomas BM 06/02/2006) loitering in front of 922 Spruce Street while rolling a marijuana cigar. Investigators made contact
with the defendant who immediately attempted to sit down on the steps. Thomas began to be uncooperative and tensed up when
investigators asked him to come down from the steps. During a pat down search on Thomas he was found to be in possession of 16.7
grams of marijuana in his left coat pocket and a Taurus G3 9mm handgun bearing serial #ACA438590 which contained (1) one
round in the chamber and (11) eleven rounds in the magazine) in his right coat pocket. The firearm was checked local and NCIC and
negative. Thomas is listed on the Car Jacking Bullen on Street Smart.

On Thursday November 24th 0217 hours, C Platoon Officers were dispatched to 1305 Richards Alley in reference to
a suspect who had threatened persons inside the house with a shotgun. Prior to arrival victims had fled the residence and reported that
the suspect was now inside refusing to exit. C Platoon officers secured a perimeter and established a line of communication to the
defendant (Ryan Mullen WM 12/25/1996) through vehicle loudspeakers.
After several minutes of negotiating, Mullen exited the residence unarmed and was taken into custody. Officers then conducted a
preliminary search of the residence for any additional victims. While searching officers located in plain view a black Mossberg
shotgun, two handguns, various suspected illegal narcotic substances, and drug paraphernalia.
Interviews with the victim/defendant (Dante Jannuzzio WM 01/23/1997) stated that Ryan Mullen and others had been drinking at the
bars and returned to the residence. Once back at 1305 Richards Alley they continued drinking and smoking marijuana. While in the
residence, Mullen became agitated and verbally threatened residents to get his shotgun. The argument escalated and Mullen retrieved
his shotgun. Mullen then stood at the top of the stairway pointing and racking the shotgun towards the residents. The other residents
were able to flee and alert police.
A search warrant was executed at the residence and the following items were located and tagged as evidence.
• Mossberg 500 12 gauge Shotgun (#V0198173)
• Smith & Wesson M+P Shield 9mm Handgun (#RHB0876)
• Glock 22 .40 Caliber Handgun (#BKWH238)
• 4 Marijuana Plants
• 200 rounds of 9mm Luger ammunition
• 100 Sig Sauer Hollow point 9mm rounds
• 100 Remington .40 Caliber Pistol and Revolver Rounds
• 45 .22 Rifle rounds
• 200 vials of suspected homemade marijuana oil cartridges
• Machinery used to infuse oils with marijuana
• Large amounts packaging materials.
Both the defendant and the victim were taken into custody for weapons and title 16 violations.

defendant_name: Bakr Dillard, Tavion Washington, Zakeer Washington, Christopher Wilmoth, Eric Harding
case_summary:
On May, 9, 2022, Det. Wicks (CID) presented the investigation into the Attempted Murder of Jamil Bailey and Troy Faison to the New Castle County Grand Jury. This shooting incident occurred on April 14, 2022, in the 700 block of W. 7th Street, Wilmington case # 30-22-25577. The Grand Jury returned an indictment on Bakr Dillard BM 07/21/1981 who was not in custody for the charges: Attempted Murder 1st degree (3 counts), Conspiracy 1st Degree, PFBPP, PFDCF, CCDW, Resisting Arrest, PABPP and Tampering with Physical Evidence. In the month of January 2023, TFO Lynch (ATF) received investigative information from Officer Rittenhouse (USD) which enabled TFO Lynch with the assistance of TFO Schupp (FBI) to locate Dillard and obtain the probable cause needed to author a search warrant for the 934 Spruce Street, Wilmington, DE

On January 20, 2023, at 0653 hours, members of the Wilmington Police Department CMTT, DOCV, FBI, ATF, K9, UAV,CID and DSP executed the search warrant at 934 Spruce Street. During the course of the warrant execution Bakr Dillard, Tavion Washington BM 02/08/99, and Zakeer Washington BM 02/14/95 refused to comply with officers’ commands and made several attempts to flee from the residence. Tavion Washington and Zakeer Washington were quickly apprehended without incident.  Bakr Dillard discarded a firearm on the roof, and then fled through the rear alleyway towards K9 Officer Whitehead, who with the assistance of his partner was able to quickly apprehend Dillard. The residence was cleared by CMTT without incident. Bakr Dillard was transported to the Wilmington Hospital, evaluated, treated then released. 

During a search of the residence and rear yards the listed items were located and seized:
•	S&W M&P Shield, .45 caliber semi-automatic handgun, serial number HZU8470 (29N). The handgun was loaded, and the magazine contained 6 rounds of .45 caliber ammunition.
•	Glock model 26, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number ADPZ825 (29N). The handgun was loaded, and the magazine was empty.
•	Canik model TP9 SF Elite, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number 21BH188545 (29N). The handgun was loaded, and the magazine contained 18 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
•	177.1 grams of Cocaine
•	402.2 grams of Crack Cocaine 
•	6.398 grams of Heroin
•	3975.7 grams of Marijuana
•	17 Oxycodone Pills
•	Ammunition. 
•	Drug Paraphernalia  
•	$7,234.00 USC
•	DNA
•	Cellphones

Bakr Dillard is on the RTCC East Side intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

Tavion Washington was out on two pending firearms arrests; Wilmington Police arrest on April 12, 2021, WPD case # 30-21-28248, and Wilmington Police arrest on May 19, 2016, WPD case # 30-16-39640. Tavion Washington is on the RTCC OMB intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

Zakeer Washington was out on bail for a pending firearms arrest; Dover Police arrest on August 5, 2022, DPD case # 50-22-24108. Zakeer Washington is on the RTCC West Center City intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

The defendants were transported to Central and attempts were made by investigators from the DOCV and CID to interview the defendants, but were unsuccessful.

Tavion Washington was out on two pending firearms arrests; Wilmington Police arrest on April 12, 2021, WPD case # 30-21-28248, and Wilmington Police arrest on May 19, 2016, WPD case # 30-16-39640. Tavion Washington is on the RTCC OMB intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

Zakeer Washington was out on bail for a pending firearms arrest; Dover Police arrest on August 5, 2022, DPD case # 50-22-24108. Zakeer Washington is on the RTCC West Center City intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

The defendants were transported to Central and attempts were made by investigators from the DOCV and CID to interview the defendants, but were unsuccessful.

On Sunday October 15, 2023 at approximately 2208 hours, officers were dispatched to the 300 block of W. 26th
Street in reference to a shooting. Upon arrival, officers located the victim, Jill Fahey, suffering from a graze wound to the head. The
victim was transported to CER and is listed in stable condition. Det. Mosley conducted an interview with the victim who advised that
she engaged in an altercation with her boyfriend, Isiah Portis, during which time, his friend, Joshua Wright arrived from the area of W.
26th and N. Jefferson Streets. The victim advised she then heard a shot, felt dizzy, and fell to the ground. Both subjects fled the area
on foot. There was no Shot Spotter notification for this incident. An audit was requested and returned an alert for one (1) round at
319 W. 26th Street at 2206 hours. No casing was able to be located. Footage obtained, displays the victim engaged in a physical
altercation with male subjects, believed to be Portis and Wright. A single gunshot can be heard, but the shooting is not captured in
this footage. A vehicle registered to Joshua Wright, which was parked at the scene, was towed to Central, pending a search warrant.
On October 19th, 2023, a search warrant was executed with the assistance of CMTT at the suspect's residence, 2518 N. Jefferson
Street. The suspects were not present; however, after an on-scene interview, it was learned that both suspects were employed by the
Hope Center and worked the overnight shift until 0830 hours. CID responded to the Hope Center and located both suspects, taking
them into custody without incident.
During the search of the residence, a Taurus 9mm semi-automatic handgun S/N ACB499689 and a box of 9mm ammunition were
located. Both suspects were transported to central and were processed on the listed criminal offenses

On Monday October 30, 2023 at 1025 hours, in response to a wanted bulletin distributed by CID for a subject named
Joshua Wright wanted for a shooting, 18C (Chambers) observed a subject he knows as Joshua Wright walking in the area of
Sycamore and South Van Buren Street. Officer Chambers, attempting to confirm the identity of the subject, conducted an interdiction
stop of the defendant. Although, this Joshua Wright was found to be a different Joshua Wright as the subject detailed in the wanted
bulletin, the defendant did make a spontaneous utterance to Officer Chambers that he was wanted for an outstanding capias during the
interdiction stop. Officer Chambers was able to confirm the defendant was wanted by JP11 on an outstanding capias. As Chambers
attempted to place same into custody, he attempted to flee but was quickly taken into custody without further incident. Upon a search
incident to arrest, Officer Chambers located a loaded Taurus 2GC 9mm (#ABH828953) on his person. The firearm was found to be
stolen from NCCPD jurisdiction. The weapon was loaded with eleven (11) 9mm hallow point bullets including one in the chamber.
The weapon was tagged and submitted for test fire. NCCPD was notified of the recovery

On Saturday March 19th 1805 hours, SCU conducted a vehicle stop in the 300 block of N Walnut St for several
traffic infractions. SCU approached the vehicle and made contact with the driver, Daquan Smallwood. While communicating with
Smallwood, officers observed a tan in color firearm attached to the inside of the driver side door panel. The occupants were
immediately removed from the vehicle and officers located a Glock 9mm (#BWBG628) containing 19 rounds. Incident to arrest, SCU
officers searched Smallwood who was found to be in possession of (3.3 grams) of Marijuana and another (19.1 grams) located inside
the vehicle. Smallwood was also in possession of $700 USC which a K9 had a positive indication on same. The passenger, Zjahnl
Taylor BM 03/08/95 was taken into custody for an outstanding capias. Smallwood is an affiliate of Block Boyz Gang

On November 10, 2024, at approximately 1210 hours., Officer Hutt was proactively patrolling the area of W. 6th Street and N. Monroe Street. During his patrol, the defendant, Darrell Beaman (07/11/1970), was observed with a unknown object under his jacket. Upon closer inspection, it appeared to be the bottom portion of a gun holster protruding from Beaman’s jacket. Suspecting that Beaman might be concealing a firearm, Officer Hutt contacted Officer J. Meese and coordinated a pedestrian stop. During the stop, the officers recovered a black FN Herstal Belgium (S/N #386334773) semi-automatic handgun, loaded with one round in the chamber and 14 rounds (5.7x28) in the magazine.

On Wednesday November 8th at approximately 1140 hours, Members of Safe Streets observed a black Chevrolet
Malibu bearing Delaware Registration 141658 which was parked on the south side of the 600 block of W. 5th St. It should be noted
officers observed the above listed vehicle to be occupied and the vehicle to be parked too to a fire hydrant.
As members of Safe Streets approached the vehicle, both the driver/D1 (Celita Colon BF 12/22/2000) and the passenger/S1 (Terrell
Eautreau BM 03/01/2002) exited the vehicle. Officers made contact with the occupants of the vehicle and engaged the occupants in a
consensual encounter and advised D1 (Colon) that her vehicle was illegally parked. Consent to search the vehicle was obtained and
officers searched and located a SCCY CPX-2 9mm semiautomatic handgun (#893435) located concealed under the center console
gear shifter.
Both D1 (Colon) and S1 (Terrell) were taken into custody without incident and transported to Central. Celita was read her Miranda
Warnings which she waived at which time officers were able to obtain a full confession regarding the possession and concealment of
the firearm. While at central a further search of the vehicle revealed (41.2 grams) of marijuana.
D1 (Colon) was booked and processed on appropriate charges. S1 (Terrell) consented to provide DNA which was taken at central. S1
(Terrell) was released from central pending further investigation.
not in gunstat meeting reports

During September 2024, DOCV initiated an investigation into Heroin Sales by a black female from 2618 Market St, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained.

On Wednesday, September 25, 2024 at approximately 1351 hours members of Vice Unit, Safe Streets, and K9 executed the aforementioned warrant and took Daryl Smith BM 11/20/1995 into custody. During the warrant executed, numerous individuals responded to the residence and were unruly, assistance was requested and members of USD responded. During a search of the residence the following items were located and seized:
-A loaded Girsan MC28 SAT 9mm semi-automatic handgun (SN #T6368-20av01556), containing 14 rounds.
-13 grams of Marijuana
-Drug paraphernalia 

Due to the conditions of the residence, L&I was contacted, responded, and condemned the residence as unfit for humanity

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On August 1, 2025, at approximately 1330 hours, members of CGIC were contacted regarding a person potentially concealing a firearm on their person, through City Watch. Dashawn Gibbs (04/08/2007) appeared to be displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Gibbs was observed touching and re-adjusting an object in the front of his waistband area several times, in addition, a bulge could be seen underneath Gibbs’ t-shirt, where he was re-adjusting. As officers responded to the area, Gibbs took notice and attempted to conceal himself behind other individuals. Officers made contact with Gibbs where he was detained and a Smith and Wesson M&P Shield 9mm (S/N: #JRV6127) handgun was located and recovered. Gibbs was transported to Central and charged accordingly.

On Friday May 10, 2024, at approximately 2304 hours, Officers Stewart, Z. Davis, and Sergeant N. Evans were on a
directed patrol in the area of W. 3rd Street/ N. Clayton Street, when they were flagged down by a concerned citizen regarding a person
with a gun complaint. In this incident, the concerned citizen was sitting inside of her vehicle in the 1700 block of W. 3rd Street, when the defendant started looking into her car window. A verbal altercation ensued between the concerned citizen and the defendant. During the altercation, the defendant pointed a firearm at her causing her to fear for her life. The concerned citizen fled the area in her vehicle and flagged the officers down to report the incident. The officers responded to the 1700 block of W. 3rd Street and observed the defendant, matching the description provided by the reporting person. Upon observing the officers, the defendant conducted a security check of his waistband and attempted to walk away from the officers. The officers attempted to stop the defendant, who fled from officers on foot. After a brief foot pursuit, the officers were able to place the defendant (Anthony Johnson BM 12/12/2001) into custody without further incident. Incident to arrest, the officers located a loaded SCCY 9mm handgun (#483349) on the defendant’s person. The defendant was transported to Central, where he was booked on the above listed charges. The concerned citizen refused to cooperate any further with the investigation. An NCIC inquiry on the firearm was met with negative results.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
While following up on a shots fired incident, CGIC investigators obtained surveillance footage from 829 N. Spruce St. In the footage, a black male was observed entering the store and hiding a firearm, as members of Safe Streets were patrolling the area. The subject was known to be Armani Rosario (11/08/2004) who is on Level 2 probation, resulting from a firearm arrest on April 25, 2025.
On June 27, 2025, members of Safe Streets and CGIC responded to 824 N. Spruce St, to conduct an administrative search of the residence. While at the residence, Rosario’s brother, Jorge Berrios (07/05/2001) gave officers consent to search his bedroom. In Berrios’ bedroom, officers located and recovered a Glock 23 .40 caliber (S/N: BUWH667) handgun, a Glock 19 9mm (S/N: BUPW838) handgun, number handgun magazines, additional rounds of 9mm and .40 caliber ammunition, 122.16 grams of Marijuana, and drug paraphernalia.
Both Rosario and Berrios were transported to Central and interviewed. DNA was collected from Rosario to compare to the firearms. Rosario is being held at HRYCI on a probation administrative warrant.

On Friday August 12th 2034 hours, SCU Investigators were in the area of the A & Chapel Street when they observed the defendant (King, David BM 10/26/1995) loitering behind the KNF corner store. SCU Investigators conducted a consensual encounter with King, during which time officers smelled a strong odor of marijuana emanating from King’s person. A pat down on King was conducted. King was found to be in possession of a black cross body bag / satchel which contained a black in color loaded “Smith & Wesson” M&P 9mm firearm containing (1) round in the chamber and (7) rounds in the magazine. King was also in possession of (33.8 grams) of marijuana.

On April 15, 2025 at approximately 1111 hours, Officers Chambers and Evertt were on a proactive patrol in the area of
West 8th and N. Washington St. While in the area, officers observed a black Toyota Camry (DE 246137), which was violating multiple
moving violations. Officers attempted to stop the vehicle, where it began to flee. The vehicle continued to Lafayette Blvd. where it was
stopped. At this time, the passenger, Jeramine Winckler (03/24/2003) exited the vehicle and continued to flee on foot. As he was fleeing,
he could be seen grabbing his jacket pocket. PFC Everett pursued Winckler, who removed a firearm from his waistband and turned
towards Everett while throwing the weapon over a fence. The firearm was later recovered to be #1 Smith and Wesson M&P .40 Shield
(S/N: HPV5955). Everett continued pursuing Winckler who entered an alleyway and began to jump residential fences. He discarded his
jacket which contained #2 FMK 9C1 Gen 2 9mm (BB20737) and at the same time, dropped #3 Industria National De Armes (S/N:
00471) while scaling a fence. PFC Everett was able to catch Winckler in the rear of 529 Lafayette Blvd and place him into custody
without incident. All three firearms were recovered, and Winckler was found to be in possession of additional ammunition on his person.
At the time of his arrest, Winckler mentioned having information regarding the 12/30/24 Homicide/IK. Winckler is the half-brother of Jyshawn and Jyaire
Miller.
The driver, Miguel Maldonado (04/14/2002) was issued traffic summonses and released.

On July 17th, 2024, at approximately 0307 hours A Platoon (Gliem/Shea) received information from a CI that
a subject by the nick name of “Jazz” was selling illegal drugs from a vacant residence front porch in the 300 block of N. Broom
Street. Officers observed the suspect matching the description given, in the 1400 block of West 3rd Street. The subject was
attempting to hide from officers by hiding behind parked vehicles in the block. The subject, who was identified as Kevin Harris
BM 07/02/1976 began to flee through an alleyway at which time a foot pursuit ensued. Officers set up a perimeter and Harris
was taken into custody without incident. Prior to be taken into custody the defendant threw illegal drugs to the ground and
placed a firearm next to a fence in close proximity of where he was taken into custody. The amount of Title was as follows: 65
plastic vials in 3 different sizes each containing a total of 24.8 grams of crack cocaine, and 73 bags of heroin stamped “Super
Mario” for a total of .51 grams. The firearm recovered was a Smith and Wesson M&P 9mm with chambered round - S/N
#RJV3668. The magazine of the firearm was discarded by the defendant during the foot pursuit.

On Monday May 8th, 2024 at approximately 0915 hours, Officers were dispatched to 2610 Washington Street in
reference to a found property complaint. Upon officer’s arrival, they met with reporting person (Stewart, James 9/10/50) who advised
he observed an unknown subject on his Ring camera discarding an unknown item onto his garage roof. Officers utilized a ladder and
recovered a plastic bag which contained a Glock 43 9mm (# BVYK579) which contained 12 rounds in the magazine and 1 in the
chamber. The firearm was checked locally and NCIC and negative. A test fire form was submitted and the CGIC unit was notified per
email. On Tuesday May 9th, 2024, CGIC Detectives conducted an investigation into the above mentioned incident. Upon review of
the video surveillance collected, Detectives were able to positively identify the suspect as Davonte Lewis BM 07/19/1993. Detectives
applied for and were granted arrest warrants.
---------------------------- Update -----------------------------
On Monday May 13th, 2024, CGIC detectives observed Davonte walking in the area of W 25th St and N. Monroe St at which time they
conducted a pedestrian stop where he was taken into custody without incident. Davonte was transported to Central for processing.
Once in custody, Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for his residence. During the search of the residence
Detectives located and recovered one black in color SCCY CX-2 9mm handgun (#C032416) along with clothing.
While at Central Davonte was interviewed regarding the incident and confessed to same. An NCIC inquiry was conducted on the
firearm which was met with negative results. Test fire forms were submitted. Probation was notified. CID was notified and responded.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On June 3, 2025, at approximately 1903 hours, CGIC Detectives, along with Officers Mann, Marino, Shea, and Coffiey were working the 29P detail. While on patrol in the 2200 block of North Locust St, they observed a group of subjects on the western side of the street. During the time, Detectives observed Nashir Harris (04/22/2006) leaning against a vehicle out front of 2211 N. Locust St. While checking his wanted status, Harris observed the officers, at which point he immediately turned and began to flee into the residence, while grabbing his waistband.
Detectives immediately pursued Harris. While established a perimeter around the residence, Harris then exited the front door and was taken into custody without incident. While on scene, Detectives obtained consent to search during which time they located and recovered a Taurus G2C 9mm (S/N: ADB004944) handgun, a Sig Sauer P320 9mm (S/N: M18A001395) handgun, 1.98 grams of heroin and a total of 83 rounds of ammunition.
While on scene, the owner of the residence confirmed Harris, Damir Williams (01/26/2007) and Jihad Brown, all stay in the basement of the residence. This is where the Taurus and heroin were recovered. Williams was on scene, at the time of the investigation; charges are pending further investigation.
Harris and the evidence were transported to Central.

During the month of February 2023, Det. Rosaio, Alava, and Coffiey initiated an investigation into drug sales by
Dawon Brown BM 12/07/1988 at 724 N. Pine Street, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of the investigation, probable cause was
established and a search warrant was authored and obtained.
On Wednesday June 21st 1154 hours, members of the Vice Unit, OSS, and K9 executed the search warrant at 724 N. Pine Street. Upon
approaching the front door, members of the DOCV Unit used a halligan tool to breach the exterior storm door and advised the
occupants of the residence to open the door. After an unsuccessful attempt at this, officers breached the front door and observed a
black female later identified as Brandi Henry BF 07/31/1990 who remained in the open doorway and did not initially exit same.
During the warrant execution, officers observed Dawon Brown fleeing to the second floor and attempting to discard a firearm out a
