second floor window before retreating back into the house with the gun. After a period of time, Brown responded to the front door
where he was taken into custody. Brown was observed to have a laceration to his left hand that was bleeding; he was transported to the
Wilmington Hospital for treatment. During a search of the residence, crack cocaine and heroin along with several bloody bags were
located in the bathroom where Brown attempted to flush the drugs. The firearm that Brown attempted to discard out the window was
located in a second floor bedroom with blood over same. The remainder of the seized items were located throughout the residence.
• Tan Springfield Armory XDM 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial # BA206685 (29N). Handgun loaded with 1 round in
the chamber and 18 rounds in the magazine.
• Black Ruger EC9S 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial # 462-60232 (29N). Handgun loaded with 1 round in the chamber
and 6 rounds in the magazine.
• 5.2 grams of Crack Cocaine
• .252 grams of Heroin, stamped with “RiteAid & Tasty K”
• 2.2 grams of Marijuana
• $1,208.00 USC (seized)
• Drug Paraphernalia
• DNA

On November 29, 2024 at approximately 1528 hours, members of C Platoon responded to 610 Ferris St Apt. 303 in reference to a person with a gun complaint. Upon arrival, officers were flagged down by victims, Briyana Banner (09/01/2000) and Gerald Seeney (12/01/1991) who advised the defendant (Daylynn Banner BF 10/07/1985) was inside the apartment with a firearm and pointed/threated them with same. Contact was made with Daylynn Banner who was standing in the hallway outside the apartment doorway where she was detained. Daylynn advised officers that she and Briyana got into a verbal altercation which turned physical over a custody agreement. Daylynn denied displaying a firearm during the altercation, however she advised that she legally owns a firearm. Officers were given verbal consent to retrieve the firearm from the defendant’s bedroom. The firearm is a loaded Taurus G2C 9mm (#ACD784813). Banner was taken into custody and charged accordingly.

On Sunday May 22nd 2223 hours, B Platoon Officer Rosembert was dispatched to the 200 block of N/. Tatnall St in reference to a disorderly female inside a vehicle. As Officer Rosembert approached the intersection of W. 2nd & N. Tatnall St, a black in color Mazda 6 (DE XQ243657) traveling west on 2nd St disregarded a red light, and a vehicle stop was conducted. During the vehicle stop, Officer Rosembert observed a firearm protruding from between the front passenger seat and the center console. The driver, De Asja White-Jones was taken into custody and the vehicle was searched resulting in the recovery of an unloaded black in color S&W 9mm handgun along with four 9mm live rounds of ammunition.

On Thursday March 7, 2024, members of Safe Streets began efforts to locate level 1 probationer, Shawn Keys WM
04/25/2001, who was wanted for a shooting that occurred on 03/03/24 in the 700 block of N. Adams St (30-24-15971). Safe Streets
developed information that Keys was possibly located at 507 E. 5th St which is the residence of his girlfriend, Dee’Shay’Na Crawford
BF 03/20/2000).
On Friday March 8, 2024, members of Safe Streets established surveillance on the listed residence and at approximately 1940 hours,
Keys was observed through a front window. Safe Streets coordinated with Officers working the anti-violence and vehicle theft details,
who responded to assist. Keys, who was wearing the same clothing that he was at the time of the shooting, was taken into custody
without incident. Members of Safe Streets learned that there were two firearms located in the room shared by Keys and Crawford.
(Polymer 80 9mm handgun and a Lorcin .380 handgun #464006). CID was notified of the apprehension as well as fact there were
guns in the room used by Keys.
An administrative search of the residence was obtained. Additionally, Safe Streets was granted consent to search the areas of the
residence not covered by the administrative search. Two additional firearms were recovered (Glock 17 9mm #CCFB011 loaded with
thirteen rounds and a Ruger LCP .380 #322553046 semi-automatic loaded with one round in the chamber and five rounds in the
magazine) along with numerous rounds of ammunition.

On Friday March 14th 1723 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 900 block of Vandever Avenue when they
observed Tyion George BM 12/22/04 acting suspiciously. Upon Investigators attempting to make contact with George, he
immediately began fleeing on foot. While fleeing, Investigators observed George displaying characteristics of an armed gunman and
ultimately discarded a firearm into the rear yard of 938 Vandever Ave. George was taken into custody and searched incident to arrest.
George was found to be in possession of .5 grams of crack cocaine as well as 7.1 grams of marijuana on his person. Investigators
responded back to where the firearm was discarded and located a black Stoeger 9mm Firearm containing 10 rounds in the magazine
and 1 in the chamber bearing serial number T6429- 21S17223. The firearm was checked locally and NCIC and Negative. A test fire
request was completed. DNA was retrieved from the defendant.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On June 20th, 2024 members of Safe Streets conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 800 block of North Church St on
a silver in color Mitsubishi Outlander which was found to be occupied by 4 occupants. During the stop, the rear passenger, Deondre Braboy BM 03/20/1992, was removed from the vehicle and found to be in possession of a black in color Springfield XP-9 9mm handgun with an extended magazine, loaded with 4 rounds of 9mm ammunition, which was concealed in the front of his waistband area. Once Deondre was in custody, detectives located 3.5 grams of mushrooms/hallucinogens in the door handle of the rear
passenger door. During an interview, Deondre admitted to illegally concealing the firearm on his person. NCIC inquiry was conducted on the firearm which was met with negative results. Braboy was not found to be a person prohibited from legally possessing a firearm however, a DELJIS Inquiry revealed that he does not possess a Concealed Carry Permit to legally conceal a firearm on his person.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On June 6, 2025, at approximately 1146 hours, members of Safe Streets were in the area of 200 N. Franklin St, when they observed a subject operating a motorized scooters. The individual was identified to be Tyrell Pankins (05/30/2009). As officers circled the block, Pankins was seen to be sitting on the steps of 244 N. Franklin St. Officers attempted to make contact with Pankins when he began to adjust his shirt and push an object down his waistband. Once officers reached towards Pankins, he attempted to flee. He was quickly apprehended and found to be in possession of a black in color Taurus G3C 9mm (S/N: #ACB527078) loaded handgun. Pankins was also found to be in possession of 7 grams of Marijuana.
Pankins was transported to Central, along with the evidence.

On Wednesday, July 2, 2025, at approximately 1104 hours, WPD CID detectives executed a search warrant at 2812
Rosemont Ave. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Simone Blagman and explained the reasoning of the warrants. As this was
happening, Dahmere White (01/14/1997) was seen opening a rear window to the residence and throwing a black bag out to a lower
roof. White, Blagman, and Shakei Hopskins (01/25/1992) were all detained while the evidence was collected.
The bag contained one tan Glock 19x 9mm (SN BKBY428) and one black and silver Glock 48 9mm (SNBKYT555). Detectives also
located heroin in Blagman's bedroom. Several cell phones were collected as part of the investigation. All suspects were transported to
CID and at the time of this report were being interviewed. DNA samples were collected from all suspects. CID obtained video
surveillance from Imani Village cameras which captured White throwing the black bag containing the guns out of the residence.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On March 29, 2025, there was an incident of shots fired in the area of 899 N. Spruce St. Surveillance footage was obtained which showed a suspect firing a firearm, retreating, and coming back to fire more rounds causing damage to a nearby vehicle. This investigation (30-25-022462) was forwarded to CGIC for further investigation. 

CGIC Detectives began an investigation into this incident of shots fired, where they were able to identify Jamar Warren (01/03/2007) was as a suspect in the investigation. Detectives were also able to confirm Warren fled into 804 N Spruce St after the shots fired. Surveillance was conducted on the residence at which time Warren was observed at the residence on several occasions. As a result of the investigation, Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for the residence.

On April 7th, 2025, CGIC established surveillance on the residence with the assistance of DOCV. During this time, Warren was observed arriving at the residence and entering same. At approximately 1930 hours, Warren exited the residence and entered a vehicle at which point Detectives made contact with him and detained him. A search of the residence yielded the recovery of a black in color Springfield Armory XD Elite 9mm (S/N: BY580825) Firearm loaded with 18 rounds of 9mm ammunition. In addition, detectives located six magazines, two rounds of .40 caliber ammunition, 736 grams of Marijuana, and clothing.

On this date, Det. Coffiey observed Derrin FOUNTAIN operating his vehicle with illegal window tint. A vehicle stop was initiated in the 100 block of E. 39th Street. During the encounter, Derrin FOUNTAIN attempted to discard two bags of Marijuana. Derrin FOUNTAIN was detained and gave officers consent to search his vehicle at which time the listed revolver was located concealed in his trunk. Derrin FOUNTAIN was interviewed about this incident and recent acts of violence. 

The firearm as well as the Test Fire Form was submitted to FSU for processing. 

Bail information was not available at the completion of this report.

On Thursday May 25th 1939 hours, officers responded to the area of W. 36th & N. Jefferson Streets in reference to a
large fight. Upon arrival, officers observed approximately thirty (30) subjects engaged in a fight. As officers activated their emergency equipment in an attempt to get the large crowd to disperse, they observed the defendant, later identified as Tahir Corbin BM 09/19/04, grab onto his waistband, and begin to flee on foot away from officers. Officers observed Corbin continue to flee on foot holding his waistband, as he entered the rear of 501 W. 34th Street. Officer Williams provided Corbin with several verbal commands, but Corbin refused to comply, and continued to flee, holding his waistband. Officer A. Williams then deployed his departmentally issued Taser (CEW), which appeared to have a positive effect, causing Corbin to fall to the ground in the front yard of 3414 N.
Madison Street. Corbin continued to hold onto his waistband, and resisted officers. After a brief struggle, Corbin was taken into custody without further incident. Officer A. Williams then located a black in color, Beretta, APX 9mm handgun, serial number A117056X, in Corbin’s waistband. The firearm contained nine (9) rounds in the magazine and one (1) round in the chamber. Corbin was transported to the Wilmington Hospital, where he was treated and released for the Taser (CEW) deployment. At the time of this report, Corbin was awaiting arraignment for the charges of CCDW and Resisting Arrest.

On Tuesday June 28th 2115 hours, Detective Silvers was conducting surveillance in the 400 black of N. Madison St
after receiving information from an informant that Alexander Holland BM 08/03/99 who resides at 413 N. Madison St always carries a firearm in a cross body bag. During surveillance, Det. Silvers observed Holland on the sidewalk in the 400 block of N. Madison St drinking alcohol and a pedestrian stop was conducted. Holland was detained and officers seized the bottle of alcohol that he had been
drinking. During a pat down, Holland was found to be in possession of (20.7 grams) of marijuana and a loaded Taurus G2C 9mm
handgun which was concealed inside the cross body bag. Holland was mirandized and interviewed and advised that he found the
marijuana and intended on selling it. He also states that he carries the gun out in front of his house for his protection.

On Thursday, July 11, 2025, at approximately 0959 hours, WPD responded to 310 W. 22nd St, in reference to a juvenile in possession of a firearm. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Macheko Carter (12/09/65), who advised her grandson, Marjaye Carter (08/10/2012) was in possession of a firearm. Macheko Carter then handed officers the black in color Taurus G3C 9mm (SN: ACE885747) handgun, and advised her grandson was asleep within the residence. Officers then contacted K9 Williams and CGIC about the incident. K9 Williams responded to the residence to speak with the juvenile regarding his finding of the firearm. After further investigative leads, K9 Williams drafted a warrant for Carter.

On October 2, 2025, at approximately 2356 hours, Officers Gervasi and Connor were on a proactive patrol in the area of
W. 25th and N. market St, when they observed a silver Nissan Rouge (North Carolina # HMY9429) disregard a stop sign. A motor vehicle
stop was conducted in the 2100 block of N. Market St, at which time officers observed Dewight Anderson (06/13/1995) and Titus Lewis
(06/10/1995) switching seats within the vehicle. Contact was made with both defendants and Anderson was found to be wanted out of
Philadelphia for an aggravated assault. Anderson was removed from the front passenger seat and taken into custody.
While assisting with the stop, assisting officers observed a Glock 43X 9mm (SN# BSRY039) handgun, in plain view, however partially
concealed underneath the front passenger seat. Lewis was then taken into custody as well. DNA is pending for both defendants.

On March 5, 2025 at approximately 0738 hours, D Platoon (Stewart/Hutt) were on proactive patrol in the area of 799 N.Madison St in reference to a firearm investigation. While previously monitoring social media, officers were able to located NizereFitzgerald (08/17/1999) walking near the intersection of W 8th & N Jefferson St. A short time later a pedestrian stop was conducted on thedefendant in the 700 block of N Madison St where he was detained. A pat down was conducted and Fitzgerald was found to be inpossession of a loaded green and black Taurus G3 9mm (S/N: ABE554440) handgun concealed in his waistband. He was also found to bewanted out of Winchester, VA

On Thursday February 22nd, at approximately 2012 hours, members of Safe Streets observed a blue in color Hyundai
Elantra (DE 569556) fail to stop for the stop sign located at 9th and Church Streets. A vehicle stop was conducted a 12th and Northeast
Blvd. Officers made contact with Lennell Preston BM 08/11/2002 who was found to have a capias for a tint violation. Preston was
removed from the vehicle and probable cause was established to search same. During the search, officers located a loaded Glock 44
.22 caliber handgun (#AHCR883) on the floorboard in the back of the vehicle. Preston was taken into custody without incident and
transported to Central. Preston later admitted that the handgun was originally inside the glove box, but he removed same and threw it
in the back in the car when he observed the police lights.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On May 2nd, 2025, at approximately 0827 hours, CGIC Detectives were conducting surveillance in the area of 1300 Maryland Ave, pertaining to an on-going investigation. While conducting surveillance, detectives observed a subject conduct a hand to hand transaction. At this time, detectives attempted to make contact, however, the subject, later identified as Khary Knight (04/27/1988) began to flee. As he began to flee, Knight discarded a black in color satchel. He was eventually apprehended after a brief pursuit and a CEW deployment. An additional struggle ensured, however Knight was taken into custody.  
Detectives were able to recover the black in color satchel, which Knight discarded. Inside the satchel, detectives located a black in color Smith & Wesson 38 Special (S/N: DPY3889) revolver which was found to be loaded with five rounds of ammunition. On his person, detectives located 10 grams of crack cocaine.  
After being released from Wilmington Hospital, Knight was transported back to Central and charged accordingly.

Over the past few weeks, CGIC Detectives have been conducting a firearm investigation regarding Zyheen Evans
(10/11/2009). Surveillance was established on 2803 W. 2nd St, after investigators were able to match the residences interior with Evan’s
social media posts while being in possession of a suspected firearm.
On July 2, 2025, CGIC investigators were conducting surveillance on 2803 W. 2nd St. At approximately 1938 hours, investigators
observed Evans exit the front door of the residence. With the assistance of Safe Streets and Cpl. Mann, Evans was placed into custody,
due to an active VOP.
A search warrant was then applied for and granted. A search of the residence yielded the recovery of a black in color Smith and Wesson
M&P 9 Shield 9mm handgun, with an obliterated serial number. The serial number was later restored by FSU Ballistics to reveal
(S/N: JCE6250). The handgun was loaded with six rounds of ammunition in the magazine and one in the chamber. Evans was
transported to Central and charged accordingly.

On Thursday June 23rd 1611 hours, SCU were in the 2400 block of N. Tatnall St when the observed a silver Jeep
Cherokee (DE PC92870) parked on the sidewalk in the block. Officers conducted a traffic stop and made contact with two males who were standing next to the vehicle, identified as Eric McDuffie BM 10/28/92 and Jamir Graham BM 07/19/97. McDuffie, who was actively smoking marijuana at the time of the stop, advised that the vehicle belonged to his girlfriend and allowed officers to enter the vehicle to obtain his wallet from the handle area of the rear passenger side door. While obtaining the wallet, officers observed marijuana inside the rear door handle and therefore searched the vehicle. During the search, officers located a loaded Ruger 9mm
handgun which was concealed inside the pocket behind the passenger seat. Officers also located another magazine (belonging to a
different firearm) which contained live .40caliber rounds.
Graham was interviewed and advised that the magazine containing the 40 caliber rounds did belong to him but that he had no
knowledge of the firearm that was located inside the vehicle. He advised that he legally owns a 40 caliber Smith & Wesson which he
routinely carries with him. Graham consented to providing DNA.
McDuffie advised that the gun was not his but that his DNA may be on it because he recently possessed and held the firearm in his
hands. Warrants were signed on McDuffie for PFBPP, PABPP, CCDW and Possession of Marijuana.
Both subjects advised that they have close ties to Brandon Ponzo BM 09/03/08 who is a known member of NorthPak

On July 14, 2024, at approximately 2047 hours, Master Cpl. Crocker was on a Directed Patrol in the 400 block
of Monroe Streets due to the recent violence in the area. Master Cpl. Crocker observed a group of subjects loitering within the
block. Assisting units obtained the subject’s identities as well as business abroad. Prior to engaging the subjects, Cpl. Adams
observed a subject standing idle in the roadway as well as crossing the street without utilizing a crosswalk. Additionally, the
subject was observed displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. When Cpl. Adams engaged the subject and requested his
name and business abroad, the subject failed to identify himself. The subject later identified as Darnell Jervey BM
03/01/1991was taken into custody. While searching the defendant’s cross body satchel, officers located a black in color Ruger
LCP .380 firearm bearing serial # 37523663 with an extended magazine which contained 9 rounds. A check of the firearm
resulted in same being reported stolen out of Springfield Township PD. The defendant also possessed 1.764 ounces of PCP on his
person. The defendant was found to have an active Capias for his arrest.

On Thursday March 7, 2024, members of Safe Streets began efforts to locate level 1 probationer, Shawn Keys WM
04/25/2001, who was wanted for a shooting that occurred on 03/03/24 in the 700 block of N. Adams St (30-24-15971). Safe Streets
developed information that Keys was possibly located at 507 E. 5th St which is the residence of his girlfriend, Dee’Shay’Na Crawford
BF 03/20/2000).
On Friday March 8, 2024, members of Safe Streets established surveillance on the listed residence and at approximately 1940 hours,
Keys was observed through a front window. Safe Streets coordinated with Officers working the anti-violence and vehicle theft details,
who responded to assist. Keys, who was wearing the same clothing that he was at the time of the shooting, was taken into custody
without incident. Members of Safe Streets learned that there were two firearms located in the room shared by Keys and Crawford.
(Polymer 80 9mm handgun and a Lorcin .380 handgun #464006). CID was notified of the apprehension as well as fact there were
guns in the room used by Keys.
An administrative search of the residence was obtained. Additionally, Safe Streets was granted consent to search the areas of the
residence not covered by the administrative search. Two additional firearms were recovered (Glock 17 9mm #CCFB011 loaded with
thirteen rounds and a Ruger LCP .380 #322553046 semi-automatic loaded with one round in the chamber and five rounds in the
magazine) along with numerous rounds of ammunition.

On Thursday June 23rd 1930 hours, B Platoon officers responded to 1128 Pleasant St in reference to a man armed
with a gun. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Douglas Bush, who was on the roof of his residence where he advised officers
that he was armed. Officer Osler asked Bush to come down which he complied without incident. A pat down frisk for weapons was
conducted which met with negative results. Bush advised that he was being threatened by people in the neighborhood which led to
him arming himself. Officers conducted a DELJIS inquiry on Bush which revealed that he is a person prohibited from possessing both
firearms and ammunition as a result of a violent felony conviction (assault 2nd). Officers executed a search warrant and removed (15)
firearms along with ammunition and magazines which were located inside of a gun safe in a second story bedroom. Two additional
firearms were recovered from the roof of the residence where officers initially saw Bush, and where he told officers that he was
armed.

On Thursday June 23rd 1930 hours, B Platoon officers responded to 1128 Pleasant St in reference to a man armed
with a gun. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Douglas Bush, who was on the roof of his residence where he advised officers
that he was armed. Officer Osler asked Bush to come down which he complied without incident. A pat down frisk for weapons was
conducted which met with negative results. Bush advised that he was being threatened by people in the neighborhood which led to
him arming himself. Officers conducted a DELJIS inquiry on Bush which revealed that he is a person prohibited from possessing both
firearms and ammunition as a result of a violent felony conviction (assault 2nd). Officers executed a search warrant and removed (15)
firearms along with ammunition and magazines which were located inside of a gun safe in a second story bedroom. Two additional
firearms were recovered from the roof of the residence where officers initially saw Bush, and where he told officers that he was
armed.

On March 28, 2025 members of DOCV were able to execute two search warrants at 1545 E. 28th St. and 134Lower Oak St in reference to an ongoing Drug and Firearm Investigation. Detectives of DOCV, along with Safe Streets andCGIC executed the warrant at 1545 E. 28 th St, where they were able to make contact with Nathan Wilson BM 07/25/2004and Brandon Copeland BM 04/18/1983. Both subjects were taken into custody without incident. A search Nathan Wilson’sbedroom revealed a black Glock 43 9mm (S/N: ADDH804), along with Crack Cocaine, Heroin, and USC. A search warrantfor Brandon Copeland’s vehicle was granted and officers located 207 grams of packaged Marijuana for sales. Wilson andCopeland were both charged accordingl

On Tuesday April 23rd, 2024, at 0013 hours, Wilcom received a ShotSpotter notification for one round in the 3400
block of Northeast Boulevard. Officers responded to the area and observed two unknown subjects fleeing from the area on bicycles
and attempted to stop same. The defendant, Darnell Nuriddin BM 05/27/1988, jumped off the bike and fled on foot before being
taken into custody. Officers detained the second subject, Nguse Halle BF 07/11/1997 and determined she had a capias.
Located in a bag attached to the defendants bike was a loaded Cobra .380 (#CP119388) with six rounds in the magazine, 9.26 grams
of crack, 19 bags of heroin, drug paraphernalia and $502.55 USC. During a post-Miranda interview, the defendant admitted that the
gun, drugs, and cash were his. Officers did not locate any casings or victims of the shots fired incident. The defendant denied knowing
about the shots fired incident

On Saturday April 6, 2024 at 1035 hours, Wilcom received a call for a subject selling drugs in the 900 block of
Kirkwood Street. An additional call was received that the same subject was also in possession of a firearm. Responding Officers
observed a subject matching the description and officers approached same. K9-12 Williams made contact with the subject who
immediately was recognized as Chaka Hollis BM 11/05/1999. Officers provided the subject with several verbal commands to remove
his hands from his pockets which were ignored. Officers observed the subject to be extremely nervous and a pat down for officer
safety was conducted. Hollis was found to be in possession of a Sig Sauer 9mm (#52B140430) which possessed (1) round in the
chamber and (7) 9mm rounds in the extended magazine which was located in his waistband. The firearm was checked locally and
NCIC and found to be stolen out of South Carolina (Horry County PD Conway on 08/11/2019 under case number 19-07-3313. The
defendant was also in possession of 29 bags of heroin (0.203), and 7.2 grams of crack cocaine.

defendant_name: Jahnair Murphy, Nyjere Rivera, Tyrell Pankins
case_status:
D1: Resolved
D2: pending
D3 pending
case_summary:
On August 9, 2024 at approximately 1212 hours, Cpl Keith Johnson was conducting an ongoing OHV investigation in the area of the 1000 block of Sycamore St. At that time, he observed multiple subjects and OHVs in an open garage at 1003 Sycamore St. Cpl Johnson coordinated with assisting units to approach the garage at which time an individual, later identified as Jahnair Murphy (01/07/2003) fled into the residence. Murphy was then observed to attempt to discard a firearm from the rear window of the residence prior to retreating back into the residence. Ultimately, officers had established a perimeter at which time all three defendants (Jahnair Murphy, Nyjere Rivera, and Tyrell Pankins) exited a second story window onto the roof and fled into an adjacent yard. Tyrell Pankins (05/30/2009) was observed throwing a bag back onto the roof prior to all three suspects being taken into custody without further incident. During a search of the immediate area of the suspects, officers located a loaded Polymer80 Inc 9mm semi-automatic firearm. Officers located another loaded Polymer80 Inc 9mm semi-automatic firearm which had been modified with a switch for full auto capabilities in the bag that Pankins threw onto the roof. During a subsequent consent search of the residence, officers located in Nyjere Rivera’s bedroom a Taurus PT111 9mm semi-automatic firearm (serial # TJP20596).
Officers also located and seized $554 in USC, 175.5 grams of marijuana, and packaging materials. In the garage officers seized 3 dirt bikes and 1 quad. 1 of the dirt bikes was determined to be operated by Murphy and was reported stolen to NCCPD.

Over the past month, CGIC detectives were conducting a firearm investigation involving Zakyse Carter, Rshad Lockett, and Jashad Helm. During the course of the investigation, Detectives were able to obtain numerous photographs and videos of them in possession of several firearms.
On July 20th, 2025 A Platoon responded to the area of East 35th St and N. Church St regarding a shots fired incident, 30-25-52286, where officers located 26 spent casings along with a cell phone. Detectives applied for a search warrant on the phone which revealed same belonged to Rshad Lockett. As a result of the investigation, Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 129 Eastlawn Ave.
On July 22nd, surveillance was established on the residence at which point Carter was observed exited same. Detectives were able to make contact and detain him pending the search warrant. During a search of the residence, Detectives located and recovered one black in color Glock 19 Gen 5 (SN: BNEE247) loaded with 16 totals rounds of 9mm ammunition, one black in color Glock 23 (SN: AGRB981) loaded with 21 total rounds of 40 caliber ammunition, one tan in color extended magazine containing 31 rounds of 9mm ammunition, one black in color Taurus magazine, and 50 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
DNA was collected from all occupants of the residence. Carter and the evidence were transported to the Wilmington Police Department. Charges for Helm and Lockett are pending further investigation. This investigation is on-going.

Original Arrest: Over the past 2 months, CGIC detectives conducted a firearms investigation into Davon Lloyd and Ironn Collins-Demby. During this investigation, it was learned that Davon will wrap his GPS monitor in aluminum foil to prevent his locations from transmitting. 
On August 9th, 2024, CGIC Detectives established surveillance on 314 9th Ave at which point Davon Lloyd (05/15/2008) was observed exiting the residence and entering a vehicle. Detectives surveilled the vehicle to the north side of the city at which point the vehicle began driving evasively. Surveillance was able to be maintained on the vehicle at which point it was observed parking outside of 500 E 5th St. Once parked, Ironn Collin-Demby (05/31/2006) exited the driver’s seat and entered the apartment building where he stayed for approximately 1 minute before returning to the vehicle. 
As the vehicle left, a traffic stop was conducted on the vehicle at which point Davon’s GPS became active again. After conducting the traffic stop, Detectives were able to pull surveillance video of Ironn entering the apartment building where they observed him displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. During this time they were able to identify apartment B1 as the residence in the apartment building and made contact with the homeowner who confirmed Ironn has access to the apartment.
Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for the residence at which point they located and recovered a Black in color Polymer 80 9mm handgun with an extended magazine loaded with a total of 28 rounds of 9mm ammunition and a Black in color Smith & Wesson M&P 9 Shield 9mm (#NJP5701) handgun loaded with 9 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
Once the execution of the search warrant was complete, members of CGIC and Safe Streets responded to 314 9th Ave to attempt to locate Davon. While establishing surveillance on the residence, Davon exited the rear door and immediately attempted to flee upon seeing officers. After a brief pursuit Davon was taken into custody, once in custody Davon’s GPS was observed to be wrapped in aluminum foil. 

Updated Arrest: On August 19th, 2024 CGIC detectives and City Watch (Sierra) observed Ironn Collins-Demby in the area of 24th and Market. During this time, Ironn was observed displaying characteristics of an armed gunman.  Detectives were also aware of an outstanding firearm from the previous investigation.  
Detectives and members of DOCV immediately responded to the area at which point Collins-Demby was observed walking onto the front porch of 8 E 24th St.  Detectives exited their vehicles and responded to the porch to make contact with Ironn who immediately attempted to flee.  After a brief struggle, Ironn was taken into custody.  During the brief struggle, Ironn was observed discarding a firearm from the front of his waistband off of the porch.  
Once in custody, detectives recovered a black in color Girsan Regard MC 9mm firearm (SN T6368-20A00617) which was found to be loaded with a total of 13 rounds of 9mm ammunition.  During a search of Ironn, he was found in possession of .3 grams of crack cocaine.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On August 26, 2025, CGIC Detectives were in the area of E. 28th St. and Northeast Blvd in reference to an on-going firearm investigation. While in the area, Detectives observed Michael Sanders (09/10/1997) and Kendall Wisher (12/22/2002), who upon noticing detective immediately stood up and began walking away, leaving a backpack on the ground. Detectives responded to the backpack, where they located 14.7 grams of Crack Cocaine, 57.9 grams of Marijuana, and a concealed black in color Glock 43X 9mm (S/N: AHYD377) loaded handgun. Once discovering the firearm, detectives made contact with Wisher, who was initially observed next to the backpack and took him into custody without further incident.
Detectives also located paperwork inside the backpack, belonging to Sanders. An area search for Sanders was conducted at which point he was taken into custody without further incident. Surveillance footage was conducted which showed Sanders arriving to the alleyway wearing the backpack, confirming ownership.
The evidence was all taken back to Central. Sanders was charged accordingly, while Wisher was released pending DNA.

On Wednesday January 3, 2024, at approximately 1513 hours, members of Safe Streets responded to 19 Central Ave., New Castle, DE to assist Probation Officers with an administrative search/arrest.  Upon arrival Probation Officers had Stephen Grabowski WM 08/13/1984 in custody.  Grabowski is a level 3 probationer who also had a NCCPD hard warrant for domestic related terroristic threatening and harassment. During a search of the property officers located the following:

•	Mossburg 20 gauge shotgun (#K837080) which was located concealed inside a blanket in the back seat of a red GMC Sierra pickup parked directly next to the residence. Also located in the vehicle was a prescription bottle labeled “Suboxin” with the name “Stephen Grabowski” printed on the label
•	S&W .38 Special Revolver (#BBT2587) located in the first floor bedroom closet
•	Remington 870 Express 12 gauge shotgun (#B630281M) located in the first floor bedroom closet

Grabowski was transported to Central where he was interviewed regarding this incident as well as recent acts of violence in the city.  DNA was collected from Grabowski and test fire forms were submitted.  Grabowski was charged accordingly and received a $15,000 cash bail for his new charges in addition to his administrative warrant.

On Friday July 29th 1306 hours, SCU conducted a traffic stop on a white in color Honda Accord DE 447337 for an
equipment violation in the 400 block of N. Monroe St. Upon approaching the vehicle, officers smelled an odor of marijuana emanating from the vehicle and observed remnants of marijuana throughout the vehicle. SCU officers had the occupants (driver: Brennaye Brown BF 06/22/02 and passenger: Malik Winters BM 09/05/00) exit the vehicle and a search was conducted. During the search, officers located a satchel which contained a loaded High-Point 9mm Luger handgun and a loaded Beretta 9mm handgun. Winters was mirandized and advised that the weapons were his.

On Friday October 6th at approximately 2107 hours, D Platoon/Traffic Unit Officer K. Johnson observed a silver
BMW 435 DE 458742 traveling westbound on Delaware Ave with no lights on and almost entirely across the double yellow line. A traffic stop was conducted in the 1800 block of W 16th St where contact was made with the driver, Elias Torres WMH 03/07/1978. Johnson noted an overwhelming odor of alcohol emanating from the vehicle and observed the driver’s eyes to be bloodshot and glassy. Torres then advised the officer that he had a firearm on him in a holster on the right side of his waistband. The driver was ultimately taken into custody and charged with Possession of a Firearm while under the influence and DUI. The firearm was a Glock 30 .45 caliber semi-automatic pistol (#SCH613) loaded with 10 rounds in the magazine.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On Friday, August 15, 2025, at approximately 0904 hours, Officers Hutt and Connor were conducting proactive patrol in the 700 block of N. Market Street, when they observed a subject, Elijah Baker (11/19/2003), displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Officers then attempted to make contact with Baker, where a concealed Canik MC9 9mm (S/N: 25CT00789) handgun was located in the front waistband of his pants. A DELJIS inquiry revealed that Baker does not possess a valid CCDW permit and is prohibited from possessing a firearm due to a recent misdemeanor domestic violence conviction. Baker was taken into custody and transported to Central, where he was charged accordingly.

During July, Det. Coffiey initiated an investigation into Elton CHANDLER for Marijuana sales at 1112 Beech Street,
Wilmington. On this date, members of the Vice Unit executed a search warrant without incident at this location. During a search of the residence, the listed seized items were recovered: HK MP5 .22 LR containing 25 rounds of .22 ammunition, S&W MP Shield 9mm
containing 8 rounds of ammunition, POF USA PSG 9mm Rifle with one magazine, 3,230 grams of marijuana, $7,343 USC, and drug
paraphernalia

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On Tuesday, June 17, 2025, at approximately 2311 hours, ShotSpotter alerted to gunfire in the area of 16 W. 27th St (30-25-044265). Officer Diaz arrived to the area and observed a blue minivan parked at the intersection of West 28th and Enterprise St. Subject, Branden Moore (08/13/1995) was standing next to the vehicle. However, upon noticing officers, Moore fled on foot. Officers pursuit Moore until he was eventually apprehended in the 2700 block of Enterprise St. Officers conducted backtrack of Moore’s flight of path when they located a black .40 caliber Glock 27 (S/N: XLE652) underneath a parked vehicle. DNA and GSR search warrants were authored by Det. Kane.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On May 1, 2025, at approximately 1745 hours, K9 Officer A. Williams was conducting a proactive patrol in the area of 700 West 4th St when he observed a male subject illegally operating an electric scooter on the sidewalk. The subject took notice to Officer Williams, and he then began to flee while continuing to pay attention to Williams. The subject then discarded the scooter, continuing the pursuit on foot. At this time he could be observed holding his arm closely to his waistband, which is consistent with an armed gunman. The subject was eventually apprehended in the 200 block of N. Jefferson St and taken into custody without further incident. A search of the suspect, identified as Ikeem Thomas (12/27/1997), revealed crack cocaine, marijuana, and a black holster. Officer Williams retraced Thomas’ path of flight, which revealed a black and silver Taurus G2C 9mm (S/N: ADA854830) handgun loaded with one round in the chamber and twelve rounds in the magazine. Thomas was charged accordingly.

On Tuesday, November 4, 2025, at approximately 0947 hours, officers Gervasi and Connor were on a proactive patrol in
the area of 1400 Northeast Blvd when they observed subject, later identified as Hasaan Clark (07/08/2007), operating a scooter while
committing numerous traffic violations. Officers attempted to make contact with Clark, when he began to flee. Clark soon discarded the
scooter and continued to flee on foot, he was soon apprehended in the area of 1500 Heald St. Clark was found to be in possession of 4
grams of Crack Cocaine. During the pursuit, Clark was seen holding his waistband, along with other characteristics of an armed gunman.
Following the pursuit, officers backtracked Clark’s path of flight, where they recovered a Smith and Wesson SD40VE .40 caliber
(SN#FDF9096) handgun, in the rear yard of 1102 E. 15th St, which is approximately 5 feet from where Clark was apprehended. Clark
was transported back to Central, along with the evidence. DNA was taken pending the investigation.

On October 2nd, 2025, at approximately 0957 hours, members of A Platoon responded to the area of W. 3rd St and N.
Washington St, in reference to a ShotSpotter alert for three rounds. Upon arrival, they observed a gray in color Honda Accord, which
appeared to be damaged by gunfire; it was later determined the vehicle belongs to the defendant. An area canvas for a scene was met with
negative results. While on scene, officers were approached by a witness and observed several sources of video surveillance at which point
they contacted CGIC detectives.
While reviewing video, officers observed Nekye White (10/07/2002) with a firearm in his possession. During this time, White exits 501
W. 3rd St, and makes contact with officers who are able to detain him, pending the investigation. CGIC detectives then respond to the
scene. Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 501 W. 3rd St. During a search of the residence, Detectives recovered a
black and tan in color Springfield XD 9mm (SN#GM722397) handgun, loaded with 17 rounds of 9mm ammunition, 1 full auto switch,
drug packaging material, and $26,173.00 USC.
White and the evidence was transported to Central and charged accordingly.

On Thursday June 6, 2024 at 1908 hours, 14C (Josefyk/Dickerson) responded to the area of Race and Buena Vista St
regarding a disorderly group. The reporting person stated that one of the males by the name Kyren Williams had a firearm in his
waistband. Upon arrival, 14C observed two black males walk away from the main group. As the two walked southbound, the
defendant (Darien Griffin BM 10/06/2007) was observed placing an object underneath a bush. The two individuals were stopped and
a firearm was located following a search of the immediate area. The firearm (Taurus .380 serial #1F069797) is not reported stolen.
14C authored a DNA search warrant for Griffin and Williams. Griffin was charged accordingly

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
Over the past few weeks, Safe Streets Detectives began an investigation into Syaire Wilson (08/24/2007), who had outstanding warrants from NCCPD, as well as Middletown PD, in reference to multiple burglaries and receiving stolen property. On August 28, 2025, members of Safe Streets and the Drug Unit established surveillance on 2601 West St. Wilson and his sister, Gionni Brown-Congo (06/02/2000), were observed leaving the residence in a white in color Buick (DE: PC329664). A vehicle stop was conducted in the 600 block of Vandever Avenue, where Wilson was taken into custody without incident, and probable cause was established to search the vehicle.
Officers located a concealed, loaded Taurus G3C 9mm (S/N: #AGD150882) handgun in the center console of the vehicle. Brown-Congo, who does not have a concealed carry permit, admitted the firearm belonged to her. She was taken into custody without incident.
A short time later, officers observed Sharee Congo – Mother of Wilson and Brown Congo- exit the residence with a book bag and handed same to a neighbor that resides across the street. With the assistance of K9, DOCV officers executed a search warrant at 2601 West Street. Officers also located and spoke with the neighbor who voluntarily turned the book bag over to police. Officers located gun boxes, magazines and numerous rounds of 9mm ammunition inside the bag. Congo was advised that she was under arrest and which point she resisted being taken into custody. After a brief struggle, Congo was detained and transported to Central. Officers located a loaded Taurus “G2S” 9mm (S/N: #AGG296373) handgun as well as rounds of 9mm ammunition in the residence. Officers also located a small amount of heroin inside Wilson’s bedroom. While at Central, Officers executed a search warrant of the Buick Enclave and located a concealed, loaded Taurus “G2C” 9mm (S/N: #ABD457004) handgun under the seat where Wilson was located in the vehicle. All 3 firearms were not reported stolen at the time of this investigation, and test fire forms were submitted to FSU. The defendants were charged accordingly.

On December 4, 2025, at approximately 1134 hours, CGIC Investigators were in the area of 4th and Delamore St, when they observed Ollie Mays (10/12/2006) walking with another subject. During this time, Mays was observed displaying characteristics of
an armed gunman. Investigators proceeded to make contact with Mays at which he was found to be in possession of a black in color
Taurus PT111 G2 9mm (SN# TKO34908) handgun, which was loaded with 11 rounds of ammunition. Mays was transported back to
Central and charged accordingly.

On Sunday June 11th 1417 hours, A Platoon Officers Wilkers/Bond were in the area of 7th & Monroe St when they
observed Jewel Henry BM 09/03/99 and Jamil Bailey BM 06/09/94 sitting on the steps of the Faithful Missionary Baptist church
which had a No Loitering sign posted. Jewel Henry also has an active no contact order with Jamil Bailey (issued 12/16/21). As a
pedestrian stop was initiated, Henry attempted to walk away while displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Henry was stopped
and patted down for weapons. During the pat down, officers located a loaded S&W 9mm (reported stolen out of Cecil County
Sheriff’s Office) and a loaded S&W .38 revolver. Both firearms were located inside Henry’s waistband. Henry was also found to be in
possession of (34 grams) of marijuana.
not in gunstat meeting reports

During the month of July 2024, Det. Coffiey initiated an investigation into Marijuana sales from 3800 Market Street, Wilmington, by Alexander Pratt, 06/21/1989. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for the aforementioned location.
On July 31, 2014 at approximately 1012 hrs members of the Vice Unit, OSS, and K9 executed the search warrant without incident. During a search of the residence, investigators located the listed firearms, Marijuana, ammunition, and drug paraphernalia. Korey Marshall, 08/25/1983 gave consent for his vehicle during which time the listed Heroin, Cocaine, Crack Cocaine, Xanax, and currency was recovered.
The following items were seized during this search warrant: 
· FN model 509, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number GKS0103381 (29N). The handgun was not loaded, the extended magazine contained 24 rounds.
· Ruger Security 9, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number 382-02278 (29N). The handgun was not loaded, the extended magazine contained 15 rounds.
· 57.2 grams of Marijuana
· .056 grams of Heroin stamped “In Out”
· 7.7 grams of Cocaine
· 5 grams of Crack Cocaine
· 18 Xanax pills
· $975.00 USC (seized)
· Ammunition
· Drug Paraphernalia
Korey Marshall has an extensive firearm and drug arrest history in PA.

On the above date and time, 11-Adam (Cpl. Kline – S/Cpl. C. Bartolo) was investigating a suspicious vehicle that was partially parked in the intersection with a black male asleep in the driver’s seat. Upon approach, officers observed a black in color handgun (9mm Springfield Armory XD, loaded with 14 rounds, serial #XD966877, stolen out of NCCPD jurisdiction) in plain view on the passenger seat. Same was secured for officer safety purposes. The black male woke up and was placed into custody, without incident. After being positively identified, the defendant (Stevens) was found to be a person prohibited due to violent felony convictions. During a search, incident to arrest, Stevens was found to possess 70 miscellaneous prescription pills, 1 gram of crack cocaine and $442.00 in various denominations. Stevens was booked on the appropriate firearm and Title 16 charges. The USC was seized after a K9 alerted on same. A Street Smart search for Stevens met with negative results. A test fire form was completed and submitted. Bail information is not available at the time of this report.

On Monday August 1st 2221 hours, Safe Streets received a call from a CI regarding a subject armed with a firearm in
the area of West 7th Street and North Washington Street. The officers responded to the above listed area and observed Javon Malloy,
matching the description provided by the informant. The officers conducted a stop of Malloy, who unsuccessfully attempted to pull
away from the officers. During the stop, the officers located a loaded Glock 23 .40 handgun in Malloy’s waistband and approximately
2.4 grams of crack cocaine in his pants pocket.
Following the arrest, it was discovered that Malloy was a person of interest in the Wendell Smallwood Sr. shooting which occurred on
July 19, 2022. CID was notified of the arrest and interviewed Malloy regarding the Smallwood investigation. At the time of this
incident, Malloy had a court order issued out of the New Castle County Court of Common Pleas to not be in possession of any
firearms as a result of a felony firearm and PWID arrest on 7/14/2022. The firearm was submitted to FSU for processing along with a
Test Fire Form. Malloy was processed and arraigned at the Justice of the Peace Court 11.

Over the past several weeks, CGIC along with the FBI Task force, began to conduct a firearm/drug investigation into
Shanmir Gasby (02/01/2002) and 1217 W. 4th St. As a result of the investigation, Detectives applied for and were granted a search
warrant for 1217 W. 4th St.
On January 15, 2025, CGIC, Safe Streets, DOCV, and the FBI task force, with the assistance of the UAV and K9 units, established
surveillance on the residence and subsequently executed the search warrant. Shanmir Gasby, Jimmie Moore (04/26/1979), and D’Angelo
Johnson (03/06/1995) were all taken into custody without incident.
During a search of the residence, detectives located and recovered the following:
- One black in color Stevens Model 320 12 gauge Shotgun (S/N #135098G) loaded with five shotgun shells
- One black and silver Ruger LCP 380 (S/N #372213971) loaded with seven rounds of ammunition
- Six rounds of 9mm ammunition
- Five 12-Gauge shotgun shells
- $2,696.00 dollars
- 2,948.94 grams of Marijuana
- Drug paraphernalia
Shanmir, D’Angelo, Jimmie, and the evidence were transported to Wilmington Police Department.
Shanmir was charged accordingly. Warrants were signed for Garnell Stokes (05/01/1983) for the shotgun and ammunition, which were
located in his room

defendant_name: Naim Benson, Leshaun Bradley, Ayden Drummund, Tamir Knotts
ttr_category:
G1: Under
G2: Over
G3: Over
case_summary:
Over the past few months, CGIC Detectives have conducted an investigation into 1810 N. Washington St, Apt 3, in
reference to Motor Vehicle Thefts and Firearms. During the course of the investigation, Detectives were able to identify several persons
of interest to include Malikye Boyer (09/15/2005), Naim Benson (03/22/2006), Tamir Knotts (09/19/2003), Leshaun Bradley
(09/19/2005), Kyaire Harris (12/27/2004), Ayden Drummond (12/16/2005), and Jadier Torres-Melendez (01/26/2007). With the
assistance of Probation, Detectives were able to gather information regarding several firearms believed to be in the residence. As a
result, Detectives were granted a search warrant for the residence.
On April 9, 2025, CGIC, DOCV, and Safe Streets established surveillance on the residence. During this time Leshaun Bradley was
observed entering the residence.
At this time, CMTT was requested and responded to assist with the search warrant. CMTT began to make entry into the apartment
building; Jadier Torres-Melendez attempted to exit the front door and was detained by detectives, while Ayden Drummond jumped out
of the kitchen window. Drummond attempted to flee into the rear yards, however, was apprehended without further incident. While
executing the warrant, four (4) firearms were thrown out the window, which were recovered by assisting detectives. #1 - Anderson
Manufacturing AM-15 .223 rifle (#24067471) loaded with 30 rounds of ammunition, #2 - H&K P2000 9mm handgun (#121-020836)
loaded with 10 rounds of 9mm ammunition, #3 - Canik TP-9 Elite 9mm handgun (#21BH00458) loaded with 10 rounds of 9mm
ammunition, and #4 - Polymer 80 9mm handgun (No S/N) loaded with 18 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
Upon making entry into the residence, CMTT made contact and detained, Tamir Knotts, Leshaun Bradley, and Ashynah Coffey
(07/29/2002).
Located and recovered within the residence, were firearm accessories, miscellaneous ID cards, 20 rounds of 9mm ammunition, and car
keys. While conducting a search of Drummond’s path of flight, approximately 129.42 grams (4,314 bags) of heroin and 10.7 grams of
crack cocaine were located. Benson, Bradley, Drummond, Knotts, and Harris were charged according. Charges for Torres and Boyer are
pending further investigation. Coffey was released without charges.

On February 20, 2025, at approximately 1520 hours, Officers Crumlish and Shea were contacted by Delaware State Police regarding a black Ford Mustang (MD 3GJ2102), that fled from Chester Police into Delaware, where the occupants of the vehicle were known to be armed. Officers observed the vehicle traveling southbound on Bancroft Parkway, crossing over Pennsylvania Ave. At this time, a pursuit ensued, however after turning west onto West 11th St, the vehicle spun out, coming to a stop at 2102 W. 11th St. The two occupants fled from the vehicle to Bancroft Parkway and through an alley. Officers responded to the 1100 block of Woodlawn Ave, when defendant #2, later identified as Deshaun Alston (09/09/1994), ran into the rear yard. Officers were able to apprehend him and he was taken into custody without further incident.
An area search was continued and defendant #1, identified as Dewitt Johnson (03/29/1999) was subsequently taken into custody around the 2100 block of Fairfield Place. 
In plain view in the vehicle was a black in color Girsam MC-9 9mm (S/N: T6368-21CJ00134) handgun on the driver’s seat and a black Diamondback DB15 .223 (S/N: DB2148212) rife with a scope on the front passenger side floor. 
Johnson and Alston were charged accordingly.

On September 16th, CGIC along with DOCV, established surveillance on 1106 W. 4th St after Detectives initiated an
investigation on the residence and subjects. On this date, Waseem Jones was observed exiting. Jones was followed out of the area to the
500 block of N. Van Buren St where he was taken into custody without incident in reference to a Violation of Probation. As a result of the
investigation, Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 1106 W 4th St.
Once Jones was in custody, a perimeter was established on the residence in reference to impending search warrant. During this time,
Ishmael Turner, Artie Melton, and Jaseem Hammon fled from the rear of the residence. Detectives were able to make contact with Artie
Melton and Jaseem Hammon and detain both in reference to the investigation. Detectives executed the search warrant and located a black
in color Smith & Wesson M&P .40 Caliber (SN #MRA7702) handgun loaded with 14 total rounds of ammunition, a Norinco MAK 90
AK47 Style (SN #179573) Rifle loaded with 12 rounds of 7.62 ammunition, 9 rounds of 9mm ammunition, 1 gun light with a red laser.
All occupants of the residence were transported to central along with the evidence.

On June 8th, 2024 Officers Mann and Diaz initiated an investigation into a late report of a shots fired incident which occurred on June 7th, 2024.  During the course of the investigation, Officers were able to locate a call for service in reference to a suspicious person in the 200 block of W 25th St where the caller advised they heard a loud bang then people running and crying and people saying they are kids.  Officer Mann further requested a shots spotter audit which confirmed a notification in the area of West 25th St and N. West St.  Officers Mann and Diaz responded to the area where an area canvas was conducted during which time they located a victim who provided a picture of the suspect who was identified as Gabriella Francis-Maria Rivera. Based on the investigation, Officer Mann was able to obtain an arrest warrant for Gabriella and a search warrant for her residence.  

On June 26th, 2024 Officer Mann, CGIC and members of CID responded to the 2500 block of N. West St in reference to this investigation.  During this time, Gabriella was observed exiting a gray in color Chrysler 300 along with Averian Brown at which point Detectives made contact with her and took her into custody.  Once in custody, Gabriella informed Detectives her firearm was in the vehicle inside of her purse. Officers responded back to the vehicle and made contact with the front seat passenger, Janaya Starkey, who was removed from the vehicle.  A search of her purse yielded negative results.  While interviewing Starkey, she admitted to moving the firearm and placing it under the rear seat of the vehicle at which point Offices checked and confirmed the firearm was under the seat.  Starkey was placed into custody without incident. 

The search warrant for the residence, 2507 N. West St, was executed at which point the following items were located and seized:
Taurus Judge Revolver (S/N ADB947690) containing 4 .410 shotgun shells – Reported Stolen out of New Castle Country Police. 
116 grams of Crack Cocaine and 2,246.00 dollars

While at central, Officer Mann obtained DNA from Gabriella, Stakey and Averian.  A search warrant for the vehicle was applied for and granted at which point the black in color Glock 43X 9mm handgun (S/N BPLS032), which was loaded with a total of nine (9) 9mm rounds of ammunition, was recovered.  

Gabriella and Janya were charges, Averian was released pending results of DNA.

On Wednesday June 19th at approximately 1511 hours, WILCOM advised a call for shots fired in the area of 1099
block of A Street. The caller, who resides at 1021 A St, stated that shots were fired in the area and the subjects that were involved
were in the rear of 1021 / 1023 A Street. Upon arrival, officers were advised by residents in the area that the subjects were still in the
back yard area as they were watching them LIVE on camera. A perimeter was setup officers began to search the area. In the alleyway
next to 1023 A Street, officers observed three (3) black male subjects dressed in all black clothing attempting to exit the alleyway.
Immediately upon observing officers approaching, the subjects changed direction and began to flee back towards the rear yards /
parking area. Loud verbal commands were given for the subjects to STOP, which were ignored by 2 out of the 3 subjects.
M/CPL Schulz was able to stop Dontae Jones BM 08/17/2004 who "gave up" and stopped running. Upon conducting a pat down of
Jones, M/CPL Schulz felt and immediately recognized the extended magazine portion of a firearm tucked in Jones' front waistband
area. A black in color Glock Model 22 .40 cal semi-automatic handgun (#AERC126) with a 22 round extended Glock Magazine.
Consecutively, CPL Holden ran on foot to the rear of the residence where the other suspects were seen running towards him. With the
help of assisting units, the subject Chacarta Milton BM 08/29/2004 was placed to the ground and put into custody. During a search
incident to arrest a green and black Stryker 100 40 caliber (no serial number) was removed from the suspect's right pants pocket
which was zipped shut at the time. The third subject, Jamil Osbourne (BM 02/25/2002) was ordered to the ground and taking into
custody by Officer Everett and PFC Murzyn. Osbourne was not found to have anything illegal on his person. He was released from
custody.It is believed that the three (3) subject Dontae Jones, Chacarta Milton, Jamil Osbourne, were looking for and going after
Michael Dennis, 02/27/2004.

On October 23, 2024, members of Safe Streets were contacted by SPO Crist regarding level 2 probationer, Isaac Peak (04/23/98). SPO Crist advised that he observed a recent social media video that showed a firearm being displayed inside Peak’s suspected residence.  Through their investigation officers were able to determine that the residence in question was located at 1225 Lobdell Street.

On October 24, at approximately 1054 hours, members of Safe Streets, CGIC and SPO Crist observed Peak entering the front door of the residence.  Officers knocked on the door at which time Peak was observed opening a rear, second story window and discarding a firearm onto the roof.  Officers were forced to breach the front door and subsequently entered, taking Peak into custody without further incident.
Officers located and collected a Smith and Wesson M&P Shield .380 (S/N #RES8191), 485.5 grams of marijuana, 1.4 grams of cocaine as well as drug paraphernalia from the residence.  Peak was transported to Central.

In Wednesday March 20th 2024 at 1843 hours, Cpl. Akquil Williams was on patrol in the area of 4th and North
Broom Streets when he observed Joshua Thomas BM 06/02/2006 displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Cpl. Williams
quickly circled the block in an attempt to make contact with the subject. Upon seeing the police vehicle, Thomas attempted to create
distance by quickly walking in the opposite direction. Cpl. Williams made contact with Thomas who continued to act in a suspicious
manner and was warned about the presence of the police K9. During a search of the defendant, Cpl. Williams located a Glock 45 9mm
handgun loaded with sixteen (16) rounds of ammunition. Thomas was taken into custody without incident. An NCIC and Deljis
check of the firearm revealed that it was stolen out of NCCPD jurisdiction.

defendant_name: Edward Robinson, Zylier Carter, Sincere Johnson
case_summary:
Over the past several weeks, CGIC Detectives have been conducting a firearm investigation regarding Edward
Robinson BM 06/11/2009 who was observed on social media with several firearms. On April 3rd, 2024 Detective Lerro observed an
Instagram video of Robinson, Sincere Johnson BM 02/29/2008 and Zylier Carter BM 02/03/2003 driving in what appeared to a
Jeep Cherokee. Detectives were aware of a black in color 2019 Jeep Cherokee reported stolen out of WPD on March 31st, 2024 (24-
23433). An area canvas was conducted at which point the stolen Jeep Cherokee was located parked in the 600 block of S. Heald St, a
couple of houses down from Carter’s residence.
Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 605 S. Heald St. At approximately 1321 hours, Robinson, Sincere, and
Carter were observed exiting 605 S. Heald St and began walking towards the stolen Jeep Cherokee. As Detectives approached them,
they immediately fled westbound into an alleyway. Zylier was taken into custody without incident in the alley. Robinson was taken
into custody after a brief foot pursuit. Sincere fled and was no apprehended. During a backtrack, detectives located the key to the
Stolen Jeep.
Detectives executed the search warrant at 605 S. Heald St and located the following items:
- Black in color Radical Arms AR (# 20-016558) loaded with 27 rounds of 223 ammunition
- Tan and Black in color Polymer 80 9mm handgun with an extended magazine loaded with 14 rounds of 9mm ammunition
- 1 spent 223 casing
- 1 round of 223 ammunition
- 31 rounds of 380 ammunition
- (2) 12 gauge shotgun shells
- (6) sets of car keys with miscellaneous cards/IDs

On March 3, 2025 at approximately 2214 hours, Officer Everett attempted to conducted a motor vehicle stop on a greyNissan Sentra (NJ: Z69VAK) for a failure to stop at stop sign and driving wrong way on a one way. The driver (Nahum Trader BM01/05/99) continued to drive, eventually coming to a stop in the 800 block of Morrow St. Trader was removed from the vehicle afterrefusing to exit, and attempted to flee on foot. After a brief struggle, Trader was taken into custody and found to be in possession of aloaded Glock 30 .45 (S/N: TGG418) handgun, with sixteen (16) .45 rounds in the magazine and one (1) in the chamber, along with aGlock Switch. A second loaded magazine was also located in Traders jacket pocket. He was transported and charged accordingly.

In response to recent acts of violence in District 13, Det. Cuadrado initiated a drug investigation into several subjects
selling Crack Cocaine from 112 E. 23rd Street, Wilmington, DE. On Tuesday September 14th 1347 hours, surveillance was established
on 112 E. 23rd Street, surveillance observed approximately 9 individuals in front of the residence. Members of the Vice Unit, SCU,
K9, & USD responded to the location, detained all the subjects, and executed the search warrant without incident. During a search of
the residence, all the items seized were found to belong to Frank Butts and Dwayne Woodhouse.
• Mossberg MC1 SC 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial # obliterated, loaded with a total of 7 rounds of 9mm ammo.
• Springfield XDS .45 ACP semi-automatic handgun, serial # S3180366, (29N), loaded with a total of 5 rounds of .45
caliber ammunition.
• 26.5 grams of Crack Cocaine.
• .548 grams of Heroin stamped “SUSUKI & EZPASS”.
• Various types of ammunition and handgun magazines.
• $305.00 USC.
• Drug Paraphernalia.
While on scene Officer Lero observed a Black 2014 Nissan Rogue DE PC308021 (registered to Sean Smith) parked in front of the
residence. Officers were able to see in plain sight a Taurus PT III G2C 9mm handgun serial # ABC401911, (29N), loaded with a
total of 11 rounds of 9mm ammunition. The vehicle was transported to central where a search warrant was authored and obtained.
Smith was found in possession of the keys to the vehicle and .5 grams of marijuana.
All three firearms and Test Fire Forms were submitted to FSU for processing. Both firearms with serial numbers were negative for
warrants. DNA was obtained from all defendants. All defendants are convicted felons.

On Friday April 22nd 1620 hours, ACU were in the 2800 block of N. Market St when they observed Marvin Barefield acting suspiciously. Barefield immediately entered a store within the block after observing offices approaching. SCU officers conducted an approach on Barefield who was no longer in possession of a satchel which he was previously observed carrying prior to entering the store. Officers observed Barefield speaking with Shavanna Truitt who was now in possession of the satchel. Officers spoke with Truitt who advised that there was a firearm inside the satchel. Officers then searched same and located a loaded Glock 43 9mm which contained 6 rounds in the magazine and 1 in the chamber, an additional magazine containing 6 rounds, and (140) oxycodone pills.
SCU officers observed Barefield to possess keys to a vehicle which smelled like an unburnt odor of marijuana. A search of the vehicle was conducted where a purse was located in the back seat containing a SCCY CPX-2 9mm firearm loaded with (11) 9mm rounds in the magazine. On the front passenger floor board, officers observed a black bag which contained a magazine drum containing (31) 9mm rounds. (207) MDMA pills, (330.14) grams Marijuana, an assortment of (37) Marijuana edibles, (9) prepackaged marijuana cigars, and (2) marijuana vape pens were located.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On June 25, 2025, Det. Coffiey initiated surveillance on Shannon Johnson (02/27/2003) in the 1700 block of Locust St, in regard to drug sales. During the surveillance, Johnson was observed conducting several hand to hand drug transactions and then entered a vehicle parked in the block. Members of DOCV, OSS, and K9 stopped Johnson without incident. He was found to be in possession of 18.8 grams of Crack Cocaine & 3.15 grams of Heroin concealed on his person. Drug paraphernalia was observed in plain view of the vehicle. Johnson, along with his vehicle, were transported to Central. Consent was obtained from Johnson, where officers located a Springfield XD5 9mm (SN: XD916582) loaded handgun containing 16 rounds, along with additional Heroin and USC.

On December 17, 2025, at approximately 1605 hours, WPD officers were on a proactive patrol when a concerned grandmother called into Wilcom advising her grand-daughter was being held by gunpoint in a vehicle by her boyfriend. The RP was able to provide the vehicle description of a Ford Focus as well as the vehicle’s location which was the in the 500 block of Concord. The vehicle was located in the provided location and found to be occupied by a uncooperative women, and the defendant, Kevis Edwards (12/03/1989). A consent search was conducted and the above loaded firearm was located under the front driver seat where the defendant was seated. It should be noted, the defendant is a person prohibited and had an active no contact order with the passenger. The defendant
was charged PFBPP x2 Gun Ammo, RSP, and Breach of Release.

On February 19, 2025, members of Probation were monitoring the social media account for Ironn Collins-Demby (05/31/2006), during which time they observed him to be in possession of a semi-automatic handgun. At approximately 2200 hours, members of Safe Streets, and assisting officers from Probation, executed an admin search on Collin-Demby’s address of 818 Maryland Ave. Officers located and collected a loaded a Apintl-Pahrump M-1911 – A1 .45 caliber semi-automatic handgun with an obliterated serial number – which was later restored to be S/N: RIA2172970. In addition, officers located approximately 6.3 grams of Marijuana.
Collins-Demby was taken into custody without incident and transported to Central. Officers were granted a search warrant to collect DNA.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
Over the past few weeks, Safe Streets Detectives began an investigation into Syaire Wilson (08/24/2007), who had outstanding warrants from NCCPD, as well as Middletown PD, in reference to multiple burglaries and receiving stolen property. On August 28, 2025, members of Safe Streets and the Drug Unit established surveillance on 2601 West St. Wilson and his sister, Gionni Brown-Congo (06/02/2000), were observed leaving the residence in a white in color Buick (DE: PC329664). A vehicle stop was conducted in the 600 block of Vandever Avenue, where Wilson was taken into custody without incident, and probable cause was established to search the vehicle.
Officers located a concealed, loaded Taurus G3C 9mm (S/N: #AGD150882) handgun in the center console of the vehicle. Brown-Congo, who does not have a concealed carry permit, admitted the firearm belonged to her. She was taken into custody without incident.
A short time later, officers observed Sharee Congo – Mother of Wilson and Brown Congo- exit the residence with a book bag and handed same to a neighbor that resides across the street. With the assistance of K9, DOCV officers executed a search warrant at 2601 West Street. Officers also located and spoke with the neighbor who voluntarily turned the book bag over to police. Officers located gun boxes, magazines and numerous rounds of 9mm ammunition inside the bag. Congo was advised that she was under arrest and which point she resisted being taken into custody. After a brief struggle, Congo was detained and transported to Central. Officers located a loaded Taurus “G2S” 9mm (S/N: #AGG296373) handgun as well as rounds of 9mm ammunition in the residence. Officers also located a small amount of heroin inside Wilson’s bedroom. While at Central, Officers executed a search warrant of the Buick Enclave and located a concealed, loaded Taurus “G2C” 9mm (S/N: #ABD457004) handgun under the seat where Wilson was located in the vehicle. All 3 firearms were not reported stolen at the time of this investigation, and test fire forms were submitted to FSU. The defendants were charged accordingly.

On July 15, 2024, at approximately 2145, Officers Mann and Diaz were on mobile patrol in the unit block of
Gordon Street when they observed three individuals acting suspiciously. They stopped their patrol vehicle, at which point the
individuals ran. Officer Mann apprehended Thomas Wisher BM 12/02/1987, and Officer Diaz apprehended Charles Gwyn. The
third subject eluded officers. Thomas Wisher was wearing a black shoulder bag, which was unzipped. The officers found
narcotics and cash in the bag. They searched the route that Wisher fled and found a black Glock 30 .45 (serial # KTB115), loaded
with 13 hollow-point rounds in the magazine. In addition to the gun, officers found evidence linking the firearm to Wisher. The
officers determined that Mr. Gwyn was wanted for an outstanding capias. They transported both subjects to the police station for
further investigation. At Central, officers determined the bag Wisher was carrying was embroidered with “Run it up or die.”
However, StreetSmart inquiries linking Wisher as a member/associate came back negative. Officers recovered 48 bags of heroin
(stamped “the joker”), 14 capsules of crack, and $977.

On September 14, 2025 CGIC detectives initiated an investigation into a shots fired which occurred in the 400 block of
W 29th St on September 13. While on the initial scene, Patrol located 19 spent casings which consisted of eight (8) .45 caliber casings,
eight (8) .380 caliber casings, and three (3) 9mm casings. Video surveillance was recovered, which shows three suspects discharging
firearms. During the investigation, Detectives were able to positively identify the three suspects as Brian Palmer (04/08/2008), Dhossan
Whyte (12/16/2009), and Kaleek Brooks (07/24/2011). As a result, Detectives were granted search warrants for each residence.
On September 25, 2025, Detectives were conducting surveillance when they observed Palmer walking in the area of 29th and Washington
St. Detectives made contact with Palmer and took him into custody without incident. Once in custody, the search warrant was executed on
his residence, where Detectives located the clothes he was wearing during the incident. On September 26, 2025 Detectives established
surveillance on 2930 N. Jefferson St. CGIC along with CMTT executed the search warrant and were able to take Whyte into custody
without incident. During a search of the residence, Detectives recovered a loaded black and silver in color Bersa Thunder 45 Caliber
(SN# A2312) handgun. Palmer and Whyte were charged accordingly. Warrants are in the process of being signed for Brooks

On Monday November 7th at approximately 0930 hours, officer(s) responded to 1324 N. King Street, Capitol
Healthcare Clinic, regarding a burglary. Suspect(s) unknown entered the business by way of a second floor, bathroom window, by
removing the security bars and breaking the window. The suspect(s) then ransacked the desk and office area. USC and an Apple
IPhone were reportedly taken from the desk. Around 1030 hours, DSP responded to 1424 Pulaski Highway, Elizabeth Plaza, regarding
another commercial burglary. The incident occurred between 0400 – 0530 hours on that date. It that incident, USC and a S&W .40
caliber handgun was taken.
Throughout the course of those investigations, Zymere Brown (BM 03/06/1992) was identified as the suspect in both incidents. Det.
Merced later disseminated a bulletin identifying Brown as the suspect, with warrants on file.
On Friday November 18th 2200 hours, M/Cpl. Keith Johnson saw a 2013 Chevy Malibu, DE. XQ311067, which is registered to
Brown, in the 3400 Blk. N. Market Street and conducted a traffic stop. Brown was the sole occupant and arrested without incident.
During a search of the vehicle, Johnson located a black backpack containing burglary tools, an Apple IPhone, and a small amount of
marijuana. Johnson also located a S&W .40 caliber handgun (ten rounds) in the trunk hidden under the spare tire.

On Monday March 18th, 2024 CGIC detectives were conducting surveillance in the area of W 4th St and N.
Madison St when they observed the defendant (Tyshawn Bartley BM 02/07/2006) walking southbound on Madison St past
Detectives. While Bartley was walking in the block, Detectives observed same to display several characteristics of an armed gunman.
Detectives attempted a pedestrian stop in the 200 block of N. Madison St at which point Bartley immediately began to flee westbound
through an alleyway. Detectives pursued Bartley into the alleyway at which point they discharged their CEW with a positive result.
Once Bartley was in custody, Detectives located a black in color Ruger EC9s 9mm handgun (S/N 462-87347) which was found to be
loaded with a total of 6 rounds of 9mm ammunition. An NCIC inquiry was conducted on the firearm which revealed same was
reported stolen out of NCCPD. NCCPD was notified of the recovery. Probation was notified and a test fire form was submitted.

On Wednesday November 30th 1806 hours, SCU Investigators were in the area of Conrad and Harrison Streets per the request of Captain Campos regarding community complaints within the area.  While patrolling the area of Conrad and Franklin, SCU investigators observed Defendant 1 (Brown, Da’quan (BM 10/29/1996) displaying characteristics of an armed gunman.  Additionally, Investigators were aware Brown was 29P. Investigators lost site of the defendant who was later observed exiting out of the (Franklin Deli & Grocery) corner store at 1232 W. 4th St.  Upon the defendant observing Investigators approaching, the defendant quickly re-entered the store.  Investigators entered the store and took the defendant into custody.  

Investigators reviewed the store’s surveillance cameras and observed Defendant 2 (Hiche, Baltazar (BM 11/12/1999) inside the store briefly speaking to Da’quan Brown. Hiche is then observed removing an object out of his waistband and placing same inside a trash can before exiting the store.  The surveillance video also shows Brown remove an object from his waistband and place same underneath the trash bag within the trash can then exit the store just before coming into contact with investigators. Hiche was later located sitting on the steps of 407 N. Franklin Street and taken into custody. 

Inside the trash can, SCU Investigators recovered a loaded black in color (9mm Taurus G2C bearing serial number ABC426688 which contained (1) one round in the chamber and (11) eleven rounds in the magazine. A check of the firearm revealed same not to be reported stolen.
