They also located a loaded black in color (22 caliber Ruger bearing serial number 381029656 which contained (5) five rounds in the magazine. A check of the firearm revealed same to be reported stolen on 11/28/2022 by DSP Troop 6 under case number 0622103153. DATA made the agency notifications of the recovery.  

Test fire requests were submitted for both firearms. Both Defendant’s DNA was obtained.

On Wednesday December 21st 2327 hours, C Platoon Officers were dispatched to 617 Geddes Street in reference to
a domestic complaint. Officers located the victim sheltering at 606 Geddes St. A preliminary interview was conducted where the
victim stated that she was in a heated argument with her boyfriend, Ian Maier WM 07/06/90. This argument became physical and the
defendant pushed her up against a dresser. As they continued to argue the defendant destroyed various items in the house and
responded upstairs and retrieved a firearm from the master bedroom. Upon returning downstairs with the firearm, the victim fled the
residence in fear for her safety, where she then notified police. Officers were able to tactically approach the defendant and give him
verbal commands. The defendant complied and was taken into custody without incident. A loaded Ruger LC9 9mm pistol was
recovered from the defendant’s right jacket pocket. An additional search yielded 43 rounds of Winchester 9mm ammunition and 20
rounds of Federal Syntech ammunition. Upon taking the defendant into custody he was displaying signs of alcohol intoxication. The
defendant was charged with aggravated menacing, offensive touching, and weapons offenses.

defendant_name: Young, Idris; King, Kijire; Chambers, Kevin
case_status:
D1: Resolved
D2: Resolved
D3: Resolved
case_summary:
On Saturday May 14th 1910 hours, Street Crimes Officers were in the 1200 block of Maryland Ave when they
observed a black Jeep Cherokee (DE PC256936) which failed to possess a valid tint waiver. SCU officers approached the vehicle and spoke with the operator (Idris Young BM 01/18/98), front passenger (Kevin Chambers BM 04/26/98) and rear seat passenger (Kijire King BM 09/23/98). While speaking with the occupants, SCU officers observed what appeared to be an AR style pistol protruding from underneath the front driver seat and into the rear of same. Officers also observed a firearm partially concealed underneath the
front passenger seat and floorboard. All three occupants were removed from the vehicle and detained.
SCU officers conducted a search warrant on the vehicle and located the following:
• Located underneath the front driver seat, protruding out the rear was (HK) 416 AR-style pistol chambered in .22 LR
ammunition (# HBO19304).
• Located in the rear cargo compartment was a firearm magazine containing (19) .22 caliber rounds
• Located on the passenger side floor board was a TP9PA(Canik) 9mm semi-automatic handgun (# TG472-18BJ09845)
with one round chambered & one black in color Canik brand magazine containing (5) 9mm rounds.
• Located inside the center console cup holder was a Canik magazine containing (15) 9mm rounds.
• Located inside the center console was 5.4 grams of marijuana

On Saturday April 16th 1746 hours, SCU officers conducted a traffic stop on a vehicle for heavy tint and for blocking the flow of traffic in the 100 block of S Harrison St. As officers approached the vehicle they smelled a strong odor of burnt marijuana coming from the vehicle. Idris Young (driver) and Zakee Newton BM 03/30/03 (passenger) were removed from the vehicle and same was searched. During the search, officers located a loaded Smith and Wesson M&P 45 Caliber firearm containing 5 rounds in the magazine and 1 in the chamber underneath the driver side floor mat. Officers also located an additional magazine in the glove box containing 7 rounds. A black mechanic bag was observed on the passenger side floor board containing approximately (114.3 grams) of marijuana. Idris Young was charged with CCDW and traffic related offenses. Zakee Newton was charged with Possession of Marijuana.

defendant_name: Marhi Clark, Amir Clark, Nasir Turner
case_summary:
On the above date and time, officers were dispatched to the above address in reference to a theft of a firearm. Upon arrival, officers made contact with the victim, who advised that between 04/05/2024 and 04/07/2024 his firearm (black in color, Glock 43X, 15 round magazine, serial #CAUW394) was removed from his vehicle (black in color, Lexus RX350, DE PC327783). It is unknown if the vehicle was secured; however, there was no forced entry into same. The vehicle was parked on the north side of the street in the above listed block. An area canvass for witnesses met with negative results. Several surveillance cameras were located in the above block, but none were available for review at this time. The vehicle was processed for fingerprints, but met with negative results. TRU was contacted regarding the potential surveillance. A copy of this report was forwarded to the Data Center for entry into NCIC.
----------------------------------------------------------- Update ---------------------------------------------------------------
        On April 8th, 2024 CGIC Detectives initiated an investigation into the above firearm theft.  During the course of the investigation, Detectives were contacted by City Watch (Sierra) who advised she observed three juvenile suspects on the City Watch Cameras walking in the area checking car doors during the time of the firearm theft.  She further advised she believed the suspects entered the 711 at W. 4th St and N. Union St.  
TRU was able to retrieve video surveillance of the incident as well as the video surveillance from the 7-11.  Detectives reviewed the surveillance videos and were able to positively identify Marhi Clark BM 04/23/2008, Amir Clark BM 04/23/2008, and Nazir Turner BM 04/12/2007 as the suspects.  As a result of this investigation, Detectives were granted arrest warrants for Marhi, Amir and Nazir. Detectives applied for and were granted search warrants for 418 N Franklin St and 1007 W 8th St in regards to this investigation.  

On April 12th, 2024 at approximately 0600 hours CGIC executed both search warrants with the assistance of CMTT, Safe Streets, K9 and members of A Platoon. While responding to the residence, Detectives observed a group of 4 juvenile males, to include the suspects, walking eastbound on 4th St.  Detectives attempted to make contact with the suspects at which point they all fled.  After a brief foot pursuit, Marhi and Ishmael Turner were taken into custody.  

As a result of the search warrants the following evidence was located and recovered:
        418 N Franklin St:
- Black in color Glock 19 9mm handgun (Serial Number CCAW570) loaded with 13 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color Glock 17 9mm handgun (Serial Number CAGS184) loaded with 12 rounds of ammunition
                - 2 empty magazines/Misc Firearm accessories
        1007 W 8th St:
                - Black in color Glock 47 (Serial Number CAFD759) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color FMK 9mm handgun (Serial Number BB22209) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
                - 9 rounds of 40 caliber ammunition
                - 38 rounds of 9mm ammunition
                - 2 Spent 9mm casings
                - Miscellaneous firearm accessories
        Marhi and Ishmael and the evidence were transported to the Wilmington Police Department. Amir Clark and Nasir Turner turned themselves in the following day. The stolen firearm is still outstanding at this time. DNA was obtained from other occupants in the residence regarding the recovered firearms, charges are pending the comparison.

"During the month of December 2023, Det. Cuadrado initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales from Giotto
Berry BM 09/30/1992 from 2615 Pine Street, Wilmington, DE. Further information was that Giotto Berry was in possession of a
handgun and currently wanted.
On Friday January 5, 2024, Berry was observed exiting 2615 Pine Street, enter the passenger seat of a vehicle and proceeded to the
200 block of E. 28th Street. During mobile surveillance, the operator of the vehicle was observed committing several traffic infractions
and was stopped. During the traffic stop Berry was taken into custody and found to be in possession of 26.2 grams of Crack Cocaine
concealed in his underwear. Both occupants and the vehicle were transported to Central. Through the course of this investigation, a
search warrant was authored and obtained for 2615 Pine Street, Wilmington, DE. The warrant was executed by members of the Vice
Unit & OSS without incident. During a search of the residence investigators located the following:
• Black & green Glock 19, Gen 4, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number BGUR160 (29P Georgia). The handgun was
loaded, and the magazine contained 14 rounds.
• Black Springfield Arms XD, .45 Caliber semi-automatic handgun, serial number XD675875 (29N). The handgun was
loaded, and the magazine contained 9 rounds.
• Black & silver S&W 9VE, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number RBF4860 (29N). The handgun did not have a
barrel installed, 9mm barrel located separately.
• 146.8 grams of Crack Cocaine (this includes the amount located on Berry)
• 14.5 grams of Cocaine
• 70.3 grams of Marijuana
• 266 rounds of 9mm ammunition
• Numerous firearm parts, lights, sights, and extended magazine
• $524.00 USC (seized)
• Drug Paraphernalia"

On Thursday April 14th 1346 hours, DOCV were conducting surveillance in the area of 7th & Monroe St regarding
an unrelated investigation when they observed an in progress shooting. DOCV detectives observed a blue metallic Honda Pilot (PA
LVR8640) enter the 700 block of W 7th St and stop near a black cherry metallic Chevrolet Malibu (MD 8ED7976). The occupants of
the Honda Pilot opened the front passenger side door and discharged multiple rounds into the parked Chevrolet Malibu which was
occupied by Jamil Bailey BM 06/09/94 & Troy Faison BM 11/28/87. The suspect vehicle was observed with a shattered rear window
fleeing north on Jefferson St. In the area of Delaware Ave and Adams St, the two suspects (later identified as Demarius Bradley and
Ernest Hill) fled from the vehicle and were pursued by numerous officers. Ernest Hill was pursued into Trinity Church Cemetery
where he was taken into custody by Safe Street officers after a taser deployment. A Taurus G2C 9mm handgun (#TL071592) was
located inside his right pant leg. Demarius Bradley fled on foot and was located hiding inside an unsecured Delaware Horticulture van
with the assistance of civilians in the area. B Platoon office Agosto took Bradley into custody. Bradley was not wearing shoes at the
time of his arrest. Officers backtracked his route and located his sneakers along with a discarded hooded sweatshirt, a second Taurus
9mm handgun (#ACC347293), and a separate extended magazine in 1100 block of N Adams St. During the ensuing foot pursuit and
apprehension, WILCOM advised of two shooting victims who arrived at WER via private vehicle. The victims were identified as
Jamil Bailey BM 06/09/94 & Troy Faison BM 11/28/87. Both victims were listed as critical but stable condition.
A secondary canvass of the cemetery on Delaware Ave was conducted which resulted in the recovery of a Glock .40 handgun with an
extended magazine. The Glock was found to be stolen in WPD’s jurisdiction in 2016 (30-16-71906)
(12) 9mm casings located in the 700 block of W 7th St.
Dillard/Bailey feud

On July 25th, at approximately 2235 hours, members of Safe Streets were proactively patrolling the Riverside area where they observed Samad Stewart (02/01/1995), Michael Sanders (09/10/1997) and Kendall Wisher (12/22/2002) acting suspiciously in the area of 26th and Claymont Streets.  As officers turned down Jensen Drive to get a better look at the subjects, all three began running E/B through the courtyards.  Officers pursued the subjects and quickly detained all three. Samad Stewart was found to be in possession of a concealed Glock “43X” 9mm handgun, loaded with nine rounds of ammunition. Officers located a Sig Sauer “SP2022” 9mm handgun, loaded with sixteen rounds of ammunition, lying in the grass approximately fifteen feet from where the subjects were detained.

During the month of February 2024, Det. Trent Martin initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales from Ziare Davis-Shelton BM 11/24/2002 from 1 W. 27th Street, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for this location. On Wednesday February 21, 2024, the search warrant was executed by members of the Vice Unit, CGIC, and K9. During the warrant execution, officers located Ziare Davis-Shelton in the unit block of W. 27th Street and took same into custody without incident. Ziare Davis-Shelton was found to be in possession of a loaded Glock 43X 9mm
handgun (#BXSV956) and (.7) grams of crack cocaine. During the execution of the warrant, Purnell Davis BM 06/15/1964 fled from
the rear of the location where he was taken into custody. The residence was found to have multiple people in the residence who were
all detained without incident. The residence was found to be inhabitable and L&I was contacted, L&I responded, condemned, and boarded up the residence. Animal control contacted, responded, and took custody of several neglected dogs. Purnell Davis was sought by CID Det. Wilkers for a Robbery incident that occurred in the 2300 block of Carter Street on November 16, 2023. Both defendants were interviewed about this
incident and recent acts of violence. The firearm (29N) as well as the Test Fire Form was submitted to FSU for processing. Ziare
Davis-Shelton is on the NorthPak intelligence bulletin along with numerous, older, intelligence-related fliers

On Thursday September 1, 2022, Detective Deveraux and DOCV executed a search warrant at 2900 W. 4th St following a drug investigation. During the search warrant, Isaiah Frazer BM 04/21/99 and Aje Watkins-Anderson BM 08/16/00 were located inside the residence and detained. A search was conducted resulting in the following seized items:

•	Taurus G2C 9mm loaded with (11) rounds (#ABC364765)
•	(49) -- .38 caliber rounds 
•	(1) -- .380 caliber round 
•	(40) – 9mm rounds 
•	(9) MDMA pills
•	2081 grams of Marijuana
•	$7415 USC
•	Scales and packaging materials

On Tuesday November 29th 2000 hours, Safe Streets officers conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 1500 block of West 4th Street for a registration violation.  During the stop, the officers made contact with the driver and sole occupant of the vehicle, Isaiah Stanley BM 11/05/93. While making contact with Stanley, the officers observed Stanley displaying nervous behavior.  The officers received consent from Stanley to search the vehicle.  During the consent search, the officers located a loaded Smith and Wesson 9mm concealed inside a fanny pack located on the rear passenger floorboard.  Also inside the fanny pack, the officers located a small amount of marijuana.

Officers conducted a probation inquiry of Isaiah Stanley’s residence at 260 Christiana Road, Apt J4, New Castle, DE.  The inquiry determined that his brother, Anthony Stanley (BMN, DOB 08/16/1997), also listed the address as his residence.  Anthony Stanley is prohibited from possessing firearms due to multiple violent felony convictions.

During a post arrest interview with Isaiah Stanley, he advised officers that he had additional firearms in his residence.  Officers received consent from Isaiah Stanley to enter the residence and retrieve the firearms for relinquishment.  The officers responded to the aforementioned address and removed an additional 4 firearms from the residence.
•	Davis Industries P-32 .32 Cal (S/N: P163716)- Negative
•	Deutchewerke 25 Cal (S/N: 75617)
•	Diamond black AR15 556 (S/N:DB2032818) - Negative
•	GS6-54 .22 Cal (S/N: A314091) –  (purchased by Isaiah Stanley on 06/05/21 @ Millers Gun Center)

Stanley was charged with CCDW, possession of marijuana, and miscellaneous Title 21 violations.

On April 16, 2025, while monitoring social media, officers observed Level 3 Probationer, Malcolm Lewis (08/16/2004)
posting and holding a firearm. Lewis, who is on probation, is prohibited from possessing firearms. Due to the observation on social media,
members of Safe Streets, as well as Probation, responded to 1607 W. 5th St, Apartment C1, for an administrative search. During the admin
search, officers located and collected a loaded Smith and Wesson M&P 9 Shield 9mm (#JPR6575) handgun in Lewis’ bedroom.

dealer_name: Armeria Bam Bam and Sports Shop
case_summary: not in gunstat meeting reports

defendant_name: Bakr Dillard, Tavion Washington, Zakeer Washington, Christopher Wilmoth, Eric Harding
case_summary:
On May, 9, 2022, Det. Wicks (CID) presented the investigation into the Attempted Murder of Jamil Bailey and Troy Faison to the New Castle County Grand Jury. This shooting incident occurred on April 14, 2022, in the 700 block of W. 7th Street, Wilmington case # 30-22-25577. The Grand Jury returned an indictment on Bakr Dillard BM 07/21/1981 who was not in custody for the charges: Attempted Murder 1st degree (3 counts), Conspiracy 1st Degree, PFBPP, PFDCF, CCDW, Resisting Arrest, PABPP and Tampering with Physical Evidence. In the month of January 2023, TFO Lynch (ATF) received investigative information from Officer Rittenhouse (USD) which enabled TFO Lynch with the assistance of TFO Schupp (FBI) to locate Dillard and obtain the probable cause needed to author a search warrant for the 934 Spruce Street, Wilmington, DE

On January 20, 2023, at 0653 hours, members of the Wilmington Police Department CMTT, DOCV, FBI, ATF, K9, UAV,CID and DSP executed the search warrant at 934 Spruce Street. During the course of the warrant execution Bakr Dillard, Tavion Washington BM 02/08/99, and Zakeer Washington BM 02/14/95 refused to comply with officers’ commands and made several attempts to flee from the residence. Tavion Washington and Zakeer Washington were quickly apprehended without incident.  Bakr Dillard discarded a firearm on the roof, and then fled through the rear alleyway towards K9 Officer Whitehead, who with the assistance of his partner was able to quickly apprehend Dillard. The residence was cleared by CMTT without incident. Bakr Dillard was transported to the Wilmington Hospital, evaluated, treated then released. 

During a search of the residence and rear yards the listed items were located and seized:
•	S&W M&P Shield, .45 caliber semi-automatic handgun, serial number HZU8470 (29N). The handgun was loaded, and the magazine contained 6 rounds of .45 caliber ammunition.
•	Glock model 26, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number ADPZ825 (29N). The handgun was loaded, and the magazine was empty.
•	Canik model TP9 SF Elite, 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial number 21BH188545 (29N). The handgun was loaded, and the magazine contained 18 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
•	177.1 grams of Cocaine
•	402.2 grams of Crack Cocaine 
•	6.398 grams of Heroin
•	3975.7 grams of Marijuana
•	17 Oxycodone Pills
•	Ammunition. 
•	Drug Paraphernalia  
•	$7,234.00 USC
•	DNA
•	Cellphones

Bakr Dillard is on the RTCC East Side intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

Tavion Washington was out on two pending firearms arrests; Wilmington Police arrest on April 12, 2021, WPD case # 30-21-28248, and Wilmington Police arrest on May 19, 2016, WPD case # 30-16-39640. Tavion Washington is on the RTCC OMB intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

Zakeer Washington was out on bail for a pending firearms arrest; Dover Police arrest on August 5, 2022, DPD case # 50-22-24108. Zakeer Washington is on the RTCC West Center City intelligence bulletin along with numerous other intelligence related fliers.

The defendants were transported to Central and attempts were made by investigators from the DOCV and CID to interview the defendants, but were unsuccessful.

On Wednesday July 27th 1627 hours, A Platoon Officers Geiser/Osler responded to 2601 Lamotte St for a person with a gun complaint. As officers arrived in the area they observed the described suspect vehicle (gold Pontiac DE 497944) parked in the 2500 block of Lamotte St. The vehicle pulled away from the curb and began to travel south as the patrol vehicle approached. Officers conducted a vehicle stop in the unit block of E. 24th St where they made contact with the driver (Chase) and observed a live .40 round on the driver’s seat near Chase’s leg. All occupants were removed from the vehicle and identified as Jabrei Chase BM 01/06/99 (driver), Elijah Collins BM 03/09/00 (front seat passenger), and Jerry Toston BM 06/28/99 (rear seat passenger). As the occupants were being removed from the vehicle, Chase advised officers that he had a handgun concealed near the driver’s side dashboard. During a search of the vehicle, officers located a Glock 23 .40 caliber handgun which was tucked in the front corner dashboard on the driver side, (90) grams of marijuana, and $553 USC. 

Chase was interviewed and advised that the marijuana that was found on his possession was his (12 grams), however, he advised he did not know anything about any additional weed found inside the vehicle. Chase admitted that the firearm in the vehicle was his and he purchased it at Star Quest Shooters on 06/07/22. Chase advised that he was carrying the firearm for his protection due to being a shooting victim in Wilmington back in 2019. Chase further advised that he had to buy another firearm because his last gun was confiscated by police during a previous encounter on 05/13/22 (SCU motor vehicle stop/Nazir Cassidy/Kymere Allen arrest)

Elijah Collins & Jerry Toston both charged with PWID & Conspiracy 2nd

On Friday September 9th 1754 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 500 block of W. 23rd St when the defendant (Bell, Jack BM 10/29/2000) was observed smoking a marijuana blunt. SCU Investigators made contact with the defendant and conducted a pat down. While patting down the defendant’s cross body satchel, SCU Investigators immediately felt the framing of a firearm. The defendant was taken into custody and a black in color “TAURUS” Model G3X 9mm firearm bearing serial number ACN755103 which contained (10) rounds in the magazine was removed from the cross body satchel.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On December 30, 2024, at approximately 2357 hours, Officers Downs and Rennewanz responded to 1300 East 16th St, Apartment 308, in reference to an assault with a weapon. Upon arrival, officers made contact with victim, Charneta Johnson (07/28/1984), who stated she was assaulted earlier in the day around 1430 hours. Johnson stated that her boyfriend, Anton Campbell (11/09/1968) had arrived at her apartment where they began to argue. She then noticed he had a firearm in his possession, which escalated the argument. Campbell assaulted Johnson and he left the residence.
Shortly after, Campbell called Johnson’s cell phone, stating she needed to respond to his residence at 1135 E. 13th St. Upon Johnson’s arrival to his residence, she was confronted by Campbell and his wife, Deborah Banner (02/10/1962). At this time, both defendants started to physically assault Johnson. She states she was able to leave and get back to her own apartment, when she began to receive numerous phone calls and threats from the defendants. It should be noted officers did observe lacerations to the victim’s head and face, however she refused medical attention.
Officers responded to 1135 East 13th St and made contact with Campbell who was outside the residence. Officers observed Campbell to be carry a motorized skateboard with a black fanny pack strapped across his body. Campbell yelled for Deborah Banner as officers began to question him regarding the incident. Banner responded outside at which time Campbell passed her the fanny pack. Both subjects were taken into custody without incident. A search of the fanny pack was conducted at which time a silver and pink Lorcin L25 (S/N #390151) .25, loaded with one (1) round in the chamber and five (5) rounds in the magazine. Both defendants were charged accordingly.

On Friday April 28th 1235 hours, D Platoon Officer C. Hutt responded to the Fresh Grocer (800 W. 4th St) for a report of a disorderly person who fled the store prior to police arrival. During the investigation, Officer Hutt made contact with Tracy
Whitlock BM 11/17/1962, the store’s security guard. During the investigation, Officer Hutt determined that Whitlock got into a physical altercation with the unknown disorderly person. During the confrontation, Whitlock’s concealed firearm fell to the ground, causing the unknown subject to flee the store. Contact was made with Whitlock’s supervisor, who confirmed that Whitlock is not allowed to possess firearms on the business premises. A Deljis inquiry was conducted on Whitlock which determined that he did not possess a CCDW permit. Whitlock was arrested for CCDW and his loaded Stoeger STR-9 9mm handgun (#T6429-21U5133) was
seized.

On Wednesday April 19th 2004 hours, while working Anti-Violence overtime, Officer Sean Cannon observed Ahjir
Black BM 10/04/06 loitering with a small group in the 900 block of N Church Street. Officer Cannon was aware that Black was
violating his active court ordered curfew of 1900hrs. With the help of assisting units, Cannon coordinated a pedestrian stop of Ahjir
Black and the other 5 members of the group within the 900 block of N Church Street. As officers were making contact with the group,
Clifton Jackson BM 09/08/2008 advised officers that he was in possession of a handgun. Jackson was placed into custody without
incident and found to be in possession of a loaded Taurus G3C 9mm handgun (#ADK828130). Jackson was also in possession of a
small amount of marijuana. Black was placed into custody without incident and transported to central. Clifton Jackson has been
charged with PFBPP (Juvenile), CCDW and Possession of Marijuana. Black was charged with Breach of Peace.

Case Summary: On Sunday February 25th at 0415 hours, Officer Potts and Crocker along with K9 Officer Meese were dispatched to 511 N Union Street in reference to a domestic related assault. Upon their arrival, they came in contact with both parties involved. M/Cpl Potts was aware a court order was issued for the male subject to cease contact with female involved. The male was identified as Jaimir Holloway BM 05/06/1998. As officers began to place Holloway into custody he stated he was in possession of a firearm concealed in his jacket. Holloway was placed into custody without incident and officers located a Ruger .38 caliber revolver. The firearm is not reported stolen. The female half advised she called 911 due to an argument ensuing between both parties which escalated into Holloway attempting to choke her. Holloway was charged with CCDW, violation of a no contact order and offensive touching.

time_to_recovery: Not clear – does not list purchase date (and was stolen from victim by voss in incident leading to arrest/recovery)
case_summary:
On Tuesday August 22nd at approximately 1614 hours, 33F (S/Cpl. J. Vasquez) self-dispatched himself to 1 W. 10th
St in reference to a theft of a firearm. Upon his arrival, he made contact with the victim who stated that he parked his vehicle in the
area of Makers Alley for approximately 20 minutes. He stated that when he returned to his vehicle, his book bag which contained his
Smith & Wesson .380 firearm (#KHL0322) was missing from the front passenger’s seat. Officer Vasquez issued a case number to the
victim and immediately responded to the command center to review surveillance footage. While reviewing the footage, he witnessed
the defendant (Antonio Vass WM 02/28/1998) walking away from the victim’s vehicle holding the book bag. Vasquez disseminated
the suspect description over Wilcom and several units began an area search. At approximately 1739 hours, Cpl. M. Smagala was in the
area of the Sunday Breakfast Mission when he witnessed the defendant walk into the building. The defendant was placed into custody
without incident. During a search of the defendant, the stolen firearm was located in his waistband. The defendant was Mirandize by
S/Cpl. Vasquez at which time the defendant admitted to stealing both the book bag and the firearm

On Saturday September 17th 1553 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 200 block of W. 20th St when they observed
a tan in color Jeep Cherokee operated by (Smith, Jacquan BM 10/23/1988) parked in the block. SCU Investigators made contact with
Smith to determine his business abroad as well as determining if Smith possessed a valid tint waiver. While speaking with Smith,
Investigators smelled the odor of marijuana coming from within the vehicle and observed marijuana residue on the passenger side
floor board. SCU conducted a brief search of the vehicle, however when the center console was opened, a firearm was observed. SCU
Investigators stopped the search and obtained a JP Court 11 search warrant for the vehicle which ultimately resulted in the recovery of
a loaded Glock 43X 9mm (located inside the center console). Also located inside the center console were (16) individually packaged
marijuana bags (approximately 151 grams) and (16.2 grams) of crack cocaine. Smith possessed approximately $1800 USC on his
person which was seized.

On May 21st, 2024 CGIC Detectives were in the area of West 26th St and North West St when they observed
Zyheen Evans, Sincere Johnson and Dhossan Whyte walking westbound on 26th St. Detectives attempted to make contact with
Zyheen at which point he immediately fled west on 26th St and into 118 W 26th St. Zyheen then exited the residence through a side
basement door and began fleeing westbound through an alley. After a brief pursuit, Zyheen was taken into custody without incident. A
search granted a search warrant for the residence. During a search of the residence detectives located and recovered one black in color
Taurus G2 Millennium with an obliterated serial number loaded with 11 rounds of 9mm ammunition, 1 spent 9mm casing, 1 round of
32 auto ammunition, and a black in color holster.
UPDATE
On May 23rd, 2024 CGIC detectives were advised the above mentioned spent casing had a NIBIN connection to 5 additional
incidents. Over the following weeks, detectives conducted an investigation into the NIBIN match at which point they were able to
apply for and were granted a search warrant in reference to 118 W 26th St.
On June 5th, 2024 CGIC detectives were conducting surveillance on 118 W 26th St in reference to this investigation at which point
Maurice Cooper, Brian Palmer, and Kaleek Brooks were observed entering the residence. During this time DOCV, Safe Streets and
Juvenile Probation began responding to the area to assist with the investigation. Moments later Maurice, Brian and Kaleek exited the
residence and began walking westbound.
CGIC detectives responded to the area of 27th and N West St where they observed Maurice, Brian, and Kaleek standing next to a
white in color Ford Fusion. A pedestrian stop was attempted at which point Maurice immediately began to flee however was taken
into custody after a foot pursuit with the assistance of DOCV and Safe Streets. Brian Palmer and Kaleek Brooks were both taken into
custody without incident. Kaleek was found to be in possession of a black in color Smith and Wesson SW99 45 caliber handgun (S/N
SAH0697) which was loaded with 3 rounds of 45 caliber ammunition.
While on scene at the pedestrian stop, surveillance observed William Brooks entering a white in color vehicle in front of 118 W 26th
St. The vehicle ultimately responded to the intersection of 27th St and West St at which point Detectives made contact with vehicle
and took William into custody regarding this investigation. A search of the vehicle was conducted which yielded negative results.
Members of CGIC, DOCV, Probation and Safe Streets responded to 118 W 26th St and executed the search warrant. During a search
of the residence, detectives located and recovered the following:
- Silver and Black in color Smith & Wesson SD9VE 9mm handgun (S/N FCY5646) which was loaded with 11 rounds of 9mm
ammunition.
- Silver and Black in color Glock 17 CO2 BBgun
- 2 unspent 9mm rounds of ammunition
William, Kaleek, Brian and Maurice were transported to Central along with the evidence. Test fire forms were submitted.
William was charged with Possession of a Firearm by Person Prohibited X 2 and Carrying Concealed Deadly Weapon. Kaleek was
charged with Possession of a Firearm/Ammo by Person Prohibited X 2 and Carrying Concealed Deadly Weapon.
Maurice was charged with Resisting Arrest and processed on his outstanding Capias’s, additional charges pending the results of DNA.
Brain was released at this time pending the results of DNA.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On May 7, 2025, at approximately 2331 hours, Officers Smagala and R. Mitchell observed a vehicle in the area of 6th and Monroe, which was in violation of multiple traffic offenses. Officers were able to identify the driver as Jaiden Harris (05/19/2006).  The vehicle then fled the area and due to community safety, a pursuit was not initiated at this time.
On May 8, 2025, Harris was observed leaving his residence of 711 N. Dupont St, where he was taken into custody, along with the vehicle from the day prior. A search of the Lexus RC (DE XQ633034)) resulted in the recovery of approximately three ounces of marijuana and a digital scale. After Harris was Mirandized, he admitted to engaging in multiple high-speed pursuits with law enforcement agencies across Delaware and Pennsylvania over the previous three weeks. He also informed officers of substances within his bedroom at 711 N. Dupont St.
On May 9, 2025, at approximately 0610 hours, members of the C and A Platoons executed the search warrant at 711 North Dupont Street. During the search, officers recovered approximately a Glock 20 10mm (S/N: BWBL288) handgun equipped with an extended magazine containing 18 rounds, 3.35 pounds of marijuana, and $2,191 in United States currency. Harris was charged accordingly.

defendant_name: Jaquan Blagman, Jordan Smith, Rasheed Smith, Sari Blagman
case_summary:
During the month of October, Det. Silvers and Gibson initiated an investigation into Marijuana sales from 2000
Pennsylvania Avenue, Apartment 206, Wilmington, by Jaquan Blagman BM 09/23/1996 and several other unidentified individuals.
On Wednesday November 1, 2023, Jaquan Blagman, Rasheed Smith BM 12/22/90, and Jordan Smith BM 07/20/97 were
observed exiting the apartment carrying a shoe box, entering a vehicle, and traveling northbound on I-95. During mobile surveillance,
the operator, Jaquan Blagman was observed committing numerous traffic infractions and was stopped. During the traffic stop the
occupants of the vehicle failed to comply with officers' directions, were behaving nervously, and attempting to hide money on their
person. Officers were able to smell a strong odor of Marijuana coming from the vehicle and removed the occupants and detained
same. K9 Sgt. Conine and his partner responded and gave a positive indication on the vehicle. The occupants and vehicle were
transported to Central. Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for the vehicle operated
by Jaquan Blagman. During a search of the vehicle, investigators located approximately 1 pound of Marijuana.
Surveillance was maintained on the apartment while Det. Silvers authored a search warrant for same. While waiting for the courts to
review the warrant, Sari Blagman BF 11/18/77 was observed entering the apartment. Investigators attempted to make contact with
her but she refused to talk to investigators. Investigators could hear Sari frantically moving furniture in the apartment. Det. Silvers
obtained the search warrant and executed same, placing Sari into custody. During a search of the apartment investigators located a
loaded Glock 30 .45 semi-automatic handgun (# BDAD275), (42.3) pounds of marijuana, various pieces of jewelry, a money counter
and a heat sealer. Investigators observed footprints on the exterior roof and were able to observe numerous bags had been thrown from
the roof into the trees. These bags were recovered and contained a majority of the seized Marijuana along with $105,775 USC. A third
search warrant was authored for another vehicle utilized by Jaquan Blagman and inside that vehicle an additional pound of Marijuana
was seized

On July 18, 2025, members of Safe Streets attempted to stop Jacquez Robinson (05/23/1995) near the intersection of Read and S. Franklin St. Robinson immediately fled on a motorized scooter. Officers pursued Robinson where they observed him discard two bags, containing a Taurus G2C .40 (SN: SFS28297) handgun, 2.72 grams of Heroin, and 4 MDMA pills. Robinson then discarded the scooter, continuing to flee on foot, until he was apprehended, after attempting to hide in a rear yard in the 200 block of S. Franklin St. Robinson was taken into custody without further incident and found to be in possession of 2.9 grams of Crack Cocaine. He was transported to Central.

On Wednesday August 9, 2023, at approximately 2307 hours, ShotSpotter alerted for twenty-two (22) rounds in the
1600 block of West 4th Street. Arriving officers conducted an area canvass and located eight (8) spent 9mm casings in the 1700 block
of West 3rd Street, on the sidewalk and roadway directly in front of 1709 (Haven Methodist Church). As a result of this incident, three
(3) separate unoccupied vehicles parked in the block were struck by projectiles.
Officers also located two (2) spent 9mm casings on the sidewalk, directly in front of 217 North Dupont Street. During that time,
James Jordan BM 11/13/1973 approached officers on scene advising that he heard gunshots in the block. Jordan stated that he exited
his residence at 217 N. Dupont with his firearm in hand and shot the gun in the air to scare the suspects away. Jordan permitted
officers to retrieve the firearm from the front porch area of the residence. Officers seized the firearm, a Springfield Armory 9mm
(Serial #BY484060), loaded with one (1) round in the chamber and two (2) rounds in the magazine. Jordan was transported to
Central, where he was booked for discharging a firearm in a roadway. The firearm was submitted into evidence along with a
completed Test Fire Request Form.

On Sunday October 1st 1910 hours, Wilcom dispatched officers to 1312 N. French Street in reference to a person
with a gun. As officers were arriving on scene updated information was relayed that the male suspect was actively in crisis (mental
health). As M/Cpl. Santana and an assisting unit were exiting their vehicles, one gunshot was heard in the vicinity of the back of the
house (Shotspotter notification for one round – 136-227067). Officers made contact with the defendant’s wife (Renee May BF
11/23/1975) and son (Jayvonne May BM 05/07/2000) and were able to safely remove all occupants from the residence. At the same
time officers quickly established a perimeter and moments later the defendant (James May BM 04/01/1974) was observed attempting
to exit an alleyway near the residence. May was ultimately taken into custody without incident and found to be in possession of a
Glock 9mm handgun (#846483) with two 10 round magazines. It was discovered that while May was arguing with his wife, has held
the firearm to his head multiple times and made suicidal statements. May was transported to CAPES unit where he was admitted. May
was processed on the below listed charges on Saturday October 7th. A weapon relinquishment order was completed and the following
firearms were removed from the residence: CZ Scorpion EVO 9mm rifle (#F182669), Glock 42 .380 handgun (#ADAG324), and a
Glock 19 9mm handgun (#BHCR399).

ttr_category: Over for firearms purchased from Starquest
