DOCV executed a search warrant at 209 W 29th St in reference to a drug investigation.
Items seized:
1st floor hallway- 32.3 grams Crack Cocaine, (8) 9mm Luger rounds, black magazine with (9) .357 rounds
Kitchen drawer – brown glass sauce pan, silver knife, (2) digital scales (commonly used to cook/mix powder
cocaine into crack cocaine)
2nd floor bedroom – Glock 31 .357 w/ extended magazine (#MPV151)
Gambrell gave written consent for his cell phone and DNA Buccal Swa

On Tuesday, September 23, 2025, at approximately 1406 hours, WPD P&P responded to 805 N. Franklin St, which is
the listed probation address of Clarence Jarman (12/11/2000). Upon arrival, P&P officers made contact with Jarman and Rafelito Hiche
(09/07/2002). An admin search was approved and once entering the residence, officers located a firearm in plain view in the living room.
CGIC detectives were called to recover a Glock 43 9mm (SN#BZTV118) firearm and detain Jarman. He was taken back to Central and
charged accordingly. This investigation is going. It should be noted that Jarman was a shooting victim from five days prior.

On Tuesday May 10th 1740 hours, WILCOM received a 911 call in reference to a shots fired incident. Upon officer’s
arrival, they were advised by several bystanders that the resident (Kenna Mask) had exited her apartment with a firearm in her hand
and began yelling at several juveniles who had been playing near her vehicle. Just prior to responding back inside the residence, the
defendant held the firearm up in the air and discharged one round. Officers located one spent .380 caliber casing directly in front of
the steps leading to the residence. Contact was made with the defendant by way of an open first floor window; however she refused to
exit the residence. A search warrant was authored and tactical measures were taken to have the defendant safely removed from the
residence which was successful.
A search of the apartment was conducted which yielded the following:
• Glock 42 .380 handgun (#ACVT373) containing 3 rounds of .380 ammunition – located in bedroom closet (stolen out of NC)
• (75) rounds of .380 ammunition – located in bed side table in master bedroom
• $11,719 USC

On Thursday September 28th at 2222 hours, 11C (Downing) was flagged down at 9th and Bennett Street regarding a
male armed with a firearm. The witness stated that she observed a black male wearing a green hooded sweatshirt walking northbound
on Bennett Street carrying a weapon. Downing relayed the information on channel A and conducted an area search for the subject.
Shortly thereafter, Downing observed a black male matching that description in the 1200 block Thatcher St and a pedestrian stop was
conducted with the assistance of 16E (H. Brown). The defendant, Dayshawn Kent-Harden BM 06/16/2005 was found to be in
possession of a Springfield 9mm firearm (Serial # BA722717) reported stolen out of NCCPD (32-23-63563). Kent-Harden was
charged accordingly.

On December 16, 2024, at approximately 0140 hours, WPD responded to the area of 901 N. Union St, in reference to a ShotSpotter alert for one (1) round. Upon arrival, officers immediately located the suspect, Sandy Frais-Montero (08/22/1987), and appeared to be suffering from facial injuries. The initial investigation revealed that the suspect had been forcibly removed from the Merengue House (837 N Union Street) by security staff. During a physical altercation between the Frias-Montero and the security personnel. Frias-Montero was able to gain control of a firearm which belonged to security officer, Jamil Phillips (09/01/1995). The Sig Sauer P320 .40 (S/N #58C339782) firearm was discharged into the air and then thrown back to Phillips. At this time Phillips then "pistol whipped” Frias-Montero and then fled back inside the bar area. Officers later found a live .40 caliber round in the suspect's pocket. The magazine was found in the victim's pocket, who then surrendered his firearm to officers. Additionally, officers located a spent .40 caliber casing on top of a parked car in the Union Park Lot.

On Wednesday April 6th 1314 hours, SCU officers were in the area of 500 W 4th St when they observed a possible
wanted subject. Upon driving by the subject, SCU officers were able to confirm it was not the wanted individual and circled the block.
Additional SCU officers maintained surveillance and observed the subject begin to sprint away from the area while displaying
characteristics of an armed gunman. Officers took Aaron Graham into custody in the 200 block of Garden Ct. He was found to be in
possession of a Taurus G2C 9mm located inside a fanny pack. While in turnkey, the defendant stated that the firearm was his brothers
(Jamir Graham) and that his mother did not want the weapon in her residence.

On Thursday July 6th 1730 hours, Gun Intelligence Investigators Lerro and Linkhorst were on proactive patrol in the
the 500 block of W. 24th Street when they observed a subject displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Investigators exited their
unmarked police vehicle and attempted to make contact with the subject who was identified as (Ahsaad Blackwell BM 05/28/2005).
Blackwell quickly began fleeing on foot east in the 500 block of W. 24th Street and discarded a loaded tan in color Sig Sauer 9mm
(#M18A002993) in between parked vehicles. Investigators were able to take Blackwell into custody after a CEW deployment. A DNA
search warrant was drafted and the defendant’s DNA was obtained. A test fire request was completed. Blackwell was charged with
CCDW, Hindering Prosecution and Resisting Arrest.

On February 24, 2025, Investigators were contacted by Juvenile Probation Supervisor D. Carnevale who requested
assistance in locating and apprehending a known juvenile offenders identified as Keisan Gibson-Jones (10/30/2008). While in the area of
Town Estates Dr, CGIC Detectives and Probation Officers observed Gibson-Jones outside the apartments. Members of D Platoon (Z.
Davis) assisted in securing the rear of the apartment at which time Gibson-Jones was apprehended without incident. Upon further
investigation, Detectives located a black in color Glock 17 9mm (S/N: CDTW366) handgun equipped with an extended magazine within
a grill where Gibson-Jones was first observed

On Sunday September 18th 1109 hours, Officers responded to the 800 block of W 4th St in reference to a large fight. Upon arrival, officers took note that the fight appeared to be a continuation of an investigation that occurred earlier this morning and documented under 30-22-65862. During this second response, officers were directed to the defendant (Jaquia BANKS), who allegedly was in possession of a concealed firearm in her purse and was using it as a means of threatening parties involved within the altercation. Banks was found to be in possession of a loaded SCCY CPX-1 9mm handgun, concealed within her purse, for which she does not have a permit to carry in such a manner. She was taken into custody for the weapons offenses, and in furtherance of the investigation into her role within the fight. Officers were unable to make contact with any cooperative victims of aggravated menacing or related offenses.

On Wednesday September 14th 2032 hours, Officer Brady on directed patrol in the 900 block of N. Spruce Street,
advised that shots were being fired in the area of E. 10th and N. Pine Streets. Officer Brady responded to the area, and advised he
observed a subject running west on E. 10th Street, but lost sight when the subject fled north on Clifford Brown Walk. Shot Spotter
then alerted for three (3) rounds at 609 E. 10th Street, and for one (1) round at 925 Kirkwood Street. Officers responded to the area,
and observed the defendant, Jarred Walker, in the 1000 block of Clifford Brown Walk. Walker advised officers that he had left Bible
Study, and when asked further questions, same advised he was in possession of a firearm in his right pocket. Officers Schulz and A.
Williams located a black in color Taurus GC2 9mm handgun, with fifteen (15) rounds in the magazine and one (1) round in the
chamber, in the right pants pocket of Walker. Walker was taken into custody without incident and transported to Central. Officers
conducted an extensive area canvass for a scene, which was met with negative results. Several sources of surveillance were located,
but were unable to be obtained at this time. No victims or witnesses were located. Search warrants were obtained, and DNA and
Gunshot Residue samples were collected from Walker.

On Sunday October 1st, at approximately 0107 hours this unit 11-David (Ludlam) responded to 1014 N. Lombard
Street in reference to a shots fired complaint. Upon arrival, assisting units investigated and found that a fight had broken out that
involved the residents of 1014 Lombard Street and a group of females. During the altercation Nicole Hinson BF 04/06/1976 exited
the residence of 1014 N. Lombard Street and fired two (2) rounds into the air causing the group to flee. A witness advised that he
observed Nicole exit her residence and fire two rounds into the air and return inside of the residence. For police safety, all occupants
inside the residence were identified. During this time, Officer Martin made contact with Alexander Letitia BF 01/09/2002 who advised
that she was coming out of the second floor bedroom with an unloaded firearm. Alexander handed over a Stoeger STR-9SC 9mm
handgun which was fully loaded. Thru investigation it was discovered that a different firearm was used during the shots fired
incident. Officer Ludlam attempted to get a search warrant consent form from Nicole, but she refused. Nicole was taken into custody
without incident and transported to central for processing. A night time search warrant for the residence was approved by Judge
Michelle Michini. Officer Meese and Officer Hutt conducted the search of the residence and recovered the correct firearm a Smith
and Wesson MP 9MM (Serial Number HLA0475) with one (1) round 9mm in the chamber and seven (7) rounds in the magazine
which was located in the master bedroom.

On Sunday March 20th 0320 hours, D Platoon officers were dispatched to Planet Fitness on the Riverfront for a
disorderly subject armed with a firearm. Upon arrival, officers were flagged down by an employee of Pure Flavor Lounge who
advised that the defendant brandished a firearm and may have gone to the Hyatt Hotel on Justison St. Officers responded and located
Ernest Fennell in the lobby of the hotel. Upon contact, officers observed a bulge in the front waistband area. Fennell was taken into
custody and a pat down revealed a loaded Taurus 9mm in a holster which was concealed by his sweatshirt. Fennell advised that he was
at the Pure Flavor Lounge with friends who attempted to assault and rob him of his wallet. He advised that he was at the hotel looking
for a group of friends who had left him stranded. Fennell was transported to Wilmington Hospital for an abrasion on the back of his
head (possibly related to the incident described during the investigation).
Later that day (2036 hours) the arresting officer (Ptlm. R. Jacobs) made contact with Upper Darby Township PD who advised that
Ernest Fennell did steal the firearm that was recovered. Per Sgt. Kreysa, Upper Darby working on additional charges in PA.

dealer_name: John Dutton's (license name John Leon Dutton Jr.)
case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On Tuesday, August 19, 2025, at approximately 2010 hours, Officers Franzone and Holden responded to 12th and Washington St, in reference to a person with a gun. Upon arrival, officers observed Ra’shawn Owens (03/14/2005), who matched the description by the reporting party. When approached, Owens fled on foot but was apprehended without incident in the 1200 block of Washington St. Owens was found in possession of a concealed and loaded Taurus TX .22 caliber (SN: #1PT650186) handgun, additional .22 caliber rounds, and 1.71 grams of marijuana. He admitted to fleeing because he had a firearm. The firearm and drugs were secured as evidence.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: Case Summary: On Saturday, May 24, 2025, at approximately 0250 hours, Officers Diaz and Lopez were responding to a vehicle collision where it was advised that three males in dark clothing fled a vehicle that collided with another vehicle. Upon reaching the area of W. 2nd and N. Adams St. officers observed the three black males. When attempting to approach, one of the subjects, Elyasa Elbashier (08/04/2006), fled and while doing so, he was seen grabbing his waistband and blading his body away from officers. The two other individuals, who were identified as Jaden Watson (05/17/2008) and Robert Lebrew Jr (08/23/2005), did not flee and remained with officers. Elbashier continued to flee for several blocks. Officers lost sight of Elbashier briefly before he was apprehended at 300 N. Monroe St. He was found to be in possession of Marijuana. Officers conducted a back track of Elbashier’s flight of path, where they recovered a black in color Glock 19 9mm (SN: BSKR842) handgun. Elbashier was transported back to Central, and charged accordingly. DNA was taken pending the investigation.

On Tuesday, May 7, 2024, CGIC Detectives observed James Larue BM 06/03/1993 openly carrying a black firearm while standing at the intersection of 3rd and Lombard Streets. Det. Moses knew Larue from previous encounters and believed that he was currently prohibited from possessing a firearm. CGIC detectives conducted a criminal inquiry on James Larue BM 06/03/1993 and found that he was currently prohibited from possessing a firearm due to a guilty conviction for possessing a controlled substance on 04/19/2023 out of New Castle County Court of Common Pleas. It should be noted that this conviction prohibited James Larue from possessing a firearm and/or live ammunition for five years from the date of conviction, which was 04/19/23. Detectives made contact with Larue and took him into custody without incident. Detectives found that he was in possession of a black Glock 17 9mm (#UVH383). The Glock contained a magazine that held (16) live rounds of 9mm ammunition. 
 James Larue advised these detectives that he purchased the firearm from First State Firearm store. Detectives confirmed that he purchased the firearm on 03/21/2023 which was approximately one month before he was found guilty of the drug-related charges that prohibit him from possessing a firearm. The Glock was tagged and stored in the evidence locker under the supervision of Sgt. Mitchell. Det. Moses found probable cause to sign warrants on James Larue (BM 06/03/1993) for PFBPP and PABPP.

On Sunday December 11th 0354 hours, units were dispatched and responded to the 900 block of Orange Street in
reference to an armed carjacking that just occurred. Upon arrival, contact was made with the victim, McGovern, who works at Apexx
Lounge. McGovern advised that his vehicle (gray in color, 2005 Infiniti G35, PA LJL5674) was warming up while parked in front of
Sterling Grille (919 N. Orange Street). McGovern advised that he observed two male subjects in black ski masks get into his vehicle,
at which time he ran and attempted to jump into same. McGovern advised that he observed that one of the suspects was armed with a
handgun, when that suspect began striking him on the head with same. McGovern advised that after being struck several times, he
was able to exit the vehicle, at which time the suspects fled in his vehicle, eastbound on W. 10th Street, out of sight. At approximately
0515, 163-Adam (PFC. Crumlish) observed what he believed to be the stolen vehicle, sitting at the intersection of Lobdell and
Townsend Streets. PFC. Crumlish verified the registration, at which time the vehicle fled southbound on S. Heald Street at a high rate
of speed. After a short vehicle pursuit, the vehicle crashed while travelling over the Margaret Rose Henry Bridge into the Riverfront.
The sole occupant, Dunn, exited the driver’s side of the vehicle and fled on foot, while holding what officers believed to be a firearm
in his hand. After a short foot pursuit, Dunn was taken into custody and was found to be holding his GPS ankle monitor. Recovered
in plain view on the driver’s side floorboard of the vehicle was a loaded Taurus G3C 9mm handgun which was found to be stolen out
of New Castle County PD. The GPS monitoring line was contacted, at which time it was found that Dunn was present in the 900 block
of N. Orange Street at the time of the carjacking.

defendant_name: Ana Vazquez and Jaylynn Hernandez, Case # 30-22-42213
case_summary: On Saturday June 18th 1316 hours, C Platoon officer McKeever conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 400 block of S. Broom St on a vehicle that was flagged in DELJIS for Disregarding a PO Signal on June 16, 2022. Contact with was made with the driver, Ana Vazquez WFH 05/16/04, front seat passenger, Jaylynn Hernandez WFH 10/24/00, and three juveniles (ages 4-12) who were located in the backseat. During the traffic stop, Vazquez exhibited nervous behavior and provided a false name to the officer. A lawful search of the vehicle was conducted and located on the floor board of the front driver’s seat was a neon green bag containing a loaded Springfield XD Elite 9mm handgun with a partially obliterated serial number. Jaylynn Hernandez was mirandized and interviewed and advised that the firearm belonged to her and that she had purchased it from Cabela’s for her protection.

On Friday August 4, 2023 Qasim Pointer BM 07/31/2001 was taken into custody at the Red Roof Inn (1119 S.
College Ave.) by the US Marshalls Task Force and DSP SORT. While fleeing, Pointer dropped a book bag he had in his possession.
Det. Rook authored a search warrant for the contents of the bag and upon searching same located a Springfield .45 Auto handgun
(Serial Number: XS614465), one silver in color magazine loaded with (5) .45 caliber rounds and marijuana. A search warrant was
conducted on Pointer’s hotel room and vehicle however, nothing of evidentiary value was located.
Det. Rook interviewed Pointer about the original shooting incident (June 27, 2023 – 4th & Franklin St) and Pointer admitted to his
involvement in same. Pointer was booked and processed for his outstanding warrant stemming from the shooting incident and Det.
Rook additionally charged him with PFBPP (X2), Possession of Marijuana, and resisting arrest stemming from the gun and drugs
found during his arrest. Philadelphia Police was also made aware of Pointer’s arrest as he is wanted for murder out of their
jurisdiction. For both cases Pointer was given a total bail of $532,100 cash and is being held at HRYCI.

On the 20th of June, 2023, Officers responded to the 1300 Block of Maryland Avenue in reference to a call for a shooting victim. Upon arrival Officers located Javon Jones suffering from a gunshot wound to the lower back and Hailee Krhan suffering from a gunshot wound to the foot. Jones was transported to AI Hospital and Krahn was transported to CER. Officers located scene in the block consisting of three spent shell casings. Detective Rodrigues responded to CER to interview Krhan, who stated that her ex-boyfriend Angelo Brown shot her. She stated that she was in the block with Jones and her current boyfriend, William Sawyer, who is believed to be the intended target when a silver vehicle NFD entered the block and Brown began shooting out of the passenger window. She stated that Brown has a no contact order with her from a previous domestic violence incident reported in State jurisdiction. Detective Mosley responded to the AI Hospital to interview Jones, who stated that he was with Krahn and Sawyer in the block when a silver vehicle approached. Jones stated that the shooter was in the front passenger seat of the vehicle and was wearing a yellow sweat shirt. Jones was shown a photo lineup and positively identified Brown as the lone shooter. Detective Hayman conducted an interview of Sawyer, whose statement was consistent with Jones and Krahn, but was unable/unwilling to identify the shooter. 

On the 30th of June, 2023, a search warrant was executed at 716 Woodtop Ave Wilmington, Delaware by CID with the assistance of CMTT. The address is the residence of the suspect, Angelo Brown. Brown was located inside the residence and taken into custody without incident. Located during the search was a Smith and Wesson 9mm semi-automatic handgun and a box of 9mm ammunition containing 33 of 50 rounds. Also located during the search was clothing the suspected was wearing at the time of the shooting. Detective Hayman processed Brown on the listed criminal offenses.

On Wednesday September 7th 2249 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 700 block of E. 22nd St when they observed
the defendant (Redden, Meccour BM 04/25/2005) acting suspiciously. The defendant was observed exiting Eddies Market, however
upon seeing SCU vehicles, Redden walked back into the store. SCU Investigators made contact with the defendant to establish his
business abroad. The defendant was asked if he had any firearms in his possession which he advised, “Yes”. SCU Officers took the
defendant into custody and removed a black in color “CANIK” Model TP9 9mm firearm which contained (1) round in the chamber
and (14) rounds in in the magazine. The firearm was reported stolen from FAYETTEVILLE North Carolina PD under case number
22-008471 on 4/10/2022. Redden also had a bag of heroin stamped Bin Laden on his person.

defendant_name: Jeremiah Winder, Laron Coleman, Elijah Winder
case_summary:
On October 6, 2025, at approximately 2144 hours, Officer Diaz observed a black in color Jeep Cherokee (DE
PC542253) fail to stop at a number of stop signs. Officer Diaz stopped the Jeep in the 1900 block of North Market Street. During the
stop, the driver, Jeremiah Winder (10/09/2003) and front passenger, Laron Coleman (12/06/2007), appeared visibly nervous. Elijah
Winder (08/14/2002) was in the rear passenger seat. Due to officer safety concerns and the suspicious behavior, all occupants were
detained. At this time, Elijah Winder admitted to having a firearm in his pants – a Glock 19X 9mm (SN#CELC529) handgun. The
weapon was secured and when asked if there were other firearms in the vehicle, Jeremiah Winder advised an additional firearm was
under the driver’s seat – a Glock 19 9mm (SN#CDKL958) handgun, which was recovered. Officer Diaz later located twenty-two 5.56
rifle rounds in a black plastic bag that was on the rear seat, as well as an additional American Manufacturing AM15-C 5.56
(SN#NS293875) Rifle.
All three occupants were transported to Central, along with the recovered firearms.

On Thursday February 23rd 1317 hours, A Platoon (Wilkers/Bond) conducted a motor vehicle stop in the area of 7th
& Orange St for illegal window tint and an expired registration. Officers made contact with the registered owner/operator, Justin Dye BM 09/02/1987 and immediately smelled the odor of marijuana coming from the vehicle. A search of the vehicle revealed the
following:
• Sig Sauer 9mm handgun with laser sight (#58H233107 – 29N) loaded with 10 rounds in the magazine.
• 19 rounds of 9mm ammunition
• 132 grams of Marijuana
• 26 MDMA tablets
Dye was placed into custody without incident and was found to be wanted for three traffic capias of out JP Court 11. Dye was
transported to central and charged accordingly. A test fire form was completed and submitted

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On August 28, 2025, at approximately 2004 hours, officers responded to 199 W. 23rd St, after being alerted to a person with a gun, who was also intoxicated. Officers responded and made contact with the complainant who stated that her son, Jhaquez Toston (07/27/1995) was drunk, armed with a firearm, and threatened to shoot his two siblings, victims Angeleno and Angel Warner. Officers located Toston in the 200 block of Concord Avenue and took him into custody without incident. He was highly intoxicated and carrying a loaded Glock 19X 9mm (S/N #YMS739) handgun loaded with 42 additional rounds of ammunition. He was transported to Central where he was charged accordingly, and an active warrant out of this agency.

On Wednesday January 3, 2024, at approximately 1513 hours, members of Safe Streets responded to 19 Central Ave., New Castle, DE to assist Probation Officers with an administrative search/arrest.  Upon arrival Probation Officers had Stephen Grabowski WM 08/13/1984 in custody.  Grabowski is a level 3 probationer who also had a NCCPD hard warrant for domestic related terroristic threatening and harassment. During a search of the property officers located the following:

•	Mossburg 20 gauge shotgun (#K837080) which was located concealed inside a blanket in the back seat of a red GMC Sierra pickup parked directly next to the residence. Also located in the vehicle was a prescription bottle labeled “Suboxin” with the name “Stephen Grabowski” printed on the label
•	S&W .38 Special Revolver (#BBT2587) located in the first floor bedroom closet
•	Remington 870 Express 12 gauge shotgun (#B630281M) located in the first floor bedroom closet

Grabowski was transported to Central where he was interviewed regarding this incident as well as recent acts of violence in the city.  DNA was collected from Grabowski and test fire forms were submitted.  Grabowski was charged accordingly and received a $15,000 cash bail for his new charges in addition to his administrative warrant.

On Tuesday July 19th 1705 hours, Safe Streets Officers were contacted by P&P PO Crist who advised that he
watched an Instagram Live video showing a known Level 3 probationer (Zakarriayah Romeo BM 01/11/01), holding a silver in color
semi-automatic firearm while inside 929 Lombard St.
At 1845 hours, Safe Streets officers responded to the residence in order to conduct a probation “walk-through” for investigative
purposes. As officers were knocking on the front door, they observed an unknown male subject (later identified as Keyon Jackson BM
06/20/01) open a second story window and throw a silver in color handgun to the roof located below the window. Shortly after,
Zakarriayah Romeo opened the front door where he was detained by officers. Located inside the residence were Marquise Grayson
BM 08/14/04 and Keyon Jackson BM 06/20/01). An admin search was granted as well as verbal consent from the primary resident of
the home. During the search, SPO Phelps recovered the firearm from the roof (a loaded Ruger .22 handgun). While checking Grayson
for T16 and/or weapons, officers located a Jennings 9mm handgun under his leg. The firearm was completely concealed from view
under Grayson until he was moved from his wheelchair. Grayson was also found to be in possession of (4.0 grams) of marijuana.
Post Miranda interview, Jackson admitted to throwing the silver Ruger out of the window where it was recovered. Romeo was
interviewed and denied ever touching either firearms or having knowledge of firearms being inside the residence (despite being on
camera holding the firearm found under Grayson’s leg). Grayson was interviewed and advised that he had just finished a workout on
the second floor of the residence and returned to the living room where he observed the Jennings 9mm lying on the seat of his
wheelchair. He stated that he did not know how the firearm got there, but was “too tired” to move it, so he decided to just sit on top of
it. All three subjects signed consent forms for their DNA.
SPO Phelps completed an admin warrant for Zakarriayah Romeo. Grayson and Jackson were charged with firearm offenses.

On Friday November 25th 0219 hours, C Platoon Officers (Franzone/Murzyn) were dispatched to meet with a subject
who advised he had discharged his firearm at a dog in the area of 7th and Spruce Streets. The subject had no further information at this
time and no scene was located. A short time later the victim called Wilmington Police and advised that the suspect (Joe Haynes BM
09/03/1960) had fired his firearm inside his residence at 706 E 7th St., Apt. A. Officers responded and located projectile damage inside
the residence. The victim advised that Haynes was in his residence and interacting with his dog at which point Haynes fired one round
from his firearm at the floor near the dog. The victim advised that he was seated in the dining room, in close proximity. Warrants were
signed for Haynes and a warrant attempt was made at his residence. Upon responding to officers at the door, Haynes was immediately
taken into custody. A S&W MP Shield .380(NHL4872) handgun was located in his front right pocket. This firearm was loaded with
8 rounds in the magazine and no round chambered. Haynes was charged with Reckless Endangering 1st and weapons offenses

On October 23, 2024, at approximately 1200 hours, members of Safe Streets were contacted by a Confidential
Informant (CI) who stated that Jose Burgos (05/12/97), was in possession a firearm that was concealed inside his vehicle.
Additionally, the CI stated that Burgos was a “drug dealer” that sells marijuana, cocaine, fentanyl and prescription pills.
Members of Safe Streets responded to the area of 1200 Read St, at approximately 1215 hours and observed Burgos sitting in a Honda
minivan. As officers approached Burgos to engage in a casual conversation they observed a Scion parked directly in front of the
minivan. The driver’s door of the Scion was opened, where a fanny pack could be seen laying on the driver’s side floorboard in plain
view. Protruding from the fanny pack, there appeared to be what looked like part of a firearm.
During the conversation with Burgos, officers learned that the Scion belonged to him. Consent was obtained to search the Scion at
which time officers located a Smith and Wesson SD-9 9mm (S/N #EFE4012) concealed within the fanny pack. Burgos was taken
into custody without incident. Officers obtained consent to search 1208 Read Street where contraband commonly used to package heroin was located within the residence. A search of the Honda minivan yielded no additional contraband.

defendant_name: Jermaine Francois, Dasean Carney, Jazzlyn Johnson
case_summary:
On December 7th, 2023 CGIC detectives were conducting surveillance in the area of W. 25th St and N. Madison St in reference
to an ongoing NIBIN/Shots Fired investigation. Through the course of the investigation CGIC detectives identified Dasean Carney, Jermaine
Francois and Jazzlyn Johnson as persons of interest.
While conducting surveillance in the area, Carney and Francois were observed exiting 2519 N Madison St along with additional unknown
suspects. CGIC detectives, along with the assistance of K9 Williams and CEU Schultz, made contact with Carney and Francois in the 2400 block
of N. Madison St where they were both taken into custody without incident for their outstanding capiases.
Once in custody, detectives made contact with 2519 N. Madison St in reference to this investigation who consented to a search of the
residence. During the search officers located and recovered one (1) Black in color Glock 19 9MM handgun (S/N BGGG284) loaded with 14
total rounds of ammunition, one (1) H&R 22 Caliber Revolver (S/N AC58003) loaded with 6 rounds of ammunition, and one (1) Black in color
PMF 9MM handgun (No Serial Number) loaded with 20 total round of ammunition.
During a search of Francois, he was found to have 3 sets of car keys in his pocket. An area search was conducted for the vehicles at
which point a 2024 white in color Ford Explorer bearing Pennsylvania registration LXT6947 was located in the 400 block of McCabe. NCIC
inquiry was conducted which revealed same to have been reported stolen out of Upper Chichester Pennsylvania, same was notified of the recovery.
Francois, Carney and the vehicle were transported to the Wilmington Police Department.
NCIC inquiries were conducted on the firearms which were met with negative results. Test fire forms were submitted.
NCCPD was notified in reference to Francois outstanding warrant.
Francois was charged for Possession of Firearm/Ammo by Person Prohibited x 2, Receiving Stolen Property and was processed on his
outstanding capias/warrant. Carney was processed for his outstanding VOP, firearm charges are pending. Warrants for Jazzlyn in reference to
Possession of a Firearm by Person Prohibited are pending

On Saturday March 4th 1545 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 300 block of Townsend Street when they
observed the defendant (Dashawn Romeo BM 03/26/2002) leaning against a vehicle within the block. Upon the defendant seeing the
SCU vehicle approaching, the defendant was observed bending over as if he put something down on the ground. Investigators made
contact with the defendant and inquired what he put down. Investigators conducted a canvass where the defendant was observed and
located a (black & silver PT-22 cal. 22LR SN# 63893Z firearm containing 8 rounds in the magazine) which was located on the
ground by the rear passenger wheel. Romeo was also found to be wanted for a violation of probation issued on 01/23/23. During a
search of Romeo, Investigators located 11.9 grams crack cocaine inside Romeo’s pants pocket. Romeo was taken into custody without
incident. The recovered firearm was checked locally and NCIC and Negative. A DNA search warrant was drafted for Romeo’s DNA
and same was tagged into evidence. A test fire request was completed.

On Thursday March 21st, 2024, at approximately 1421 hours, Wilcom received a call for a robbery at Preferred Tax Service, 2201-A Market Street. Several A-Platoon officers were across the street on a directed patrol within the unit block of Gordon Street. Those officers quickly responded on foot to the business and were directed to the unit block of W. 23rd Street, where the suspect was last seen. Officers immediately observed the suspect fleeing westbound on 23rd Street and gave chase. After a brief foot pursuit, the suspect (Chivas Tucker BM 09/16/1983) was tased and taken into custody by Officers Geiser, Mann, Marshall, Truluck, and Reid. On the suspect’s person was $1,569 USC and (2) two bags. Inside one of the bags was a black in color Taurus .40 handgun 

Additional officers responded to the scene and met with the victim. The victim is the business owner, and he advised that the suspect had entered the store with a second suspect and asked for him by name. The second suspect was described as a black female dressed in dark clothing, wearing a baseball style hat and dark sunglasses. Once the owner responded to the front of the store, both suspects produced handguns and forced (2) two female employees and (2) two female customers to the rear of the business. The female suspect held all of the women at gunpoint while the male suspect forced the owner to his office and demanded he turn over any cash on the premises. The owner advised that they didn’t have any, at which point the suspect pistol-whipped him in the face. The owner then turned over a large amount of USC from his pants pocket to the suspect. Prior to fleeing, the suspect fired (2) two gunshots at the victim, missing him.

A scene consisting of one spent .40 caliber shell casing was located in the back room of the business. FSU responded and processed the scene. A video of the incident, which included sound, was obtained and reviewed, which captured the incident in its entirety. Still images of the unknown female suspect were disseminated via Street Smart in an effort to identify her, and results are pending.

On November 16th, 2023 CGIC/RTCC detectives were conducting surveillance on the area of W. 24th St and N.
Tatnall St. While conducting surveillance, multiple individuals were observed walking to and from several vehicles parked in the
block. At approximately 1253 hours, Rashawn George, Nazir Cassidy and another unknown suspect were observed entering a tan in
color 2007 Nissan Altima bearing Delaware Registration 241092. Detectives observed the vehicle make a traffic infraction at which
point a motor vehicle stop was attempted in the 200 block of W. 29th St. The vehicle initially was stopped before reversing into
Detective Moses’s police vehicle and beginning to flee eastbound on 29th St striking Detective Lerro’s police vehicle.
After striking Det. Lerro’s police vehicle, the vehicle continued to flee eastbound on the northern sidewalk of 29th St where it struck
the front porch/steps of three residence’s causing minor damage to same. The vehicle then attempted to turn southbound onto West St
when it struck a vehicle parked in the block at which point the occupants exited the vehicle and fled on foot. After a foot pursuit,
Rashawn George (Driver) was taken into custody in the rear years of the 2800 block of Prestwyck Ct. Rashawn was found in
possession of 34 baggies (.238 grams) of suspected heroin. K9 Officer Williams and his partner began conducting a track for the
remaining suspects. After an extensive search, K9 Williams located Nazir Cassidy hiding in an alleyway between N. Tatnall St and
Prestwyck Ct. Nazir immediately fled again and entered a vehicle however with the assistance of D Platoon and CEU the vehicle was
stopped and he was taken into custody. An area canvas for the 3rd suspect was conducted but met with negative results.
While securing the accident scene, officers located a silver and black in color Smith & Wesson SD40VE 40 Caliber firearm (S/N
FCV1366) under the Nissan on the driver’s side. Traffic Unit Officers Johnson and Simmons responded to the scene regarding the
accident. Documented under case number 23-88537.Once all suspects were in custody, assisting officers responded to the area of W
24th St and N. Tatnall St where they secured two suspect vehicles in regards to this investigation. One of the vehicles was found to be
reported stolen out of Chester County, same was notified of the recovery. Rashawn, Nazir and the vehicles were transported to the
Wilmington Police Department. Detectives authored and were granted search warrants for the vehicles. NCIC inquiry was conducted
which revealed firearm was reported stolen out of Avondale Pennsylvania. Test fire form was submitted.
Rashawn was charged for Possession of a Firearm during the Commission of a Felony, Possession of Firearm/Ammo by Person
Prohibited x 3, Possession of Controlled Substance, Carrying Concealed Deadly Weapon, Disregarding Police Signal, Resisting
Arrest, and traffic charges. Cassidy was charged with Resisting Arrest.

On Thursday April 14th 1346 hours, DOCV were conducting surveillance in the area of 7th & Monroe St regarding
an unrelated investigation when they observed an in progress shooting. DOCV detectives observed a blue metallic Honda Pilot (PA
LVR8640) enter the 700 block of W 7th St and stop near a black cherry metallic Chevrolet Malibu (MD 8ED7976). The occupants of
the Honda Pilot opened the front passenger side door and discharged multiple rounds into the parked Chevrolet Malibu which was
occupied by Jamil Bailey BM 06/09/94 & Troy Faison BM 11/28/87. The suspect vehicle was observed with a shattered rear window
fleeing north on Jefferson St. In the area of Delaware Ave and Adams St, the two suspects (later identified as Demarius Bradley and
Ernest Hill) fled from the vehicle and were pursued by numerous officers. Ernest Hill was pursued into Trinity Church Cemetery
where he was taken into custody by Safe Street officers after a taser deployment. A Taurus G2C 9mm handgun (#TL071592) was
located inside his right pant leg. Demarius Bradley fled on foot and was located hiding inside an unsecured Delaware Horticulture van
with the assistance of civilians in the area. B Platoon office Agosto took Bradley into custody. Bradley was not wearing shoes at the
time of his arrest. Officers backtracked his route and located his sneakers along with a discarded hooded sweatshirt, a second Taurus
9mm handgun (#ACC347293), and a separate extended magazine in 1100 block of N Adams St. During the ensuing foot pursuit and
apprehension, WILCOM advised of two shooting victims who arrived at WER via private vehicle. The victims were identified as
Jamil Bailey BM 06/09/94 & Troy Faison BM 11/28/87. Both victims were listed as critical but stable condition.
A secondary canvass of the cemetery on Delaware Ave was conducted which resulted in the recovery of a Glock .40 handgun with an
extended magazine. The Glock was found to be stolen in WPD’s jurisdiction in 2016 (30-16-71906)
(12) 9mm casings located in the 700 block of W 7th St.
Dillard/Bailey feud

On Friday January 6th 1836 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 300 block of West Street when they observed Jader Wright BM (01/28/2002) and Joshua Wright BM (12/23/1998) walking southbound on West Street. Upon the subjects observing the approaching Street Crimes Vehicle, the subjects immediately slowed their pace. Investigators conducted an approach on the subjects. During the approach, Investigators heard a metal object strike the street near the subjects. Upon inspecting the area in which Investigators heard the noise, Investigators located a black (9mm Keltec Model P-11 bearing serial #AA3A55 which contained (11) eleven rounds in the magazine on the street by a parked vehicle. The firearm was checked local and NCIC and negative. Joshua Wright was 29P for a Family Court Capias. Both subjects consented to their DNA being taken which was obtained and placed into evidence. A test fire request was submitted. At this time the investigation is on-going. Both were charged with PFBPP Gun and Ammo.

On December 19, 2024, at approximately 1930 hours, Officer Williams (K9-12) was conducting a directed patrol in the area of 6th and Madison Streets when he notified WILCOM regarding gunfire in the area. Shortly thereafter, a ShotSpotter alert was received indicating four rounds fired at 837 N. Madison Street. While en route to the location of the ShotSpotter activation, Officer Williams observed an unknown subject, later identified as Marcus Hamilton (01/23/1981) walking at the intersection of 8th and Morrow Streets. The subject appeared disoriented, prompting Officer Williams to think he was possibly shot, he then initiated a pedestrian stop. Upon further investigation, Hamilton appeared to have a bulge under his t-shirt on the right side, and was found to be in possession of a black Smith & Wesson .40 caliber (S/N #JDJ0280) handgun, with a single round loaded in the magazine (which has a six-round capacity). A crime scene was subsequently identified by officers, comprising two spent .40 caliber casings, one located on the front porch of 839 Morrow Street and the other on the front porch of 841 Morrow Street. After being read his Miranda Rights, Hamilton admitted to discharging the firearm into the air while walking through the block.

On August 5, 2024, CGIC responded to 705 East 6th St, Apt #2 to assist Juvenile Probation with a firearm investigation. Upon arrival on scene, Juvenile Probation stated that they responded to the location in an attempt to take the defendant, Isaias Gonzalez (07/09/2008), into custody on a Violation of Probation. It was stated that Gonzalez was located within the residence, in the rear bedroom, sleeping in a bed with a juvenile, Aston Martin (05/10/2023) and female, Staniyah Martin-Johnson (11/20/2004).
Upon taking him into custody, a firearm was located within his right pants pocket. The firearm was a black in color Smith & Wesson M&P 9mm bearing serial # JRT1755. The firearm had a 13 round magazine which was loaded with 11 rounds of mixed 9mm ammunition (there was no round located in the chamber). Gonzalez was taken into custody without further incident and placed into the back of probation's vehicle. Juvenile Probation took custody of the firearm from Gonzalez until CGIC’s arrival, where it was then taken into custody by same. Staniyah stated that she was Isaias' sister and that the child was her son. She stated that she had no idea that Isaias had a firearm in his pants pocket while they were laying down with her son. The residence belongs to Gonzalez's grandmother Leah Cofield (07/29/1961) who stated that Isaias does not stay at the residence all the time and comes and goes as he pleases. She gave verbal consent reference the rest of the residence for any other firearms or contraband, which were met with negative results.*Firearm was reported stolen 08/01/2024 by Jonathan Hildner, who resides at 401 A Street, Wilmington, DE 19801.

On Wednesday March 29th 1604 hours, SCU Investigators were in the area of Delaware Ave and Washington St
when they observed a blue Chevy Impala (DE 559094) driving at a high rate of speed. Investigators attempted to catch up to the
vehicle to initiate a traffic stop, however the vehicle accelerated and failed to stop. The vehicle finally came to a stop in the 900 block
of W. 8th St where Investigators met with operator/defendant (Rahman Moody BM 05/15/2006) and immediately took him into
custody. Kathrine Conquest BF 10/31/06 (front seat passenger), Giavonna Barbour BF 06/13/08, Journie Torres BF 04/12/07 and
Alyandra Yancy WFH 03/04/08 (rear seat passengers) were all asked to exit the vehicle and were detained. During a search of Journie
Torres, Investigators located a black in color Glock 19 9mm firearm containing 13 rounds in the magazine and 1 in the chamber
located inside of Torres’ purse. A check locally NCIC of the recovered firearm’s serial number (BPLH594) was reported stolen out of
WPD on 07/26/2021 (firearm removed from victim’s secured vehicle @ 4310 Miller Rd).
All subjects were transported back to central where they were mirandized and questioned regarding this firearm investigation. During
questioning, Torres advised that Rahman Moody removed the gun from under his leg and handed the firearm back to her to at which
time she concealed same in her purse until it was ultimately discovered by police. An interview with the additional occupants
corroborated Torres statement.
A DNA search warrant for Moody was drafted and DNA was taken from each of the occupants of the vehicle. A test fire request was
completed. Moody was charged with Felony Disregarding, PFDCF, CCDW, PFBPP x2. Torres was not charged at this time pending
AG correspondence.
Rahman Moody and Alyandra Yancy were shooting victims on 01/05/23 in 1399 Wilson St. (30-23-1080; CIO Det. Rivell)

defendant_name: Jermaine Francois, Dasean Carney, Jazzlyn Johnson
case_status:
D1: Resolved
D2 and D3 not in spreadsheet
case_summary:

to an ongoing NIBIN/Shots Fired investigation. Through the course of the investigation CGIC detectives identified Dasean Carney, Jermaine
Francois and Jazzlyn Johnson as persons of interest.
While conducting surveillance in the area, Carney and Francois were observed exiting 2519 N Madison St along with additional unknown
