of N. Madison St where they were both taken into custody without incident for their outstanding capiases.
Once in custody, detectives made contact with 2519 N. Madison St in reference to this investigation who consented to a search of the
residence. During the search officers located and recovered one (1) Black in color Glock 19 9MM handgun (S/N BGGG284) loaded with 14
total rounds of ammunition, one (1) H&R 22 Caliber Revolver (S/N AC58003) loaded with 6 rounds of ammunition, and one (1) Black in color
PMF 9MM handgun (No Serial Number) loaded with 20 total round of ammunition.
During a search of Francois, he was found to have 3 sets of car keys in his pocket. An area search was conducted for the vehicles at
which point a 2024 white in color Ford Explorer bearing Pennsylvania registration LXT6947 was located in the 400 block of McCabe. NCIC
inquiry was conducted which revealed same to have been reported stolen out of Upper Chichester Pennsylvania, same was notified of the recovery.
Francois, Carney and the vehicle were transported to the Wilmington Police Department.
NCIC inquiries were conducted on the firearms which were met with negative results. Test fire forms were submitted.
NCCPD was notified in reference to Francois outstanding warrant.
Francois was charged for Possession of Firearm/Ammo by Person Prohibited x 2, Receiving Stolen Property and was processed on his
outstanding capias/warrant. Carney was processed for his outstanding VOP, firearm charges are pending. Warrants for Jazzlyn in reference to
Possession of a Firearm by Person Prohibited are pending

On December 12th, 2023 CGIC Detectives were monitoring social media when they observed Donte Stokes (2/13/2000) post
multiple pictures of himself holding a tan and black firearm as well as picture/video of a recent homicide victim, Malik Benson.
During the investigation, Detectives were able to confirm the location the pictures were taken were from within his residence.
On December 13th, 2023 CGIC along with Safe Streets responded to Donte’s residence in reference to this investigation.
While conducting a search, Probation officers located one (1) Tan and Black SCCY CPX-2 (S/N 934331) loaded with 9 round of
ammunition in the magazine in an upstairs bedroom

CGIC investigators have been actively investigating two shots fired incidents that both occurred on 10/17/24. These
incidents took place in the 800blk of N. Adams Street (30-24-799044) and the 600blk of N. Adams Street (30-24-79045). A total of
Twenty four (24) 9mm casings were collected between the two scenes.
On Tuesday, October 22, 2024, at approximately 1400 hours, surveillance was established within the 800blk of W 8th Street. During
surveillance, several subjects were observed in within this block engaging in suspicious activity, as well as hand to hand transactions.
One of the subjects was identified as Jamere Black (DOB 04/13/2002). Black was found to have an active no contact order with the
800blk of W 8th Street.
These factors, along with the recent shots fired incidents, led to CGIC investigators attempting to make contact with the subjects
loitering within the block.
With the assistance of Safe Streets and K9-12 (Williams), CGIC investigators entered the 800blk of W. 8th Street.
Immediately after observing the police vehicles, numerous subjects attempted to flee the area on foot. One individual, Wahkee
Tabron (DOB 09/29/2004) was observed discarding a green and black Glock 19 (S/N #AKSB103) from his person as he fled from
detectives. Tabron was apprehended and the firearm was recovered in the rear yard of 711 N. Monroe Street.
After a brief foot pursuit, Jamere Black was apprehended and found to be in possession of one hundred and one (101) bags of
suspected heroin.
Antwyne Shamburger (DOB 12/25/1989) was observed discarding and object down a storm drain within the 800blk of Monroe Street.
Shamburger was detained without incident. The sewer grate was removed and investigators recovered a plastic bag containing 51 bags
of suspected heroin, .85 grams of crack and 4 MDMA pills.

On Friday January 6th 0900 hours, Sector 3 officers responded to the area of Harrison/Lancaster Streets for a person with a gun complaint. Preliminary information revealed that the victim was operating a vehicle in the area during which time the suspect walked into her path, causing her to slow down and honk her horn. The suspect subsequently removed a firearm from an open carry position and displayed same to her. The victim quickly left the area and called the police with his descriptions. Officers Linkhorst/K Kirlin and Stewart located the suspect inside Rodriguez Grocery (1 S. Harrison St) and safely took same into custody, retrieving a black in color, Glock 26, 9mm semi-automatic handgun (Serial # BPTK477) from his holster. The gun was negative for any warrants, and the suspect is not currently prohibited due to criminal history. Surveillance was located and secured. Out of custody warrants were signed due to the defendant being treated at Wilmington Hospital for unknown illness. The defendant was processed and released no supervision.

On March 3, 2025 members of DOCV executed a search warrant at 1911 W. 3 rd Street in regards to a Drug
Investigation/sales of marijuana. Officers were able to establish surveillance of the residence and observed drug activity involving Jose
Gavina (09/22/1998) and Waldemar Ortiz (02/01/2000). Gavina was taken into custody leaving the residence, just prior to the search
warrant. DOCV, along with the assistance of CGIC executed the warrant and seized one black and tan FN 509 9mm (S/N: GKS0262747)
handgun, one tan and black FN 509 9mm (S/N: GKS0258457) handgun, and one Winchester XSP 12 gauge (S/N: TR172725YZSP)
shot gun. In addition, officers seized 1,818.6 grams of Marijuana, drug packaging material, and $1,628.00 USC. Both defendants were
charged accordingly.

On Friday, July 18, 2025, at approximately 0008 hours, WPD officers were on a proactive patrol in the area of West 4th and Delamore Place, when they observed a black in color Jeep Compass (DE temp XF506882) with illegal window tint. Officers then made a vehicle stop and made contact with the driver, Andre Norwood (05/24/1987). The front passenger was identified as Malikye Boyer (09/15/2001), and the rear passenger was identified as Davonte Talbert (04/13/2008). A DELJIS inquiry revealed the driver, Andre Norwood, to have a suspended license, where officers then asked him to step out of the vehicle. Due to the suspended license, officers decided to tow the vehicle, and asked the other occupants to exit the vehicle. Upon doing so, Boyer was observed to have a Glock 43X 9mm (SN#BUTW391) in his front waistband. The firearm was later confirmed to be stolen out of NCCPD. A search of the vehicle revealed a Ruger Security .380 (SN#38707248) to be found underneath the front passenger seat, being in close proximity to both Boyer and Talbert. Officers also located a total of 183 grams of Marijuana, a digital scale, and USC in the vehicle. The individuals were brought back to Central, where DNA was taken, and charged accordingly.

On July 19, 2025 approximately 2150 hrs. Cpl. Marshall was on proactive patrol when he observed a white Dodge
Durango (PA LRH7849) traveling in the area of Concord Avenue. An NCIC inquiry revealed the vehicle to be stolen. Upon this
realization, Cpl. Marshall then activated his emergency equipment, at which time the vehicle attempted to flee. A pursuit ensued,
until the vehicle stopped and multiple subjects wearing all black clothing exited the vehicle.
Assisting units arrived in the area at which time a perimeter was established. As a result of the incident, seven individuals were
apprehended and identified as Katavioa Taylor, Kwell Evans, Jaden Dorsey, Ronald Womack, Mekhi Turner, Rahshad Rawls,
and Saleem Garnett. A search of the area revealed a 1) Springfield XD-9 (S/N: #XD207270) 9mm handgun was recovered in the
rear yard of 502 West 35th Street.
The Dodge Durango was transported to the Central where a search warrant was executed, and yielded the recovery of 2) DPMS
Panther Arms AR-15 (S/N: #FFH281535) with one round in the chamber and 23 rounds in the magazine, 3) AR-15 style rifle
with no markings with one round in the chamber and 10 rounds in the magazine, five (5) .223 rifle casings and one (1) .45 caliber
casing. All seven subjects were charged accordingly.
*It should be noted that the following morning, the owner of 502 West 35th St, called to report a found firearm in the front yard. The
firearm was a Desert Eagle handgun (S/N #031542) .40 caliber handgun. The listed suspects have not been charged with this
firearm (30-25-052192).
*It should be noted that the following morning, the owner of 504 West 35th St, called to report a found firearm in the rear yard. The
firearm was a Springfield XD (S/N #US592346) .45 caliber handgun. The listed suspects have not been charged with this firearm
(30-25-052324)

defendant_name: Jones, Kyaire; Cooke, William; Lowman, Sharif
case_status:
D1: Resolved 
D2: Resolved
D3: Resolved
case_summary:
During the month of June, Det. Rosaio initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales by Kyaire Jones and
William Cooke from 612 N. Tatnall Street, Wilmington, DE. Additional information was obtained that both subjects possibly possessed
four handguns.
On this date, during the course of surveillance, William Cooke was observed entering a vehicle and leaving the area. While operating
the vehicle, William Cooke was observed pointing a handgun out of the vehicle window. The vehicle was followed to the 1300 block of
Linden Street where it parked. Members of the Vice Unit with the assistance of CGIC conducted a Felony vehicle stop and took all
occupants into custody without incident, the occupants and vehicle were transported to Central. It should be noted that this stop was
conducted in the presence of family members.
Surveillance was maintained on the residence, shortly after the initial arrest, Kyaire Jones and Sharif Lowman were observed exiting
the residence with a bag and walking away. Members of CGIC attempted to stop Kyaire Jones and Sharif Lowman at 8th & Tatnall
Street. Upon approach Kyaire Jones fled from officers and after a brief foot pursuit was taken into custody. Kyaire Jones was found to
have on his person the listed Glock Gen 5 (#BUCY515) with a full auto selector switch and a large quantity of Crack Cocaine. Sharif
Lowman was found to have on his person the listed Stoeger 9mm (#T6429-22Y08505).
Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for 612 N. Tatnall Street and the vehicle William
Cooke was operating. The search warrant was executed on the residence without incident, and the Ruger LCP (#371538268), additional
drugs, and drug paraphernalia were located. L&I contacted and responded regarding the conditions of the residence. A search warrant
was executed on the vehicle, the handgun observed during surveillance was found to be a CO2 pellet gun, additional drugs and
paraphernalia were also recovered.

On September 12, 2024 at approximately 1545 hours, members of Safe Streets stopped a gray in color Honda Accord
(CA: 8SGP564) in the 300 block of N. Madison Street for a traffic violation. During the course of the stop, officers removed the front
passenger, Caleb Coleman (10/22/2000) from the vehicle, at which point they recovered a loaded Smith and Wesson 9mm handgun
(#FZU1799) from his waistband. The driver, Paul Waller (06/02/1987) was removed from the vehicle as well and found to be in
possession of a loaded Beretta .45 caliber handgun (#PK31803) that was concealed in a fanny pack that was draped across his chest.
Both suspects were taken into custody without incident; neither of the defendants had permits to conceal firearms.

On Sunday June 11th 1417 hours, A Platoon Officers Wilkers/Bond were in the area of 7th & Monroe St when they
observed Jewel Henry BM 09/03/99 and Jamil Bailey BM 06/09/94 sitting on the steps of the Faithful Missionary Baptist church
which had a No Loitering sign posted. Jewel Henry also has an active no contact order with Jamil Bailey (issued 12/16/21). As a
pedestrian stop was initiated, Henry attempted to walk away while displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Henry was stopped
and patted down for weapons. During the pat down, officers located a loaded S&W 9mm (reported stolen out of Cecil County
Sheriff’s Office) and a loaded S&W .38 revolver. Both firearms were located inside Henry’s waistband. Henry was also found to be in
possession of (34 grams) of marijuana.

On Monday October 02, 2023, Det. Rosaio observed Julius Ventura BM 05/09/2005 and Jayden Smith walking in
the 700 block of Catawba Street during which time Julius Ventura removed a firearm that was concealed in his waistband. Both
subjects then entered the Rutledge apartment building located at 312 W. 8th Street before members of the Vice Unit could conduct a
stop on them. Members of the Vice Unit with the assistance of Patrol, CID, and the Gun Unit established a perimeter of the apartment
building exterior and simultaneously cleared the interior. Contact was made with the property management company who were able to
determine both subjects entered apartment #16. Shortly after, Julius Ventura and Jayden Smith exited apartment 16 and were detained
without incident. Ventura was immediately interviewed and advised that his grandmother and a young female were still in the
apartment. Both Ventura and Smith were transported to Central.
Investigators made numerous, unsuccessful attempts by various means to contact the grandmother. Members of the Hostage
Negotiation Team that were present were unsuccessful in making contact with the grandmother. Det. Rosaio authored and obtained a
search warrant for the aforementioned location. Upon executing the warrant contact was made with the grandmother and a young
female who denied hearing officers at her door. Located inside the residence: black in color Ruger Security 9mm semi-automatic
handgun (#385-42148) and a black in color Ruger 5.7 x 28 semi-automatic handgun with a partially obliterated serial number (#642-
19207), 25.9 grams of marijuana and drug paraphernalia.
Julius Ventura admitted to owning and possessing the Ruger Security 9mm semi-automatic handgun but not the Ruger 5.7x28 caliber
semi-automatic handgun which he claims belongs to his older brother.
The firearms as well as the Test Fire Form were submitted to FSU for processing. DNA was obtained from both Ventura and Smith

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
time_to_recovery:
424
(note: while DOA is 6/17/25, gun was recovered on 5/21/25)
case_summary:
Original Report (30-25-037015): On May 21, 2025, at approximately 1248 hours, members of Safe Streets responded to 706 W. 9th St, Apt 3, regarding probationer, Malek Waters (06/27/2000). Waters was not present at the residence at the time of the investigation. Officers conducted an administrative search of the residence and located a Glock 27 .40 (S/N: CAYZ649) loaded handgun. Beings that Waters is on probation and prohibited from possessing a firearm, an arrest warrant was issued.
Arrest Report (30-25-044097): On June 17, 2025, at approximately 1115 hours, Officers Meese and Hutt were on a proactive patrol in the area of 600 N. Monroe St. During the patrol, officers observed known subject, Malek Waters; officers were aware of Waters’ active warrant regarding the Safe Streets Firearm Investigation. In addition to the active warrants, Waters had several outstanding capiases for other charges.
Officers attempted to make contact with Waters, when he fled on foot. After a brief foot pursuit, officers deployed their CEW and successfully took Waters into custody without further incident. Waters was transported to Central, where he was processed for the active warrants.

On Friday April 29th 1752 hours, A Platoon officers conducted a motor vehicle stop for illegal window tint and expired registration. Officers made contact with the driver, Al’Lesha Taylor-Jones, and two passengers, Christopher Deputy BM 10/19/2001 and Markevis Brown BM 12/26/2002. It was discovered that no one in the vehicle possessed a valid driver’s license. During an inventory search of the vehicle, officers located a black in color S&W 9mm which was concealed in the glove box. During the investigation, Taylor-Jones admitted to possessing the firearm, while claiming she possessed a concealed carry permit. It was found that Taylor-Jones did not have a permit. She was charged with CCDW and released on $3,000 unsecured. The passengers were released without being charged.

On Wednesday June 21st 0050 hours, 171 Adam (N. Gliem) was stopped in the parking lot of the Speedy Mart (1120 S. Broom Street) when he observed a gray 2007 Chevrolet Impala displaying Pennsylvania temporary registration 3790276 traveling south on Broom Street. Officer Gliem pulled behind the car and determined the temp tag was fraudulent. Additionally, he
noticed that the occupants were wearing masks. He attempted to stop the vehicle, but it fled through Latimer Heights and then back
into the city. The vehicle traveled north on Franklin Street, where it struck a parked car in the unit block of North Franklin St and all
four occupants fled on foot. Officers were able to apprehend the driver (John Stowe BM 07/12/1995) and passenger (Kevin Stowe
BM 05/10/1994). Officer Gliem had the vehicle towed to Central where he located a SCCY CPX-2 9mm semi-automatic firearm
(serial # C045580) on the driver side floorboard. Also located within the vehicle was, 3 grams of crack cocaine, 5 Ecstacy pills, 8
Xanax pills, and 3 heroin baggies stamped “Cash App” & “RP”. Officer Gliem identified John Stowe as the vehicle operator and
weapons offender. John Stowe was charged with the weapons offense and Kevin Stowe charged with resisting arrest.

On February 11, 2025, Det. W. Martin was conducting surveillance in the area of 1700 N. Locust St, due to recent information on drug sales at this location. At approximately 1120 hours, Juan Pena-Zamudio (10/12/2022) was observed meeting with a subject and engaging in a hand to hand transaction. After the buyer then left the area, Pena-Zamudio was seen getting into the driver’s seat of a vehicle. Two more hand to hand transactions were observed through the passenger window of the car. Assisting units were then contacted to stop the occupants of the car.
Officers approached and Pena-Zamudio exited the driver’s side, as he was ordered to do, and he was placed in custody. He was found to be in possession of a Stoeger STR-9 9mm (S/N: T6429-19U07775) loaded with 15 rounds of ammunition. The firearm was reported stolen out of Coatsville PD. In addition, Pena-Zamudio was also found to be in possession of 1.2 grams of crack cocaine. The passenger, Shaun Powell (03/16/2002) exited the vehicle and dropped a black and brown in color Polymer 80 9mm (No S/N) loaded with 16 rounds of ammunition. He then attempted to flee, at which time a K-9 was sent and able to detain same.
Both subjects and the vehicle was transported to Central, were a se4arch warrant was applied and granted. Additional paraphernalia, oxycodone, and marijuana were located inside the vehicle. Defendants were charged accordingly
not provided

On Wednesday December 21st 1416 hours, B Platoon Officers conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 400 block of N.
Broom St for an expired registration. Upon contacting the driver, Kamyrn Matthews BM 11/02/97, Officers Rook and Cannon
detected a strong odor of marijuana coming from inside of the vehicle. The driver was removed from the vehicle without incident at
which time Officers observed in plain view a clear plastic bag of marijuana along with a firearm magazine on the floorboard of the
vehicle. A search warrant was obtained and a black in color Glock 26 9mm pistol was located under the driver’s seat and a total of 42
grams of marijuana. Matthews was charged with CCDW along with the appropriate T16 charges.

On Thursday June 13, 2024, at approximately 0905 hours, the Wilmington Police Communications Unit received a 911 call for shots fired at 2834 Rosemont Avenue. The caller said a projectile came through their wall and nearly struck a juvenile. Units responded to 2834 Rosemont and determined that a projectile came through a second-floor wall from the adjoining house (2832). Officers spoke with the victim, who said she was in her room when the projectile came through the wall, went through her television, and then lodged into her bed. Her arm sustained an abrasion from fragments of the television/bed.

Officers established a perimeter around 2832 Rosemont Avenue and then used the loudspeaker to order the occupants to exit. Stephan Deshields BM 08/22/2006 exited without incident and was taken into custody by officers. Officers debriefed Mr. Deshields and determined he was the sole occupant. With the assistance of CID, officers applied for a search warrant for 2832 Rosemont Avenue, which was granted. Officers searched the house and located three firearms, ammunition (9mm, .22 cal, 12 gauge), and numerous credit cards with various names. Officers recovered the following guns:

•	Pink Glock 9mm Model 19 (Serial # AGKA918), Extended Magazine, No NCIC Record. A casing was lodged in the ejection port as a result of a double-feed
•	Black Glock 9mm Model 19 (Serial # MP2843DC), Standard Magazine, No NCIC Record
•	Brown Canik 9mm TP9SF (Serial # T6472-21), Extended Magazine, No NCIC Record 

The investigation is ongoing as Officers Mann/Diaz are collecting statements, DNA, and gunshot residue. However, preliminary information revealed that Mr. Deshields discharged a firearm in the second-floor bedroom of 2832 Rosemont Avenue. The projectile went through the wall and entered the second-floor bedroom of 2834 Rosemont Avenue.

On September 24th, 2024 CGIC initiated an investigation into Naseer Bullock (02/01/2007) after being contacted by Cpl Mann in reference to an aggravated menacing/terroristic threatening which occurred in the unit block of W 36th St. Cpl Mann responded to a complaint of a Person with a Gun in the area of the Pal Center. During his initial investigation, Cpl Mann made contact with the victims in this incident who advised of an altercation which occurred in the unit block of W 36th St during which time a suspect by the name of ‘Naz’ produced a firearm an threatened to ‘air it out’. During Cpl Mann’s initial investigation he was able to identify Naseer Bullock as a person of interest in this incident. 
 As a result of the investigation, CGIC detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 30 W 36th St. On September 26th, CGIC along with Cpl Mann and Juvenile probation responded to 30 W 36th St and made contact with Naseer Bullock, Drea Dimatteo (10/13/2003) and Shawn Cooper (05/25/1982) at which point detectives executed the search warrant. 
 During a search of the residence, Detectives located and recovered one black in color Beretta APX 9mm (SN #A156480X). While interviewing the occupants, Detectives were able to determine that Naseer has access to a Grey in color Volkswagen Passat which was parked out front. Detectives subsequently had the vehicle towed to Central where a search warrant was executed. During a search of the vehicle, Detectives located and recovered a black and grey in color Taurus G3C 9mm firearm (SN #ACH157880) loaded with a total of 8 rounds of 9mm ammunition.

defendant_name: Marhi Clark, Amir Clark, Nasir Turner
case_summary:
On the above date and time, officers were dispatched to the above address in reference to a theft of a firearm. Upon arrival, officers made contact with the victim, who advised that between 04/05/2024 and 04/07/2024 his firearm (black in color, Glock 43X, 15 round magazine, serial #CAUW394) was removed from his vehicle (black in color, Lexus RX350, DE PC327783). It is unknown if the vehicle was secured; however, there was no forced entry into same. The vehicle was parked on the north side of the street in the above listed block. An area canvass for witnesses met with negative results. Several surveillance cameras were located in the above block, but none were available for review at this time. The vehicle was processed for fingerprints, but met with negative results. TRU was contacted regarding the potential surveillance. A copy of this report was forwarded to the Data Center for entry into NCIC.
----------------------------------------------------------- Update ---------------------------------------------------------------
        On April 8th, 2024 CGIC Detectives initiated an investigation into the above firearm theft.  During the course of the investigation, Detectives were contacted by City Watch (Sierra) who advised she observed three juvenile suspects on the City Watch Cameras walking in the area checking car doors during the time of the firearm theft.  She further advised she believed the suspects entered the 711 at W. 4th St and N. Union St.  
TRU was able to retrieve video surveillance of the incident as well as the video surveillance from the 7-11.  Detectives reviewed the surveillance videos and were able to positively identify Marhi Clark BM 04/23/2008, Amir Clark BM 04/23/2008, and Nazir Turner BM 04/12/2007 as the suspects.  As a result of this investigation, Detectives were granted arrest warrants for Marhi, Amir and Nazir. Detectives applied for and were granted search warrants for 418 N Franklin St and 1007 W 8th St in regards to this investigation.  

On April 12th, 2024 at approximately 0600 hours CGIC executed both search warrants with the assistance of CMTT, Safe Streets, K9 and members of A Platoon. While responding to the residence, Detectives observed a group of 4 juvenile males, to include the suspects, walking eastbound on 4th St.  Detectives attempted to make contact with the suspects at which point they all fled.  After a brief foot pursuit, Marhi and Ishmael Turner were taken into custody.  

As a result of the search warrants the following evidence was located and recovered:
        418 N Franklin St:
- Black in color Glock 19 9mm handgun (Serial Number CCAW570) loaded with 13 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color Glock 17 9mm handgun (Serial Number CAGS184) loaded with 12 rounds of ammunition
                - 2 empty magazines/Misc Firearm accessories
        1007 W 8th St:
                - Black in color Glock 47 (Serial Number CAFD759) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color FMK 9mm handgun (Serial Number BB22209) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
                - 9 rounds of 40 caliber ammunition
                - 38 rounds of 9mm ammunition
                - 2 Spent 9mm casings
                - Miscellaneous firearm accessories
        Marhi and Ishmael and the evidence were transported to the Wilmington Police Department. Amir Clark and Nasir Turner turned themselves in the following day. The stolen firearm is still outstanding at this time. DNA was obtained from other occupants in the residence regarding the recovered firearms, charges are pending the comparison.

On Thursday September 15th 2030 hours, Safe Streets conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 900 block of Concord Avenue for a tint violation. During the stop, the officers made contact with Equan Barber BM 0/04/95 (the driver) and Kasreey’l Perry BM 05/12/96 (the passenger). While making contact with the occupants, the officers smelled an odor of marijuana coming from within the vehicle and conducted a probable cause search. During the search, officers located a loaded Taurus G2 9mm firearm in the trunk of the vehicle along with (7.3 grams) of marijuana. During the course of the investigation, Perry admitted to owning/ possessing the firearm and marijuana. Barber was issued a traffic ticket for the equipment violation and released from police custody. Perry was transported to Central and processed as an arrest for the firearm related charges. The firearm was submitted to FSU for processing along with a Test Fire form.

On Thursday April 24, 2024, Det. Rosaio initiated surveillance on the 200 block of N. Franklin Street and the
surrounding area due to recent shots fired incidents. During the course of surveillance, Det. Rosaio observed the occupants of a Jeep
Liberty engaged in drug activity. The vehicle was surveilled and a stop was initiated in the 200 block of N. Connell Street for a traffic
infraction. The passenger, later identified as Hamza Carter BM 07/12/2005, immediately fled from the vehicle and after a brief foot
pursuit was taken into custody without incident. Hamza Carter was found to possess the listed Glock .45 handgun (#TCN880) and
1.29 grams of Crack Cocaine. The Jeep (which fled from the initial stop at 2nd & Connell) was surveilled by members of the DOCV
and with the assistance of USD a vehicle stop was initiated in the 2400 block of W. 4th Street. The operator, Leo Bey BM 07/21/1979
was found to possess .1 grams of Crack Cocaine and H-A .22 (#610245) High-standard handgun was recovered from the vehicle

On Tuesday September 5th at approximately 0030 hours, officers were dispatched to 623 W. 7th Street in regards to a domestic violence compliant involving a firearm. Officers arrived on scene and ascertained information that the suspect left the area in a black in color Honda Accord. While officers were speaking with the victim (Lonyae Lecompte BF 01/16/1997), the defendant (Kevis Edwards BM 12/03/1989) pulled back up to the residence. Officers obtained a statement from the victim who advised her and the defendant who is her child’s father got into a verbal argument at which time the defendant pointed a black in color firearm at her. Officers obtained a statement from the defendant who advised he was involved in a verbal argument with his child’s mother, however he never possessed a firearm during the incident. Cpl. Clark and Cpl. Wilkerson obtained written consent to search the defendant’s vehicle. During the search, officers located a black in color Glock .380 caliber firearm which contained 8 rounds in the magazine and 1 round in the chamber. The firearm bearing serial # AHSF584 which was checked locally & NCIC and Negative. The defendant was taken into custody without incident and charged with Agg. Menacing, PFBPP domestic and CCDW.

On Thursday March 10th 1033 hours, SCU conducted a motor vehicle stop for a traffic infraction (failure to signal) in the 800 block ofGrant Ave. Upon conducting the traffic stop, the passenger of the vehicle was observed making furtive movements within the vehicle. As SCU officer Akil opened his door to approach the vehicle, the Lexus abruptly drove off before coming to a second stop in front of 705 Grant Ave. As officers exited their vehicle a second time, the front seat passenger of the Lexus (Donte Broomer), immediately
exited the vehicle and began distancing himself away from same. SCU officers were able to place Broomer into custody after a brief struggle. Contact was made with the driver of the vehicle, Kayla Ramos BF 01/09/92, who was removed from the vehicle. Two bags were located in the vehicle, a plastic hand bag on the front passenger floorboard and a dark in color fanny pack on the rear passenger seat. Due to the unusual manner in which the vehicle came to a stop, the furtive nature of Broomer’s movements inside the vehicle,
and Broomer abruptly exiting the vehicle and proceeding to ignore lawful commands, the vehicle was towed to central while SCU officers authored a search warrant. Once the search warrant was approved, officers located a black in color “Carry My Own Weight” fanny pack positioned on the rear passenger side seat which contained a black in color Beretta APX 9mm handgun, (6) clear plastic bags containing 150 grams of marijuana, (2) black zip lock bags containing 13 grams of marijuana, and a black and silver scale with
marijuana residue on same. Rios advised that the bags belonged to Broomer and consented to providing a sample of her DNA. She was issued a ticket for the traffic infraction and released. Broomer was charged with the weapons offenses, PWID and Resisting Arrest. A search warrant for his DNA was authored and approved.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On Wednesday February 15th 1536 hours, members of the DOCV initiated surveillance in the 300 block of W. 7th St in reference to drug complaints. During surveillance, Daniel McClain BM 09/17/90 was observed selling Marijuana in front of the business located on the north side of the block. Members of the DOCV initiated a pedestrian stop on Daniel McClain and Kenneth Chandler BM 01/03/1977 who was in his presence. Upon approach, Daniel McClain was observed discarding a small quantity of marijuana and was detained without incident. His vehicle was located and later searched, resulting in the recovery of 407 grams of marijuana.  

Kenneth Chandler was found in possession of a S&W M&P 9mm handgun (#NKC5854 – loaded with 1 round in the chamber, magazine empty). The firearm as well as the Test Fire Form was submitted to FSU for processing. Both defendants were transported to central and charged accordingly. A restriction for the aforementioned area was requested as part of their bail.

On September 29, 2024, at 1630 hours, Officers Marshall/Giles were flagged down in the 500 block of Lombard
Street regarding a report of aggravated menacing. Officers made contact with victim, Delgene Ray (10/23/1994), who informed
them that he had been involved in an altercation with an unknown black male near the intersection of E. 5th Street and Lombard
Street. During the altercation, the suspect pointed a firearm at Ray's head. Fearing for his safety, Ray retreated to another block and
called the police. He provided the officers with a description of the suspect and directed them to the 400 block of Lombard Street.
Upon arrival at the directed location, officers observed a man matching the description provided by the victim. The suspect, later
identified as Jecavis Stanford (06/19/1988), was standing in the area. As officers attempted to approach him, Stanford fled. During
the pursuit, officers noted that Stanford was clutching his front waistband, a behavior often associated with carrying a concealed
firearm. Officers pursued Stanford into the apartment complex located at 503 E. 4th Street. Stanford entered apartment 2A but soon
after was seen exiting the apartment through a window in an attempt to continue fleeing. Officer Crumlish deployed his CEW,
successfully incapacitating Stanford, and allowing officers to take him into custody.
Inside the apartment, officers made contact with two occupants, Janashia Chapman and her son, Khiaon Chapman. Ms. Chapman
stated that she did not know Stanford and confirmed that he had entered her apartment unlawfully. She provided consent for the
officers to search her residence, during which they recovered the black and silver in color 9mm Springfield Armory XD9 semi-
automatic handgun (SN #MG416854), loaded with 17 rounds in the magazine and 1 round in the chamber; firearm is
consistent with the victim’s description.

On 1 August 2024 at 0630 hours Wilcom received a call for a report of a male subject with a self-inflicted GSW.
Shortly thereafter Donnell Money (07/12/89) arrived at the St. Francis Hospital with a GSW to his arm. Preliminary information
and surveillance from the store suggests that he was attempting to pay for merchandise at the 7-11 when a gun concealed on his
person accidentally discharged in his pocket striking him in the left arm. He fled the store prior to police arrival, however a blood
trail was tracked to the rear of 302 N. Union St and a Davis Industries .380 cal. handgun was recovered from inside a grill. CID
responded to the scene and Money’s residence. A search warrant was obtained and executed for 302 N. Union Street, Apartment 2.
Miscellaneous rounds of ammunition were located, as well as a Glock 17 pellet gun that was loaded with seven (7) rounds of 9mm
ammunition in the magazine. The firearm investigation is ongoing however the GSW is a result of being self-inflicted.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On December 14th, 2023, at 2316, the Wilmington Police Communications Unit received a 911 call for a trespasser sleeping in the
store at 800 West 4th Street (America’s Best Wings). WILCOM dispatched 16 Adam (Rennewanz/Simpler) to investigate. When
they arrived, they found the defendant sleeping on the floor. The officers observed a firearm handle protruding from his coat
pocket. They secured the weapon and took the defendant into custody without incident. The officers discovered the defendant had
49 heroin bags (34 stamped “Tasty Kake” and 15 stamped “Hip Hop King”) and 39 grams of marijuana.
The firearm was a Glock 48 (Serial: AETA117) 9mm loaded with eleven rounds. The weapon was not reported stolen.

Members of Safe Streets were contacted by M/Cpl. Justin Wilkers regarding Shamar Wright BM 03/29/01, who is
a level 3 probationer and was possibly in possession of a firearm. Safe Streets Officers began an investigation into Wright and learned that he tested positive for marijuana during a probation office visit on 02/02/23. Officers were granted approval for an administrative search of Wright’s residence located at 805 N. Church St. On Wednesday February 2nd members of Safe Streets and Street Crimes
established surveillance on the residence and observed Wright exiting at approximately 1935 hours. Wright was taken into custody without incident at which time he was found to be in possession of approximately 15 grams of marijuana. While Wright was seated in a police vehicle, he was able to escape from the back door and attempted to flee on foot. Members of Safe Streets and Street Crimes quickly recaptured Wright without incident before transporting him to Central. During a search of the residence, officers located a
Glock 44 .22caliber handgun (#ADEY781), loaded with 9 rounds of .22 caliber ammunition as well as approximately 64.1 grams of marijuana inside Wright’s bedroom. While at Central, Wright admitted to possessing the handgun and marijuana that were found in his room. Wright consented to have his DNA collected. Wright is prohibited from owning or possessing firearms/ammunition due to prior felony convictions.

defendant_name: Idris Young, Kijire King, Kevin Chambers
case_summary:
On Saturday May 14th 1910 hours, Street Crimes Officers were in the 1200 block of Maryland Ave when they observed a black Jeep Cherokee (DE PC256936) which failed to possess a valid tint waiver. SCU officers approached the vehicle and spoke with the operator (Idris Young BM 01/18/98), front passenger (Kevin Chambers BM 04/26/98) and rear seat passenger (Kijire King BM 09/23/98). While speaking with the occupants, SCU officers observed what appeared to be an AR style pistol protruding from underneath the front driver seat and into the rear of same. Officers also observed a firearm partially concealed underneath the front passenger seat and floorboard. All three occupants were removed from the vehicle and detained. 

SCU officers conducted a search warrant on the vehicle and located the following:
•	Located underneath the front driver seat, protruding out the rear was (HK) 416 AR-style pistol chambered in .22 LR ammunition (# HBO19304).

•	Located in the rear cargo compartment was a firearm magazine containing (19) .22 caliber rounds

•	Located on the passenger side floor board was a TP9PA(Canik) 9mm semi-automatic handgun (# TG472-18BJ09845) 
with one round chambered & one black in color Canik brand magazine containing (5)  9mm rounds.

•	Located inside the center console cup holder was a Canik magazine containing (15) 9mm rounds.

•	Located inside the center console was 5.4 grams of marijuana

On Thursday August 18th 1131 hours, SCU were in the 700 block of E. 10th St when they observed a group loitering
in a vacant lot on the south east corner of E. 10th St. SCU Investigators approached the group and observed (Valera, Makaveli HM
09/23/2006) who was wanted for Non Compliance Breach of Release and Assault 3rd. The defendant was also observed displaying
characteristics of an armed gunman. SCU Investigators searched the defendant and located a tan and green in color loaded Taurus
G2C 9mm firearm concealed in the defendant’s waistband.

dealer_name: Target Master (license name Tommy Gun Inc)
case_summary:
Kevin Harris Homicide – 7/4/2024 
**Remington and S&W located in residence, belonging to suspect. Stoeger located besides victim.

On October 7, 2025, at approximately 1426 hours, members of Safe Streets observed Keyair Gregory (09/05/96)
walking in the 1900 block of Market Street with a handgun partially sticking out of his pocket. As officers continued watching, Gregory
removed the firearm from his pocket and concealed same in his front waistband area. Officers from Safe Streets and the Vice Squad
conducted a pedestrian stop and confirmed Gregory was in possession of a concealed, loaded Stoeger STR-9 9mm (SN#T65429-
23U11029) handgun, without a valid concealed carry permit. Gregory was taken into custody and transported to Central.

On May 9, 2024 at approximately 1000 hours, members of Safe Streets and CGIC responded to 2511 Carter Street
in order to conduct an administrative search of the residence occupied by Abdur-Rahman Muhammad BM 11/16/1999.
Muhammad, who is on level 3 (GPS) probation, had left the residence just prior to the arrival of police. Once inside, officers located a
Glock 23 .40 caliber (#ALL482) above listed firearm and numerous rounds of .40 caliber and 9mm ammunition. Members of Safe
Streets and CGIC utilized GPS to track Muhammad to the area of Lancaster and Woodlawn Avenues. Officers stopped Muhammad
and took him into custody without incident. Muhammad was transported to Central where he was uncooperative with interview
attempts. DNA was collected from Muhammad and a test fire form was submitted to FSU. Muhammad was charged accordingly and
an administrative warrant was submitted.

DOCV investigation into Chaka Maddrey BM 12/17/86 for drug sales from various locations throughout the city of Wilmington. Search warrants were obtained for 201 N. Poplar St, Apt B7 and 716 E. 10th St.
On Tuesday April 26th DOCV members initiated surveillance on Chaka Maddrey at 201 N Poplar St. Upon Maddrey leaving the residence, a motor vehicle stop was initiated in the 700 block of E 4th St. Maddrey refused to stop but was not pursued. A short time later, Maddrey was observed walking away from his vehicle in the 800 block of Lombard St before being taken into custody.
Both search warrants were executed at 201 N Poplar St Apt B7 (which was found unoccupied) and 716 E 10th St., 2nd Floor (which was occupied by Rashun Goldsborough BM 10/01/77 and Brenda Maddrey BF 07/05/64). Lesha Bradley BF 04/04/86 was taken into custody at central as she was attempting to retrieve a vehicle from this incident.
Between both residences’ and two vehicles, the following items were seized:
FN 509 9mm handgun (#GKS0101801) loaded with 17 rounds of ammunition
Glock magazine containing (13) 9mm rounds of ammunition
52 grams of Cocaine
83.21 grams of Crack Cocaine
1,929.6 grams of Marijuana
84 Oxycodone Pills
$2,527 USC
Drug Paraphernalia
Cellphones
(Both the firearm and additional magazine were located in the bedroom that Goldsborough exited from prior to being taken into custody)
DNA search warrants were authored and obtained from all subjects.

On Tuesday, October 28, 2025, CGIC Investigators were conducting surveillance in reference to an ongoing firearm
investigation, in the area of S. Harrison St and Sycamore St. While conducting surveillance, detectives observed Jermaine Francois
(07/03/2007), Quadir Warren (10/03/2004), and Dasean Carney (08/01/2007) exit 529 S. Harrison St, and begin walking southbound.
Detectives were aware both Francois and Warren were currently wanted on outstanding warrants. As detectives attempted to make contact
with the group, regarding the warrants, all three subjects immediately fled. As Carney began to flee, Detectives observed him to be
displaying characteristics of an armed gunman and gave chase. After a brief pursuit, all three subjects were taken into custody.
During a search of Carney, Detectives located and recovered a loaded Taurus 605 Protector Poly .357 caliber (#ABG702730) revolver.
Carney, Francois, and Warren were transported back to Central, along with the evidence, and charged accordingly.

On September 11th, 2023 Detective Lubek notified WILCOM regarding Nakeem Bailey BM 07/06/2000 in the area of 5th and N. Madison St armed with a firearm. Det. Lubek advised Nakeem was observed placing the firearm in the front of his waistband. As CGIC and D Platoon officers arrived to the area, Nakeem was observed walking eastbound on 5th St towards Montgomery St. Upon seeing the officers, Nakeem immediately turned westbound and began to flee and discarded the firearm near the intersection of W 5th St and N. Madison St. Detective Linkhorst recovered the firearm, which was found to be a black in color Glock 9mm semi-automatic (#BRZH404) which was loaded with 9 rounds of 9mm ammunition in the magazine and 1 in the chamber, while assisting officers pursued Nakeem. After a brief pursuit, Patrolman Hutt was able to take the defendant into custody in the 400 block of N. Monroe St. The firearm was checked locally and NCIC which was met with negative results, a test fire form was submitted. Nakeem was transported to Central where he was charged accordingly..

On Tuesday June 13, 2023, ShotSpotter received a notification of 4 rounds in the area 27th and Thatcher Streets
under case number 30-23-45469. Officers Matic and Callery were dispatched to the incident location and were able to obtain a
doorbell camera video which displayed a subject firing a handgun in the direction of unknown subjects while several unassociated
pedestrians were in the area. Investigator Lerro observed one of the subjects in the video possessing a plastic bag which they did not
previously have in their possession prior to the shots fired incident. Investigator Lerro responded to the corner store at 26th and
Northeast and reviewed the store’s surveillance video and was able to positively identify the subjects in the store video as Defendant 1
Luchiano Diaz BM 03/01/2004 and Defendant 2 Jazzlyn Johnson BF 06/12/2005 through prior encounters. Additionally,
Investigator Lerro was able to confirm the subjects in the video were the same subjects involved in the shots fired incident.
Investigators were able to author JP Court 20 search warrants for defendant‘s residences at 1609 Coleman Street and 225 A 8th Ave.
On Friday June 23rd 0614 hours, a search warrant was executed at Diaz residence (1609 Coleman St). Diaz was located in the
residence and taken into custody without incident. Additionally, Johnson was not present during the execution of the search warrant
and responded back to same and was taken into custody without incident. A black in color Ruger Security 9 9mm firearm was
recovered containing 10 rounds of ammunition (#385-48753).
DOCV’s Safe Streets, Vice and Gun Intelligence Unit Investigators executed the search warrant at 225 A 8th Avenue where Defendant
3 (Jonathan Bailey BM 12/13/1998) was taken into custody without incident. During the search of 225 A 8th Avenue, investigators
located a black book bag under a bed in the residence suspected to be Bailey’s bedroom which contained two firearms:
• black in color S&W M&P .380 handgun (#KFS0758) with 1 round in the chamber and 13 live rounds in the extended
magazine reported stolen on 12/05/2022 under case number 32-22-092569.
• black in color Polymer 80 9mm containing 1 round in the chamber and 19 live rounds in the extended magazine
Investigators Mirandized Diaz who was interviewed inside CID who provided a confession to possessing the firearm as well as the
shots fired incident. DNA was recovered from all 3 Defendants. A test fire request was completed.
Luchiano Diaz was charged with Reckless 1st, CCDW, PFDCF, Tampering, Conspiracy will be added during Intake.
Jonathan Bailey was charged with 2x PFBPP (PFA) and processed on 3 capias and 1 felony hard warrant out of DSP.
Jazzlyn Johnson was charged with Conspiracy 2nd and Reckless 1st (Bail: $6,000 secured ; Pre-Trial Supervision)

On Wednesday July 6th 1957 hours, SCU Officers were on proactive patrol in the Browntown area when they
observed a black male subject, later identified as Savion Posey, wearing a yellow cross body bag / walking from the middle of the
block on 6th Ave towards Maryland Ave. Upon observing officers, Posey stopped and abruptly sat down on the steps of 1 6th Ave.
Officers then exited their vehicle and upon doing so, Posey stood up from the steps and attempted to flee into 1 6th Ave before being
taken into custody. Officers then conducted a frisk of the cross body bag and immediately felt the outline of a firearm. Located inside
the bag was a loaded Heckler and Koch USP Compact .40 caliber firearm, (24.6 grams) of marijuana, and (.077 grams)of heroin.
Posey was also found to be in possession of Oxycodone pills. At the time of this incident, Posey was wanted by WPD for domestic
related Aggravated Menacing / Theft of MV.

On Wednesday January 4th 2023, Street Crimes Investigators were in the 2400 block of Jessup Street when a white
in color Toyota Camry bearing Delaware (460035) was observed failing to come to a complete stop at several stop signs. Investigators
initiated a vehicle stop in the 2100 block of Jessup Street. Investigators met with the single operator Knas Reves BM (03/30/1998). A
Deljis inquiry was conducted on Reves which resulted in Reves being actively wanted on a Trespassing Capias. Reves was removed
from the vehicle and asked if he possessed anything illegal in his vehicle. Reves advised his firearm was underneath his seat. Reves
advised he was licensed; however Investigators conducted a CCDW inquiry which yielded no results for Reves possessing an active
CCDW. Located underneath the driver seat was a black in color “Glock” .380 SN (AGDN693) containing (1) in the chamber and (6)
live 9mm rounds of ammunition in the magazine. The firearm was checked local and NCIC and found to be negative. Reves was
charged with Driving Offenses and Carry Concealing a deadly weapon (a firearm) without a permit

defendant_name: Marhi Clark, Amir Clark, Nasir Turner
case_summary:
On the above date and time, officers were dispatched to the above address in reference to a theft of a firearm. Upon arrival, officers made contact with the victim, who advised that between 04/05/2024 and 04/07/2024 his firearm (black in color, Glock 43X, 15 round magazine, serial #CAUW394) was removed from his vehicle (black in color, Lexus RX350, DE PC327783). It is unknown if the vehicle was secured; however, there was no forced entry into same. The vehicle was parked on the north side of the street in the above listed block. An area canvass for witnesses met with negative results. Several surveillance cameras were located in the above block, but none were available for review at this time. The vehicle was processed for fingerprints, but met with negative results. TRU was contacted regarding the potential surveillance. A copy of this report was forwarded to the Data Center for entry into NCIC.
----------------------------------------------------------- Update ---------------------------------------------------------------
        On April 8th, 2024 CGIC Detectives initiated an investigation into the above firearm theft.  During the course of the investigation, Detectives were contacted by City Watch (Sierra) who advised she observed three juvenile suspects on the City Watch Cameras walking in the area checking car doors during the time of the firearm theft.  She further advised she believed the suspects entered the 711 at W. 4th St and N. Union St.  
TRU was able to retrieve video surveillance of the incident as well as the video surveillance from the 7-11.  Detectives reviewed the surveillance videos and were able to positively identify Marhi Clark BM 04/23/2008, Amir Clark BM 04/23/2008, and Nazir Turner BM 04/12/2007 as the suspects.  As a result of this investigation, Detectives were granted arrest warrants for Marhi, Amir and Nazir. Detectives applied for and were granted search warrants for 418 N Franklin St and 1007 W 8th St in regards to this investigation.  

On April 12th, 2024 at approximately 0600 hours CGIC executed both search warrants with the assistance of CMTT, Safe Streets, K9 and members of A Platoon. While responding to the residence, Detectives observed a group of 4 juvenile males, to include the suspects, walking eastbound on 4th St.  Detectives attempted to make contact with the suspects at which point they all fled.  After a brief foot pursuit, Marhi and Ishmael Turner were taken into custody.  

As a result of the search warrants the following evidence was located and recovered:
        418 N Franklin St:
- Black in color Glock 19 9mm handgun (Serial Number CCAW570) loaded with 13 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color Glock 17 9mm handgun (Serial Number CAGS184) loaded with 12 rounds of ammunition
                - 2 empty magazines/Misc Firearm accessories
        1007 W 8th St:
                - Black in color Glock 47 (Serial Number CAFD759) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
- Black in color FMK 9mm handgun (Serial Number BB22209) loaded with 14 rounds of ammunition
                - 9 rounds of 40 caliber ammunition
                - 38 rounds of 9mm ammunition
                - 2 Spent 9mm casings
                - Miscellaneous firearm accessories
        Marhi and Ishmael and the evidence were transported to the Wilmington Police Department. Amir Clark and Nasir Turner turned themselves in the following day. The stolen firearm is still outstanding at this time. DNA was obtained from other occupants in the residence regarding the recovered firearms, charges are pending the comparison.

During the month of April 2024, CGIC Detectives initiated a firearm investigation into Andre Ramsey BM
04/25/1979 after receiving information from K9 Officer Truluck regarding Andre being wanted on firearm charges out of
Pennsylvania and being in possession of a firearm. Andre was also currently wanted by Delaware State Police in regards to a vehicle
pursuit as well as a WPD warrant for a theft. During the course of investigation, detectives were able to identify possible residences as
well as receiving information regarding Andre selling pills.
On Monday April 15th, 2024, CGIC Detectives responded to the 600 block of W. 25th St in an attempt to locate Andre. Upon arrival
into the block, Andre was observed standing on the north side of the block working on his son’s vehicle. Detectives made contact
with Andre and took him into custody without incident. While taking Andre into custody, Detectives observed the vehicle he was
observed driving parked in the driveway with the trunk open. While confirming the registration, Detectives observed and seized a
black in color Sarsilmaz SAR-9 9mm handgun (Serial Number T1102-20BV58939) with a Sixray laser/flashlight loaded with a total
of 18 rounds of 9mm ammunition which was located in the trunk.
While on scene, Detectives made contact with Andre’s son who consented to a search of his vehicle. During a search of the vehicle,
detectives located a bag belonging to Andre which contained a brown in color wallet with Andre’s ID cards, a digital scale, 60
Alprazolam pills, 55.07 grams of marijuana, and 30.29 grams of suspected Fentanyl. Andre along with the vehicle located in the
driveway were transported to Central. A search warrant was obtained for the vehicle which resulted in the recovery of 52 additional
Alprazolam pills

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
Please reference the double shooting of Jakai Randall and Marcus Hardin for further details.
On Saturday, June 14, 2025, at approximately 2340 hours, WPD officers observed the suspect vehicle, a white Lexus SUV (DE PC527168) hit on an LPR, coming into the city. Officers Wiggins and Jones located the vehicle at 9th and Madison St. A felony traffic stop was conducted, and the driver was identified as Yaphet White (02/03/1998). White appeared to be wearing the same clothing, which was observed on surveillance footage at the time of the shooting. After being transported to Central, Det. Wilkers interviewed White, where he confessed to the shooting, post Miranda. A search warrant was executed for White’s vehicle, where officered located and recovered an EEA Witness P5 9mm (S/N: AE93495) handgun. White was charged accordingly.
not provided
not in gunstat meeting reports

defendant_name: Rashan Johnson and Vincent Harris, Case # 30-22-65705
case_summary:
On Saturday September 17th 1453 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 200 block of W. 20th St when they observed
defendants (Johnson, Rashan BM 01/16/2007) and (Harris, Vincent BM 12/17/2002) loitering on and in front of a vacant property
(220 W. 20th St). SCU Investigators made contact with the defendants at which time Johnson displayed characteristics of an armed
gunman and was patted down. During the pat down on Johnson, Investigators immediately felt what was believed to be a firearm in
Johnson’s cross body satchel and ultimately recovered a loaded Taurus G2C 9mm. Harris was pat down and was found to be in
possession of a prescription bottle containing .08 grams of crack cocaine. As officers were attempting to place Harris into custody he
fled on foot and dropped a loaded Polymer 80 9mm. He was ultimately taken into custody and the firearm was secured.

On December 3, 2025, at 0350 hours, 13A (Diaz/Grieco) responded to 1900 Superfine Lane in reference to a
ShotSpotter notification for one (1) round. Upon arrival, officers made contact with the Defendant, Lafel Crawford (01/10/1999), who was found to be in possession of a loaded Taurus G3C 9mm (SN#AGL601378) handgun. Crawford was mirandized and admitted to firing one round into the Brandywine Creek from the Market Street Bridge. Officers then responded to the Market Street Bridge, where
they located a scene consisting of one (1) spent 9mm casing on the eastern sidewalk.

On November 18, 2025, CGIC Detectives, along with Det. Cannon, Det. Macnamara, Cpl Shea, and Cpl Crumlish, were
on patrol in the area of Chestnut and Connell St, when they observed Emilio Gutierrez (11/30/2002) and Arion Flowers (03/18/2010)
operating a motorized scooter westbound on Chestnut St towards oncoming traffic. CGIC detectives were able to identify Gutierrez, due
to a recent firearm investigation.
CGIC detectives exited their vehicle to make contact with Gutierrez, at which point he and Flowers immediately began to flee. Flowers
was observed to be displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Gutierrez was immediately taken into custody. Flowers was taken into
custody after a brief foot pursuit. At this time he discarded a tan in color Sig Sauer P320 9mm (SN#M17-077818) handgun which was
loaded with 16 rounds of ammunition, underneath a nearby vehicle.
Gutierrez and Flowers were transported to Central, along with the evidence

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On Wednesday, May 14, 2025, at approximately 1935 hours, WPD officers responded to the area of 399 N. Market St, in reference to a 911 call for shots fired. Upon arrival officers made contact with subject, Lamar Gregory (03/09/1986) in the intersection of 3rd and N. Market. Gregory admitted to firing a handgun at a vehicle, resulting from a motor vehicle collision. Victim, Marquise Smith (09/14/1996) advised his vehicle had been damaged as a result of the gun being fired. Witnesses confirmed the story of events. The Sarsilmaz SAR9 9mm (T1102-21BV91930) was seized as part of the investigation. Gregory was identified to be a person prohibited, based on past felony charges, therefore, he was transported to Central, and charged accordingly.

On Tuesday May 17th 2000 hours, Safe Streets officers conducted a motor vehicle stop on a Dodge Charger (DE
781115) in the 600 block of S. Harrison St for an equipment violation (tinted windows). Upon approaching the vehicle, officers
detected an odor of marijuana and observed a handgun partially concealed under the front passenger seat of the vehicle. Officers
attempted to remove Wilson from the vehicle at which time he accelerated away from the stop.
Officers observed the vehicle turn into the 1100 block of Colombia Ave at which time Wilson parked the vehicle and fled into 1105
Colombia Ave. A perimeter was established of the residence and Wilson ultimately surrendered to the officers without further
incident. He was found to be in possession of (2.3 grams) marijuana. The officers conducted a search of Wilson’s vehicle and
recovered a Jimenez Arms 9mm firearm loaded with 8 rounds and an additional (1.2 grams) of marijuana.

On January 17th, 2024, at approximately 2133 hours Wilmington Police patrol officers responded to the 1100 block
of West 3rd Street in reference to a ShotSpotter notification for 4 rounds. Upon arrival officers located 4 spent 9mm shell casings
directly in front of 1106 West 3rd Street. The surveillance footage depicted the following: Suspect 1- A black male wearing a grey in
color zip up jacket/hoodie and black pants with a white stripe down the side Suspect 2- A heavyset black male suspect wearing a black
hooded sweatshirt with a distinct logo on the left chest, black in color sweatpants with a white stripe, black in color sneakers. While
observing the video footage of this incident this said Suspect 1 appeared to enter and exit 1106 W. 3rd Street and begin to possibly
argue with unknown individuals in a white in color Nissan sedan unknown model. During the possible argument, the subject removed
a firearm concealed on his person, open the rear car door, and discharged several rounds at the individuals inside of the said vehicle.
The vehicle then immediately fled the area at a high rate of speed. As the vehicle is seen leaving the area Suspect 1 can be seen giving
the firearm to Suspect 2 who discharges additional rounds from the handgun in the direction of the said vehicle. Following the
shooting, Suspect 1 and Suspect 2 can be seen reentering 1106 West 3rd Street.
Through the course of this investigation, the suspects were identified as follows: Suspect 1- Marlen Cisney BM 02/05/2004 Suspect
2- Marcell Johnson-Chapman BM 09/09/2008 It was discovered that Marlen Cisney and Marcell Johnson-Chapman are brothers
residing at 1106 West 3rd Street. On 1/25/24, CGIC investigators began monitoring Marlen Cisney’s location, at which point he was
observed exiting 1106 West 3rd Street and was taken into custody without incident during a vehicle stop. After Marlen Cisney was
taken into custody, Detective Shea authored a search warrant for the listed residence, which was executed by members of CID, CGIC,
and USD. While officers were gaining entry into the front of the residence, Patrolman Gordy observed a handgun being discarded
from a rear window. Marcell Johnson-Chapman and Marquis Johnson-Cisney (BMNH 4/10/05) were located inside the residence and
taken into custody. Marquis Johnson-Cisney was discovered to be an additional brother of Marlen and Marcell. During a search of the
residence, a Luger P38 9mm handgun was located in the rear of the property. Additionally, clothing evidence relating to the shots
fired incident was located inside the residence. Officers then executed an additional search warrant for 704 West 31st Street, which
was listed as an additional address for Marlen. During this search, a Ruger P95 9mm handgun was located. Marlen, Macell, and
Marquis were all transported to Wilmington Police Headquarters for processing. The handguns were submitted to FSU along with a
test fire form. Detective Shea authored and executed DNA search warrants for Marcell and Marquis in reference to a firearm
investigation.

On Saturday January 28th 1858 hours, members of Safe Streets conducted a vehicle stop in the 200 block of E. 4th St for a registration violation. Officers made contact with the operator who was identified as Amanda Ricks BF 02/02/89 and the passenger, Brandon Williams BM 09/10/01. Ricks advised officers that she was in possession of a handgun and that same was located inside the glove box. Both occupants were removed from the vehicle at which time Williams was found to have a hard warrant (WPD) for Assault 3rd. Williams was taken into custody without incident and found to be in possession of approximately 1 gram of marijuana. A search of the vehicle was conducted at which time three firearms were located, concealed inside the vehicle. Ricks confirmed that she did not possess a concealed carry weapon permit. Ricks was taken into custody without incident and found to be in possession of 10 grams of marijuana. Once at central, Ricks admitted to owning the three concealed firearms located inside the vehicle. Williams stated that he never touched any firearms inside the vehicle. Both consented to their DNA collected. Williams was processed on his warrant and issued a summons for civil possession of marijuana. Ricks was charged with CCDW (3 counts), PFBPP (3 counts), civil possession of marijuana and registration violation.

During the month of January 2023, Det. Alava and Coffiey initiated an investigation into Heroin sales by Jamil Hill BM 01/20/1994 in the 800 block of Kirkwood St. Additional information was that Jamil Hill possessed a handgun.

Thursday April 6th 0936 hours, members of the Vice Unit and K9 established surveillance on 59 N. Pennewell Drive, Wilmington,  during which time both Jamil Hill and his girlfriend, Amber Clark BF 04/16/1991 were observed exiting the residence and entering their vehicle. During the course of surveillance, Jamil Hill was observed committing traffic offenses and stopped in the 800 block of Lombard Street.  During the Detectives interaction with Hill, same admitted to possessing Heroin and was detained without incident. Hill and his vehicle were transported to central for processing and Clark was transported to her place of employment.

Surveillance of 59 N. Pennewell Drive was maintained while Det. Coffiey authored a search warrant for the residence. During this time Amber Clark was observed arriving back at the residence; quickly entering and exiting then leaving the area. A traffic infraction was observed by the operator of the vehicle who was later identified as Amber Clark’s boss and a vehicle stop was conducted. During the approach of the vehicle, Amber Clark immediately handed over a stack of currency to Detectives; same was removed from the vehicle and during a pat down was found to be in possession of a loaded Colt Mustang .380 semi-automatic handgun (#RS49700) loaded with 6 rounds. Amber Clark was detained and all parties transported back to central. During a strip search of Clark, same was found to possess the listed seized drug concealed on her person. 

Items Seized: 
•	Silver in color Colt Mustang, .380 semi-automatic handgun, serial # RS49700 (29N). Handgun magazine loaded 6 rounds. 
•	40.3 grams of Crack Cocaine
•	1.764 grams of Heroin
•	7.7 grams of Marijuana
•	$1,472.00 USC (seized)
•	Drug Paraphernalia  
•	DNA
•	Cell phones

The search warrant for 59 N. Pennewell Drive, Wilmington, DE was obtained and executed, no additional evidence was located. 
The firearm and the Test Fire Form were submitted to FSU for processing. DNA and cell phone were obtained from the defendants.

On May 12th 1604 hours, Safe Street officers were in the 400 block of E. 3rd St when they observed subjects later
identified as Leandre Stovall BM 05/30/00 & Ronel Juandoo BM 08/11/01 actively smoking marijuana. Officers also observed
Leandre Stovall to be open carrying a firearm. Officers approached the group, confirmed that both subjects were in possession of marijuana, and took both subjects into custody. Incident to arrest, Juandoo was found to be in possession of (47 grams) of marijuana and Stovall was found to be in possession of (1 gram) marijuana along with a Glock 31firearm which was loaded with ten rounds of .357 ammunition. Juandoo was issued a citation for possession of marijuana and released. Stovall was processed on PFBPP (Title 16) and possession of marijuana

On Wednesday March 15th 1050 hours, Safe Streets conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 300 block of E. 4th St. after observing the operator using his cell phone while driving. Officers made contact with the operator, Leon White BM 09/20/1985, during which time they detected the odor of marijuana coming from within the vehicle. A probable cause search of the vehicle was conducted. During the search, officers located a backpack that contained a loaded Glock 42 .380 (#ABMZ583) and 63.8 grams of Marijuana. White admitted that the firearm and marijuana belonged to him. He was transported to Central where he was charged accordingly, but released after posting $6,102 cash bail. A test fire form was submitted to FSU.

On Sunday, December 7, 2025, at approximately 1850 hours, Officers Diaz and Grieco were dispatched to 333 East 35th Street, in reference to an aggravated menacing incident. Upon arrival, officers determined that the victim had been involved in a road rage encounter in the area of 99 Eastlawn Avenue. During this incident, the defendant, later identified as Leonard Watson (02/01/1994)
produced a firearm and pointed it at the victim while operating his vehicle. The victim reported that he discreetly followed Watson’s vehicle back to his residence located at 523 East 35th Street. The victim observed the defendant enter the residence at which time he contacted 911. Officers responded to Watson’s residence and established a perimeter. Watson was observed attempting to exit through the rear of the
residence. At that time, officers entered the residence and placed Watson into custody. While entering through the basement, officers observed two handguns – one Smith & Wesson SW380 .380 (SN#RAB0920) handgun, and one Smith & Wesson SD9VE 9mm
(SN#FBH8888) handgun in plain view on the bed in the defendant’s bedroom. Additionally, a short-barreled AR-style Diamond Back LLC DC15 (SN#DB2104453) rifle with 30-round magazines was located in close proximity to the bed. A consent-to-search form was obtained and executed. During the search, officers recovered brass knuckles and a small quantity of marijuana. Watson was transported back to Central and charged accordingly.

On Friday February 24th 2010 hours, members of Safe Streets responded to 924 E. 27th St for a home visit on Lamar Marshall BM 12/21/1985, who is a level 2 probationer.  Marshall was also the victim of a shooting on 11/16/22 in the 400 block of MLK Blvd (30-22-80053).  Marshall was not home at the time of the visit. Officers located drug packaging material inside Marshall’s bedroom, and an administrative search was approved. Officer’s located (2) safes underneath Marshall’s bed that contained a Bersa Thunder .380 caliber semi-automatic handgun (#495970), ammunition, and handgun magazines. Officers also located a small amount of marijuana (3.4 grams) inside Marshall’s bedroom.  Marshall was taken into custody on 03/21/23.

On July 15, 2025, CGIC detectives were contacts by City Watch in reference to a Person with a Gun in the Judy Johnson Park. Detectives reviewed the video surveillance and responded to the area with the assistance of Safe Streets. Upon arrival, Sameer Bolden (06/14/2007) was observed in the standing in the park, on the DuPont St side, along with two other subjects at which point detectives exited their vehicle and made contact with Bolden, who was found to be in possession of a black in color Taurus G3C 9mm (#ACK391186) firearm which was concealed in the front of his waistband. Bolden and the firearm were transported to Central. Bolden was also processed on an outstanding warrant.

On Friday May 5th 1815 hours, officers responded to Pennsylvania Ave. & N. Lincoln Street for a motor vehicle
accident involving multiple vehicles. Upon arrival, V1 advised that he was sitting in a friend’s vehicle in the 900 block W. 4th St
when observed the Defendant, who he knows as “Tec Blow” approaching him with a firearm. He advised that he exited the vehicle
and began running around as the defendant pointed the firearm at him. He then jumped in the rear of V2’s vehicle and told her to drive
off. V2 drove off and the defendant began chasing them in a stolen black Kia Forte (PA KKM1344). The vehicles traveled west on W.
4th St and then north on N. Lincoln St. Upon reaching the intersection, a collision occurred between V2’s vehicle and two additional
vehicles. The defendant fled the area but was later observed by Safe Streets officers, exiting the passenger side of the vehicle in the
1200 block of Chestnut St. Cpl. Roy and MacNamara gave chase and Cpl. Roy apprehended the defendant in the 1200 block of Elm
St. Cpl. MacNamara recovered a black Sig Sauer .380 caliber firearm (#26C073449) that he defendant discarded while running. A
short while later the stolen black Kia collided with a vehicle in the intersection of S. Jackson & Maple Street. The unknown operator
fled the vehicle prior to officers arriving. V2 sustained a fractured neck in the collision at Pennsylvania Ave. & N. Lincoln Street. She
was treated and released from St. Francis Hospital. The defendant confessed to possessing the firearm but denied chasing the vehicle.
He was positively identified by V1. The defendant was remanded to HRYCI on $97,500 cash bail and a P&P Administrative
Warrants

On Thursday May 12th 0656 hours, WILCOM dispatched officers to the 200 block of N. Broom St in reference to an
assault with weapons complaint. Upon arrival, officers were approached by Jamiere Archie who advised that his younger sisters,
Jamairah and Janiyah, were assaulted and sprayed with pepper spray while waiting for the school bus. Jamiere advised that he
approached the vehicle the suspects had entered (2017 white Jeep DE XQ244505), at which time, the driver (Jayla Townes) removed a
firearm from her tan in color purse, pointed same at Jamiere, and threatened him. Preliminary investigation revealed that the sisters
had been involved in a physical altercation earlier in the week with a Talina Townes while at AI DuPont High School.
A general broadcast was provided of the suspect vehicle and same was located unoccupied in the 2600 block of Lamotte St.
Surveillance was established on the vehicle and after a short time, Jayla Townes exited 2700 N. Market St, carrying a tan in color
purse, along with a black male, later identified as Tajee Foeman, who was carrying a small black bag. Both Townes and Foeman
entered the vehicle and were taken into custody without incident. Officers were able to obtain a search warrant for both Townes
vehicle as well as her residence (2700 N Market St., Apt 416). While executing a search warrant for the vehicle, officers located a tan
in color purse, which contained a black S&W .380 handgun loaded with two rounds. Also located was a small black in color bag
which contained a Ruger LCP 9mm handgun loaded with six rounds along with (65 grams) of Marijuana. Upon searching the
residence, officers located a box of .380 caliber ammunition.
Both Townes and Foeman were charged accordingly and DNA search warrants were authored.
Tajee Foeman provided his brother’s information (Tamir Foeman BM 06/12/99). Tajee provided Tamir’s name and DOB to officers
on scene and back at Headquarters. Tajee also filled out the Departmental Pedigree form with the false information. It was not until
arraignment that Tajee informed the officers and the judge that he lied about his identity. Additional charges were filed for Criminal
Impersonation and Making a False Written Statement.
