On Thursday March 16th 1907 hours, C Platoon officers responded to 1118 W. 4th St for a person with a gun
complaint. Upon arrival the Victim’s mother advised that she and her son were walking out of ShopRite (501 S. Market St) when a
silver Nissan pulled alongside of the passenger side of the victim’s car and pointed a handgun at the victim. She advised that the
victim pulled off as she began calling 911. She advised that she recognized the defendant as her neighbor, Luis Marrero WM
02/24/02. The victim provided the same details but further advised that the Defendant’s cousin is the father of his girlfriend’s child
and there has been ongoing custody issues between them. The victim believes that was why the defendant pointed the gun at him.
Officers contacted the Defendant who advised that he owns a gun but that it is secure in his residence and that his vehicle may have
been at the Shop Rite earlier today but that he did not point a gun at anyone. The defendant initially refused the officers entry into his
residence but later gave consent for the officers to look for the gun. They retrieved a loaded tan Sig Sauer 365xl 9mm semi-
automatic handgun (#NRA076451) in a safe in the defendant’s bedroom. They also located 235 grams of Marijuana in the safe. The
Defendant was transported to Central and booked on the listed charges.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On July 28, 2025 at approximately 1203 hrs. Officer Crumlish conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 500 block of West 8th Street on a blue Subaru (Temp Tag DE 7727R95) for an expired registration. Contact was made with the driver, Makail West (02/20/2002), who provided his license and an insurance card that was also expired. West was asked if he had anything in the vehicle that was illegal, at which time he advised of a firearm in his bag that was on the passenger front seat. West was asked to exit the vehicle and placed into custody without incident. Inside the bag, officers located opened the bag and located a black Glock 45 (ser#PA5809PD) in a waist band style holster which contained seventeen (17) rounds of 9mm hollow point ammunition in the magazine. The firearm was not reported stolen.

On June 1st 1558 hours, SCU were in the 300 block of E 23rd St when they observed Jarrod Reams BM 10/02/92 sitting on the front steps of 314 E 23rd St. Officers know Reams to have a court ordered “No contact with 3 block radius of the 300 block of E 23rd St.” As officers approached Reams, they observed a second subject later identified as Jahnair Murphy BM 01/07/03 exhibiting characteristics of an armed gunman. Officers conducted a pat down on Jahnair Murphy who was found to be in possession of a loaded Glock 48 9mm handgun concealed inside his waistband, (7.1 grams) of crack cocaine, and (11) Oxycodone pills.

On Friday January 18th, 2024, CGIC detectives were continuing the NIBIN investigation regarding the shots fired incident which occurred in the 4200 block of N. Market St.  During the course of the investigation, Det. Rook obtained video surveillance of Jashad Helm BM 01/12/2007 discarding a firearm which was later recovered by an unidentified male.  
CGIC detectives responded to the area in attempted to locate the unknown male at which point they observed Hector Santiago BM 10/27/2005 and Michael Williams BM 07/15/2005, both known associates of Jashad Helm, driving in the area of W. 41st and Shipley.  
Detectives initiated surveillance on the vehicle and observed a motor vehicle infraction at which point they conducted a motor vehicle stop.  As the vehicle came to a stop, the front seat passenger (Hector Santiago) exited the vehicle abruptly and began to distance himself from the vehicle at which point he was immediately detained.  During the stop, the driver (Michael Williams) advised detectives that Hector had placed something under his seat.  While Detectives were conducting the traffic stop, Messiah Clarke BM 05/31/2010, began to approached the stop.  As Messiah approached, Detectives recognized him to match the description of the individual seen on surveillance recovering the firearm that was discarded by Jashad following the initial shots fired incident. 
Michael, Hector, and the vehicle were transported to the Wilmington Police Department.  During a search of the vehicle, Detectives located a black in color Glock 19 9mm handgun with an extended magazine and a Glock Auto-Sear (partially obliterated serial # BWAR561) which was loaded with a total of 31 rounds of ammunition under the front passenger seat.  Messiah Clarke was taken into custody later that day and charged with PFBPP, CCDW and Tampering with Physical Evidence. Clarke was released on $11,000 secured bail.

On September 29, 2024, at approximately 1324, Officers Mann and Diaz were conducting a directed patrol at 23rd and
Market Streets when they observed two individuals, later identified as Mustafa Westcott (10/04/2004) and associate, Jaiden Brown
(06/18/2003) walking west in the unit block of West 23rd Street. Westcott matched the description of a robbery suspect from the day
prior 09/28/24. Officers then stopped and approached the individuals. At this point Westcott began acting suspiciously. Officers
attempted to engage in a conversation with Westcott, at which point he ran. As he was doing so, Westcott fell to the ground, throwing a
firearm as he went fell. Officers were then able to apprehend Westcott and recovered the black in color Ruger EC9S (#45542051),
loaded with ten (10) rounds in the magazine and one (1) in the chamber.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On Saturday November 19th 2042 hours, C Platoon Officers were dispatched to 2625 N. Market St in reference to a domestic dispute involving weapons. Once making entry into the residence officers could hear yelling coming from the back bedroom. Officers began to give verbal commands from the hallway for the suspect (Marlon Alpizar WMH 09/30/81) to exit the bedroom with his hands up. Officers then heard the victim (Iris Alpizar WFH 02/09/81) yell for help at which time officers entered the bedroom. Upon entering the bedroom, officers observed Marlon on top of Iris, preventing her from exiting the bedroom. Marlon was placed into custody and found to be in possession of a loaded Glock 19 9mm handgun which was located in a holster on his left hip. In addition to the firearm, Marlon was in possession of prescription bottle with no label containing (36) Xanax pills. Iris advised that she and Marlon were involved in a verbal dispute when Marlon held her down on the floor and would not let her leave the residence. Iris advised that her children called 911.

Over the past several weeks, CGIC detectives have been conducting a firearm investigation regardingQuamere Britt BM 07/21/2006 who has been seen on social media in possession of several firearms. On March 19, 2025,CGIC Detectives were in the 300 block of W 23 rd St when they observed Britt displaying characteristics of an armed gunman.As Detectives continued to drive towards Britt, he fled into the rear alley behind 2301 N. Washington St, where he attemptedto flee up a fire escape. Detectives were able to order him off the fire escape and make contact with him without furtherincident. During a search of his person, Detectives located a black in color Polymer 80 9mm (S/N: CA39336) handgunloaded with 16 rounds of 9mm ammunition. Britt was transported to Central and a search warrant was granted for his DNA.

1. On June 9, 2025, at approximately 1537 hours, Officers Clark and Grady were on patrol in the area of 10th and Pine St
when they observed an individual, matching the description related to a shooting investigation. CID was notified and advised the subject
was Darrell Carter (01/02/2004), who has an active warrant issued by WPD. Officers conducted a pedestrian stop on Carter, who was taken into custody without incident. During the stop, Carter informed the officers
that he was in possession of a firearm. A Walther PPS 9mm (S/N: AZ9539) handgun loaded with one round in the chamber and six
rounds in the magazine, was located in the front waistband of his pants.

On Friday February 10th 1918 hours, C Platoon Cpl. Keith Johnson conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 1700 block
of W. 4th St for failure to signal. Upon making contact with the driver, the officer smelled the odor of Marijuana emanating from the
interior of the vehicle. The driver (Radiel Rodriguez 03/14/01) was found to have an active warrant out of State of Pennsylvania for
Fleeing or Attempting to Elude and Officer with extradition authorized. A search of the vehicle revealed 683 grams of Marijuana in 96
individual packages. It also revealed a Glock 19 (Serial #AGGM019) loaded with thirty 9mm rounds in an extended magazine and
$378.00 in USC.

On July 19, 2025 approximately 2150 hrs. Cpl. Marshall was on proactive patrol when he observed a white Dodge
Durango (PA LRH7849) traveling in the area of Concord Avenue. An NCIC inquiry revealed the vehicle to be stolen. Upon this
realization, Cpl. Marshall then activated his emergency equipment, at which time the vehicle attempted to flee. A pursuit ensued,
until the vehicle stopped and multiple subjects wearing all black clothing exited the vehicle.
Assisting units arrived in the area at which time a perimeter was established. As a result of the incident, seven individuals were
apprehended and identified as Katavioa Taylor, Kwell Evans, Jaden Dorsey, Ronald Womack, Mekhi Turner, Rahshad Rawls,
and Saleem Garnett. A search of the area revealed a 1) Springfield XD-9 (S/N: #XD207270) 9mm handgun was recovered in the
rear yard of 502 West 35th Street.
The Dodge Durango was transported to the Central where a search warrant was executed, and yielded the recovery of 2) DPMS
Panther Arms AR-15 (S/N: #FFH281535) with one round in the chamber and 23 rounds in the magazine, 3) AR-15 style rifle
with no markings with one round in the chamber and 10 rounds in the magazine, five (5) .223 rifle casings and one (1) .45 caliber
casing. All seven subjects were charged accordingly.
*It should be noted that the following morning, the owner of 502 West 35th St, called to report a found firearm in the front yard. The
firearm was a Desert Eagle handgun (S/N #031542) .40 caliber handgun. The listed suspects have not been charged with this
firearm (30-25-052192).
*It should be noted that the following morning, the owner of 504 West 35th St, called to report a found firearm in the rear yard. The
firearm was a Springfield XD (S/N #US592346) .45 caliber handgun. The listed suspects have not been charged with this firearm
(30-25-052324)

On Thursday June 23rd 1930 hours, B Platoon officers responded to 1128 Pleasant St in reference to a man armed
with a gun. Upon arrival, officers made contact with Douglas Bush, who was on the roof of his residence where he advised officers
that he was armed. Officer Osler asked Bush to come down which he complied without incident. A pat down frisk for weapons was
conducted which met with negative results. Bush advised that he was being threatened by people in the neighborhood which led to
him arming himself. Officers conducted a DELJIS inquiry on Bush which revealed that he is a person prohibited from possessing both
firearms and ammunition as a result of a violent felony conviction (assault 2nd). Officers executed a search warrant and removed (15)
firearms along with ammunition and magazines which were located inside of a gun safe in a second story bedroom. Two additional
firearms were recovered from the roof of the residence where officers initially saw Bush, and where he told officers that he was
armed.

Kevin Harris Homicide – 7/4/2024 
**Remington and S&W located in residence, belonging to suspect. Stoeger located besides victim.

On December 17, 2025, at approximately 1049 hours, WPD CID detectives were on doing surveillance in the Center City area, attempting to locate a white Ford Fusion (MD 1GP4177), which was involved in a WPD shooting (30-25-82721), which had been assigned to Det. Everett. During this time, the vehicle was observed parked in front of the Hicks Anderson Center, with two (2) subjects inside. The vehicle soon fled the area, until it was eventually seen again, in the area of 3602 Miller Road. Upon locating the vehicle, WPD officers attempted to make contact with the vehicle and occupants, giving commands to exit the vehicle. At this time the
vehicle fled at a high rate of speed. The vehicle was pursued until the 3200 block of North Van Buren Street, until it was stopped. The driver, Haywood Johnson
(07/26/1986) exited the vehicle from the front passenger seat, holding the front of his waistband and fled on foot through an alleyway. The pursuit continued on foot, officer observed Johnson discard an object, until Johnson was eventually apprehended in the 700 block of 31st St. After the apprehension, an area canvass was conducted where Johnson fled; officers located two (2) firearms, a Lorcin L9 9mm
(SN#L1073966) loaded handgun and one silver and black Magnum Research Desert Eagle 9m (SN#MN002632) loaded handgun. Johnson was taken back to Central, and charged accordingly.

Over the past few weeks, members of the DOCV initiated an investigation into Dawune Boardley (09/25/1991)
regarding the sale of Crack Cocaine from the residence of 2236 N. Pine St. As a result of the investigation, a warrant was obtained for the
residence.
On October 21, 2025, members of DOCV observed Boardley exit the residence and attempted to take him into custody, however, as
officers approached, Boardley fled the scene on a bicycle. After a brief pursuit, officers apprehended him in the 2300 block of N. Market
Street. Following a short struggle, he was taken into custody without further incident. Boardley was found to be in possession of a loaded
Glock 17 9mm (SN#BCPC567) handgun, which was concealed in the front waistband of his pants. Additionally, officers recovered 25
pills of Alprazolam. A search of the residence yielded no further evidence.

On Thursday June 13, 2024, at approximately 0905 hours, the Wilmington Police Communications Unit received a 911 call for shots fired at 2834 Rosemont Avenue. The caller said a projectile came through their wall and nearly struck a juvenile. Units responded to 2834 Rosemont and determined that a projectile came through a second-floor wall from the adjoining house (2832). Officers spoke with the victim, who said she was in her room when the projectile came through the wall, went through her television, and then lodged into her bed. Her arm sustained an abrasion from fragments of the television/bed.

Officers established a perimeter around 2832 Rosemont Avenue and then used the loudspeaker to order the occupants to exit. Stephan Deshields BM 08/22/2006 exited without incident and was taken into custody by officers. Officers debriefed Mr. Deshields and determined he was the sole occupant. With the assistance of CID, officers applied for a search warrant for 2832 Rosemont Avenue, which was granted. Officers searched the house and located three firearms, ammunition (9mm, .22 cal, 12 gauge), and numerous credit cards with various names. Officers recovered the following guns:

•	Pink Glock 9mm Model 19 (Serial # AGKA918), Extended Magazine, No NCIC Record. A casing was lodged in the ejection port as a result of a double-feed
•	Black Glock 9mm Model 19 (Serial # MP2843DC), Standard Magazine, No NCIC Record
•	Brown Canik 9mm TP9SF (Serial # T6472-21), Extended Magazine, No NCIC Record 

The investigation is ongoing as Officers Mann/Diaz are collecting statements, DNA, and gunshot residue. However, preliminary information revealed that Mr. Deshields discharged a firearm in the second-floor bedroom of 2832 Rosemont Avenue. The projectile went through the wall and entered the second-floor bedroom of 2834 Rosemont Avenue.

On Saturday June 11th 1911 hours, SCU Officers were in the area of the 2200 block of Washington Street when they
observed a 2006 Ford SUV parked in front a fire hydrant and bearing an expired PA temporary tag (3675834). SCU officers made
contact with operator Zyaire Benson (BM 03/31/2003) and smelled a strong odor of marijuana emanating from the vehicle. Officers
identified the following individuals as occupants of the vehicle and removed same
Zyaire Benson BM 03/31/03 (Driver)
Nasir Holmes BM 01/14/02 (front passenger)
Odeja Crumpler BF 05/16/95 (rear passenger)
Zylier Carter BM 02/03/03 (rear passenger) - Capias x3 and was in possession of (51.8 grams) of marijuana
While searching the vehicle, SCU officers located a Black Taurus G2C (9MM) firearm Model PT111 SN# TMA68307 with (5)
rounds in the magazine none in the chamber located underneath the front driver seat.
All suspects consented to providing DNA but declined to provide statements regarding the incident.
