case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On August 12, 2025, at approximately 0103 hours, Officers N. Gliem and Lopez were on a proactive patrol, when subject, Antwain Canty (05/31/2007) was observed operating an electric scooter in the public roadway. Officers attempted to stop Canty, when he fled on the scooter, soon dropping the scooter, while continuing on foot. In the 200 block of N. Harrison St, Officer N. Gliem observed Canty remove a firearm from his waistband, where he was then given verbal commands to drop the firearm. Canty complied, dropping the firearms, at which point he was taken into custody and the loaded Springfield XD-45 .45 caliber (S/N: XD644892) handgun was recovered. Canty was taken back to Central and charged accordingly.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
In early June, CGIC detectives were contacted by Cpl. Dan Shea, who advised that he had received information regarding the possibility of drugs and firearms being stored within 1703 W. 2nd St. Over the following weeks, CGIC investigators assisted Cpl. Shea in obtaining a search warrant for the address.
On June 26, 2025, Cpl. Shea established surveillance on the residence at which point Karmyn Demby (06/12/2003) and Aaron Parson (06/14/2005) were observed exiting the front door. The two were stopped without incident.
Once in custody, members of CGIC and Safe Streets executed the search warrant, where they located #1 CZ CZ75 9mm (S/N: 5516U) handgun and #2 Beretta Pietro .380 (Obliterated S/N) with a brown wooden handle.
Both subjects were transported to Central, along with the evidence.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
On Saturday, May 17, 2025, at approximately 1515 hours, WPD responded to the residence of 622 McLane St, in
reference to an intoxicated subject with a firearm. Upon arrival, the victim, Rebecca Lockwood (08/22/1977) was able to safely exit the
residence. She advised officers, a verbal argument ensued, at which time, the suspect, Paul Lockwood (06/05/1981) proceeded to fire
two rounds into the floor with his handgun. Officers were able to make contact with the suspect and instruct him to exit the residence,
to which he complied. Consent was given to search the residence which yielded the recovery of a black in color Beretta PX4 Storm
9mm (SN: PX402168) handgun with one 9mm chambered round and a 17 round magazine containing seven additional rounds. In
addition, two (2) 9mm casings and two (2) projectiles were recovered, surrounding visible damage to the floor. Paul Lockwood was
transported to Central and charged accordingly

On September 23rd, 2025, WPD responded to the 3500 block of Miller Road for a shots-fired investigation (30-25-
68088). Officers determined that the incident occurred within the Delaware State Police’s jurisdiction and turned the investigation over to
them (01-25-81486). Investigators from the DSP determined that a bronze Honda Civic (DE 509372), was involved in the incident. They
flagged the Honda’s registration as a stop vehicle for being involved in the incident.
On September 26th, 2025, at 1244 hours, Officer Crumlish observed the Honda in the 200 block of North Walnut Street. He conducted a
registration check and confirmed the stop vehicle flag for the Honda. Officers conducted a felony car stop, where Danny Thompson was
ordered out of the vehicle. He immediately recognized that Thompson was wearing an empty holster. Officer Crumlish took Mr.
Thompson into custody and asked about the empty holster. Thompson said the firearm was in the Honda’s center console. Officers
secured the vehicle and contacted DSP.
DSP took custody of Mr. Thompson and the Honda and transported them to Troop 2 for processing. DSP detectives executed a
search warrant (related to the shots fired incident) to search the Honda, during which they located a black Ruger LCP .380 (Serial
#379028999) in the center console. DSP contacted Officer Crumlish and notified him of their findings. Mr Thomspon has an active
Warrant for WPD due to this incident

During the month of January, members of Safe Streets began an investigation into Malik Purnell BM 10/25/2001
for the illegal sale of marijuana. Additionally, Purnell was believed to be in possession of a handgun. On January 27, 2024 Safe
Streets located Purnell in the 200 block of W. 29th St and coordinated a pedestrian stop. Purnell was found to be in possession of a
loaded Smith & Wesson Shield 9mm handgun that was concealed in his waistband as well as a small amount of marijuana. Purnell
was taken into custody without incident. During a post Miranda interview, Purnell admitted to trading marijuana to an unknown male
for the firearm. Purnell also admitted that he sells marijuana illegally and advertises same on Instagram. The firearm was reported
stolen out of DSP (Troop 7) jurisdiction. A test fire form was submitted and Purnell was charged accordingly

On October 29, 2025 at approximately 1850 hours, members of Safe Streets made a motor vehicle stop on a white Jeep
Grand Cherokee (DE PC125699) for window tint violation, in the area of 200 N. Dupont St. Jhavon Goode (02/18/1993), who was
identified as the driver and sole occupant, was found to be on level 3 probation for a firearm related assault 1st conviction. Goode
provided consent to search the vehicle. Officers located a Smith and Wesson M&P Shield 9mm (SN# HRP6503) handgun in the center
console, as well as 11 grams of Crack Cocaine, on the floorboard under the driver’s seat. Goode was taken into custody and transported
to Central.
Officers then responded to Goode’s residence of 3901 Sussex Dr, Apartment C, to conduct a probation administrative search. Officers
located and recovered packaging material and an additional 104 grams of Crack Cocaine. The evidence was all brought back to Central,
and Goode was charged accordingly.

On Tuesday, September 23, 2025 at approximately 1256 hours, members of DOCV were conducting surveillance for
open air-drug activity in the 400 block of W. 7th St. During this time, Jayden Roane (05/05/2011) and Nysire Brice (06/27/2010) were
observed engaging in hand to hand drug transactions. A pedestrian stop was initiated on the subjects. Brice was found to be in possession
of a Jennings Bryco 59 9mm (SN#716786) handgun loaded with eight rounds in the magazine and one round in the chamber. Roane
was found to be possession of approximately 102.8 grams of Marijuana, packaged in multiple containers, and a digital scale. Brice and
Roane were taken into custody and charged accordingly.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On August 4, 2025, CGIC Detectives were conducting surveillance in the area of N. Franklin S, in reference to multiple recent shots fired incidents. While in the area of 200 N. Franklin St, Detectives observed Victor Johnson (12/13/2005) riding a bike southbound. Detectives confirmed Johnson’s wanted status and confirmed he still currently had 2 outstanding warrants as well as 1 capias. At this time, Johnson was observed exiting the corner store located at Chestnut and Franklin St. Detectives attempted to make contact with him at which point he immediately began to flee on his bike. Johnson continued to flee, until he collided into Detective Lerro’s vehicle, causing damage to same. Johnson was eventually apprehended in the 1100 block of Elm St, with the assistance of K9 Williams and Duco. Detectives recovered the firearm, in which they observed Johnson discard as he was taken into custody. The firearm was confirmed to be a Glock 26 9mm (SN: #BARU270) handgun, with an extended magazine loaded with 20 total rounds of 9mm ammunition. Johnson was charged accordingly.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On Tuesday, May 27, 2025, while working a 29P detail, CGIC detectives along with Officers Mann, Rodgers, Meese, and Hutt were on proactive patrol in the area of W. 6th and N. Tatnall St when they observed a possible wanted subject sitting in the driver’s seat of a parked vehicle talking to another individual in the window. The additional individual was identified to be Tayvon Richardson (10/28/2000). Officers stopped their vehicles to make contact with the driver at which point Richardson immediately turned and began fleeing which displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. Officers briefly pursued Richardson before taking him into custody in the area of W 7th and N. Tatnall St. Once in custody, officers located and recovered a black and silver Glock 48 9mm (S/N: BLGR003) handgun loaded with a total of nine rounds. In addition, Richardson was found to be in possession of 17 grams of crack cocaine. Richardson and the evidence was transported to Central.

defendant_name: Jayla Townes and Tajee Foeman Case #: 30-22-32502
case_summary:
On Thursday May 12th 0656 hours, WILCOM dispatched officers to the 200 block of N. Broom St in reference to an
assault with weapons complaint. Upon arrival, officers were approached by Jamiere Archie who advised that his younger sisters,
Jamairah and Janiyah, were assaulted and sprayed with pepper spray while waiting for the school bus. Jamiere advised that he
approached the vehicle the suspects had entered (2017 white Jeep DE XQ244505), at which time, the driver (Jayla Townes) removed a
firearm from her tan in color purse, pointed same at Jamiere, and threatened him. Preliminary investigation revealed that the sisters
had been involved in a physical altercation earlier in the week with a Talina Townes while at AI DuPont High School.
A general broadcast was provided of the suspect vehicle and same was located unoccupied in the 2600 block of Lamotte St.
Surveillance was established on the vehicle and after a short time, Jayla Townes exited 2700 N. Market St, carrying a tan in color
purse, along with a black male, later identified as Tajee Foeman, who was carrying a small black bag. Both Townes and Foeman
entered the vehicle and were taken into custody without incident. Officers were able to obtain a search warrant for both Townes
vehicle as well as her residence (2700 N Market St., Apt 416). While executing a search warrant for the vehicle, officers located a tan
in color purse, which contained a black S&W .380 handgun loaded with two rounds. Also located was a small black in color bag
which contained a Ruger LCP 9mm handgun loaded with six rounds along with (65 grams) of Marijuana. Upon searching the
residence, officers located a box of .380 caliber ammunition.
Both Townes and Foeman were charged accordingly and DNA search warrants were authored.
Tajee Foeman provided his brother’s information (Tamir Foeman BM 06/12/99). Tajee provided Tamir’s name and DOB to officers
on scene and back at Headquarters. Tajee also filled out the Departmental Pedigree form with the false information. It was not until
arraignment that Tajee informed the officers and the judge that he lied about his identity. Additional charges were filed for Criminal
Impersonation and Making a False Written Statement.

Over the past month, CGIC detectives were conducting a firearm investigation involving Zakyse Carter, Rshad Lockett, and Jashad Helm. During the course of the investigation, Detectives were able to obtain numerous photographs and videos of them in possession of several firearms.
On July 20th, 2025 A Platoon responded to the area of East 35th St and N. Church St regarding a shots fired incident, 30-25-52286, where officers located 26 spent casings along with a cell phone. Detectives applied for a search warrant on the phone which revealed same belonged to Rshad Lockett. As a result of the investigation, Detectives applied for and were granted a search warrant for 129 Eastlawn Ave.
On July 22nd, surveillance was established on the residence at which point Carter was observed exited same. Detectives were able to make contact and detain him pending the search warrant. During a search of the residence, Detectives located and recovered one black in color Glock 19 Gen 5 (SN: BNEE247) loaded with 16 totals rounds of 9mm ammunition, one black in color Glock 23 (SN: AGRB981) loaded with 21 total rounds of 40 caliber ammunition, one tan in color extended magazine containing 31 rounds of 9mm ammunition, one black in color Taurus magazine, and 50 rounds of 9mm ammunition.
DNA was collected from all occupants of the residence. Carter and the evidence were transported to the Wilmington Police Department. Charges for Helm and Lockett are pending further investigation. This investigation is on-going.

On Wednesday September 7th 1739 hours, D Platoon Officers Linkhorst / Miller relayed that they were behind an
occupied Silver Honda Accord (bearing DE Registration 62594) in the 1200 block of Chestnut St which was taken in an armed
carjacking the day prior, out of Chester Township Police Jurisdiction (Case # 20-22-0906M4696). Officers attempted to coordinate a
felony car stop, however the vehicle accelerated and a pursuit was initiated. The pursuit continued Southbound through the City,
ultimately culminating when the vehicle collided with the secured front gate to Delaware Recycling Center (1101 Lambson Lane) and
coming to rest. The occupants fled from the vehicle, and a foot pursuit ensued, during which time Officers Linkhorst and Miller
relayed direction of travel and that one of the suspects appeared to be holding a handgun. The suspects fled into one of the Recycling
Center buildings and coordination was quickly established, under the supervision of Sgt Leahy and Sgt Cavanaugh, to contain any
further suspect advancement. The building was evacuated of employees, and efforts were made to secure the assistance of DSP and
NCCPD, Trooper 4, as well as WPD K9, Drone, and Street Crimes officers. The result of the coordinated search led to the
apprehension of RAINEY and CLARK, both of whom were found hiding within the Recycle Center machinery. Both were taken into
custody and transported to nearby hospitals, where they were treated for non-life threatening injuries sustained during their flight from
police/attempt at hiding. Located in plain view within the abandoned Honda were two (2) handguns. The vehicle was towed to central
where Officers Linkhorst and Miller authored search warrants for the vehicle, as well as suspect DNA. Both subjects are OMB
affiliates with extensive firearms related history. Deljis confirmed both subjects to be on level 3 probation.

On September 4, 2025, at approximately 1403 hours, members of the DOCV executed a search warrant at 102 N.
Vanburen St (Apt A), in regards to an ongoing Drug Investigation. Detectives executed the search warrant and made contact with Jeremy
Yeager (03/06/1997) inside the resident when he was taken into custody without incident. Once taken into custody, Yeager was found to
be in possession of Crack Cocaine and Heroin on his person. A search of the residence, yielded the recovery of one black in color Ruger
Security-9 9m (SN: 382-78832) handgun, loaded with (15) 9mm rounds of ammunition, along with additional Crack Cocaine and
Heroin. While at Central, Yeager admitted to the illegal substances which were found on his person. Yeager was charged accordingly.

On Saturday July 30th 0615 hours, Shot Spotter alerted for a total of (21) rounds at 2713 N. Tatnall St. Officers
responded and conducted an area canvass for a scene, which was met with negative results. Video surveillance was obtained and
displayed the defendant exit 2709 N. Tatnall St and fire several rounds into the air before reentering the residence. Officers established
a perimeter and a search warrant for the residence was obtained. Bolling exited the residence and was taken into custody without
incident. Bolling was found to be in possession of a loaded Taurus Millennium G2 9mm handgun which was located in the right side
of his waistband. A search of the residence yielded a holster, 9mm ammunition, and an additional magazine loaded with 9mm
ammunition.

On Monday April 25th 2120 hours, officers responded to the area of 30th & N Market St in reference to a person with
a gun wearing all black clothing and holding a large red Target bag. While in the area, officers witnessed a subject matching that
description walk into Rash’s Hair and Beauty Supply. The subject exited the store shortly after and a pedestrian stop was conducted.
The subject admitted to having a firearm on his person and officers located a loaded Beretta APX 9mm in the front pocket of the
subject’s hooded sweatshirt. The firearm was reported stolen to Philadelphia PD in December of 2021.

On Wednesday August 17th 1655 hours, SCU were in the 800 block of W 9th St when they observed a blue in color Kia Sorrento DE PC247334 parked by a fire hydrant. Officers approached the vehicle and made contact with the operator/defendant (Stewart, Samad BM 02/01/1995). While speaking with the defendant, SCU Investigators observed a holster in the driver side door
panel which contained a magazine. Upon removing the defendant from the vehicle, the defendant advised his firearm must have fell under the seat. SCU Investigators searched the vehicle and located a black in color loaded “Smith & Wesson” M&P 9mm Shield Firearm with a laser on same bearing SN # JBN9095 containing (1) round in the chamber (10) rounds in in the extended magazine concealed under the driver seat. Also located in the vehicle the defendant possessed (2) additional magazines containing (19) additional rounds.

On July 25th, at approximately 2235 hours, members of Safe Streets were proactively patrolling the Riverside area where they observed Samad Stewart (02/01/1995), Michael Sanders (09/10/1997) and Kendall Wisher (12/22/2002) acting suspiciously in the area of 26th and Claymont Streets.  As officers turned down Jensen Drive to get a better look at the subjects, all three began running E/B through the courtyards.  Officers pursued the subjects and quickly detained all three. Samad Stewart was found to be in possession of a concealed Glock “43X” 9mm handgun, loaded with nine rounds of ammunition. Officers located a Sig Sauer “SP2022” 9mm handgun, loaded with sixteen rounds of ammunition, lying in the grass approximately fifteen feet from where the subjects were detained.

On Monday July 18th 0211 hours, B Platoon Officer Rosembert responded to the area of Front & N. Poplar Sts in
reference to juveniles attempting to break into vehicles. While en route, three male subjects were observed running northbound on
Poplar St and were ultimately taken into custody in the 300 block of E. 3rd St. The juveniles were identified as Dahmin Hall BM
04/11/05, Isaian Boney BM 11/06/06, and Cy’nye Stallings BM 09/20/06. During a pat down, Stallings advised that he had a fanny
pack on him (located under his hoodie / strapped to his chest). Stallings did not respond when officers asked him what was inside the
fanny back, but gave permission to open same. Located inside the fanny pack was a loaded Taurus G2 9mm firearm. Boney and Hall
were issued summons and released to their parents. Stallings was charged with the appropriate firearm offenses.

On February 2, 2025, at approximately 2118 hrs. Officers Crumlish and D. Shea were on proactive patrol when they conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 1300 block of West 6th Street on a black in color Chevrolet Traverse (DE PC115016), after the vehicle failed to stop for stop sign. Officers made contact with the driver who was identified as Marquis Warren (12/19/2002). A Deljis inquiry on Warren revealed that his license was suspended and that he had an active capias out of the New Castle County Court of Common Pleas (Conspiracy 3rd). At this time, Warren was taken out of the vehicle and placed into custody.
A search of the vehicle revealed a magazine loaded with five rounds of 9mm ammunition and one loose 9mm cartridge in the compartment of the Navigation system. Officers then located a Kimber Micro-9 9mm (S/N #PB0316109) firearm in the glovebox of the vehicle.
Warren was transported to the Central and charged accordingly.

On November 26, 2025 Detective Shea, with the assistance of Safe Streets and CID, executed a search warrant at 602 E. 23rd Street, in reference to an open homicide investigation. Upon entering the residence, Yahim Harris (10/24/2000) was located hiding in the basement and taken into custody without incident. Located within close proximity to Harris, officers located a lock box were a loaded Glock 30 .45 Caliber (SN#CBWB241) handgun. The firearm was equipped with a “switch” device making it capable of full
automatic operation. In the same box, officers located an additional loaded Glock 19 9mm (SN#CDYG377) handgun. Located in a second floor bedroom, which belonged to Jayvon Hale-Jones (04/08/2000), Detectives located clothing, and one Taurus
G3C 9mm (SN#AEJ666819) handgun. The firearm was equipped with a “switch” device making it capable of full automatic operation. Hale-Jones was not present inside the residence and efforts are underway to locate him.
Harris was transported to Central and was processed accordingly. The investigation is on-going.

During the month of July, members of Safe Streets began a firearm and drug investigation involving Darrell Oliver
BM 06/14/1987. On July 12th, at approximately 2005 hours, members of Safe Streets observed Darrell Oliver at Shearman and
Lombard Streets where they attempted a pedestrian stop. Oliver fled on foot, discarding a loaded Colt .45 (S/N SS20001) caliber
handgun as well as thirty two (32) grams of crack cocaine. After a brief foot pursuit, Oliver was taken into custody in the 1000 block
of Clifford Brown Walk. Oliver was found to be in possession of an additional 2 grams of crack cocaine as well as .091 grams of
heroin. Oliver was transported to Central where he refused to cooperate with an interview. The firearm was reported stolen out of East
Whiteland Township (PA) Police Department, and a test fire form was submitted to FSU.
not in gunstat meeting reports

During August 2023, Det. Silvers initiated an investigation into Chaquan Byrd BF 01/10/1991 for the sale of Heroin
from her residence, 110 N. Franklin Street, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of the investigation, a search warrant was authored
and obtained for the aforementioned location.
On August 25, 2023 at approximately 1208 hours, Basil McCoy BM 01/11/1989 was taken into custody on the sidewalk in front of
the residence. Members of the Vice Unit, GIU, and K9 executed the search warrant at 110 N. Franklin St and took Chaquan Byrd BF
01/10/1991 into custody.
The listed items were located in the residence and seized:
• Ruger 9mm semi-automatic handgun (#860-68718) – reported stolen out of Bedford County, VA
• (1.911 grams) of Heroin stamped “Rite Aid” & “Walk Dead”
• (2) Oxycodone pills
• $463 USC
• Drug paraphernalia

On Saturday March 30, 2024 @ 2355 hours, (Cpl. Marcone) was flagged down by an unidentified citizen, who reported that they observed a female being chased by a male subject with a gun in the area. Cpl. Marcone found a female who appeared to be in some type of distress in the unit block of Cedar Street, who advised that the suspect was a black male in a black coat. Officers took up an area canvass for the suspect, at which time several officers observed the defendant, Sean Perry BM 02/20/1981, hiding behind a vehicle in the unit block of 5th Avenue. Perry was stopped and patted down at which time officers felt a holster under Perry’s coat. He was placed into custody, without incident. Officers immediately located a firearm directly under the vehicle that Perry was hiding behind (black in color, Ruger 57 handgun (#642-33052), sixteen (16) FN 5.7x28mm rounds in the twenty round magazine and one (1) round in the chamber. It should be known that the believed female victim fled the area and did not make any further contact with police. Officers located a witness who stated that he observed the entire incident. The witness stated that Perry was assaulting the female, when a male jumped in, at which time Perry fired a shot into the air. Officers responded back to the unit block of Cedar Street and located one (1) FN 5.7x28mm casing in front of 14 Cedar Street. No ShotSpotter alert received, audit requested. Post Miranda, Perry admitted that the gun was his, but stated that he was open carrying. Perry also admitted that a round was fired from his handgun, but that it was while he was struggling with the other male who tried to remove his handgun from his person. DNA collection was pending at the time of this report. A test fire form was completed and submitted to FSU.

On Wednesday April 19th 0018 hours, officers responded to the area of the 700 block of W. 4th St for a ShotSpotter
alert for three (3) rounds. Upon arrival officers located the victim (Jahniya Maddox 07/22/05) inside 233 Garden Court suffering from
a gunshot wound to the leg. Officers located the scene in the 700 block of W 3rd street: Two (2) live 9mm rounds and two (2) 9mm
casings were located. Officers on scene began receiving information that the shooters name was “Nevaeh” and that she had fled from
the area in a burgundy Chrysler. The victim was transported to AI Hospital originally and then she was taken to CER for her injuries.
While the officers were on scene at 233 Garden Court, the suspect was seen behind 223 N. Madison Street (which is the 200 block of
Garden Court). The suspect fled back into the residence after seeing the officers. Officers immediately secured the residence and using
a loud speaker had the residents exit. The suspect had fled out of the front of the residence prior to a perimeter being set up. While
holding the perimeter of the residence, officers noticed a black female matching the suspect description in the 200 block of Madison
street. She was taken into custody and identified as Nevaeh Comeger BF 11/27/2002. Patrol officers also located a burgundy Chrysler
registered to Comeger in the rear of 210 N. Madison Street. Positive identifications of the suspect were made. A search of the
residence revealed a black in color Ruger 9mm firearm (#462-63910) located inside a black book bag inside a closet on the second
floor. Det. Wham authored an arrest warrant for Nevaeh Comeger for Assault 1st degree, Reckless Endangering 1st Degree (3 counts),
and PFDCF

defendant_name: Ahjir Black, Ahmaj Boyd, Kevin Nash
case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary: On July 2, 2025, members of Safe Streets were in the area of 6th and Spruce St when they observed Ahjir Black (10/04/2006), operating a black in color Ford Fusion (DE 201237). The vehicle was also occupied by Ahmaj Boyd (01/13/2007) and Kevin Nash (08/19/2005). Officers were aware that Black had an outstanding warrant for offensive touching. A vehicle stop was conducted in the 400 block of Spruce St, where Black was taken into custody without incident. Probable cause was established to search the vehicle, at which time officers located a Taurus G2S 9mm handgun (SN: TMR90348), which was concealed within. All three defendants were transported to Central where they were interviews and DNA was collected. They were charged accordingly.

On Wednesday September 13th at approximately 1519 hours Investigators from the CGIC Unit were assisting CID
and the DOCV (Vice Unit) in attempting to stop a known wanted subject Quincey Thomas (BMNH 9-8-03) who is actively wanted on
firearm related charges along with being wanted for a shooting incident. These Investigators were advised by Detective Cuadrado that
Thomas was in the basketball court in the area of W. 6th and N. Madison Street wearing a black in color hooded sweat shirt with
white in color writing on the front of same. It should be known that as these Investigators along with assisting Investigators
approached W. 7th Street and N. Monroe Street an Officer advised that "he's running west bound toward Adams Street" at which time
this Investigator observed a subject running west bound in the alley (Beatty Place) toward Adams Street wearing a black in color
hooded sweat shirt. The subject continued to run from officers and was observed reaching into his cross body bag and removed a
black in color handgun, discarding same into an alley way on W. 6th St. It should be known that Detective Silvers ultimately recovered
the handgun which can be described as follows: A black in color Taurus PT 709 handgun, serial #TEY86346 loaded with one (1)
9mm round in the chamber and seven (7) 9mm rounds of ammunition in the magazine. After the subject discarded the handgun in the
alley Investigator Moses’ ultimately tackled the subject and placed same into custody without further incident. It should be known that
after Investigator Moses placed same into custody, these Investigator's observed the subject not to be Quincey Thomas and it was
Taghmeir Ruiz (04-21-2003). Investigator Moses searched Ruiz after placing same into custody and located approximately 3.5 grams
of Marijuana, a purple in color iPhone and a set of keys. These Investigators conducted a DELJIS Inquiry of Ruiz and learned same to
be actively wanted for his arrest for the following charges: Terroristic Threatening and two capias's one for Assault 3rd degree and one
for insurance card.

Over the past several months, CGIC detectives conducted a firearm investigation regarding Shawn Robbins BM 11/13/1999 in the 200 block of W 28th St. During that time, members of DOCV conducted a drug investigation into same. On February 2, 2024, CGIC, DOCV, Safe Streets, and members of the FBI task force established surveillance on 208 W 28th St in regards to the investigation. At approximately 1145 hours, the defendant Shawn Robbins BM 11/13/1999 arrived at the residence in a maroon in color Chevy Malibu. Detectives made contact with Shawn as he approached the residence at which point he was taken into custody without incident. While taking Shawn into custody, he was found to be in possession of a tan in color FN509 9mm handgun (#GKS0118657), loaded with a total of 13 rounds of ammunition, which was concealed in the front of his waist band. Once in custody, Detectives executed two search warrants at 208 W 28th St Apt 1 and 2. During a search of Apt 2, Detectives located and recovered one black in color Taurus G3C 9mm handgun (#ACN766562) loaded with 8 round of ammunition, a total of 136 grams of marijuana, 55 unused zip lock baggies used for the sale of marijuana, and a scale

On March 1, 2025, at approximately 1302 hours, Officer Hutt was on a proactive patrol in the area of West 5th and N. Madison St when he observed a 2008 burgundy Nissan Altima (DE 527175) commit a stop sign violation at the intersection. With the assistance of Officer Jacobs, a motor vehicle stop was conducted at 700 West 4th Street. The vehicle was occupied by the driver, Quamarii Barksdale (04/13/2007) and passenger, Keith Williams (08/28/20080. Through the course of the investigation, Barksdale was found to be in possession of a Glock 23 .40 handgun, with an obliterated serial number, which was located in his front waistband. The obliterated serial number was later restored to be (S/N: BCGM850). Barksdale was taken into custody without incident and the vehicle was turned over to Williams.

case_status: Disposition not yet listed in Gunstat 2025 spreadsheet (as of 5/20/25 update)
case_summary:
Over the past few weeks, Safe Streets Detectives began an investigation into Syaire Wilson (08/24/2007), who had outstanding warrants from NCCPD, as well as Middletown PD, in reference to multiple burglaries and receiving stolen property. On August 28, 2025, members of Safe Streets and the Drug Unit established surveillance on 2601 West St. Wilson and his sister, Gionni Brown-Congo (06/02/2000), were observed leaving the residence in a white in color Buick (DE: PC329664). A vehicle stop was conducted in the 600 block of Vandever Avenue, where Wilson was taken into custody without incident, and probable cause was established to search the vehicle.
Officers located a concealed, loaded Taurus G3C 9mm (S/N: #AGD150882) handgun in the center console of the vehicle. Brown-Congo, who does not have a concealed carry permit, admitted the firearm belonged to her. She was taken into custody without incident.
A short time later, officers observed Sharee Congo – Mother of Wilson and Brown Congo- exit the residence with a book bag and handed same to a neighbor that resides across the street. With the assistance of K9, DOCV officers executed a search warrant at 2601 West Street. Officers also located and spoke with the neighbor who voluntarily turned the book bag over to police. Officers located gun boxes, magazines and numerous rounds of 9mm ammunition inside the bag. Congo was advised that she was under arrest and which point she resisted being taken into custody. After a brief struggle, Congo was detained and transported to Central. Officers located a loaded Taurus “G2S” 9mm (S/N: #AGG296373) handgun as well as rounds of 9mm ammunition in the residence. Officers also located a small amount of heroin inside Wilson’s bedroom. While at Central, Officers executed a search warrant of the Buick Enclave and located a concealed, loaded Taurus “G2C” 9mm (S/N: #ABD457004) handgun under the seat where Wilson was located in the vehicle. All 3 firearms were not reported stolen at the time of this investigation, and test fire forms were submitted to FSU. The defendants were charged accordingly.

On Tuesday February 21st 1505 hours, SCU Investigators were in the area of 2nd & N. Van Buren Street when they
observed a vehicle illegally parked. While Investigators were conducting an approach on the vehicle, the Defendant / Operator Jawan Hamilton (BM 02/10/1989) was observed making furtive movements inside the vehicle compartment. The defendant rapidly exited the vehicle causing him to fall to the ground. The defendant became extremely irate and defensive during a brief field interview. While speaking with the defendant, Investigators observed an open container of liquor on the front passenger seat as well as marijuana
remnants throughout the floor board of the vehicle. Investigators searched the vehicle and observed a black in color jacket on the rear seat of the vehicle. Inside the jacket, Investigators located 3 cell phones and a (Smith & Wesson SD40 VE 40 caliber handgun containing (1) one round in the chamber and (11) eleven 40 caliber rounds bearing SN# FXH1538. Additionally, Investigators observed a hair on the firearm which was collected and tagged for DNA purposes. During the search of the vehicle, Darren Staats (BM 06/16/1985) approached Investigators and advised he possessed items in the vehicle. Staats was detained for further investigation. Investigators drafted JP Court DNA search warrants for the defendant and suspect. A test fire request was complet

On Tuesday June 20th 0748 hours, 16 David (Ptlm. Courtney Hutt) was conducting an ongoing firearm investigation
involving the defendant/Shawn Harrison BM 12/04/1970 was she observed Harrison walking in the area of W. 9th and North
Jefferson Streets. Officer Hutt observed Harrison with his hands in his pockets and actively blading his body away. This action caused
the defendant’s shirt to be pulled tight to his body, revealing the outline of a firearm in his waistband area. Officer Hutt with the
assistance of Officers Martin and Hiers conducted a pedestrian stop of Harrison in the 900 block of West Street. The results of the stop
revealed Harrison to be in possession of a black Smith & Wesson MP 40 Shield firearm (#HWW7473) with a green laser sight
mounted to the weapon’s trigger guard and to be loaded with seven (7) rounds of ammunition. The firearm was located in a black
cloth style holster inside the defendant’s waistband

On Thursday June 16th 1417 hours, A Platoon officer Crumlish conducted a motor vehicle stop in the 700 block of
N. Jackson St on a 2015 Chrysler 200 (DE 406470) operating with illegal window tint. Contact was made with the operator of the
vehicle, Ronald Wright, who did not have a valid driver’s license and appeared extremely nervous and evasive while providing basic
information. Wright was asked to exit the vehicle, which he complied, and was patted down for weapons. Located inside Wright’s
waistband was a loaded Taurus G2C 9mm (#TMR78417) which was reported stolen to WPD on January 16, 2021 during a burglary at
409 Eastlawn Ave (30-21-004341). Wright was also found to be in possession of (4.6 grams) of marijuana.

On December 23rd, 2023, at 01507, 132 Adam (Diaz) was on patrol in the 200 block of West 36th Street when he saw
a group of juveniles acting suspiciously. Upon noticing Officer Diaz, the defendant separated from the group and walked away. Officer
Diaz observed that the defendant displayed characteristics of an armed person, so he coordinated with A Platoon officers to conduct a
pedestrian stop. During the stop, Officer Diaz located a 9mm Ruger EC9s (serial number S9-62829) concealed in the defendant’s
clothing. Officer Diaz took him into custody without incident and transported him to the station for processing.
The firearm was not listed as stolen in NCIC. Officer Diaz submitted an arrest warrant for numerous firearm-related charges.

On Wednesday January 10, 2024, at approximately 1959 hours, members of Safe Streets conducted a vehicle stop on
a U-Haul Ford transit van in the 300 block of E. 8th St for an equipment violation. Immediately upon stopping, the passenger, Jahmai
Massey BM 12/11/1995, attempted to quickly exit the vehicle, but officers ordered him back inside same. Massey was found to have
numerous capiases as well as a WPD hard warrant for “Unauthorized Use of a MV”. Massey was removed from the vehicle at which
time officers located a loaded Springfield XD-9 9mm handgun (#S4923998) in the front pocket of his hooded sweatshirt. Officers
also located approximately .112 grams of heroin/fentanyl on Massey. Massey was taken into custody without incident and transported
to Central where he confessed to possessing the above listed items in a post Miranda interview. Massey, who is a person prohibited
due to previous weapons related convictions, was charged accordingly. Massey was given a $43,500 cash bail on his new charges and
currently being held at HRYCI.

A Platoon (Crumlish) responded to 700 block of Lombard St in Compton Park in reference to a person with a gun. Wilcom advised that the subject was a black male wearing a blue jump suit with a firearm in his waistband and was yelling in the center of the park. The park in located within one city block of two different schools (The Bancroft School and Sarah Webb Pyle Academy). As officers arrived, they observed Edward Robinson in the center of the park with both hands in his pant’s pockets. Officers gave several verbal commands to remove his hands from his pockets. Robinson refused and yelled, “Shut up” several times. Robinson turned away from the officers and began to walk with his hands still not visble. Officers then observed a black in color firearm with a black in color holster in the path of Robinson (approximately 10 feet away). Officer Crumlish immediately ran towards the firearm and secured it from the path of Robinson. Robinson continued to disobery orders and pulled away from officers before being placed into custody. Robinson was transported to Central where he advised that he stole the firearm from his girlfriend’s vehicle after an argument. He advised that he threw the gun from his person when he saw police approaching the park

On Friday June 30th at 2037 hours, members of Safe Streets were on proactive patrol in the West Center City area
when they observed Artezz Finney BM 12/14/1987 parked in the 400 block of Montgomery Street, holding a firearm in his right
hand. Officers immediately exited the police vehicle and gave Finney verbal commands to drop the gun. Finney dropped the gun at
which time he was removed from the vehicle and taken into custody without further incident. A silver in color ZIG “PC1911” .45
caliber semi-automatic handgun (#T062-20AK00246) was recovered from the back floorboard. During a post-Miranda interview,
Finney admitted to possessing the firearm at the time officers confronted him, but stated it belonged to his girlfriend. Finney was
transported to Central where he was charged accordingly and an administrative warrant was submitted. Finney is on Level 3 probation
for prior firearm charges stemming from a Safe Streets arrest that occurred on 09/30/19.

On Thursday November 9th Cpl. Frey and Ptlm. Cannon responded to the area of 3300 N. Madison Street in
reference to a ShotSpotter alert for one (1) round at 3309 N. Madison. Officers made contact with a caller that confirmed hearing
gunfire and located a scene consisting of (1) .22 casing in the rear of 3311 N. Madison St. While the officers were checking the area
for additional evidence/victims, the defendant, Anthony Coffield BM 08/15/1970, exited the rear of 3311. When officers questioned
him about his involvement, Coffield was evasive and officers discovered that he had a shell casing in his pocket. Coffield was
detained and subsequently determined to be a person prohibited. A search warrant was executed for GSR, DNA and the defendant’s
residence. Two firearms were recovered from the residence, a Smith & Wesson M&P 9mm (SN NLS5791) and a Polymer 80 Model
PF955 “Ghost Gun” along with (325) 9mm ammo, (41) .25 Auto, (227) .22 caliber live rounds and (8) various ammunition magazines
were recovered. No property damage was observed and no apparent victim in reference to this incident was located.

On Wednesday November 2nd 2038 hours, ShotSpotter alerted for 1 round for the 2400 block of W 4th Street, near the intersection of W 4th St and Hawley St. Officers Davis and Gledhill quickly responded to the area and observed Angel Cruz walking from the location, displaying characteristics of an armed gunman. A pedestrian stop was conducted, and officers subsequently located a loaded Bersa TPR9C 9mm hangun concealed on his person along with 1 bag of suspected heroin. The suspect refused to cooperate with providing any information as to his business abroad. A search for a scene in the area of the ShotSpotter alert was met with negative results. Officers also did not locate any damage, victims or witnesses. This alert was documented under 30-22-76870. Deljis confirmed that CRUZ does not have a valid permit to carry a firearm concealed, and is prohibited from possessing the firearm while also in possession of heroin. Deljis revealed CRUZ to have limited traffic and assault history, and StreetSmart records don’t indicate any gang affiliations. Charges were authored for firearm and drug related offenses under 30-22-76888.

On January 28, 2025, at approximately 0228 hours, Officer N. Gliem was on a proactive patrol when he conducted a motor vehicle stop on South Clayton and Cedar St for a gray in color Hyundai Elantra (PA. LWT4373). Officer N. Gliem made contact
with the driver and passenger at which time he had the driver, Charles Chambers (02/25/1990), step out of the vehicle. Chambers was
checked and advised to stand by the Patrol Vehicle. As Officer Marino asked the passenger, Joel Hurtt (09/23/1995), to step out of the
vehicle who was insisted that he be allowed to keep smoking his cigarette. Hurtt was advised to place his cigarette on top of the vehicle at
which time he fled on foot. As the Hurtt exited the vehicle a Taurus Millennium G2 9mm (S/N #TKW30506) handgun fell to the ground. Officers gave pursuit of the subject while assisting officers secured the firearm. He was quickly apprehended, after the use of the officer’s
CEW. Hurtt was transported to the Wilmington Hospital where he was treated and released for CEW exposure and abrasions to his hands, knees, and left side of the face.

On Thursday August 17th at approximately 1817 hours, Officer Fawzi and Officer Smith responded to a trespassing
complaint inside of a vacant property located at 507 Vandever Ave. As officers entered the property they observed Edward Wilson
BM 04/14/1980 and Tykisha Stanford BF 03/14/1986 sleeping inside. Officers also observed a black Walther 9mm handgun within
arm’s reach of Wilson. Both defendants were placed into custody and transported to central. Further investigation revealed that the
firearm was reported stolen to DSP Troop 2. Wilson was found to be wanted on numerous firearm charges from Tennessee. The US
Marshals Service forwarded a detainer in reference to same. Both defendants were charged with the appropriate firearm charges as
well as criminal impersonation, criminal trespass and hindering prosecution.

defendant_name: Francis Miller, Derris Llyod, Ke-mani Evans, Josiah Grimes
case_summary:
On Friday May 13th 1312 hours, A Platoon officers (Kline/Oakes) were on proactive patrol in the 800 block of E 4th
St when they located a black Volkswagen Jetta which was a suspect vehicle in an earlier shots fired incident in the unit block of W.
24th St. Officers were able to get behind the vehicle and conduct a NCIC inquiry on the vehicles registration which revealed that the
vehicle was taken during an armed carjacking from 401 N Spruce St on May 12, 2022 at 1135 hours and was involved in a pursuit
with WPD on May 13, 2022 at 0009 hours.
Officers activated their emergency equipment at which time the vehicle refused to stop. A vehicle pursuit ensued which lasted several
minutes and eventually ended with the vehicle crashing at the intersection of E. 10th & N Spruce St. All suspects exited the vehicle,
which resulted in Ke’mani Evans BF 09/07/04 being run over by the suspect vehicle as it was still moving. When officers removed the
vehicle from Evans foot, they located a loaded Springfield 9mm handgun with an extended magazine under her body. That firearm
was reported stolen to DSP Troop 3 on September 30, 2020. Josiah Grimes BM 11/02/05 was taken into custody moments after the
collision.
Francis Miller BM 06/01/04 and Derris Lloyd BM 01/24/05 fled south on Spruce St while holding firearms. As officer’s approached
on Derris Lloyd’s location, he threw a pink in color SCCY 9mm handgun with an extended magazine in a vacant lot and was taken
into custody. Officers also located another firearm (black in color Polymer 80 .22 caliber) in the same lot. That firearm is believed to
belong to Francis Miller. Miller was able to elude police after the initial foot pursuit. M/Cpl. Draper dispatched a drone from the roof
of WPD headquarters and began flying same over the area where Miller was last seen. M/Cpl. Draper located Miller hiding in the
backyard of 913 Church St where he was taken into custody without incident

On October 31, 2023, at 1040 hours, Detective Josh Wilkers relayed information on Channel A that a black male
was armed with a gun at 23rd and N Pine St. The male was described as wearing a face mask, blue coat with white sleeves, and
standing in front of the corner store at 23rd and N Pine St. Detective Wilkers monitored city watch cameras and advised responding
units that the individual walked into the corner store just prior to their arrival. Responding units set up a perimeter around the store as
assisting units entered Black’s Deli and conducted a search for the subject. The officer’s proceeded to the basement and located the
subject hiding underneath the bilco doors. After being giving several verbal commands to exit, the suspect complied and was placed
into custody. Officer’s located a black in color Taurus G3C 9mm firearm (Serial#AEC139607) hidden in the shelves of the
basement. The Defendant was transported to Central and interviewed by 14C (Rittenhouse). Swanson acknowledged being the
individual in video surveillance but denied possessing a firearm. Swanson was on probation at the time of the arrest. Officer Crist was
notified and an administrative warrant was completed

SCU in the area of 100 W 27th St when they observed a white in color 2015 Chevrolet Impala DE 233040 parked
along the northern side of the street. Upon passing the vehicle, officers immediately detected the strong odor of
marijuana coming from within said vehicle. Officers made contact with the driver of the vehicle (Rashad Osborne)
and observed a burnt marijuana blunt located in the front center console in plain view. Officers then asked Osborne
if he was smoking weed, which he advised he was. Officers asked Osborne is there was any weapons in the vehicle
to which Osborne advised that he had his gun in his possession. Osborne was removed from the vehicle and taken
into custody. Located on the driver’s side floorboard was a silver and black in color SCCY CPX-1 9mm handgun.
Osborne advised officers that there was additional marijuana located in the back of the vehicle (98 grams).
Post Miranda, Osborne advised that he was aware that his firearm was concealed while on the floorboard of his
vehicle, and that he was aware that it is illegal to be in possession of a firearm while also in possession of a
controlled substance.

On October 31, 2024, CID made an arrest of Amir Henry (07/14/2004), who was identified as a suspect in a homicide (case number 24-067115). 
On November 1, 2024, a Sig Sauer P365 9mm (S/N #66F863860) firearm was recovered at 10 Bedford Drive Wilmington, DE 19809 as part of an ongoing homicide investigation. That firearm was found to be stolen from Miller’s Gun Shop on May 26, 2024 as part of a burglary along with 15 other firearms/NCCPD-Det Diksa. For further information, please contact Det. Tom Rittenhouse/CID or Det. Brandon Mosley/CID.

Over the past two weeks, CGIC detectives initiated a firearm investigation regarding Curtshawn Palmer (08/07/2005) being in possession of a firearm. During the investigation, Detectives observed social media posts showing Curtshawn and an additional suspect in possession of a firearm which resembled a firearm stolen during the Millers Gun Shop Burglary. As a result of the investigation, detectives were able to identify 101 Harbor Drive, Claymont, DE 19703 as a residence frequented by Curtshawn and his associates.
On September 18th, while conducting surveillance on 101 Harbor Drive, Detectives observed Curtshawn exiting the apartment building. While walking through the parking lot, Curtshawn was observed displaying characteristics of an armed gunman; which included making “security checks”, to confirm the suspected firearm is still in place, he also appeared to be noticeably nervous, once noticing detectives. At this point, Detectives were able to make contact with him. While making contact, Curtshawn advised he was in possession of a firearm. Curtshawn was taken into custody and Detectives recovered one black in color Glock 43X 9mm firearm (#CCDL280) which was loaded with a total of 10 rounds of ammunition.

On August 18, 2024 at approximately 0200 hrs Officers Mann and Diaz where in the area of 899 East 26th Street when they observed a male subject walking northbound in the 2500 block of North Locust Street. Officers made contact with the male subject at the corner of East 26th Street and North Locust Street; the male subject, later identified as Zhamere Dredden (03/30/2006) was observed walking with his right arm braced against his body while his left arm swung freely. The male subject then walked westbound on East 26th Street continuing to brace his right arm against his body. Officers attempted to stop Dredden at which time he fled southbound through Brown Burton Winchester Park. 
After a brief pursuit, Dredden was observed attempting to conceal himself behind a flat bed truck then reach over a privacy fence in the rear of 2210 North Church Street and placed into custody.
Officer Mann conducted a visual inspection of the rear yard the privacy fence surrounds and observed what appeared to be a black in color firearm laying on the ground, confirmed to be a Ruger Max 9 (SN #350172441). The firearm had a chambered 9mm round along with nine (9) additional 9mm rounds in the magazine of the firearm.
not in gunstat meeting reports

On Sunday June 18th 2226 hours, officers were on scene at W.4th and N. Jackson Streets, in reference to a vehicle collision. While on scene, the driver of the striking vehicle later identified as Juda Burnett BM 08/07/2002, fled north on Jackson Street. Officer Adams, 18-Barvo, and K9-13 Officer Payne, pursued Burnett on foot. Same was able to be taken into custody without incident in the 1100 block of Carpenter Street. Search incident to the arrest, officers located a loaded silver in color Taurus G3, serial number ABM215920, with sixteen (16) rounds in the magazine, and one (1) round chambered, inside a fanny pack Burnett was carrying. The firearm was not reported stolen. All items were tagged as evidence, and all necessary forensic processing paperwork was submitted.

defendant_name: Jones, Kyaire; Cooke, William; Lowman, Sharif
case_status:
D1: Resolved 
D2: Resolved
D3: Resolved
case_summary:
During the month of June, Det. Rosaio initiated an investigation into Crack Cocaine sales by Kyaire Jones and
William Cooke from 612 N. Tatnall Street, Wilmington, DE. Additional information was obtained that both subjects possibly possessed
four handguns.
On this date, during the course of surveillance, William Cooke was observed entering a vehicle and leaving the area. While operating
the vehicle, William Cooke was observed pointing a handgun out of the vehicle window. The vehicle was followed to the 1300 block of
Linden Street where it parked. Members of the Vice Unit with the assistance of CGIC conducted a Felony vehicle stop and took all
occupants into custody without incident, the occupants and vehicle were transported to Central. It should be noted that this stop was
conducted in the presence of family members.
Surveillance was maintained on the residence, shortly after the initial arrest, Kyaire Jones and Sharif Lowman were observed exiting
the residence with a bag and walking away. Members of CGIC attempted to stop Kyaire Jones and Sharif Lowman at 8th & Tatnall
Street. Upon approach Kyaire Jones fled from officers and after a brief foot pursuit was taken into custody. Kyaire Jones was found to
have on his person the listed Glock Gen 5 (#BUCY515) with a full auto selector switch and a large quantity of Crack Cocaine. Sharif
Lowman was found to have on his person the listed Stoeger 9mm (#T6429-22Y08505).
Through the course of this investigation, a search warrant was authored and obtained for 612 N. Tatnall Street and the vehicle William
Cooke was operating. The search warrant was executed on the residence without incident, and the Ruger LCP (#371538268), additional
drugs, and drug paraphernalia were located. L&I contacted and responded regarding the conditions of the residence. A search warrant
was executed on the vehicle, the handgun observed during surveillance was found to be a CO2 pellet gun, additional drugs and
paraphernalia were also recovered.

On Monday November 20th, 2023 CGIC detectives with the assistance of DOCV detectives established surveillance
in the 200 block of Bayard Ave in reference to the defendant, Christopher Garibaldi BM 12/15/2000. While conducting
surveillance, the defendant was observed exiting the residence and entering a red in color Kia Forte along with his girlfriend, Trinityh Jackson (BF 12/13/2002). DOCV detectives followed the defendant to the Shoprite in Bear DE where the defendant exited the driver’s seat of the vehicle and began to enter the store at which point CGIC detectives attempted to make contact with him. As detectives approached, the defendant attempted to flee however was taken into custody. Once in custody, detectives responded to the Kia where they obtained consent to search the vehicle. As detectives began to search the vehicle, they observed a silver/gray firearm under the driver’s seat of the vehicle. The firearm recovered is silver in color SCCY CPX1 9mm semi-automatic handgun (# C109741) loaded with 9 rounds of 9mm ammunition in the magazine and 1 in the chamber. An NCIC inquiry was conducted which revealed firearm was reported stolen out of Chester Pennsylvania. The vehicle was subsequently towed to the Wilmington Police Department pending a search warrant which was met with negative results. Ciana Carter (BF 5/19/97) and Trinityh Jackson both consented to DNA Buccal swabs and were released at this time. Garibaldi was charges accordingly.

On Monday June 6th 1844 hours, WILCOM dispatched units to the area of Canby Park for a shooting. Units arrived
to find the victim (Brian Streater BM 12/28/07) suffering from a GSW to the right thigh. The victim advised he was walking in the
park near the basketball court when he was shot in the leg by another group of juveniles. Witnesses were located and a description was
provided over WILCOM of the suspects involved in the shooting incident. Safe Streets officers located 3 juveniles matching the
description in the 500 block of S. Broom St. Officers made contact with Zion Neives BM 03/18/08, Talib McMichael BM 01/03/07 &
Malik Samuels BM 03/12/08. During the stop, officers located an unloaded Springfield XD .40 caliber handgun inside of a green book
bag which was in Zion Neives possession. McMichael was searched and found to be in possession of a silver magazine loaded with
(6) live rounds of .40 caliber ammunition along with (1) live round.
Witnesses provided a detailed physical description of Talib McMichael as the shooter. McMichael was read his Miranda Rights and
interviewed by Det. Mosely & Det. Hayman and stated that he had the handgun concealed within his waistband. He stated that neither
Zion Neives nor Malik Samuels knew that he initially had the gun on his person. He then admitted to firing a single shot in the
direction of multiple juveniles that were standing around together. He stated that he then ejected the magazine from the handgun and
stuck it in the book bag that Zion Neives was wearing, unbeknownst to him, as they were fleeing the area.
DNA & GSR warrants obtained for all three suspects

*See Gun Arrest of Messiah Henry and K’Den Bowens for Details on Prior Events * 30-25-059968*
CGIC Detectives continued their investigation and while doing so, were contacted by Probation regarding prison calls being made by
Sabeer Mumin and Nhyjee Evans. During these calls, they advised they were in possession of two firearms when they fled and described
the location where the firearms were hidden. CGIC Detectives along with K9 officers responded out to the 200 block Woodrow Ave and
were able to locate a black in color Glock 43x 9mm (#AHKY460), which was found to be loaded with 9 rounds of ammunition, in the
location described in the prison calls. Based on the investigation, Detectives applied for and were granted arrest warrant for Evans and
Mumim as well as a search warrant for Mumim’s residence.
On September 11th, CGIC along with DOCV and Safe Streets, located Mumim where he was taken into custody, after he exited his
vehicle. The vehicle was transported to Central where a search warrant was executed, as well as Mumin’s residence. As a result of the
search warrants, Detectives located and recovered a black in color Smith & Wesson 9mm Shield (SN: JDL9002), which was found to be
loaded with 4 rounds of 9mm ammunition, and 91 grams of marijuana from the residence; 94 grams of marijuana and 1.56 grams of
heroin from the vehicle. Mumin was charged accordingly

During the month of February 2023, Det. Rosaio, Alava, and Coffiey initiated an investigation into drug sales by
Dawon Brown BM 12/07/1988 at 724 N. Pine Street, Wilmington, DE. Through the course of the investigation, probable cause was
established and a search warrant was authored and obtained.
On Wednesday June 21st 1154 hours, members of the Vice Unit, OSS, and K9 executed the search warrant at 724 N. Pine Street. Upon
approaching the front door, members of the DOCV Unit used a halligan tool to breach the exterior storm door and advised the
occupants of the residence to open the door. After an unsuccessful attempt at this, officers breached the front door and observed a
black female later identified as Brandi Henry BF 07/31/1990 who remained in the open doorway and did not initially exit same.
During the warrant execution, officers observed Dawon Brown fleeing to the second floor and attempting to discard a firearm out a
second floor window before retreating back into the house with the gun. After a period of time, Brown responded to the front door
where he was taken into custody. Brown was observed to have a laceration to his left hand that was bleeding; he was transported to the
Wilmington Hospital for treatment. During a search of the residence, crack cocaine and heroin along with several bloody bags were
located in the bathroom where Brown attempted to flush the drugs. The firearm that Brown attempted to discard out the window was
located in a second floor bedroom with blood over same. The remainder of the seized items were located throughout the residence.
• Tan Springfield Armory XDM 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial # BA206685 (29N). Handgun loaded with 1 round in
the chamber and 18 rounds in the magazine.
• Black Ruger EC9S 9mm semi-automatic handgun, serial # 462-60232 (29N). Handgun loaded with 1 round in the chamber
and 6 rounds in the magazine.
• 5.2 grams of Crack Cocaine
• .252 grams of Heroin, stamped with “RiteAid & Tasty K”
• 2.2 grams of Marijuana
• $1,208.00 USC (seized)
• Drug Paraphernalia
• DNA

On Thursday September 22nd 0600 hours, SCU Investigators executed a JP Court 11 search warrant on 911 S. Broom Street in regards to a Gun Investigation.  It should be noted, this residence is occupied and owned by the McDole family.  With the assistance of Team Leader Sibbaluca and the CMTT Team, Defendant 1 (Dale, Dustin BM 09/19/1998) and Defendant 2 (Dale, Demetre BM 08/22/1996) were safely taken into custody.  

During the search of (Dustin Dale’s) room, Street Crimes Investigators located:
•	Polymer 80 9mm handgun containing (14) 9mm rounds in the magazine
•	Ghost Gun AR Pistol Style Rifle chambered in .300 Blackout rounds (17 total rounds in magazine)
•	(100) loose assorted caliber casings
•	(234.5 grams) of Marijuana
•	(8) glassine baggies of Heroin
•	(6) plastic trash cans containing suspected crack cocaine

During the search of (Demetre Dale’s) room, Street Crimes Investigators observed the adjacent window open. Investigators searched the roof landing by the adjacent bedroom and located:
•	Ghost Gun AR Style Rifle chambered in 5.56 rounds (17 total rounds in the magazine)
•	Glock 19 9mm (#BTXT421) which contained (20) 9mm rounds in the extended magazine (reported stolen out of Troop 6)
•	(197) loose assorted caliber casings consisting of 7.62, 5.56, 9mm, 300 blackout and .22 caliber rounds
•	(183.1 grams) of Marijuana
•	Drug Paraphernalia

During the search of the residence, two empty firearm boxes were located in the defendant’s bedrooms.  Through investigative measures SCU Investigators were able to determine the firearms associated to the recovered boxes were previously recovered by SCU. These firearms were not reported stolen.
	Glock 48 9mm (#AEAF545) – Jauwaun Smith 04/21/95 Gun Arrest @ 399 W 24th St on 07/08/22 (22-047492)
E Trace: purchased by Demetre Dale on 04/28/20 @ Starquest
NIBIN: Assault victim Demetre Dale on 06/23/20 @ 100 N Rodney St  & Shots Fired on 08/27/20 @ W 25th & N Tatnall
	S&W 40 caliber M&P 2.0 (#NAW0124) – Michael Braxton 06/25/02 (NorthPak) Gun Arrest @ 2399 N Tatnall St on 06/14/22 (22-41116) (w/ Darmond Green – brother of Darnesia Green IX victim 2400 N Tatnall on 08/07/22)
E Trace: purchased by Nyaaire Hollis 03/12/98 on 09/22/21 @ Starquest 
NIBIN: Reckless Endanger 04/22/22 @ 2300 N Tatnall St – Residence 2401 N Tatnall St struck
not in gunstat meeting reports

On Thursday November 10th 1452 hours, SCU Investigators were in the 400 block of W. 23rd St when they observed
the defendant Grant-Higgin, Derrick (BM 06/13/1991) walking on foot acting suspiciously. Upon attempting to make contact, the
defendant quickly walked onto the porch of 407 W 23rd St and then fled inside the residence. Street Crimes officers observed the
defendant in possession of a cross body bag prior to entering the residence. Street Crimes Officers provided several verbal commands
for the defendant to exit which the defendant complied. The defendant was observed not wearing the cross body satchel when he
exited the residence. The defendant was taken into custody without incident. Street Crimes Officers made contact with the property
owner of 407 W 23rd St who responded to the incident location. The owner provided investigators written consent to search the
residence. Street Crimes Officers located a similar satchel on the first floor bathroom of the residence which contained a loaded
(Bersa Lusber 7.65 Caliber Firearm containing 1 live round in the chamber and (3) 7.65 rounds in the magazine. The serial #
52284 could not be checked locally and NCIC due to the number being partially faded. A serial number restoration request was made.
During a recorded video statement, the defendant provided a confession that the firearm was his and he found it approximately three
(3) days ago in an alley way

On Friday April 22nd 2252 hours, Officer O’Connor was on a complaint in the 800 block of W. 8th St when he observed a white Kia Optima travel westbound through the intersection of W. 8th & N. Monroe St. The vehicle entered the 800 block of W. 8th St and struck the rear left side bumper of the marked patrol vehicle. The officer made contact with the operator, Thomas Hatcher, who appeared to be exhibiting signs of a person under the influence of alcohol. Hatcher was taken into custody for suspicion of DUI. The officer conducted a search of Hatcher incident to arrest and located a Ruger .380 located in his right jacket pocket. Mr. Hatcher advised that he had a concealed carry permit (Confirmed in DELJIS – issued 11/30/21).

On Wednesday January 31, 2024 observed an abandoned vehicle in the travel lane. As M/ Cpl. Hazzard approached the vehicle to investigate, Tiffany Righter approached him followed by Maurice Brooks BM 08/09/1976. Righter informed him that she and Brooks had been involved in a domestic dispute at her residence during which time Brooks stole her handgun and discharged at least two rounds, one on the inside of her residence and one in the 1500 block of W. 5th Street.
Brooks and Righter then entered her vehicle and she began to drive. As she was traveling in the 600 block of N. Lincoln Street she exited her vehicle in an attempt to flee from Brooks. Based off of her statements, M/ Cpl. Hazzard provided Brooks’ description to units in the area. Officers then observed Brooks enter 500 N. Clayton Street. Officers were able set up a perimeter and CMTT and the CMHNT were activated. Attempts to make contact with Brooks were made and he advised that he was in Dover. A search warrant for the residence was secured and CMTT entered and cleared the residence. Brooks was unable to be located at this time.
The Forensic Services Unit was contacted and processed the residence which consisted of the collection of two spent 9MM casing from inside of the residence, one black in color Beretta 9MM handgun (#A181161Z), ammunition and one spent 9MM casing from the 1500 block of West 5th Street.
On February 1, 2024, M/Cpl. L. Flores was contacted by a family member of Maurice Brooks regarding him turning himself in. Upon Brooks arrival to Central, he refused to exit the vehicle. Officers were able to convince Brooks to exit the vehicle and he was taken into custody without further incident.
